sourceString: Rapidly increasing cumulative incidence of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in the European Union/European Economic Area and the United Kingdom, 1 January to 15 March 2020
targetString: Imibare rusange y’abanduye indwara ya koronavirusi (COVID-19) yagiye yiyongera vuba mu bihugu by’Umuryango w'Ibihugu by'Uburayi/Akarere k’ubukungu bw’Uburayi no mu Bwongereza, kuva ku itariki ya 1 Mutarama kugera kuri 15 Werurwe 2020

sourceString: The cumulative incidence of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) cases is showing similar trends in European Union/European Economic Area countries and the United Kingdom confirming that, while at a different stage depending on the country, the COVID-19 pandemic is progressing rapidly in all countries.
targetString: Imibare rusange y’abanduye indwara ya koronavirusi (COVID-19) iteye kimwe mu bihugu by’Umuryango w'Ibihugu by'Uburayi/Akarere k’ubukungu bw’Uburayi no mu Bwongereza bikaba byerekana ko, nubwo igeze ku rwego rutandukanye bitewe n’igihugu, icyorezo cya COVID-19 kiri gukwirakwira vuba mu bihugu byose.

sourceString: Based on the experience from Italy, countries, hospitals and intensive care units should increase their preparedness for a surge of patients with COVID-19 who will require healthcare, and in particular intensive care.
targetString: Hashingiwe ku byabaye mu Butaliyani, ibihugu, ibitaro n’ahavurirwa indembe bigomba kurushaho kwitegura kwakira umubare munini w’abarwaye COVID-19 bazasabwa kwitabwaho, cyane cyane mu bijyanye no kwita ku barwayi barembye.

sourceString: On 31 December 2019, a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown aetiology was reported in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
targetString: Ku itariki ya 31 Ukuboza 2019, mu mujyi wa Wuhan, Intara ya Hubei, mu Bushinwa habonetse abantu barwaye umusonga watewe n’ikintu kitazwi.

sourceString: On 9 January 2020, the China Center for Disease Control and Prevention reported the causative agent as being a novel coronavirus now referred to as severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Ku itariki ya 9 Mutarama 2020, Ikigo gishinzwe kurwanya no gukumira indwara mu Bushinwa cyatangaje ko watewe na koronavirusi nshya ubu izwi nka koronavirusi ya 2 itera indwara yo mu myanya y’ubuhumekero ikaze cyane (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: Since, the illness resulting from SARS-CoV-2 infection has been named coronavirus disease (COVID-19).
targetString: Kuva ubwo, indwara iterwa no kwandura SARS-CoV-2 yitwa indwara ya koronavirusi (COVID-19).

sourceString: Evidence to date is that ca 80% of individuals with COVID-19 have a mild disease, i.e. a respiratory tract infection with or without pneumonia, and most of these recover.
targetString: Kugeza ubu ibimenyetso byerekana ko nka 80% by’abantu banduye COVID-19 bagira uburwayi bworoheje, ni ukuvuga uburwayi bwo mu myanya y’ubuhumekero bujyana cyangwa ntibujyane n’umusonga, kandi benshi muri bo barakira.

sourceString: In ca 14% cases, COVID-19 develops into a more severe disease requiring hospitalisation while the remaining 6% cases experience critical illness requiring intensive care.
targetString: Mu barwayi bagera kuri 14%, usanga COVID-19 ivamo indwara ikaze cyane isaba kujyanwa mu bitaro mu gihe mu barwayi basigaye bangana na 6% baremba bigasaba kwitabwaho mu byumba by’indembe.

sourceString: The mortality of patients hospitalised due to COVID-19 is ca 4%.
targetString: Umubare w’abarwayi bapfa bari mu bitaro bishwe na COVID-19 ni nka 4%.

sourceString: In this study, we assess the trends in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 in each European Union/European Economic Area (EU/EEA) country and the United Kingdom (UK) and compare them to that of Hubei Province, China.
targetString: Muri ubu bushakashatsi, turasuzuma uko imibare rusange y’abanduye COVID-19 ihagaze muri buri gihugu cyo mu Muryango w'Ibihugu by'Uburayi/Akarere k’ubukungu bw’Uburayi (EU/EEA) no mu Bwongereza (UK) maze tuyigereranye n’iyo mu Ntara ya Hubei, mu Bushinwa.

sourceString: We also compare the current number of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK with that in Italy during 31 January–15 March 2020.
targetString: Turanagereranya umubare w’abarwaye COVID-19 muri iki gihe mu bihugu bigize EU/EEA na UK n’uwo mu Butaliyani kuva kuri 31 Mutarama kugera kuri 15 Werurwe 2020.

sourceString: COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK
targetString: Abarwaye COVID-19 mu bihugu bigize EU/EEA na UK

sourceString: Subsequent to China, COVID-19 underwent further geographical spread and the dynamic of the COVID-19 pandemic in the rest of the world currently follows that of this country.
targetString: Nyuma y’Ubushinwa, COVID-19 yakomeje gukwirakwira mu bindi bihugu kandi usanga uko iki cyorezo cya COVID-19 gikwirakwira ahandi ku isi bigenda kimwe no muri iki gihugu.

sourceString: On 11 March 2020, the Director General of the World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic.
targetString: Kuri 11 Werurwe 2020, Umuyobozi mukuru w’Ishami ry'Umuryango w'Abibumbye ryita ku buzima (OMS) yatangaje ko COVID-19 ari icyorezo.

sourceString: In the 5 March issue of Eurosurveillance 2020, Spiteri et al. reported on the first European confirmed COVID-19 cases according to the WHO case definition.
targetString: Mu nomero ya Eurosurveillance 2020 yo ku wa 5 Werurwe, Spiteri na bagenzi be batangaje imibare y’abarwayi ba mbere bemejwe ko barwaye COVID-19 i Burayi hakurikijwe igisobanuro cy’umurwayi cya OMS.

sourceString: In the EU/EEA, the first three confirmed cases were reported by France on 24 January 2020 in persons returning from Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
targetString: Muri EU/EEA, abarwayi batatu ba mbere bemejwe ko banduye bagaragajwe n’Ubufaransa kuri 24 Mutarama 2020 mu bantu bari bavuye muri Wuhan, Intara ya Hubei, mu Bushinwa.

sourceString: As at 15 March 2020, COVID-19 cases had been detected in all 30 EU/EEA countries and the United Kingdom (UK), whereby between 31 December 2019 and that date included, 39,768 cases and 1,727 deaths had been reported, with 17,750 cases and 1,441 deaths from Italy alone.
targetString: Kuva kuri 15 Werurwe 2020, mu bihugu 30 byose bigize 30 EU/EEA no mu Bwongereza (UK) hari hatahuwe abarwaye COVID-19, ku buryo hagati y’iyi tariki na 31 Ukuboza 2019, hari hamaze kugaragara abarwayi 39 768 n’abapfuye 1 727, muri bo abarwayi 17 750 n’abapfuye 1 441 ari abo mu Butaliyani gusa.

sourceString: Obtaining cumulative number and cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases
targetString: Kubona umubare rusange w’abarwaye COVID-19 n’uko ikwirakirwa muri rusange

sourceString: At the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC), the notified COVID-19 case counts in each country worldwide, obtained from only official sources such as the countries’ Ministry of Health, national and regional health authorities and the WHO, are updated each day at 8:00 a.m.
targetString: Mu Kigo gishinzwe kurwanya no gukumira indwara mu Burayi (ECDC), imibare y’abarwaye COVID-19 itangazwa hakurikijwe buri gihugu ku isi, yatanzwe n’ahantu hizewe gusa nka Minisiteri y’Ubuzima, inzego z’ubuzima ku rwego rw’igihugu n’akarere na OMS, igenda ivugururwa buri munsi saa 8:00.

sourceString: These data were used for assessing the trends of COVID-19 in EU/EEA and the UK, and comparing them to that in Italy.
targetString: Aya makuru yakoreshejwe mu gusuzuma uko imibare y’abarwaye COVID-19 ihagaze muri EU/EEA na UK, no mu kuyigereranya n’iyo mu Butaliyani.

sourceString: As a proxy of the prevalence of active COVID-19 cases, we calculated the 14-day truncated cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases, thus taking into account the natural course of COVID-19, in each EU/EEA country and the UK, during the 1 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: Mu rwego rwo kugaragaza uko imibare y’abakirwaye COVID-19 ihagaze, twateranyije imibare y’abanduye COVID-19 mu minsi 14, bityo twibanda ku buryo COVID-19 igenda yandura bisanzwe, muri buri gihugu kigize EU/EEA no muri UK, kuva kuri 1 Mutarama kugera kuri 15 Werurwe 2020.

sourceString: We also presented the cumulative number of notified cases of each country as at 15 March 2020 8:00 a.m. compared with that of Italy for the 31 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: Twanagaragaje imibare y’abarwayi buri gihugu cyagaragaje kuva kuri 15 Werurwe 2020 saa 8:00 tugereranyije n’iy’Ubutaliyani hagati ya 31 Mutarama na 15 Werurwe 2020.

sourceString: Trends of COVID-19 in EU/EEA countries and the UK
targetString: Uko imibare y’abarwaye COVID-19 ihagaze mu bihugu bigize EU/EEA na UK

sourceString: The trends in the 14-day truncated cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK generally followed that of Hubei Province (China) (Figure 1).
targetString: Muri rusange usanga uko imibare rusange y’abanduye COVID-19 mu bihugu bigize EU/EEA na UK yari ihagaze mu gihe cy’iminsi 14 bimeze kimwe n’iyo mu Ntara ya Hubei, mu Bushinwa (Igishushanyo cya 1).

sourceString: For the EU/EEA and the UK overall, the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 started to increase around 21 February and then increased sharply around 28 February 2020 (Supplementary material).
targetString: Muri rusange muri EU/EEA na UK, imibare y’abanduye COVID-19 yatangiye kuzamuka nko kuri 21 Gashyantare noneho izamuka bikabije nko kuri 28 Gashyantare 2020 (Inyandiko y’inyongera).

sourceString: This was mostly driven by the rapid increase in the number of reported cases from Italy, but all other EU/EEA countries and the UK showed similar increasing trends of the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 (Supplementary material).
targetString: Ibi byatewe cyane cyane n’izamuka rikabije ry’umubare w’abarwayi bagaragajwe mu Butaliyani, ariko no mu bindi bihugu byose bigize EU/EEA na UK hagaragaye izamuka ry’imibare y’abanduye COVID-19 (Inyandiko y’inyongera).

sourceString: Figure 2 shows the cumulative number of COVID-19 cases, in EU/EEA countries and the UK compared with that in Italy for the 31 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: Igishushanyo cya 2 kirerekana ikigereranyo cy’imibare y’abarwaye COVID-19, mu bihugu bigize EU/EEA na UK n’iyo mu Butaliyani kuva kuri 31 Mutarama kugera kuri 15 Werurwe 2020.

sourceString: It highlights that, as at 15 March 8:00 a.m., 15 other EU/EEA countries and the UK had already reported a total number of cases comparable to that of Italy just 3 weeks prior or less.
targetString: Cyerekana ko, kuri 15 Werurwe 8:00, ibindi bihugu 15 bigize EU/EEA na UK byari byamaze kugaragaza umubare wose w’abarwaye ungana n’uwo Ubutaliyani mu byumweru 3 mbere y’aho cyangwa uri munsi yawo.

sourceString: Our results indicate that the number of notified cases of COVID-19 is rapidly increasing in the EU/EEA and the UK.
targetString: Imyanzuro twagezeho yerekana ko umubare w’abagaragajwe ko banduye COVID-19 uzamuka vuba muri EU/EEA na UK.

sourceString: The observed trends in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 suggest that the pandemic is progressing at a comparable speed in all countries.
targetString: Imihindagurikire y’imibare rusange y’abanduye COVID-19 yerekana ko iki cyorezo kiri gukwirakwira ku muvuduko ungana mu bihugu byose.

sourceString: This is despite countries being at different stages, variations in national public health responses, and possibly different case definitions in countries and different protocols for selecting patients that must be tested for confirmation of COVID-19, including catch-up testing.
targetString: Ibi bikaba ari ko bimeze nubwo ibihugu biba bigeze ku bipimo bitandukanye, ingamba bifata mu rwego rw’ubuzima zikaba zihindagurika, n’ibisobanuro by’abanduye bikaba bishobora gutandukana mu bihugu ndetse hakabaho porotokore zitandukanye mu gutoranya abarwayi bagomba gupimwa kugira ngo hemezwe ko barwaye COVID-19, harimo no gupima abatarabashije gupimwa.

sourceString: Early March 2020, doctors in the affected regions of Italy described a situation in which ca 10% of patients with COVID-19 required intensive care and media sources reported that hospitals and intensive care units in these regions had already reached their maximum capacity.
targetString: Mu ntangiriro za Werurwe 2020, abaganga bo mu turere twibasiwe mu Butaliyani basobanuye ko abarwaye COVID-19 bagera ku 10% bari bakeneye kwitabwaho mu byumba by’indembe n’ibinyamakuru bitangaza ko ibitaro n’ahavurirwa indembe byo muri utwo turere byari byamaze kwakira umubare bidashobora kurenza.

sourceString: Data on admission of COVID-19 cases in a hospital and/or an intensive care unit are currently available at EU/EEA level for only 6% and 1% cases, respectively (data not shown).
targetString: Amakuru ku barwaye COVID-19 bashyizwe mu bitaro cyangwa ahavurirwa indembe ubu aboneka ku rwego rwa EU/EEA ubu ni 6% na 1% by’abarwayi gusa (amakuru ntagaragazwa).

sourceString: They should, however, be collected in a systematic fashion to complement current surveillance data that focus on the number of reported cases and the number of deaths.
targetString: Nyamara, agomba gukusanywa mu buryo bunonosoye kugira ngo yunganire amakuru ku barwayi bakurikiranwa muri iki gihe yibanda ku mubare w’abarwayi bagaragajwe n’umubare w’abapfuye.

sourceString: A study performed in 2010–11 showed a large variation in the availability of intensive care and intermediate care beds in Europe, ranging from 29.2 in Germany to 4.2 beds per 100,000 population in Portugal.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi bwakozwe mu 2010–11 bwerekanye ko ibyumba byakira indembe n’ibyumba byakira abarwayi batarembye cyane biboneka ku buryo butandukanye i Burayi, kuva ku bitanda 29,2 mu Budage kugera kuri 4,2 ku bantu 100 000 muri Poritigali.

sourceString: This means that countries may have more or less resources than Italy (12.5 intensive care and intermediate care beds per 100,000 population in 2010–11).
targetString: Ibi bivuze ko ibihugu bishobora kuba bifite ibikoresho byinshi cyangwa bikeya kurusha mu Butaliyani (bari bafite ibitanda byakira indembe n’abatarembye 12,5 ku bantu 100 000 mu 2010–11).

sourceString: Modelling scenarios related to healthcare capacity saturation, with estimates for each EU/EEA country and the UK of the prevalence of hospitalised COVID-19 cases associated with a > 90% risk of exceeding intensive care bed capacity, are provided in the sixth update of the ECDC rapid risk assessment on COVID-19.
targetString: Mu nyandiko ya gatandatu ikubiyemo amakuru mashya y’isuzuma ryihuse ry’ibibazo ECDC yakoze kuri COVID-19, hagaragaramo ingero zerekana imibare y’abarwayi irenze ubushobozi bwo kubitaho, ziherekejwe n’ikigereranyo kuri buri gihugu kigize EU/EEA na UK cy’abarwaye COVID-19 bari mu bitaro hamwe n’ikigero cya 90% cy’imibare yabo yarenga ibitanda biri ahavurirwa indembe.

sourceString: Since cases have so far clustered in certain regions in EU/EEA countries and the UK, and hospitals and intensive care units usually serve a defined regional catchment population, information about cases and intensive care beds should preferably be made available at the Nomenclature of territorial units for statistics 2 (NUTS-2) level.
targetString: Kubera ko kugeza ubu uturere tumwe na tumwe two mu bihugu bigize EU/EEA na UK ari two dukunze kugaragaramo abarwayi benshi, kandi ibitaro n’ahavurirwa indembe usanga ubusanzwe byakira abantu bavuye mu karere kihariye, amakuru yerekeye abarwayi n’ibitanda by’indembe akwiye kuboneka ku rwego rw’ibarurishamibare ry’uturere 2 (NUTS-2).

sourceString: The experience from Italy and the current trends in other countries show that the COVID-19 pandemic is progressing rapidly in the EU/EEA and the UK.
targetString: Urugero rw’Ubutaliyani n’uko ibintu bihagaze mu bindi bihugu byerekana ko icyorezo cya COVID-19 kiri gukwirakwira vuba muri EU/EEA na UK.

sourceString: Countries, hospitals and intensive care units should thus prepare themselves for a scenario of sustained community transmission of SARS-CoV-2 and an increase in the number of patients with COVID-19 requiring healthcare, and in particular intensive care, such as the one occurring in the affected regions of Italy.
targetString: Bityo, ibihugu, ibitaro n’ahavurirwa indembe bigomba kwitegura guhangana n’ubwandu bwa SARS-CoV-2 buzakomeza mu baturage n’izamuka ry’umubare w’abarwaye COVID-19 basaba kwitabwaho, cyane cyane mu bijyanye no kwita ku barwayi barembye, nk’uko biri kugenda mu turere twibasiwe mu Butaliyani.

sourceString: As pointed out in the recent ECDC rapid risk assessment, a rapid, proactive and comprehensive approach is essential to delay the spread of SARS-COV-2, with a shift from a containment to a mitigation approach, as the anticipated rapid increase in the number of cases may not provide decision makers and hospitals enough time to comprehend, accept and adapt their response accordingly if not implemented ahead of time.
targetString: Nk’uko byavuzwe mu isuzuma ry’ibibazo ryihuse riheruka gukorwa na ECDC, ni ngombwa gukoresha uburyo rusange bwihuse kandi bukoreshwa hakiri kare mu rwego rwo gukumira ikwirakwira rya SARS-COV-2, bityo uburyo bwo gukumira bugasimbura guma mu rugo, kubera ko izamuka ryitezwe ry’umubare w’abarwayi rishobora gutuma abafata ibyemezo n’abashinzwe ibitaro batabona umwanya uhagije wo gusesengura, kumvikana ku ngamba bagomba gufata no kuzikoresha bikwiye ziramutse zidafashwe hakiri kare.

sourceString: The rapid risk assessment also lists the public health measures to mitigate the impact of the pandemic.
targetString: Isuzuma ryihuse ry’ibibazo rinerekana ingamba z’ubuzima rusange zifatwa mu rwego rwo kugabanya ingaruka z’iki cyorezo.

sourceString: There is a short window of opportunity during which countries have the possibility to further increase their control efforts to slow down the spread of SARS-CoV-2 and decrease the pressure on healthcare.
targetString: Hari amahirwe make ibihugu byakoresha kugira ngo birusheho kongera ingamba bifata mu rwego rwo kubaganya ikwirakwira rya SARS-CoV-2 n’ingaruka zayo ku nzego z’ubuzima.

sourceString: Failing this, it is likely that the healthcare systems of other EU/EEA countries will face a surge of patients that require intensive care within the coming days or weeks.
targetString: Ibi biramutse bidakozwe, birashoboka ko inzego z’ubuzima zo mu bindi bihugu bigize EU/EEA byahura n’ikibazo cy’umubare munini w’abarwayi barembye mu minsi cyangwa mu byumweru biri imbere.

sourceString: The outbreak of Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), has thus far killed over 3,000 people and infected over 80,000 in China and elsewhere in the world, resulting in catastrophe for humans.
targetString: Icyorezo cy’indwara ya koronavirusi 2019 (COVID-19), cyatewe na koronavirusi 2 (SARS-CoV-2) itera indwara yo mu myanya y’ubuhumekero ikaze cyane (SARS), imaze guhitana abantu barenga 3 000 no gufata abarenga 80 000 mu Bushinwa n’ahandi ku isi, bityo ikaba ari amakuba ku bantu.

sourceString: Similar to its homologous virus, SARS-CoV, which caused SARS in thousands of people in 2003, SARS-CoV-2 might also be transmitted from the bats and causes similar symptoms through a similar mechanism.
targetString: Kimwe n’indi virusi bisa, SARS-CoV, yateye ibicurane bikaze cyane (SARS) ibihumbi by’abantu mu 2003, SARS-CoV-2 na yo ishobora gukwirakwizwa n’uducurama ikaba igira ibimenyetso bisa kandi bigaragara kimwe.

sourceString: However, COVID-19 has lower severity and mortality than SARS but is much more transmissive and affects more elderly individuals than youth and more men than women.
targetString: Ariko COVID-19 usanga idakaze cyane kandi ihitana abantu bake ugereranyije na SARS nubwo yandura vuba cyane kandi ikaba ikunda kwibasira abantu bakuze kurusha urubyiruko ikanibasira cyane abagabo kurusha abagore.

sourceString: In response to the rapidly increasing number of publications on the emerging disease, this article attempts to provide a timely and comprehensive review of the swiftly developing research subject.
targetString: Kubera umubare wiyongera cyane w’ibitangazwa kuri iyi ndwara nshya, iyi nyandiko iragerageza gukora isuzuma rusange kandi rifite akamaro ry’iyi ngingo igenda irushaho gukorwaho ubushakashatsi.

sourceString: We will cover the basics about the epidemiology, etiology, virology, diagnosis, treatment, prognosis, and prevention of the disease.
targetString: Turibanda ku nshoza z’ibanze nk’ubumenyi bw’iyi ndwara, ikiyitera, virusi iyitera, uko isuzumwa, uko ivurwa, uko ikwirakwira n’uko yirindwa.

sourceString: Although many questions still require answers, we hope that this review helps in the understanding and eradication of the threatening disease.
targetString: Nubwo hakiri ibibazo byinshi bisaba gusubizwa, twizeye ko iri suzuma rizafasha mu kumenya no kurandura iyi ndwara ibangamiye ubuzima.

sourceString: The Spring Festival on January 25, 2020 has become an unprecedented and unforgettable memory to all Chinese who were urged to stay indoors for all the holiday and for many weeks after due to the outbreak of a novel viral disease.
targetString: Iserukiramuco (Spring Festival) ryo ku itariki ya 25 Mutarama 2020 rimaze kwandika amateka adashobora kwibagirana mu Bashinwa bose basabwe kuguma iwabo mu biruhuko byose no mu byumweru byinshi byakurikiyeho bitewe n’icyorezo cyatewe na virusi nshya.

sourceString: The virus is highly homologous to the coronavirus (CoV) that caused an outbreak of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) in 2003; thus, it was named SARS-CoV-2 by the World Health Organization (WHO) on February 11, 2020, and the associated disease was named CoV Disease-19 (COVID-19).
targetString: Iyi virusi ifite ibintu byinshi ihuriyeho na koronavirusi (CoV) yateye icyorezo cy’ibicurane bikaze cyane (SARS) mu 2003; bityo Ishami ry'Umuryango w'Abibumbye ryita ku buzima (OMS) rikaba ryarayise SARS-CoV-2 ku itariki ya 11 Gashyantare 2020, noneho indwara iyikomokaho yitwa Indwara ya CoV 19 (COVID-19).

sourceString: The epidemic started in Wuhan, China, and quickly spread throughout the entire country and to near 50 others all over the world.
targetString: Iki cyorezo cyatangiriye mu mujyi wa Wuhan, mu Bushinwa, nuko gikwirakwira mu gihugu cyose no mu bindi bihugu bigera kuri 50 ku isi hose.

sourceString: As of March 2, 2020, the virus has resulted in over 80,000 confirmed cases of COVID-19, with more than 40,000 patients discharged and over 3,000 patients who died.
targetString: Ku itariki ya 2 Werurwe 2020, abantu barenga 80 000 bari bamaze kwemezwa ko banduye virusi ya COVID-19, muri bo abarenga 40 000 bamaze gusezererwa naho abapfuye barenga 3 000.

sourceString: WHO warns that COVID-19 is “public enemy number 1” and potentially more powerful than terrorism.
targetString: OMS iburira abantu yemeza ko COVID-19 ari “umwanzi rusange wa 1” kandi ko ishobora kugira ingaruka zikomeye kurusha iterabwoba.

sourceString: According to PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/), in less than two months, over 200 papers have been published on COVID-19 including its virology, epidemiology, etiology, diagnosis, and treatment since the first report on January 7, 2020 that determined the sequence of the virus isolated from multiple patients.
targetString: Nk’uko bigaragazwa na PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/), mu gihe kitageze ku mezi abiri, hatangajwe inyandiko zirenga 200 kuri COVID-19 harimo izivuga kuri virusi iyitera, ku cyorezo cyayo, aho yakomotse, uko isuzumwa n’uko ivurwa kuva igihe raporo ya mbere yatangarijwe ku itariki ya 7 Mutarama 2020 yasobanuye imiterere ya virusi yari yafashwe mu barwayi batandukanye.

sourceString: This review attempts to summarize the research progress in the new and swiftly developing subject area.
targetString: Iri suzuma riragerageza gukora incamake y’ubushakashatsi bumaze gukorwa kuri iyi ngingo nshya kandi irimo gukorwaho ubushakashatsi cyane.

sourceString: Whenever possible, we will try to compare COVID-19 with SARS and another CoV-caused disease, Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS, an outbreak in 2012).
targetString: Igihe cyose bishoboka, tuzagerageza kugereranya COVID-19 na SARS ndetse n’indi ndwara iterwa na CoV, nk’ibicurane byo mu Burasirazuba bwo hagati (MERS, byagaragaye mu 2012).

sourceString: We will also discuss what we have learned so far regarding the prevention and prognosis of the disease as well as some remaining yet urgent questions.
targetString: Tuzanasuzuma amasomo tumaze kunguka kugeza ubu ku bijyanye no gukumira ikwirakirwa no kumenya igitera iyi ndwara ndetse na bimwe mu bibazo byihutirwa bitarabonerwa ibisubizo.

sourceString: CoVs have been traditionally considered nonlethal pathogens to humans, mainly causing approximately 15% of common colds 4.
targetString: Virusi zo mu bwoko bwa CoVs ubasanzwe zifatwa nka virusi zitica abantu, usanga zitera cyane cyane ubwoko 4 bw’ibicurane bikunze kuboneka ku gipimo kigera nko kuri 15%.

sourceString: However, in this century, we have encountered highly pathogenic human CoVs twice, i.e., SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, which caused an outbreak originally in China in 2003 and Saudi Arabia in 2012, respectively, and soon spread to many other countries with horrible morbidity and mortality.
targetString: Ariko, muri iki kinyejana, twahuye na virusi za CoVs zibasira abantu cyane incuro ebyiri, ari zo SARS-CoV na MERS-CoV, zateye icyorezo cyagaragaye mu Bushinwa mu 2003 no muri Arabiya Sawudite 2012, noneho nyuma yaho zikwirakwira mu bindi bihugu byinshi abantu batagira ingano barandura abandi barapfa.

sourceString: Therefore, the current COVID-19 is the third CoV outbreak in the recorded history of humans.
targetString: Ni yo mpamvu COVID-19 yo muri iyi minsi ari icyorezo cya gatatu cya CoV kigaragaye mu mateka ya muntu.

sourceString: As shown in Fig. ​Fig.1,1, clusters of pneumonia that had unknown origins were first reported from Wuhan on December 31, 2019 to the China National Health Commission.
targetString: Nk’uko bigaragara mu Gishushanyo ​Igishushanyo cya 1.1, abantu barwaye umusonga watewe n’ikintu kitazwi bagaragaye bwa mbere mu mujyi wa Wuhan ku itariki ya 31 Ukuboza 2019 ari na bwo byamenyeshejwe Komisiyo y’Igihugu Ishinzwe Ubuzima mu Bushinwa.

sourceString: Seven days later the sequence of the CoV was released.
targetString: Nyuma y’iminsi irindwi ni bwo hasohotse inyandiko isobanura imiterere ya CoV.

sourceString: On January 15, 2020 the first fatal case from Wuhan was reported.
targetString: Ku itariki ya 15 Mutarama 2020 ni bwo hapfuye umuntu wa mbere muri Wuhan.

sourceString: Meanwhile, the epidemic rapidly spread to the neighboring cities, provinces, and countries.
targetString: Hagati aho icyorezo cyakwirakwiye vuba mu yindi mijyi, intara n’ibihugu bituranye.

sourceString: On January 20, the infection of health-care providers was reported, suggesting that human-to-human transmission was possible.
targetString: Kuri 20 Mutarama, hatangajwe ko hari abaganga banduye, byumvikana ko abantu bashobora kwanduzanya iyi virusi.

sourceString: On January 23, the city of Wuhan was locked down with all its public transportation stopped.
targetString: Kuri 23 Mutarama, umujyi wa Wuhan washyizwe mu kato n’uburyo bwose bwo gutwara abantu burahagarikwa.

sourceString: On January 24 the first clinical study on the disease reported that, out of 41 patients with confirmed cases, only 21 had direct contact with the Wuhan seafood market that was considered the starting site of the infection from an unknown animal source.
targetString: Kuri 24 Mutarama ni bwo ubushakashatsi bw’ubuvuzi bwa mbere kuri iyi ndwara bwatangaje ko, mu barwayi 41 bari bemejwe ko banduye, 21 ni bo bonyine bari bageze ku isoko ry’ibituruka mu nyanja ry’i Wuhan abantu bavugaga ko ari ho ubwandu bwari bwaturutse butewe n’inyamaswa itazwi.

sourceString: On January 30, WHO declared the outbreak a global health emergency.
targetString: Kuri 30 Mutarama, OMS yatangaje ko iki cyorezo ari amakuba abangamiye ubuzima ku isi.

sourceString: By the time of this report, the disease has already spread throughout China and near 50 other countries all over the world (Fig. ​(Fig.2).2).
targetString: Igihe iyi raporo yatangazwaga, iyi ndwara yari yamaze gukwirakwira mu Bushinwa hose no mu bindi bihugu bigera kuri 50 ku isi hose (Igishushanyo ​(Igishushanyo cya 2).2).

sourceString: As the situation is rapidly evolving, the final scope and severity of the outbreak remain to be determined.
targetString: Kubera iki cyorezo kiri gukwirakwira vuba, ntibyoroshye kumenya aho kizagarukira n’ingaruka zacyo.

sourceString: On February 11, 2020, a multi-center study on 8,866 patients including 4,021 confirmed COVID-19 patients presented a more updated illustration of the epidemic as follows (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA).
targetString: Kuri 11 Gashyantare 2020, ubushakashatsi bwakorewe ku bigo binyuranye ku barwayi 8 866 barimo abarwayi 4 021 bagaragajwe ko banduye COVID-19 bwatanze ishusho ivuguruye kurushaho y’uko iki cyorezo gihagaze dusanga ku rubuga (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA).

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 infected people of all ages, but mainly at the age of 30-65.
targetString: Abantu banduye SARS-CoV-2 bafite imyaka inyuranye, ariko biganjemo abafite hagati y’imyaka 30 na 65.

sourceString: Almost half (47.7%) of the infected individuals were over 50 years old, very few were under 20, and only 14 infected individuals were under the age of 10.
targetString: Hafi icya kabiri (47,7%) cy’abanduye bari barengeje imyaka 50, bake cyane bafite munsi ya 20, noneho abantu banduye 14 gusa bari bafite munsi y’imyaka 10.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 infected more men (0.31/100,000) than women (0.27/100,000).
targetString: Abagabo ni bo banduye SARS-CoV-2 cyane (0,31/100 000) kurusha abagore (0,27/100 000).

sourceString: COVID-19 expanded in clusters mainly in and around Hubei.
targetString: COVID-19 yakwirakwiye cyane cyane muri Hubei no mu turere byegeranye.

sourceString: COVID-19 took an average of 5 (2-9) days from onset to diagnosis.
targetString: Ugereranyije, kuva COVID-19 yagaragara kugera habonetse uburyo isuzumwa hashize nk’iminsi 5 (2-9).

sourceString: The average incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days.
targetString: Ugereranyije byafashe iminsi 4,8 (3,0-7,2) kugira ngo igaragaze ibimenyetso.

sourceString: The average time from onset to death was 9.5 (4.8-13) days.
targetString: Ugereranyije umuntu wa mbere yapfuye hashize 9,5 (4,8-13) kuva igaragaye.

sourceString: The basic reproductive number (R0) was 3.77 (95% CI: 3.51-4.05), and the adjusted R0 was 2.23-4.82.
targetString: Umubare w’ibanze w’abashobora kwandura (R0) wari 3,77 (95% CI: 3,51-4,05), naho R0 iburungushuye yari 2,23-4,82.

sourceString: The number of infected people increased exponentially before 23 Jan. 2020, matching the time of massive transportation before the Spring Festival in China.
targetString: Umubare w’abanduye wiyongeye bikabije mbere yo kuri 23 Mutarama 2020, uhura n’igihe abantu benshi baba bakora ingendo mbere y’iserukiramuco ‘Spring Festival’ mu Bushinwa.

sourceString: The mortality of patients with confirmed cases was 1.44% (95% CI: 1.10-1.86%), and the adjusted mortality of all the patients was 3.06% (95% CI: 2.02-4.59%).
targetString: Umubare w’abemejwe ko banduye wari 1,44% (95% CI: 1,10-1,86%), naho umubare uburungushuye w’abapfa mu barwayi bose wari 3,06% (95% CI: 2,02-4,59%).

sourceString: Three major risk factors for COVID-19 were sex (male), age (≥60), and severe pneumonia.
targetString: Ibibazo bitatu bikomeye kuri COVID-19 byari igitsina (gabo), imyaka (≥60), n’umusonga ukaze.

sourceString: CoVs are a subfamily of large and enveloped viruses containing a single strand of sense RNA.
targetString: Virusi za CoVs ni akaryango ka virusi nini zifite utwugara zirimo RNA y’ibyiyumviro imwe rukumbi.

sourceString: They can be divided into four genera, i.e., alpha, beta, gamma, and delta, of which alpha- and beta-CoVs are known to infect humans.
targetString: Zishobora gushyirwa mu bwoko bune, ari bwo alufa, beta, gama na delita. Muri ubu bwoko virusi za CoVs zo mu bwoko bwa alufa na beta ni zo zishobora kwanduza abantu.

sourceString: The envelope spike (S) glycoprotein binds to its cellular receptors angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) and dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4) for SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, respectively, and then membrane fusion occurs.
targetString: Girikoporoteyine yo ku mutwe (S) w’akugara ifata ku imvubura bita ACE2 n’indi bita DPP4 mu gihe cya SARS-CoV na MERS-CoV, noneho ingenangingo zikihuza.

sourceString: The viral RNA genome is released into the cytoplasm; after replication of the viral genome, genomic RNA accompanied by envelope glycoproteins and nucleocapsid proteins forms virion-containing vesicles, which then fuse with the plasma membrane to release the virus.
targetString: Jenome ya virusi ya RNA iravuburwa ikajya mu y’ingirabuzimafatizo; jenome ya virusi yamara gukopororwa, RNA ya jenome iri kumwe na girikoporoteyine z’akugara na poroteyine za nekereyokapuside ikora imvubura z’inyangingo fatizo zihuza n’ingenangingo za purasima zikavamo virusi.

sourceString: The first genomic sequence of SARS-CoV-2 was reported on January 10, 2020.
targetString: Imiterere ya mbere ya jenome ya SARS-CoV-2 yagaragajwe ku itariki ya 10 Mutarama 2020.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 was found to be a new type of beta-CoV with more than 99.98% genetic identity among 10 sequenced samples collected from the original site of the outbreak, the Huanan Seafood Market in Wuhan.
targetString: Hagaragaye ko SARS-CoV-2 ari ubwoko bushya bwa beta-CoV byahuje jene ku kigero cya 99,98% mu bizamini ndangamiterere 10 byafashwe aho icyorezo cyatangiriye, mu isoko ry’ibiva mu nyanja ry’i Huanan muri Wuhan.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 is genetically more similar to SARS-CoV than to MERS-CoV.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 ifite jene zisa cyane n’iza SARS-CoV kurusha MERS-CoV.

sourceString: Through transmission electron microscopy, SARS-CoV-2 particles were found in ultrathin sections of human airway epithelium.
targetString: Muri mikorosikope ya elegitoronike isuzuma uko yandura, uduce twa SARS-CoV-2 twagaragaye mu bice binanutse bikabije bya epiteriyumu y’imyanya y’ubuhumekero y’umuntu.

sourceString: Human ACE2 was found to be a receptor for SARS-CoV-2 as well as SARS-CoV.
targetString: Imvubura ya ACE2 mu muntu ni yo basanze ibamo SARS-CoV-2 na SARS-CoV.

sourceString: However, the S protein of SARS-CoV-2 binds to human ACE2 more weakly than that of SARS-CoV, which is coincident with the fact that SARS-CoV-2 causes less severe infection in patients than SARS-CoV.
targetString: Ariko poroteyine ya S ya SARS-CoV-2 yihuza n’imvubura ya ACE2 y’umuntu buhoro cyane kurusha iya SARS-CoV, ibi bikaba bihuye n’ibyemezwa ko SARS-CoV-2 yanduza abarwayi bidakabije kurusha SARS-CoV.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 can also form a novel short protein encoded by orf3b and a secreted protein encoded by orf8.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 ishobora no kuba poroteyine ngufi nshya ikorwa na poroteyine ya orf3b na poroteyine ivuburwa ikorwa na poroteyine ya orf8.

sourceString: The orf3b of SARS-CoV-2 may play a role in the viral pathogenicity and inhibit the expression of IFNβ; however, orf8 does not contain any known functional domain or motif.
targetString: Poroteyine ya orf3b yo muri SARS-CoV-2 ishobora kuba igira uruhare mu bushobozi bwo gutera indwara bwa virusi no kubuza IFNβ kugaragara; ariko poroteyine ya orf8 ntabwo ibamo imiterere cyangwa imimerere izwi.

sourceString: On February 18, 2020, Zhou, et al., reported the cryo-EM structure of the full-length human ACE2 at 2.9 Å resolution in complex with the amino acid transporter B0AT1.
targetString: Ku itariki ya 18 Gashyantare 2020, Zhou na bagenzi be batangaje imiterere yo muri mikorosikope ya elegitoronike ikoresha ubushyuhe bwo hasi cyane (cryo-EM) bw’imvubura ya ACE2 yuzuye y’umuntu ku bucucike bwa 2,9 Å mu rusobe rw’inyangingo igendamo aside amino B0AT1.

sourceString: They found that the complex, which had open and closed conformations, was assembled as a dimer and the ACE2-B0AT1 complex can bind two S proteins, which provides evidence for CoV recognition and infection.
targetString: Basanze ko urwo rusobe, rufite imiterere ifunguye n’ifunze, yikusanyije nk’inyangingo ebyiri kandi urusobe rwa ACE2-B0AT1 rushobora guhuza poroteyine za S ebyiri, bikaba ari ikimenyetso cy’imigaragarire n’ubwandu bya virusi ya CoV.

sourceString: B0AT1 may become a therapeutic target for drug screening to suppress SARS-CoV-2 infection.
targetString: B0AT1 ishobora kwibandwaho mu gusuzuma imiti yo kurandura ubwandu bwa SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: The origin and intermediate host
targetString: Inyamaswa yakomotseho n’iyandujwe bwa mbere

sourceString: It has been known that both SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV originated from bats and were transmitted to humans via civet cats and camels, respectively.
targetString: Birazwi ko SARS-CoV na MERS-CoV zombi zaturutse mu ducurama noneho abantu bakazanduzwa n’impimbi n’ingamiya.

sourceString: Through a phylogenetic comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with other CoVs, bats were considered the native host of SARS-CoV-2 as the new virus is 96% identical to two SARS-like CoVs from bats called bat-SL-CoVZX45 and bat-SL-CoVZX21.
targetString: Hifashishijwe igereranyankomoko rya SARS-CoV-2 hamwe n’izindi virusi za CoVs, byagaragaye ko uducurama ari two SARS-CoV-2 yakomotseho kubera ko virusi nshya iteye kimwe ku kigero cya 96% na virusi ebyiri za CoVs zisa nka SARS zikomoka ku ducurama zitwa ‘bat-SL-CoVZX45’ na ‘bat-SL-CoVZX21’.

sourceString: However, what intermediate host helped the virus cross the species barrier to infect humans remains unknown, and the transmission route is yet to be elucidated.
targetString: Ariko inyamaswa yanduye bwa mbere yafashije iyi virusi kubasha kwibasira ubwoko bunyuranye kugeza yanduje abantu ntiramenyekana, kandi n’uburyo yanduramo ntiburamenyekana neza.

sourceString: Ji, et al., proposed snakes as a carrier of the virus from bats to humans which involved homologous recombination within the S protein.
targetString: Ji na bagenzi be bavuze ko inzoka zishobora kuba ari zo zanduje abantu iyi virusi ziyandujwe n’uducurama bikaba byarajyanye no kwiyuburura muri poroteyine ya S.

sourceString: According to a study, researchers in Guangzhou, China, suggested that pangolins - long-snouted, ant-eating mammals often used in traditional Chinese medicine - are the potential intermediate host of SARS-CoV-2 based on 99% genetic homology in a CoV discovered in pangolins and SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Nk’uko bigaragazwa n’ubushakashatsi, abashakashatsi bo muri Guangzhou, mu Bushinwa, bavuze ko ibisamujyonjyo, inyamabere zigira umunwa muremure zirya intozi zikaba zikoreshwa cyane n’abavuzi ba gihanga mu Bushinwa, bishobora kuba ari byo byanduye bwa mbere SARS-CoV-2 bitewe n’imiterere ya jene iteye kimwe ku kigero cya 99% yatahuwe muri virusi ya CoV yo mu bisamujyonjyo na SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, 1% difference spread all over two genomes is still a big difference; thus, conclusive results for concrete evidence are awaited (Fig. ​(Fig.33).
targetString: Ariko, ikinyuranyo cya 1% kigaragara muri jenome zombi kiracyari kinini; bityo hategerejwe imyanzuro itanga ibimenyetso bifatika (Igishushanyo ​(Igishushanyo 33).

sourceString: The physicochemical properties of SARS-CoV-2 are largely not yet known.
targetString: Ibyinshi mu biranga virusi ya SARS-CoV-2 ntibiramenyekana.

sourceString: SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV can survive in vitro for 48 hours in a dry environment and up to 5 days under 20 °C and 40%-50% humidity.
targetString: Virusi za SARS-CoV na MERS-CoV zishobora kumara hanze amasaha 48 ziri ahantu hashyushye, zikaba zageza ku minsi 5 ziri ahantu hafite ubushyuhe buri munsi ya 20 °C n’ubuhehere buri hagati ya 40% na 50%.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 may possess similar properties.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 ishobora kugira ibiyiranga bimwe.

sourceString: It has been reported that SARS-CoV-2 is sensitive to ultraviolet rays and heat at 56 °C for 30 minutes; ether, 75% ethanol, chlorine-containing disinfectant, peracetic acid, chloroform, and other fatty solvents, but not chlorhexidine, can effectively inactivate the virus.
targetString: Hagaragajwe ko SARS-CoV-2 itihanganira imirasire y’izuba n’ubushyuhe bwo kuri dogere 56 °C mu minota 30; eteri, etanoru 75%, imiti bisukuza irimo korore, aside perasetike, kororoforume, n’ibindi bitembabuzi by’amavuta, ariko atari kororegisidine, bishobora kwica iyi virusi neza.

sourceString: The entire human population generally lacks immunity to SARS-CoV-2 and hence is susceptible to the novel virus.
targetString: Muri rusange abantu bose nta budahangarwa bagira kuri SARS-CoV-2 bityo baka bibasirwa n’iyi virusi nshya.

sourceString: Currently, no detailed study has been reported regarding the immunological response to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Kugeza ubu, nta bushakashatsi bwimbitse burakorwa ku byerekeranye n’uko umubiri uhangana na SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Thus, we can only refer to previous studies on other CoVs, especially SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV (Fig. ​(Fig.4).4).
targetString: Ni yo mpamvu, twifashisha gusa ubushakashatsi bwakozwe mbere ku zindi virusi za CoV, cyane cyane SARS-CoV na MERS-CoV (Igishushanyo ​(Igishushanyo cya 4).4).

sourceString: In general, after a virus invades the host, it is first recognized by the host innate immune system through pattern recognition receptors (PRRs) including C-type lectin-like receptors, Toll-like receptor (TLR), NOD-like receptor (NLR), and RIG-I-like receptor (RLR).
targetString: Muri rusange, iyo virusi imaze kwinjira mu wayanduye, ibanza gutahurwa n’ubudahangarwa kamere binyuze mu nyakira zitandukanya imisusire (PRR) zikubiyemo inyakira zimeze nka regitine zo mu bwoko bwa C, inyakira ya TLR, inyakira ya NLR n’inyakira ya RLR.

sourceString: Through different pathways, the virus induces the expression of inflammatory factors, maturation of dendritic cells, and synthesis of type I interferons (IFNs) which limit the spreading of the virus and accelerate macrophage phagocytosis of viral antigens.
targetString: Mu nzira zinyuranye, iyi virusi itera ubushye, kubyimba kw’uturemangingo ngaragira, no kwiyegeranya kwa poroteyine zo mu bwoko bwa I (IFN) ziremwa mu rwego rwo guhangana na virusi bigabanya ikwirakwira rya virusi maze bikongera kuribwa kwa virusi zateye indwara.

sourceString: However, the N protein of SARS-CoV can help the virus escape from the immune responses.
targetString: Ariko, poroteyine ya N ya SARS-CoV ishobora gufasha iyi virusi gucika ibiyirwanya by’ubudahangarwa bw’umubiri.

sourceString: Soon, the adaptive immune response joins the fight against the virus.
targetString: Nyuma y’igihe gito, ubudahangarwa bw’umubiri butangira kurwanya iyi virusi.

sourceString: T lymphocytes including CD4+ and CD8+ T cells play an important role in the defense.
targetString: Ingirabuzima fatizo za T zikubiyemo uturemangingo twa CD4+ na CD8+ T tugira uruhare rukomeye mu kurinda umubiri.

sourceString: CD4+ T cells stimulate B cells to produce virus-specific antibodies, and CD8+ T cells directly kill virus-infected cells.
targetString: Uturemangingo twa CD4+ T twongerera imbaraga uturemangingo twa B kugira ngo dukore abasirikare b’umubiri bashobora guhangana n’iyo virusi, noneho uturemangingo twa CD8+ T tugahita twica uturemangingo twanduye virusi.

sourceString: T helper cells produce proinflammatory cytokines to help the defending cells.
targetString: Uturemangingo dufasha twa T dukora sitokine zifasha gutwika kugira ngo zifashe kurinda uturemangingo.

sourceString: However, CoV can inhibit T cell functions by inducing apoptosis of T cells.
targetString: Ariko CoV ishobora guca intege imikorere y’uturemangingo twa T itera urupfu rw’uturemangingo twa T.

sourceString: The humoral immunity including complements such as C3a and C5a and antibodies is also essential in combating the viral infection.
targetString: Ubudahangarwa bwo mu matembabuzi bukubiyemo inyunganira nka C3a na C5a n’abasirikare b’umubiri na bwo bugira akamaro mu kurwanya ubwandu bwa virusi.

sourceString: For example, antibodies isolated from a recovered patient neutralized MERS-CoV.
targetString: Urugero, abasirikare b’umubiri bavanwe mu murwayi wakize baciye intege MERS-CoV.

sourceString: On the other hand, an overreaction of the immune system generates a large number of free radicals locally that can cause severe damages to the lungs and other organs, and, in the worst scenario, multi-organ failure and even death.
targetString: Ikindi kandi, kwirwanaho bikabije by’ubudahangarwa bw’umubiri bituma habaho umubare munini w’ingengangingo zidafite aho zifashe mu mubiri zishobora gutuma ibihaha n’izindi ngingo byangirika cyane, noneho, byagenda nabi, ingingo zinyuranye zikareka gukora hakaba hanavamo n’urupfu.

sourceString: The SARS-CoV-2 infection, featured by clustering onset, is more likely to affect elderly people with comorbidities and pregnant women.
targetString: Ubwandu bwa SARS-CoV-2, bwagaragaye mu banduye igitangira, ikunda kwibasira abantu bashaje barwaye izindi ndwara zinyuranye n’abagore batwite.

sourceString: It is common that for people who are exposed to a large number of viruses or whose immune functions are compromised, they have higher chance to be infected than others.
targetString: Akenshi usanga abantu bibasiwe na virusi nyinshi cyangwa bafite ubudahangarwa bw’umubiri budakora neza ari bo baba bafite ibyago byinshi byo kwandura kurusha abandi.

sourceString: The estimated mean incubation period of SARS-CoV-2 is 1-14 days, mostly 3-7 days based on a study of the first 425 cases in Wuhan.
targetString: Ikigereranyo cy’iminsi SARS-CoV-2 imara mu mubiri mbere yo kugaragaza ibimenyetso ni hagati y’iminsi 1 na 14, akenshi akaba ari hagati y’iminsi 3 na 7 hashingiwe ku bushakashatsi bwakozwe ku barwayi 425 ba mbere muri Wuhan.

sourceString: However, a study on 1,099 cases demonstrates that the incubation period was 3 days on average and ranged from 0 to 24 days.
targetString: Ariko, ubushakashatsi ku barwayi 1 099 bwerekanye ko igihe bifata kugira ngo ibimenyetso bigaragare ari iminsi 3 muri rusange kandi ko kiba hagati y’iminsi 0 na 24.

sourceString: A more recent study, as described above, demonstrates that the incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days based on the demography of 8,866 cases.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi bwa vuba cyane, nk’uko byavuzwe haruguru, bwerekanye ko igihe bifata kugira ngo ibimenyetso bigaragare ari iminsi 4,8 (3,0-7,2) hashingiwe ku mubare w’abarwayi 8 866.

sourceString: It is very important for health authorities to adjust the effective quarantine time based on the most accurate incubation period, thus preventing infected but symptomless people from transmitting the virus to others.
targetString: Ni ngombwa cyane ko inzego z’ubuzima zagena igihe cy’akato kiboneye hashingiwe ku gihe nyacyo bifata kugira ngo ibimenyetso bigaragare kurusha ibindi, bityo bikaba byabuza abantu banduye ariko badafite ibimenyetso kwanduza abandi.

sourceString: As a common practice, individuals exposed to, or infected by, the virus are usually required to be quarantined for 14 days.
targetString: Nk’uko bisanzwe, abantu bahuye n’ubwandu cyangwa banduye virusi basabwa kujya mu kato k’iminsi 14.

sourceString: Should the quarantine time be extended to 24 days?
targetString: Igihe cy’akato kiramutse cyongewe kikagera ku minsi 24?

sourceString: Fever is often the major and initial symptom of COVID-19, which can be accompanied by no symptom or other symptoms such as dry cough, shortness of breath, muscle ache, dizziness, headache, sore throat, rhinorrhea, chest pain, diarrhea, nausea, and vomiting.
targetString: Akenshi umuriro ni cyo kimenyetso gikomeye cya mbere cya COVID-19, ukaba ushobora kutajyana n’ikindi kimenyetso cyangwa ukajyana n’ibindi bimenyetso nk’inkorora y’akayi, guhumeka bigoranye, kuribwa mu ngingo, isereri, umutwe, kuribwa mu muhogo, ibicurane byinshi, kuribwa mu gatuza, impiswi, iseseme no kuruka.

sourceString: Some patients experienced dyspnea and/or hypoxemia one week after the onset of the disease.
targetString: Hari abarwayi bahumetse bigoranye cyangwa bagira ogisijeni nke mu maraso nyuma y’icyumweru bamaze gufatwa n’indwara.

sourceString: In severe cases, patients quickly progressed to develop acute respiratory syndrome, septic shock, metabolic acidosis, and coagulopathy.
targetString: Abarwayi barembye bahise bagira ibibazo bikomeye bwo guhumeka, umuvuduko w’amaraso wo hasi, ibibazo by’aside yo mu mubiri n’ibyo kuvura kw’amaraso.

sourceString: Patients with fever and/or respiratory symptoms and acute fever, even without pulmonary imaging abnormalities, should be screened for the virus for early diagnosis.
targetString: Abarwari bafite umuriro cyangwa ibimenyetso byo mu myanya y’ubuhumekero n’umuriro ukaze, nubwo baba nta bibazo by’ibihaha baba bagaragaza, bagomba gukorerwa ikizamini cya virusi hakiri kare.

sourceString: A demographic study in late December of 2019 showed that the percentages of the symptoms were 98% for fever, 76% for dry cough, 55% for dyspnea, and 3% for diarrhea; 8% of the patients required ventilation support.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi ku byiciro by’abarwayi bwakozwe mu mpera z’Ukuboza mu 2019 bwagaragaje ko ijanisha ry’ibimenyetso ryari 98% ku muriro, 76% ku nkorora y’akayi, 55% ku bibazo bya ogisijeni na 3% ku mpiswi; 8% ku barwayi basabye imashini zibafasha guhumeka.

sourceString: Similar findings were reported in two recent studies of a family cluster and a cluster caused by transmission from an asymptomatic individual.
targetString: Imyanzuro nk’iyi yatanzwe mu bushakashatsi bubiri buheruka gukorwa ku banduriye mu miryango no ku bandujwe n’abantu badafite ibimenyetso.

sourceString: Comparably, a demographic study in 2012 showed that MERS-CoV patients also had fever (98%), dry cough (47%), and dyspnea (55%) as their main symptoms.
targetString: Kimwe n’ubu bushakashatsi, ubushakashatsi bwakozwe mu 2012 ku banduye bwerekanye ko abarwaye MERS-CoV na bo bagize umuriro (98%), inkorora y’akayi (47%) n’ibibazo bya ogisijeni (55%) nk’ibimenyetso by’ibanze.

sourceString: However, 80% of them required ventilation support, much more than COVID-19 patients and consistent with the higher lethality of MERS than of COVID-19.
targetString: Ariko 80% muri bo basabye imashini zibafasha guhumeka kurusha mu barwaye COVID-19 n’umubare w’abapfuye uba munini kuri MERS kurusha uwa COVID-19.

sourceString: Diarrhea (26%) and sore throat (21%) were also observed with MERS patients.
targetString: Impiswi (26%) no kubabara mu muhogo (21%) na byo byagaragaye mu barwaye MERS.

sourceString: In SARS patients, it has been demonstrated that fever (99%-100%), dry cough (29%-75%), dyspnea (40%-42%), diarrhea (20-25%), and sore throat (13-25%) were the major symptoms and ventilation support was required for approximately 14%-20% of the patients.
targetString: Mu barwaye SARS, hagaragaye ko umuriro (99%-100%), inkorora y’akayi (29%-75%), ibibazo bya ogisijeni (40%-42%), impiswi (20-25%) no kubabara mu muhogo (13-25%) ari byo bimenyetso bikomeye n’abarwayi basabye imashini zibafasha guhumeka bageze nko kuri 14%-20%.

sourceString: By February 14, the mortality of COVID-19 was 2% when the confirmed cases reached 66,576 globally.
targetString: Ku itariki ya 14 Gashyantare, ijanisha ry’abishwe na COVID-19 ryari 2% igihe abarwayi bemejwe ku isi bari 66 576.

sourceString: Comparably, the mortality of SARS by November 2002 was 10% of 8,096 confirmed cases.
targetString: Kimwe no kuri iyi virusi, ijanisha ry’abishwe na SARS ryari 10% by’abarwayi bemejwe 8 096 mu Ugushyingo 2002.

sourceString: For MERS, based on a demographic study in June 2012, the mortality was 37% of 2,494 confirmed cases.
targetString: Kuri MERS, hashingiwe ku bushakashatsi bw’abanduye bwo muri Kamena 2012, ijanisha ry’abapfuye ryari 37% by’abarwayi bemejwe 2 494.

sourceString: An earlier study reported that the R0 of SARS-CoV-2 was as high as 6.47 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 5.71-7.23, whereas the R0 of SARS-CoV only ranged from 2 to 4.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi bwakozwe mbere y’aho bwagaragaje ko umubare w’ibanze w’abandura (R0) SARS-CoV-2 wari uhanitse ungana na 6,47, ikigereranyo cy’abandura kuri 95% (CI) ari 5,71-7,23, mu gihe R0 ya SARS-CoV yari hagati ya 2 na 4 gusa.

sourceString: A comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with MERS-CoV and SARA-CoV regarding their symptoms, mortality, and R0 is presented in Table ​Table1.1.
targetString: Igereranya rya SARS-CoV-2 na MERS-CoV na SARA-CoV ku byerekeranye n’ibimenyetso, umubare w’abapfa na R0 turarisanga mu mbonerahamwe ​Imbonerahamwe 1.1.

sourceString: The above figures suggest that SARS-CoV-2 has a higher ability to spread than MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV, but it is less lethal than the latter two.
targetString: Imibare imaze kuvugwa yerekana ko SARS-CoV-2 ifite ubushobozi buhanitse bwo gukwirakwira kurusha MERS-CoV na SARS-CoV, ariko ikaba yica abantu bake kurusha izo zindi.

sourceString: Thus, it is much more challenging to control the epidemic of SARS-CoV-2 than those of MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV.
targetString: Ni yo mpamvu bikomeye cyane kurwanya icyorezo cya SARS-CoV-2 kurusha icya MERS-CoV na SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Clustered onset often happens in the same family or from the same gathering or vehicle such as a cruise ship.
targetString: Akenshi abandura bagaragara mu muryango umwe cyangwa mu iteraniro cyangwa imodoka imwe nk’ubwato batemberamo.

sourceString: Patients often have a history of travel or residence in Wuhan or other affected areas or contact with infected individuals or patients in the recent two weeks before the onset.
targetString: Akenshi abarwayi baba barigeze gutemberera cyangwa gutura mu ntara ya Wuhan cyangwa mu tundi turere twibasiwe cyangwa se barahuye n’abantu banduye cyangwa barwaye mu byumweru bibiri byabanjirije igihe bafatiwe.

sourceString: However, it has been reported that people can carry the virus without symptoms longer than two weeks and cured patients discharged from hospitals can carry the virus again, which sends out an alarm to increase the time for quarantine.
targetString: Ariko, byagaragaye ko abantu bashobora kugendana n’iyi virusi nta bimenyetso bafite mu gihe kirenga ibyumweru bibiri kandi ko abarwayi bakize bagasezererwa mu bitaro bashobora kuba bagifite iyi virusi, bikaba byerekana ko ari ngombwa kongera igihe cy’akato.

sourceString: Patients have normal or reduced number of peripheral white blood cells (especially lymphocytes) at the early stage.
targetString: Abarwayi bagira umubare usanzwe cyangwa muke w’uturemangingo tw'umweru two mu maraso (cyane cyane ingirabuzima fatizo) mu minsi ya mbere.

sourceString: For example, lymphopenia with white blood cell count < 4×109/L including lymphocyte count < 1×109/L, and elevated aspartate aminotransferase levels and viremia were found in 1,099 COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Urugero, umubare muto w’ingirabuzima fatizo mu turemangingo tw'umweru two mu maraso ni < 4×109/L harimo ingirabuzima fatizo < 1×109/L, naho ibipimo byo hejuru by’asiparitate aminotaransiferaze (AST) na virusi ziboneka mu maraso byabonetse mu barwaye COVID-19 bangana na 1 099.

sourceString: The levels of liver and muscle enzymes and myoglobin were increased in the blood of some patients, and C-reactive protein and erythrocyte sedimentation were increased in the blood of most patients.
targetString: Ibipimo by’imvubura z’umwijima n’imikaya na miyogorobine byiyongeye mu maraso y’abarwayi bamwe na bamwe, no kwirundanya kwa poroteyine zikorwa n’umwijima na eritirosite kwariyongeye mu maraso y’abarwayi benshi.

sourceString: In patients with severe cases, the level of D-dimer, a fibrin degradation product present in the blood, was elevated, and lymphocyte count was progressively reduced.
targetString: Abarwayi barembye, igipimo cya D-dima, imvubura iterwa no kwangirika kwa fibirine iboneka mu maraso, cyari kiri hejuru, n’umubare w’ingirabuzima fatizo wagiye ugabanuka.

sourceString: Abnormalities in chest radiography are found in most COVID-19 patients and featured by bilateral patchy shadows or ground glass opacity in the lungs.
targetString: Ibibazo bigaragara mu kunyuza agatuza mu cyuma biboneka mu barweye COVID-19 benshi kandi bigaragazwa n’ibicucu biremekanye mu mpande zombi cyangwa ubwijime bwereruka (GGO) bw’ibihaha.

sourceString: Patients often develop an atypical pneumonia, acute lung injury, and acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).
targetString: Akenshi abarwayi bagira umusonga udasanzwe, ibisebe kibaze mu bihaha n’ibibazo bikomeye byo guhumeka (ARDS).

sourceString: When ARDS happens, uncontrolled inflammation, fluid accumulation, and progressive fibrosis severely compromise the gas exchange.
targetString: Iyo habayeho ibibazo bikomeye byo guhumeka (ARDS), ubushye bukabije, kwirundanya kw’amatembabuzi n’ibihaha bigenda bibabuka bibangamira cyane ihererekanwa ry’umwuka.

sourceString: Dysfunction of type-I and type-II pneumocytes decreases the surfactant level and increases surface tension, thus reducing the ability of the lungs to expand and heightening the risk of lung collapse.
targetString: Kudakora kwa pinemosite zo mu bwoko bwa I na II bigabanya igipimo cy’utunyangingo tugabanya umwanya hagati y’amatembabuzi no bigatuma ingingo zirushaho kubyigana, bityo bikagabanya ubushobozi bw’ibihaha bwo kwikwedura noneho bikongera ibyago byo gutuma ibihaha bireka gukora.

sourceString: Therefore, the worst chest radiographic findings often parallel the most severe extent of the disease.
targetString: Ni yo mpamvu, ibisubizo bibi bya radiyo y’agatuza akenshi usanga bijyana n’ubukare bukabije bw’iyi ndwara.

sourceString: On February 18, 2020, the first pathological analysis of COVID-19 demonstrated the desquamation of pneumocytes, hyaline membrane formation, and interstitial lymphocyte infiltration, and multinucleated syncytial cells in the lungs of a patient who died of the disease, consistent with the pathology of viral infection and ARDS and similar to that of SARS and MERS patients.
targetString: Kuri 18 Gashyantare 2020, isesengura rya mbere ry’igitera COVID-19 ryagaragaje ishishuka rya pinemosite, kubyimba kw’ingenangingo z’ibihaha, icengera ry’ingirabuzima fatizo mu myanya y’umwuka, n’uturemangingo dukomatanye dufite intima nyinshi mu bihaha by’umurwayi wishwe n’iyi ndwara, bihuye n’inkomoko ry’ubwandu bwa virusi n’ibibazo bikomeye byo guhumeka (ARDS), bikanamera kimwe no mu barwayi ba SARS na MERS.

sourceString: The detection of SARS-CoV-2 RNA via reverse-transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) was used as the major criteria for the diagnosis of COVID-19.
targetString: Itahurwa rya RNA ya SARS-CoV-2 RNA hifashishijwe uburyo bwo muri raboratwari bwa RT-PCR ryakoreshejwe nk’ikigenderwaho cy’ibanze mu isuzumwa rya COVID-19.

sourceString: However, due to the high false-negative rate, which may accelerate the epidemic, clinical manifestations started to be used for diagnosis (which no longer solely relied on RT-PCR) in China on February 13, 2020.
targetString: Ariko, kubera igipimo gihanitse cy’ibisubizo bivuga ko umuntu atanduye atari ukuri, bishobora gutuma icyorezo kirushaho gukwirakwira, ibimenyetso byatangiye gukoreshwa mu gusuzuma (bitacyibanda gusa ku buryo bwa RT-PCR) mu Bushinwa kuri 13 Gashyantare 2020.

sourceString: A similar situation also occurred with the diagnosis of SARS.
targetString: Ibi ni ko byanagenze ku isuzumwa rya SARS.

sourceString: Therefore, a combination of disease history, clinical manifestations, laboratory tests, and radiological findings is essential and imperative for making an effective diagnosis.
targetString: Ni yo mpamvu gukomatanya amateka y’indwara, ibimenyetso, ibizamini byo muri raboratwari n’ibisubizo byo kunyura mu cyuma bifite akamaro kandi bikaba na ngombwa kugira ngo hakorwe isuzuma riboneye.

sourceString: On February 14, 2020, the Feng Zhang group described a protocol of using the CRISPR-based SHERLOCK technique to detect SARS-CoV-2, which detects synthetic SARS-CoV-2 RNA fragments at 20 × 10-18 mol/L to 200 × 10-18 mol/L (10-100 copies per microliter of input) using a dipstick in less than an hour without requiring elaborate instrumentation.
targetString: Kuri 14 Gashyantare 2020, itsinda riyobowe na Feng Zhang ryasobanuye porotokore yo gukoresha uburyo bwa SHERLOCK bushingira kuri CRISPR mu gutahura SARS-CoV-2, itahura ibice by’ibyiganano bya RNA ya SARS-CoV-2 ku rugero rwa 20 × 10-18 mol/L kugera kuri 200 × 10-18 mol/L (kopi 10-100 kuri mikorolitiro cy’ibyinjijwe) hakoreshejwe igipimo cy’amavutta mu gihe kitageze ku isaha bidasabye ibikoresho bihambaye.

sourceString: Hopefully, the new technique can dramatically enhance the sensitivity and convenience if verified in clinical samples.
targetString: Hari icyizere ko ubu buryo bushya bushobora kuzamura cyane ireme buramutse bugenzuwe mu bizamini byo kwa muganga.

sourceString: Due to the lack of experience with the novel CoV, physicians can mainly provide supportive care to COVID-19 patients, while attempting a variety of therapies that have been used or proposed before for the treatment of other CoVs such as SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV and other viral diseases (Table ​(Table2).2).
targetString: Kubera kutamenyera CoV nshya, abaganga bashobora mbere na mbere kuba hafi y’abarwaye COVID-19, mu gihe barimo kugerageza imiti inyuranye yatanzwe cyangwa yifujwe mbere yo kuvura izindi CoVs nka SARS-CoV na MERS-CoV n’izindi ndwara ziterwa na virusi (Imbonerahamwe ​(Imbonerahamwe ya 2).2).

sourceString: These therapies include current and potential treatments with antiviral drugs, immunosuppressants, steroids, plasma from recovered patients, Chinese medicine, and psychological support.
targetString: Iyi miti ibamo imiti ikoreshwa n’ishobora gukoreshwa hamwe n’imiti irwanya virusi, imiti igabanya ubudahangarwa bw’umubiri, imiti igabanya kubyimba, purazima yavanwe mu barwayi bakize, imiti y’Abashinwa, n’ubufasha nsanamutima.

sourceString: Even plasma from recovered patients was proposed to be used for treatment.
targetString: Hanifujwe ko purazima yavanwe mu barwayi bakize yakoreshwa mu kuvura virusi.

sourceString: Pharmaceutical companies are racing to develop antibodies and vaccines against the virus.
targetString: Amasosiyete akora imiti ari gukora atikoresheje kugira ngo akore abasirikare b’umubiri n’inkingo zihangana n’iyi virusi.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 mainly attacks the lungs in the beginning and probably also attacks, to a lesser degree, other organs that express ACE2, such as the gastrointestinal system and the kidneys.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 yibasira cyane cyane ibihaha igitangira noneho ikaba ishobora no kwibasira, ku rugero rwo hasi, izindi ngingo zikora ACE2 nk’urwungano ngongozi n’impyiko.

sourceString: Nevertheless, respiratory dysfunction and failure are the major threat to the patients and the major cause of death.
targetString: Nyamara, gukora nabi no kudakora by’imyanya y’ubuhumekero ni byo bibazo bibangamira ubuzima bw’abarwayi n’impamvu nyamukuru y’urupfu.

sourceString: Thus, respiratory support is critical to relieve the symptoms and save lives and includes general oxygen therapy, high-flow oxygen, noninvasive ventilation, and invasive mechanical ventilation depending on the severity of the disease.
targetString: Ni yo mpamvu ubufasha bwo guhumeka ari ingenzi mu rwego rwo kugabanya ibimenyetso no kurokora abantu kandi hakaba harimo no kongerera umwuka muri rusange, kongerera umwuka ku gipimo cyo hejuru, gushyira ku mashini ifasha guhumeka bidakabije no guhumekera ku mashini ifasha guhumeka bitewe n’ubukare bw’indwara.

sourceString: Patients with severe respiratory symptoms have to be supported by extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO), a modified cardiopulmonary bypass technique used for the treatment of life-threatening cardiac or respiratory failure.
targetString: Abarwayi bafite ibimenyetso by’ibabazo byo guhumeka bikomeye bagomba kunganirwa n’uburyo bwo kongerera umwuka bwa ECMO, uburyo busimbura inzira y’ubuhumekero yo mu mutima n’ibihaha bukoreshwa mu kuvura abafite ibibazo bikomeye by’umutima cyangwa byo guhumeka.

sourceString: In addition, the maintenance of electrolyte balance, the prevention and treatment of secondary infection and septic shock, and the protection of the functions of the vital organs are also essential for SARS-CoV-2 patients.
targetString: Ikindi, kwita ku mikorere y’impyiko, kurwanya no kuvura izindi ndwara n’umuvuduko w’amaraso wo hasi, kubungabunga imikorere y’ingingo z’ingenzi na byo bigirira akamaro abarwayi ba SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: It has been known that a cytokine storm results from an overreaction of the immune system in SARS and MERS patients.
targetString: Birazwi ko ubwiyongere bwa sitokine buterwa no kwirwanaho bikabije by’ubudahangarwa bw’umubiri mu barwayi ba SARS na MERS.

sourceString: Cytokine storm is a form of systemic inflammatory response featured by the release of a series of cytokines including TNFα, IL-1β, IL-2, IL-6, IFNα, IFNβ, IFNγ, and MCP-1.
targetString: Ubwiyongere bwa sitokine ni uburyo bw’igisubizo cyo kwikingira cy’urwungano kigaragazwa no kuvubura sitokine zinyuranye nka TNFα, IL-1β, IL-2, IL-6, IFNα, IFNβ, IFNγ na MCP-1.

sourceString: These cytokines induce immune cells to release a vast number of free radicals which are the major cause of ARDS and multiple organ failure.
targetString: Izi sitokine zituma uturemangingo tw’ubudahangarwa bw'umubiri turekura umubare munini w’ingengangingo zidafite aho zifashe akaba ari zo zitera cyane cyane ARDS no kureka gukora kw’ingingo zinyuranye.

sourceString: Immunosuppression is essential in the treatment of cytokine storms, especially in severe patients.
targetString: Kugabanya ubudahangarwa bw’umubiri bigira akamaro mu kuvura ubwiyongere bwa sitokine, cyane cyane mu barwayi barembye.

sourceString: Corticosteroids and tocilizumab, an anti-IL6 monoclonal antibody, have been used to treat cytokine storm.
targetString: Korutikositeroyide na tosilizumabe, umusirikare w’umubiri ufite korone imwe urwanya IL6, zakoreshejwe mu kuvura ubwiyongere bwa sitokine.

sourceString: Other immunosuppression treatments for cytokine storm include the modulation of T cell-directed immune response; the blockade of IFN-γ, IL-1, and TNF; JAK inhibition; blinatumomab; suppressor of cytokine signaling 4; and HDAC inhibitors.
targetString: Iyindi miti igabanya ubudahangarwa bw’umubiri mu kuvura ubwiyongere bwa sitokine irimo kugabanya ingufu z’ubwirinzi bw’umubiri bwibasira uturemangingo twa T; gukumira IFN-γ, IL-1, na TNF; guca intege JAK; birinatumomabe; igabanya ry’ibimenyetso bya sitokine 4; n’imiti ica intege HDAC.

sourceString: Steroids, as immunosuppressants, were widely used in the treatment of SARS to reduce the severity of inflammatory damage.
targetString: Imiti igabanya kubyimba, nk’imiti igabanya ubudahangarwa bw’umubiri, yakoreshejwe cyane mu kuvura SARS mu rwego rwo kugabanya ubukare bw’ingaruka z’ubwirinzi bw’umubiri.

sourceString: However, steroids at high dosages were not beneficial to severe lung injury in SARS and COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Ariko, gufata imiti igabanya kubyimba myinshi nta kamaro byagize ku bihaha byacitse ibisebe bikaze mu barwayi ba SARS na COVID-19.

sourceString: Instead, they may cause severe side effects, especially avascular osteonecrosis, dramatically affecting the prognosis.
targetString: Ahubwo ishobora gutera ibibazo bikomeye, cyane cyane indwara y’amagufa (AVN), bigira ingaruka zikomeye ku mivurirwe y’indwara.

sourceString: Nevertheless, short courses of corticosteroids at low-to-moderate doses have been recommended to be used prudently for critically ill COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Nyamara, hifujwe ko doze nke n’izo mu rugero za korutikositeroyide zahabwa abarwayi ba COVID-19 barembye cyane mu gihe gito kandi bigakoranwa ubushishozi.

sourceString: At the time of writing, no effective antiviral therapy has been confirmed.
targetString: Igihe iyi raporo yandikwaga, mu muntu uboneye urwanya virusi wari wakabonetse.

sourceString: However, intravenous administration with remdesivir, a nucleotide analog, has been found to be efficacious in an American patient with COVID-19.
targetString: Ariko gutera urushinge rwa remdesivir, iteye kimwe na nikerewotide, byagaragaye ko bifite akamaro mu Munyamerika urwaye COVID-19.

sourceString: Remdesivir is a novel antiviral drug developed by Gilead initially for the treatment of diseases caused by Ebola and Marlburg viruses.
targetString: Remdesivir ni umuti urwanya virusi mushya wakozwe na Gilead ugenewe kuvura indwara ziterwa na virusi za Ebola na Marlburg.

sourceString: Later, remdesivir also demonstrated possible inhibition of other single stranded RNA viruses including MERS and SARS viruses.
targetString: Nyuma y’aho, remdesivir na yo yaje kugaragaza ko ishobora guca intege izindi virusi zigizwe na RNA zirimo virusi za MERS na SARS.

sourceString: Based on these, Gilead has provided the compound to China to conduct a pair of trials on SARS-CoV-2-infected individuals, and the results are highly anticipated.
targetString: Hashingiwe ku bimaze kuvugwa, Gilead yahaye Ubushinwa uyu muti kugira ngo bukore ubushakashatsi bubiri ku bantu banduye SARS-CoV-2, abantu bakaba bategereje cyane icyo bizatanga.

sourceString: In addition, baricitinb, interferon-α, lopinavir/ritonavir, and ribavirin have been suggested as potential therapies for patients with acute respiratory symptoms.
targetString: Ikindi kandi, umuti wa baricitinb, interferon-α, lopinavir/ritonavir na ribavirin yagaragajwe ko ishobora kuvura abarwayi bafite ibimenyetso by’ibibazo byo guhumeka bikomeye.

sourceString: Diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, liver damage, and other adverse reactions can occur following combined therapy with lopinavir/ritonavir.
targetString: Impiswi, iseseme, kuruka, kwangiriza kw’umwijima n’ibindi bibazo bikomeye bishobora kubaho bitewe no gukomatanya imiti na lopinavir/ritonavir.

sourceString: The interaction of these treatments with other drugs used in the patients should be monitored carefully.
targetString: Imikoranire y’iyi miti n’iyindi miti ikoreshwa mu barwayi igomba gukurikiranwa neza.

sourceString: Plasma from recovered patients and antibody generation
targetString: Purazima yavanwe mu barwayi bakize n’ikorwa ry’abasirikare b’umubiri

sourceString: The collection of the blood from patients who recovered from a contagious disease to treat other patients suffering from the same disease or to protect healthy individuals from catching the disease has a long history.
targetString: Gufata amaraso y’abantu bakize indwara yanduza mu rwego rwo kuyavuza abandi barwaye indwara imwe cyangwa kurinda abantu batarwaye kwandura iyo ndwara bimaze igihe kirekire bikorwa.

sourceString: Indeed, recovered patients often have a relatively high level of antibodies against the pathogen in their blood.
targetString: Ni byo koko, abarwayi bakize akenshi baba bafite umubare ugihe kuba munini w’abasirikare b’umubiri barwanya virusi iri mu maraso yabo.

sourceString: Antibodies are an immunoglobulin (Ig) produced by B lymphocytes to fight pathogens and other foreign objects and they recognize unique molecules in the pathogens and neutralize them directly.
targetString: Abasirikare b’umubiri ni gorobirine irinda umubiri indwara (Ig) ikorwa n’ingirabuzima fatizo za B kugira ngo irwanye virusi n’ibindi bintu bidasanzwe bakaba bamenya morekire rukumbi zo muri virusi noneho bagahita bazica.

sourceString: Based on this, plasma was collected from the blood of a group of patients who recovered from COVID-19 and was injected into 10 seriously ill patients.
targetString: Hashingiwe ku bimaze kuvugwa, purazima yavanwa mu maraso y’itsinda ry’abarwayi bakize COVID-19 noneho aterwa mu barwayi barembye cyane 10.

sourceString: Their symptoms improved within 24 hours, accompanied by reduced inflammation and viral loads and improved oxygen saturation in the blood.
targetString: Ibimenyetso bari bafite byatangiye koroha mu masaha 24, bijyana n’igabanyuka ry’ububyimbe n’umubare wa virusi ndetse na ogusijene iriyongera mu maraso.

sourceString: However, verification and clarification are necessary to propose the method for large-scale use before specific therapies are not yet developed.
targetString: Ariko igenzura n’isobanura ni ngombwa kugira ngo hatangwe uburyo bwo kuyakoresha mu barwayi benshi mu gihe hatarakorwa imiti yihariye.

sourceString: In addition, given the therapeutic effects, some disadvantages associated with the plasma should be considered carefully.
targetString: Ikindi kandi, kubera ingaruka z’imiti, zimwe mu ngaruka mbi zijyana na purazima zigomba gusuzumwana ubushishozi.

sourceString: For example, antibodies can overstimulate the immune response and cause cytokine release syndrome, which is potentially a life-threatening toxicity.
targetString: Urugero, abasirikare b’umubiri bashobora kongera bikabije ubwirinzi bw’umubiri noneho bigatuma hakorwa sitokine, zishobora kuba uburozi bwashyira ubuzima mu kaga.

sourceString: The concentration of antibodies in the blood is usually low, and the demand for the plasma is large to treat critically ill patients.
targetString: Ubusanzwe abasirikare b’umubiri aba ari bake mu maraso kandi hasabwa purazima nyinshi mu kuvura abarwayi barembye cyane.

sourceString: It is difficult to develop and produce specific antibodies rapidly enough to fight against a global epidemic.
targetString: Ntibyoroshye gukora abasirikare b’umubiri bihariye vuba bihagije mu rwego rwo kurwanya icyorezo mpuzamahanga.

sourceString: Thus, it is more critical and practical to isolate B cells from recovered patients and identify the genetic codes encoding effective antibodies or screen for effective antibodies against essential proteins of the virus.
targetString: Ni yo mpamvu ari ngombwa kandi bikabi bikwiye kuvana uturemangingo twa B mu barwayi bakize noneho hagashakwamo kode za jene zigize abasirikare b’umubiri bakaze cyangwa gusuzuma abasirikare b’umubiri bakaze bagereranywa na poroteyine za ngombwa zigize iyo virusi.

sourceString: This way, we can readily scale up the production of the antibodies.
targetString: Bigenze gutyo, twabasha rwose kongera ikorwa ry’abasirikare b’umubiri.

sourceString: TCM has been used to treat a variety of diseases in China for thousands of years.
targetString: Hashize imyaka ibihumbi n’ibihumbi ubuvuzi gakondo bw’Abashinwa (TCM) bukoreshwa mu kuvura indwara zinyuranye mu Bushinwa.

sourceString: However, its effects largely rely on a combination of multiple components in a formula that varies depending on the diagnosis of a disease based on the theories of TCM.
targetString: Ariko imikorere yayo ishingira cyane ku gukomatanya imiti inyuranye mu buryo buhindagurika bitewe n’isuzuma ry’indwara hashingiwe ku buryo bukoreshwa muri TCM.

sourceString: Most of the effective components remain unknown or are vague as it is difficult to extract and verify such components or their optimal combinations.
targetString: Imyinshi mu miti igira akamaro ntiramenyekana cyangwa ntizwi neza kubera ko bikomeye kuyiyungurura no kugenzura iyo miti cyangwa ibipimo by’imivangirwe yayo.

sourceString: Currently, due to the lack of effective and specific therapy for COVID-19, TCM has become one of the major alternative treatments for patients with light to moderate symptoms or for those who have recovered from severe stages.
targetString: Muri iki gihe, kubera ibura ry’umuti wihariye uvura COVID-19, TCM yabaye imwe mu miti ikomeye yunganira abarwayi bafite ibimenyetso byoroheje n’ibyo mu rugero cyangwa abarwayi bamaze koroherwa.

sourceString: For example, Shu Feng Jie Du capsules and Lian Hua Qing Wen capsules were found to be effective for COVID-19 treatment.
targetString: Urugero, ibitonyanga bya Shu Feng Jie Du na Lian Hua Qing Wen byagaragaye ko bishobora kugira akamaro mu kuvura COVID-19.

sourceString: Top cure rates in the treatment of COVID-19 patients were observed in several provinces in China that used TCM in 87% of their patients, including Gansu (63.7%), Ningxia (50%), and Hunan (50%), whereas Hubei province, which used TCM in only approximately 30% of its COVID-19 patients, had the lowest cure rate (13%).
targetString: Ibipimo byo hejuru byo gukira mu kuvura abarwaye COVID-19 byagaragaye mu ntara nyinshi zo mu Bushinwa zakoresheje TCM muri 87% by’abarwayi baho, nko muri Gansu (63,7%), Ningxia (50%) no muri Hunan (50%), naho mu ntara ya Hubei, yakoresheje TCM nko muri 30% gusa by’abarwaye COVID-19, habonetseyo igipimo cyo gukira cyo hasi cyane (13%).

sourceString: However, this is quite a rough comparison as many other impact factors such as the number and severity of the patients should be included in the evaluation.
targetString: Ariko iri ni igereranya ridacukumbuye kubera ko ibindi bintu byinshi bigira ingaruka nk’umubare no kuremba by’abarwayi bigomba kwitabwaho mu isuzuma.

sourceString: On February 18, 2020, Boli Zhang and coworkers published a study to compare western medicine (WM) treatment alone with combined treatment of WM and TCM.
targetString: Kuri 18 Gashyantare 2020, Boli Zhang n’abo bakorana batangaje ubushakashatsi bugereranya kuvura bakoresha imiti y’i Burayi no muri Amerika yonyine no kuvura bakomatanya WM na TCM.

sourceString: They found that the times needed for body temperature recovery, symptom disappearance, and hospitalization were remarkably shorter in the WM+TCM group than in the WM only group.
targetString: Basanze ibihe bisabwa kugira ngo umubiri usubirane ubushyuhe busanzwe, ibimenyetso bikire no kugira ngo umuntu ashyirwe mu bitaro ari bigufi cyane mu itsinda ry’abahawe WM+TCM kurusha mu itsinda ry’abahawe WM gusa.

sourceString: Most impressively, the rate for symptomatic worsening (from light to severe) was remarkably lower for the WM+TCM group than for the WM only group (7.4% versus 46.2%) and the mortality was lower in the WM+TCM group than WM only group (8.8% versus 39%).
targetString: Icyashimishije cyane ni uko igipimo cyo gukomera kw’ibimenyetso (kuva ku bimenyetso byoroheje kugera ku bikaze) cyagabanyutse bigaragara mu itsinda ry’abahawe WM+TCM kurusha mu itsinda ry’abahawe WM gusa (7,4% kuri 46,2%) n’umubare w’abapfa wabaye muto mu itsinda ry’abahawe WM+TCM kurusha mu itsinda ry’abahawe WM gusa (8,8% kuri 39%).

sourceString: Nevertheless, the efficacy and safety of TCM still await more well-controlled trials at larger scales and in more centers.
targetString: Nyamara, akamaro n’ubuziranenge bya TCM biracyategereje gukorwaho ubushakashatsi bunonosoye kurushaho ku bantu benshi no mu bigo byinshi.

sourceString: It would also be intriguing to characterize the mechanism of actions and clarify the effective components of TCM treatments or their combinations if possible.
targetString: Byanaba byiza kugaragaza uko iyi miti ikora no gusobanura neza ibigize imiti ya TCM bigira akamaro ikoreshejwe yonyine cyangwa ikomatanyijwe n’iyindi biramutse bishoboka.

sourceString: Patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 mostly experience great fear of the highly contagious and even fatal disease, and quarantined people also experience boredom, loneliness, and anger.
targetString: Abarwayi bakekwa cyangwa bemejwe ko banduye COVID-19 akenshi usanga bagira ubwoba bwinshi bwo kuba iyi ndwara yandura cyane ikaba yanabaviramo gupfa, n’abashyirwa mu kato na bo usanga batabyakira neza, bumva bari bonyine bikanabatera kurakara.

sourceString: Furthermore, symptoms of the infection such as fever, hypoxia, and cough as well as adverse effects of the treatments such as insomnia caused by corticosteroids can lead to more anxiety and mental distress.
targetString: Na none, ibimenyetso by’ubwandu nk’umuriro, ibibazo by’umwuka muke, inkorora n’ingaruka mbi z’imiti nko kubura ibitotsi biterwa na korutikositeroyide bishobora gutuma umuntu agira umuhangayiko mwinshi n’ibibazo byo mu mutwe.
