targetString: Kugeza ubu, WIV1 igaragaza ko ikomoka cyane kuri SARS-CoV yo mu ducurama, bikaba bisangiye 95% mu gusa ku isanomuzi.

sourceString: Albeit the high homology between these two viruses, it is generally believed that WIV1 is not the immediate parental virus of SARS-CoV and bats are not the immediate reservoir host of SARS-CoV.
targetString: N’ubwo izo virusi ebyiri zifitanye isano ya hafi, muri rusange hatekerezwa ko WIV1 atari yo ibyara virusi ya SARS-CoV kandi uducurama si two ndiri virusi ya SARS-CoV ikuriramo.

sourceString: Phylogenetic analysis clusters MERS-CoV to the same group as bat CoV-HKU4 and bat CoV-HKU5.
targetString: Isesengura ry’imihindagurikire ya virusi rishyira MERS-CoV mu itsinda rimwe virusi za CoV-HKU4 na CoV-HKU5 zo mu ducurama.

sourceString: Bat CoV-HKU4 and MERS-CoV utilize the same host receptor, dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4), for virus entry.
targetString: CoV-HKU4 yo mu ducurama na MERS-CoV zakirwa na poroteyine ya DPP4 imwe, ikoreshwa na virusi mu kwinjira mu mubiri.

sourceString: RNA-dependent RNA polymerase sequences of MERS-CoV are phylogenetically closer to counterparts in bat beta-CoVs identified from Europe and Africa.
targetString: Poroteyine y’imiterere ya polimerase ya RNA yo mu MERS-CoV isa cyane na virusi ngenzi yayo ifata uducurama ya beta-CoV yabonetse mu Burayi n’Afurika.

sourceString: Up to now, no live MERS-CoV can be found in wild bats.
targetString: Kugeza ubu, nta virusi nzima ya MERS-CoV wabona mu ducurama two mu ishyamba.

sourceString: MERS-CoV and its closest relative bat CoV-HKU25 share only 87% nucleotide sequence homology.
targetString: MERS-CoV n’indi virusi bisa cyane yo mu ducurama ya CoV-HKU25 bihuje gusa 87% ku isanomuzi.

sourceString: Thus, bats might not be the immediate reservoir host of MERS-CoV.
targetString: Bityo, uducurama dushobora kuba atari two ndiri virusi ya MERS-CoV ikuriraho.

sourceString: On the other hand, studies in Middle East have shown that dromedary camels are seropositive for MERS-CoV-specific neutralizing antibodies, same as camels of Middle East origin in multiple African countries.
targetString: Ku rundi ruhande, ubushakashatsi bwakorewe mu Burasirazuba bwo hagati bwagaragaje ko ingamiya zifitemo abasirikare baca intege by’umwihariko virusi ya MERS-CoV, kimwe nk’ingamiya zikomoka mu Burasirazuba bwo hagati zo mu bihugu byinshi by’Afurika.

sourceString: Live MERS-CoV identical to the virus found in humans was isolated from the nasal swabs of dromedary camels, further indicating that camels serve as the bona fide reservoir host of MERS-CoV.
targetString: Virusi nzima ya MERS-CoV isa nka virusi igaragara mu bantu yakuwe mu bipimo byo mu mazuru by’ingamiya, bigaragaraza kurushaho ko ingamiya ari indiri nyayo ya virusi ya MERS-CoV.

sourceString: It is also noteworthy that generally mild symptoms but massive virus shedding were observed in camels experimentally infected with MERS-CoV.
targetString: Biranakwiye kuvuga muri rusange ari ibimenyetso byoroheje ariko bigaragaza ko virusi yakuze ikanava ku bwinshi byagaragaye mu ngamiya zakoreweho ubushakashatsi zikanduzwa virusi ya MERS-CoV.

sourceString: Notably, infected camels shed viruses not only through respiratory route but also through fecal-oral route, which is also the main route for virus shedding from bats.
targetString: By’umwihariko, ingamiya zanduye virusi zayirekuye bitanyuze gusa mu nzira z’ubuhumekero ahubwo binanyuze mu musarani, bikaba ari na yo nzira y’ibanze virusi zanduramo zivuye mu ducurama.

sourceString: However, questions still remain since many confirmed cases of MERS have no contact history with camels prior to symptom onset, plausibly ascribed to human-to-human transmission or unknown transmission routes involving unrecognized animal species that harbour MERS-CoV.
targetString: Ariko, hari ibibazo bikibazwa kuko abenshi bemejwe ko banduye virusi ya MERS batigeze bahura n’ingamiya mbere yo gutangira kugaragaza ibimenyetso, byakwitwa ko abantu banduje abandi cyangwa bitazwi aho banduriye bikaba bishoboka ko amoko y’inyamaswa atazwi afite virusi ya MERS-CoV.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 shares 96.2% nucleotide homology with a bat CoV RaTG13 isolated from Rhinolophus affinis bats.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 ifite 96,2% by’igice cy’isanomuzi na CoV RaTG13 yo mu gacurama yakuwe mu bwoko bw’uducurama.

sourceString: As in the cases of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, the sequence divergence between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is too great to assign parental relationship.
targetString: Ku byerekeye virusi za SARS-CoV na MERS-CoV, imiterere itandukanye hagati ya SARS-CoV-2 na RaTG13 ni minini cyane ku buryo ntawavuga ko zikomoka hamwe.

sourceString: That is to say, bats might not be the immediate reservoir host(s) of SARS-CoV-2 unless almost identical bat CoVs are found in future.
targetString: Uducurama dushobora kuba atari two ndiri virusi ya SARS-CoV-2 ikuriramo keretse mu minsi iri imbere hagaragaye isa na CoV ikurira mu ducurama.

sourceString: Presumably, the intermediate animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2 should be among the wildlife species sold and killed at the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, with which many of the initial cases of COVID-19 were associated, indicative of a probable animal-to-human transmission event.
targetString: Birashoboka ko inyamaswa zikuriramo SARS-CoV-2 ziba ari zo mu mashyamba zigurishwa zikabagirwa mu Isoko rya Huanan Seafood Wholesale, aho abenshi mu banduye bwa mbere COVID-19 baturutse, bikaba ari ikimenyetso kigaragaza ko bishoboka ko inyamaswa zanduje abantu.

sourceString: Several recent studies based on metagenomic sequencing have suggested that a group of endangered small mammals known as pangolins (Manis javanica) could also harbour ancestral beta-CoVs related to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi bwinshi buherutse gukorwa bushingiye ku miterere ya metajenome, bwavuze ko itsinda ry’inyamabare nto ziri mu kaga zizwi nk’igisamujyonjyo na zo zishobora kuba zikomokaho virusi ya beta-CoV ifitanye isano na SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: These novel pangolin CoV genomes share 85-92% nucleotide sequence homology with SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Izo jenome za CoV nshya z’igisamujyonjyo zifite 85-92% by’isanomuzi rya virusi ya SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, they are equally closely related to RaTG13 with about 90% identity at the level of nucleotide sequence.
targetString: Ariko, zifitanye isano ingana na RaTG13 bikaba bisa kuri 90% ku rwego rw’isanomuzi.

sourceString: They cluster into two sub-lineages of SARS-CoV-2-like viruses in the phylogenetic tree, one of which share a more similar receptor binding domain (RBD) with SARS-CoV-2, with 97.4% amino acid sequence identity.
targetString: Ziri mu matsinda abiri mato bisa ya virusi zisa nka SARS-CoV-2 mu mihindagurikire ya virusi, imwe muri yo ifite poroteyine ituma ifata ku ngirabuzimafatizo (RBD) isa nk’iya SARS-CoV-2 kuri 97,4% by’ibiranga imiterere ya aside amino.

sourceString: In stark contrast, the RBDs of SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 are more divergent, albeit a higher degree of sequence homology genome-wide.
targetString: Ku buryo butandukanye cyane, RBD za SARS-CoV-2 na RaTG13 ziratandukanye cyane, nubwo zisa ku rugero rwo hejuru mu byerekeye isano rya jenome.

sourceString: An earlier study on diseased pangolins also reported the detection of viral contigs from lung samples, which turn out to be similarly related to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi bwakozwe mbere ku ndwara zifata igisamujyonjyo byanavuze ko hatahuwe uduce tw’isanomuzi twa virusi two mu bipimo byo mu bihaha, bikaba bifitanye isano risa na SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: This study adopted different assembly methods and manual curation to generate a partial genome sequence comprising about 86.3% of the full-length viral genome.
targetString: Ubu bushakashatsi bwakoresheje uburyo butandukanye bwo guhuza no gutoranya hatangwa imwe mu miterere ya jenome igizwe na 86,3% bya jenome yose ya virusi.

sourceString: We cannot exclude the possibility that pangolin is one of the intermediate animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Twitareka kuvuga ko bishoboka ko igisamujyonjyo ari kimwe mu nyamaswa zikuriramo virusi y a SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, currently there is no evidence in support of a direct pangolin origin of SARS-CoV-2 due to the sequence divergence between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs.
targetString: Ariko, ubu nta bimenyetso byemeza ko virusi ya SARS-CoV-2 ikomoka bitaziguye ku gisamujyonjyo kuko imiterere itandukanye hagati ya SARS-CoV-2 na SARS-CoV-2 ijyanye na beta-CoV ifata igisamujyonjyo.

sourceString: In addition, the distance between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is even shorter than that between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs.
targetString: Kandi, intera iri hagati ya SARS-CoV-2 na RaTG13 ni ngufi y’iri hagati ya SARS-CoV-2 na SARS-CoV-2 ijyanye na beta-CoV ifata igisamujyonjyo.

sourceString: The evolutionary pathway of SARS-CoV-2 in bats, pangolins and other mammals remains to be established.
targetString: Inzira y’ihinduka rya SARS-CoV-2 mu ducurama, ibisamujyonjyo n’izindi nyamaswa igomba gusobanurwa.

sourceString: Whereas the highest sequence homology has been found in the RBDs between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin, SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs, SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 share the highest genome-wide sequence homology.
targetString: Mu gihe imiterere y'isano ikomeye yagaragaye muri RBD hagati ya SARS-CoV-2 n’igisamujyonjyo, SARS-CoV-2 ijyanye na beta-CoVs, SARS-CoV-2 na RaTG13 bisangiye imiterere y’isano rya jenome ikomeye.

sourceString: It is highly speculative that the high degree of similarity between the RBDs of pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs and SARS-CoV-2 is driven by selectivity-mediated convergent evolution.
targetString: Biravugwa cyane ko urugero rwo hejuru rwo gusa hagati ya RBD ya virusi ya SARS-CoV-2 ijyanye na beta-CoV ifata igisamujyonjyo na SARS-CoV-2 iterwa n’ihinduka rigendera ku gutoranya.

sourceString: A counter-proposal is in favour of a recombination between a pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoV and RaTG13 in the third wild animal species.
targetString: Undi mushinga urifuza guhinduranya ingirangingofatizo hagati ya SARS-CoV-2 ijyanye na beta-CoV ifata igisamujyonjyo na RaTG13 igaterwa mu moko ya gatatu y’inyamaswa zo mu ishyamba.

sourceString: As a driving force in evolution, recombination is widespread among beta-CoVs.
targetString: Ku byerekeye igitera ihinduka, guhinduranya ingirangingofatizo birakorwa cyane muri za beta-CoV.

sourceString: The jury is still out on the immediate zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Inteko iracyasesengura ku nyamaswa ikuriramo virusi ya SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Besides the highly pathogenic HCoVs, the zoonotic origin of HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-HKU1 have also been studied.
targetString: Usibye HCoV zitera indwara cyane, ikomoka rya HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-NL63 na HCoV-HKU1 ku nyamaswa na ryo ryakozweho ubushakashatsi.

sourceString: Phylogenetic evidence indicated that both HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-229E might have originated from bat CoVs, while the parental viruses of HCoV-OC43 and HCoV-HKU1 have been found in rodents.
targetString: Ibimenyetso by’imihindagurikire ya virusi byagaragaje ko HCoV-NL63 na HCoV-229E zishobora kuba zarakomotse kuri CoV yo mu gacurama, mu gihe virusi zibyara HCoV-OC43 na HCoV-HKU1 zasanzwe mu ngugunnyi.

sourceString: It has been reported that a bat CoV termed ARCoV.2 (Appalachian Ridge CoV) detected in North American tricolored bat displayed close relationship with HCoV-NL63.
targetString: Byavuzwe ko CoV yo mu gacurama yiswe ARCoV.2 (CoV yo mu misozi ya Appalachia) yatahuwe mu gacurama k’amabara atatu ko muri Amerika ya ruguru yagaragaje isano ya hafi na HCoV-NL63.

sourceString: On the other hand, HCoV-229E was genetically related to another bat CoV, termed Hipposideros/GhanaKwam/19/2008, which was detected in Ghana, while camelids have also been suspected as its intermediate host.
targetString: Ku rundi ruhande, HCoV-229E yari ifite isano ishingiye kuri jene n’indi CoV yo mu gacurama, yiswe Hipposideros/GhanaKwam/19/2008, yatahuwe muri Gana, mu gihe ubwoko bw’ingamiya bwaketsweho kuba bukuriramo iyo virusi.

sourceString: For clarity, the current knowledge on animal origins of known HCoVs is summarized in Figure ​1 and Table 2.
targetString: Mu kubisobanura neza, ubumenyi buhari ku nyamaswa bizwi ko yazanye virusi ya HCoVs yavuzwe muri make mu gishushanyo cya​1 n’imbonerahamwe ya 2.

sourceString: Phylogenetic analysis has provided evidence for interspecies transmission events of HCoVs in the history.
targetString: Isesengura ry’imihindagurikire ya virusi ryatanze ibimenyetso ko mu mateka habayeo kwanduzanya hagati y’amoko kwa HCoV.

sourceString: When HCoV-OC43 crossed species to infect humans from domestic livestock around 1890, a pandemic of respiratory infection was recorded.
targetString: Igihe HCoV-OC43 yavuye mu moko amwe akanduza abantu biturutse ku matungo yororerwa mu ngo ahagana mu 1890, hagaragaye icyorezo cy’indwara yo mu buhumekero.

sourceString: The interspecies transmission history of HCoV-229E is less clear.
targetString: Amateka yo kwanduzanya hagati y’amoko kwa virusi ya HCoV-229E ntagaragara neza.

sourceString: Bat alpha-CoVs closely related to HCoV-229E have been found.
targetString: alpha-CoV yo mu gacurama isa na HCoV-229E yaragaragaye.

sourceString: Between them there is an alpaca alpha-CoV.
targetString: Hagati yazo harimo alpha-CoV ifata arupaga.

sourceString: Several lines of evidence support the transmission of virus from bats to humans directly.
targetString: Ibimenyetso byinshi bishyigikira ko kwandura kwa virusi iturutse mu ducurama igahita ijya mu bantu.

sourceString: First, humans but not alpacas might have contact with bats in a shared ecological niche.
targetString: Icya mbere, abantu atari za arupaga, bahurira n’uducurama henshi mu buturo basangiye.

sourceString: Instead, humans have close contact with alpacas.
targetString: Ariko, abantu ni bo bakunda guhura cyane na za arupaga.

sourceString: Second, HCoV-229E-related bat alpha-CoVs are diverse and non-pathogenic in bats, whereas alpaca alpha-CoV caused an outbreak of respiratory disease in infected animals.
targetString: Icya kabiri, HCoV-229E ijyanye na alpha-CoV yo mugacurama ntizisa kandi ntizanduza uducurama, aho alpha-CoV yo muri arupaga yatewe n’icyorezo cyo mu buhumekero mu nyamaswa.

sourceString: Finally, alpaca alpha-CoV has not been found in feral animals.
targetString: Hanyuma, alpha-CoV yo muri arupaga yasanzwe mu nyagasozi.

sourceString: Thus, the possibility cannot be excluded that alpacas obtain the HCoV-229E-related alpha-CoV from humans.
targetString: Bityo, ntawashidikanya ko za arupaga zandujwe HCoV-229E ijyanye na alpha-CoV n’abantu.

sourceString: In fact, bats are the direct source of human pathogenic viruses including rabies virus, Ebola virus, Nipah virus and Hendra virus.
targetString: Muri make, uducurama ni two twanduza abantu virusi itera ibisazi, virusi itera ebola, virusi ya Nipah na virusi ya Hendra.

sourceString: It is therefore not too surprising that bats might transmit HCoV-229E to humans directly.
targetString: Bityo, ntibitangaje cyane kubona uducurama dushobora guhita twanduza abantu virusi ya HCoV-229E.

sourceString: Alternatively, whereas bat alpha-CoVs serve as the gene pool of HCoV-229E, alpacas and dromedary camels might serve as intermediate hosts that transmit viruses to humans, exactly as in the case of MERS-CoV.
targetString: Mu buryo bunyuranye n’ubwo, aho alpha-CoVs ari itsinda rya jene rya HCoV-229E, za arupaga n’ingamiya zishobora kuba zakuriramo virusi zikananduza virusi abantu, bimeze neza nko kuri virusi ya MERS-CoV.

sourceString: MERS-CoV serves as an excellent example of interspecies transmission from bats to dromedary camels and from dromedary camels to humans.
targetString: MERS-CoV ni urugero rwiza rwo kwanduzanya virusi hagati y’amoko uhereye ku ducurama ukagera ku ngamiya ukanahera ku ngamiya ukageza ku bantu.

sourceString: The evolutionary origin of MERS-CoV from bats is known at its initial identification and has also been strengthened by subsequent findings.
targetString: Imihindagurikire y’inkomoko ya MERS-CoV yo mu ducurama izwi mu gihe yamenyekanye bwa mbere kandi byanashimangiwe n’ibyavuye mu bushakashatsi byakurikiyeho.

sourceString: It is obvious that bats provide a rich pool of virus species for interspecies exchange of genetic fragments and interspecies transmission.
targetString: Biragaragara ko uducurama ari itsinda rikomeye rya virusi zo mu nyamaswa mu ihererekanya ry’uduce twa jene no kwanduzanya hagati y’inyamaswa.

sourceString: Longevity, densely packed colonies, close social interaction and strong ability to fly are all favourable conditions for bats to be an ideal 'virus spreader'.
targetString: Kuramba, gutura ahantu hamwe, kubana bya hafi n’ubushobozi bukomeye bwo kuguruka ni byo bintu bituma uducurama tuba inyamaswa zikomeye mu 'gukwirakwiza virusi'.

sourceString: On the other hand, MERS-CoV has been introduced to dromedary camels for decades.
targetString: Ku rundi ruhande, hashize imyaka myinshi virusi ya MERS-CoV yinjiye mu ngamiya.

sourceString: It is well adapted to these camels that have turned from an intermediate host to a stable and natural reservoir host.
targetString: Yamenyereye neza izo ngamiya zaretse kuba inyamaswa ikuriramo zikaba inyamaswa zigirwa indiri ya virusi zibamo zitekanye no mu buryo karemano.

sourceString: MERS-CoV causes very mild disease and maintains a relatively low mutation rate in these animals.
targetString: Virusi ya MERS-CoV itera indwara idakomeye kandi ikomeza kugenda ihinduka gahoro muri izo nyamaswa.

sourceString: Its sporadic transmission to humans is an accident and humans remain a dead-end host of MERS-CoV as its transmission cannot be sustained.
targetString: Kwandura ikagera mu bantu ni impanuka kandi abantu ntibanduza virusi ya MERS-CoV kuko ikwirakwira ryayo ridakomeye.

sourceString: In contrast to the role of camels in the transmission of MERS-CoV, the role of pangolins, if there is any, in the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 is different.
targetString: Ku bitandukanye n’uruhare rw’ingamiya mu kwanduza MERS-CoV, uruhare rw’ibisamujyonjyo niba ruhari, mu kwanduza virusi ya SARS-CoV-2 ruratandukanye.

sourceString: Particularly, pangolin beta-CoVs are highly pathogenic in pangolins.
targetString: By’umwihariko, beta-CoV yo mu bisamujyonjyo itera indwara cyane mu bisamujyonjyo.

sourceString: They might be a dead-end host for SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs, similar to civets in the case of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Zishobora kuba zirimo virusi ya SARS-CoV-2 ijyanye na beta-CoV ariko zitayanduza bisa nko ku mpimbi kuri SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Several possibilities for interspecies transmission of SARS-CoV-2 from animals to humans have to be ruled in or ruled out in future studies.
targetString: Birashoboka cyane ko inyamaswa zanduzanya SARS-CoV-2, inyamaswa na zo zikanduza abantu byakwemezwa cyangwa ntibyemezwe mu bushakashatsi bw’ahazaza.

sourceString: First, bats could be the reservoir host of a SARS-CoV-2-related virus almost identical to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Icya mbere, uducurama dushobora kuba ari ndiri ya virusi ifitanye isano na SARS-CoV-2 ijya gusa na virusi ya SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Humans might share the ecological niche with bats through butchering or coal mining.
targetString: Abantu bashobora gusangira ubuturo n’uducurama binyuze mu kutubaga no gucukura amakara.

sourceString: Second, pangolins could be one of intermediate amplifying host to which a SARS-CoV-2-related virus had been newly introduced.
targetString: Icya kabiri, ibisamujyonjyo bishobora kuba ari zimwe mu nyamaswa virusi zikuriramo zikanororokeramo cyane zifashwe vuba na virusi zifitanye isano na SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Humans contract the virus through butchering and consumption of game meat.
targetString: Abantu bandura virusi biturutse mu kubaga no kurya inyama z’inyamaswa z’ishyamba.

sourceString: It is possible that many mammals including domestic animals are susceptible to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Birashoboka ko inyamabere nyinshi harimo n’amatungo yo mu rugo zikekwaho kuba zifite virusi ya SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: A survey of domestic and wild animals for antibodies is warranted.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi ku matungo yo mu rugo n’inyamaswa zo mu ishyamba bwasanze zifite abasirikare barwanya virusi.

sourceString: Third, as mentioned above, recombination and adaptation of SARS-CoV-2 might have occurred in a third species that has contact with both bats and pangolins.
targetString: Icya gatatu, ku byavuzwe ku guhinduranya ingirangingofatizo no kumenyera kwa SARS-CoV-2 bishobora kuba byarabayeho mu bwoko bwa gatatu bw’inyamaswa zahuye n’uducurama n’ingamiya.

sourceString: The search for the animal origins of SARS-CoV-2 is still on.
targetString: Gushakisha inyamaswa itera SARS-CoV-2 birakomeje.

sourceString: Apart from different types of the animal hosts, three major factors on the viral side are also important in facilitating CoVs to cross species barriers.
targetString: Usibye amoko atandukanye y’inyamaswa zikuriramo virusi, ibintu bitatu ku ruhande rwa virusi na byo ni ingenzi mu korohereza CoV kujya mu yandi moko y’inyamaswa.

sourceString: First of all, their relatively high mutation rates in RNA replication.
targetString: Mbere na mbere, ni igipimo cyo guhinduka kinini cyane mu kwikoramo utundi duce twa RNA.

sourceString: In comparison to other single-stranded RNA viruses, the estimated mutation rates of CoVs could be regarded as “moderate” to “high” with an average substitution rate being ~10-4 substitution per year per site 2, depending on the phase of CoV adaptation to novel hosts.
targetString: Zigereranyijwe n’izindi virusi za jene imwe ya RNA, guhinduka kwa CoV kuri mu “rugero” cyangwa “hejuru” n’impuzandengo yo guhindura jene ni ~10-4 ku mwaka kuri buri jene 2, bitewe n’icyiciro cy’imenyera rya CoV mu nyamaswa nshya yagiyemo.

sourceString: CoVs have a proof-reading exoribonuclease, deletion of which results in exceedingly high mutability and attenuation or even inviability.
targetString: CoV ifite anzime ihindura RNA, igasiba ibice byayo bituma ihinduka cyane igacika intege cyangwa ntibe yanabaho.

sourceString: Interestingly, the nucleotide analogue Remdesivir is known to suppress CoV replication through inhibition of this exoribonuclease and the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.
targetString: Igitangaje ni uko ku gice cy’isanomuzi, umuti wa Remdesivir uzwiho guhagarika kwikoramo utundi duce kwa CoV hifashishijwe anzime ibuza poroteyine ya polimerase ya RNA gukora.

sourceString: Remdesivir is one of most promising anti-SARS-CoV-2 agents to be tested in clinical trials.
targetString: Remdesivir ni umwe mu muti utanga icyizere ku kurwanya SARS-CoV-2 wasuzumwe n’abaganga.

sourceString: Nevertheless, mutation rates of CoVs are about a million times higher than those of their hosts.
targetString: Nyamara, guhinduka kwa CoV ni hafi miliyoni kurusha inyamaswa izo virusi zikuriramo.

sourceString: In addition, mutation rate is often high when CoVs are not well adapted to the host.
targetString: Kandi, guhinduka akenshi biba biri hejuru iyo CoV zitamenyereye neza inyamaswa zikuriramo.

sourceString: Compared to SARS-CoV with a high mutation rate, the mutation rate of SARS-CoV-2 is apparently lower, suggestive of a higher level of adaptation to humans.
targetString: Mu kugereranya SARS-CoV ihinduka cyane, guhinduka kwa SARS-CoV-2 kuri hasi bigaragara, bikaba ari byo bituma imenyera cyane abantu.

sourceString: Presumably, it has already been adapted to another host close to humans.
targetString: Bivugwa ko yari yaramaze kumenyera indi nyamaswa hafi cyane y’abantu.

sourceString: In addition to SARS-CoV-2, this also applies to MERS-CoV, which is well adapted to dromedary camels.
targetString: Usibye SARS-CoV-2, ibi binareba MERS-CoV, yamenyereye neza kuba mu ngamiya.

sourceString: Theoretically, it is unlikely that genetic drift would render vaccines and antivirals against SARS-CoV-2 ineffective quickly.
targetString: Bityo, ntibyashoboka ko guhinduka kwa jene byatuma inkingino n’imiti igabanya ubukana bwa SARS-CoV-2 byacika intege vuba.

sourceString: Second, the large RNA genome in CoVs exerts extra plasticity in genome modification for mutations and recombination, thereby increasing the probability for interspecies co-evolution, which is advantageous for the emergence of novel CoVs when the conditions become appropriate.
targetString: Icya kabiri, jenome nini ya RNA iri muri CoVs ikoresha ubundi buryo bwo guhindura imiterere muri jenome igahinduka ikanahinduranya ingirangingofatizo; bityo, ikongera amahirwe yo guhindukana n’inyamaswa ibamo, bikaba ari inyungu mu mikurire ya virusi nshya za CoV igihe bikwiye.

sourceString: This is supported by the copious unique open reading frames and protein functions encoded towards the 3′ end of the genome.
targetString: Ibi bishimangirwa n’imiterere ya RNA ivamo poroteyine n’imikorere yayo isobetse y’umusozo wa 3 wa jenome.

sourceString: Third, CoVs randomly and frequently switch templates during RNA replication through a unique “copy-choice” mechanism.
targetString: Icya gatatu, CoV irahinduka kandi kenshi ikavamo utundi duce twa RNA binyuze mu buryo bwo “guhindura jenome ikenewe”.

sourceString: In a host that serves as the mixing vessel, strand switching occurs frequently during CoV RNA transcription.
targetString: Mu nyamaswa ikurimo, guhinduka kwa jenome bibaho kenshi igihe RNA ya CoV iri kujya ku ngirangingofatizo.

sourceString: Highly homologous full-length and subgenomic RNAs could recombine to generate new CoVs.
targetString: RNA zisa cyane kandi zifite jenome zungirije zishobora guhindura ingirangingofatizo zigatanga CoV nshya.

sourceString: Phylogenetic evidence of natural recombination has been found in both HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-OC43, as well as animal CoVs such as bat SL-CoV and batCoV-HKU9.
targetString: Imihindagurikire karemano ya virusi yasanzwe muri HCoV-HKU1 na HCoV-OC43, ndetse na CoV zifata inyamaswa nka SL-CoV na batCoV-HKU9 ziba mu ducurama.

sourceString: Virus-host interaction in relation to transmission
targetString: Imibanire ya virusi n’inyamaswa ibamo mu byo kwanduzanya

sourceString: Besides three viral factors stated above, viral interaction with host receptor is another key factor influential on interspecies transmission.
targetString: Usibye virusi eshatu zavuzwe haruguru, imibanire ya virusi n’inyamaswa ikuriramo ni ikindi kintu gituma habaho kwanduzanya hagati y’ubwoko bunyuranye.

sourceString: Herein, recombination of SARS-CoV is taken as a typical example, which also showed evidence of positive selection during interspecies transmission events.
targetString: Bityo, guhinduka kwa SARS-CoV bifatwa nk’urugero rufatika, byanagaragaje guhitamo neza igice cy’umubiri virusi ijyamo mu kwanduzanya hagati y’inyamaswa.

sourceString: Based on the comparative analysis between isolates of human and civet SARS-CoVs, SARS-CoV is thought to undergo rapid adaptation in different hosts, particularly with mutations at the RBD of the S protein.
targetString: Hashingiwe ku isesengura rigereranya hagati ya SARS-COV ifata abantu n’impimbi, hatekerezwa ko SARS-CoV imenyera vuba imibiri itandukanye ibamo, by’umwihariko ihinduka rya RBD rya poroteyine ya S.

sourceString: Generally, the RBD in the S protein of a CoV interacts with the cellular receptor and is intensely selected by the host antibody response.
targetString: Muri rusange, RBD yo muri poroteyine ya S ya virusi ya CoV ibana n’ingirangingofatizo iyakira kandi itoranywa bitewe n’uko irwanywa n’abasirikare b’umubiri yinjiyemo.

sourceString: In SARS-CoV, the RBD is in the 318th to 510th amino acids on the S1 fragment, which binds to the human ACE2 as well as its coreceptors for viral entry.
targetString: Muri SARS-CoV, RBD iri ku mwanya wa 318 kugeza ku wa 510 muri aside amino zo ku gice cya S1, bigatuma ifata kuri ACE2 y’umuntu ndetse akaba ari na ho virusi ishingira yinjira mu mubiri.

sourceString: The RBD of SARS-CoV is capable of recognizing the ACE2 receptors of various animals, including bat, civet, mouse and raccoon dog, allowing interspecies transmission of the virus.
targetString: RBD ya SARS-CoV ishobora kumenya ACE2 zakira virusi z’inyamaswa zitandukanye, harimo agacurama, impimbi, imbeba, ubwoko bw’impimbi, bituma inyamaswa zanduzanya virusi.

sourceString: In fact, only 6 amino acid residues were observed to be different from human and civet viral isolates in the RBD and 4 of them locate in the receptor-binding motif for interaction with the ACE2 receptor.
targetString: Muri make, ibisigazwa bya aside amino 6 gusa ni byo byasuzumwe hasangwa bitandukanye n’iby’abantu n’impimbi bifite virusi muri RBD kandi 4 muri byo bifite igice kibihuza na ACE2 yakira virusi.

sourceString: Civet SARS-CoV has K479N and S487T mutations in its RBD, which might increase the affinity of the interaction of spike protein with human ACE2 receptor.
targetString: SARS-CoV yo mu mpimbi ifite imihindukire ya K479N na S487T muri RBD yayo, bishobora kongera isano ry’imibanire na poroteyine ya S hamwe na ACE2 y’umuntu yakira virusi.

sourceString: In other words, these two amino acid substitutions might be critical to viral adaption to humans.
targetString: Mu yandi magambo, guhindura izo aside amino ebyiri bishobora kuba ari ingenzi mu gutuma virusi imenyera umubiri w’umuntu.

sourceString: It is noteworthy that SARS-CoV-2 shares the same cellular receptor with SARS-CoV.
targetString: Birashishikaje kumenya ko SARS-CoV-2 yakirwa n’ingirangingofatizo imwe nk’iyakira SARS-CoV.

sourceString: A 30% difference between SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV in the S1 unit of the S protein implicates that the binding affinity of its S protein with human ACE2 might have altered.
targetString: Kuri 30% by’itandukaniro hagati ya SARS-CoV-2 na SARS-CoV mu gice cya S1 cya poroteyine ya S bigaragaza isano iyo poroteyine ya S ifitanye na ACE2 yo mu bantu ishobora kuba yarahinduwe.

sourceString: Indeed, a cryo-EM study indicates a 10- to 20-fold higher affinity of this binding than that between human ACE2 and SARS-CoV S protein.
targetString: Mu by’ukuri, ubushakashatsi kuri cryo-EM bugaragaza ubwikube 10 - 20 bw’isano rikomeye ryo kwihuza kwa ACE2 yo mu bantu na poroteyine ya S yo muri SARS-CoV.

sourceString: It will also be of interest to determine whether any other coreceptor might be required for SARS-CoV-2 transmission.
targetString: Biranashishikaje kwemeza niba hari indi ngirangingofatizo yakira virusi yifashishwa mu kwanduza SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Intriguingly, HCoV-NL63 also binds to ACE2 but with a different part of S.
targetString: Igitangaje ni uko HCoV-NL63 na yo yihuza na ACE2 ariko ku gice gitandukanye cya poroteyine ya S.

sourceString: There exist many other HCoV receptors, such as aminopeptidase N for HCoV-229E, and 9-O-acetylated sialic acid for HCoV-OC43.
targetString: Hari izindi ngirangingo zakira HCoV, nka aminopepitidaze N ya HCoV-229E, na aside siyalike ifite asetili 9-O ya HCoV-OC43.

sourceString: They might also account for successful adaptation of these CoVs in humans after interspecies transmission from their animal hosts.
targetString: Bishobora gusobanura ukuntu virusi za CoV zimenyera umubiri w’umuntu azandujwe n’inyamaswa zakuriyemo.

sourceString: In addition to cellular receptors, the outcome of interspecies transmission of HCoVs is also governed by other host dependency and restriction factors.
targetString: Usibye ingirangingofatizo zakira virusi, kuba inyamaswa zanduzanya virusi ya HCoV binagengwa n’aho zikurira na poroteyine irwanya virusi.

sourceString: The divergence of these host proteins between humans and natural reservoir hosts of HCoVs such as bats, dromedary camels and rodents might constitute a barrier to interspecies transmission.
targetString: Itandukaniro ry’izo poroteyine z’aho virusi zikurira hagati y’abantu n’inyamaswa zagizwe indiri karemana ya virusi za HCoV nk’uducurama, ingamiya n’ingugunnyi bishobora gukumira kwanduzanya virusi hagati y’ubwoko bunyuranye.

sourceString: HCoVs have to usurp host dependency factors and subvert host restriction factors for a successful interspecies transmission.
targetString: HCoV zihinduramo ingirangingo z’aho ziri maze zikangiza poroteyine irwanya virusi kugira ngo zibashe kwanduza izindi nyamaswa.

sourceString: In this regard, molecular determinants in this important area of virus-host interaction remain to be identified and characterized.
targetString: Bityo, ibice bya molekire muri iyi mibanire ikomeye ya virusi n’inyamaswa ikuriramo bikwiye gukomeza kugaragazwa no gusobanurwa.

sourceString: An unbiased genome-wide screening of host dependency and restriction factors for SARS-CoV-2 using the state-of-the-art technology of CRISPR might be fruitful.
targetString: Isuzuma rya jenome ndakemwa ry’aho virusi ikurira na poroteyine irwanya virusi ya SARS-CoV-2 hakoreshejwe ikoranabuhanga rigezweho rya CRISPR bishobora gutanga umusaruro.

sourceString: Emergence of novel HCoVs: back to ground zero
targetString: Kwigaragaza kwa virusi nshya ya HCoV: Inkomoko yayo

sourceString: The diversity of bat CoVs provides ample opportunities for the emergence of novel HCoVs.
targetString: Amoko menshi ya CoV yo mu ducurama atanga amahirwe akomeye yo kwigaragaza kwa virusi nshya ya HCoV.

sourceString: In this sense, bat CoVs serve as the gene pool of HCoVs.
targetString: Bityo, CoV yo mu ducurama ni yo ivamo jene za HCoV.

sourceString: In addition, rapid mutation and genetic recombination also drive HCoV evolution and serve as two important steps in this process.
targetString: Kandi guhinduka vuba no guhinduranya jene bituma HCoV ihindagurika bikaba ari intambwe ebyiri zikomeye muri iki gikorwa.

sourceString: For example, the acquisition or loss of novel protein-coding genes has the potential to drastically modify viral phenotypes.
targetString: Urugero: Kubona cyangwa gutakaza jene zikora poroteyine bifite ubushobozi bwo guhindura cyane agace ka virusi.

sourceString: Among SARS-CoV accessory proteins, ORF8 has been thought to be important in adaptation to humans, as SARS-CoV-related bat viruses were isolated but found to encode divergent ORF8 proteins.
targetString: Muri poroteyine ngereka za SARS-CoV, bitekerezwa ko ORF8 ari ingenzi mu kumenyera umubiri w’umuntu, naho virusi zo mu ducurama zifitanye isano na SARS-CoV zashyizwe ukwazo bigaragara ko zikora poroteyine itandukanye ya ORF8.

sourceString: A 29-nucleotide deletion characteristic of SARS-CoVs has been found in strains isolated at the beginning of the human epidemic.
targetString: Isanomuzi ya 29 isiba SARS-CoV yagaragaye muri jene mu ntangiriro z’icyorezo cyibasiye abantu.

sourceString: This deletion splits ORF8 into ORF8a and ORF8b and is thought to be an adaptive mutation that promotes the switch of hosts.
targetString: Iri siba rigabanya ORF8 mo ORF8a na ORF8b kandi bitekerezwa ko ishobora kumenyera ihinduka rituma ihinduranya inyamaswa.

sourceString: Besides, SARS-CoV has a possible recombination history with lineages of alpha- and gamma-CoVs, where a large number of smaller recombinant regions were identified in the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.
targetString: Kandi SARS-CoV izwiho guhindura ingirangingofatizo z’amoko ya virusi za alpha na gamma-CoV, aho umubare munini w’ingirangingofatizo zahinduwe zasazwe muri poroteyine ya polimerase ya RNA.

sourceString: Recombination locations were also identified in the nsp9, most of nsp10, and parts of nsp14.
targetString: Ahahinduwe ingirangingofatizo hanagaragaye muri nsp9, inyinshi muri nsp10, n’ibice bya nsp14.

sourceString: Likewise, it has been shown that the epidemic MERS-CoV experienced recombination events between different lineages, which occurred in dromedary camels in Saudi Arabia.
targetString: Mu buryo bumwe binagaragara ko icyorezo cya MERS-CoV cyahinduye ingirangingofatizo hagati y’amoko abiri ya virusi atandukanye bikaba byarabaye mu ngamiya zo muri Arabiya Sawudite.

sourceString: Besides SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, recombination events have also been observed in other HCoVs, in which the HCoVs recombine with other animal CoVs in their non-structural genes.
targetString: Usibye SARS-CoV na MERS-CoV, ibikorwa byo guhindura ingirangingofatizo byanagaragaye mu zindi HCoV, aho HCoV ihindura ingirangingofatizo za CoV z’indi nyamaswa muri jene zihariye zayo.

sourceString: It should also be cautioned that artificial selection can contribute to unintended changes in viral genomes, most likely resulting from relieving viruses from selection pressures exerted, such as by the host immune system.
targetString: Birakwiye kumenya ko guhitamo bitari karemano byagira uruhare mu mpinduka zitagamijwe muri jenome za virusi, bika byatuma virusi zisohoka muri icyo gice cyatoranyijwe, nk’urugero abasirikare b’umubiri w’inyamaswa virusi ibamo.

sourceString: An example of these effects is the loss of a full-length ORF4 in the HCoV-229E prototype strain, owing to a two-nucleotide deletion.
targetString: Urugero rw’iyo mikorere ni kutagira jene isanzwe ya ORF4 muri HCoV-229E bigatuma isanomuzi nyabubiri isibwa.

sourceString: While intact ORF4 could be observed in bat and camel viruses related to HCoV-229E, the alpaca alpha-CoV displays a single nucleotide insertion, resulting in a frameshift.
targetString: Mu gihe ORF4 ikomeye yasanzwe muri virusi zo mu gacurama na lama zifitanye isano na HCoV-229E, alpha-CoV yo muri arupaga igaragaza kwinjirwamo n’isanomuzi imwe, bituma ihinduka.

sourceString: Last but not least, the evolution of novel HCoVs is also driven by the selection pressure in their reservoir hosts.
targetString: Icya nyuma, imihindagurikire ya virusi nshya za HCoV inaterwa n’ibibazo byo kutaramba kw’inyamaswa zigira indiri.

sourceString: Asymptomatic or only mild symptoms were detected when bats were infected with CoVs, indicating the mutual adaptation between CoVs and bats.
targetString: Kutagaragaza ibimenyetso cyangwa ibimenyetso byoroheje gusa byatahuwe ubwo uducurama twanduzwagwa CoV, bikagaraza kumenyerana hagati ya CoV n’uducurama.

sourceString: It appeared that bats are well adapted to CoVs anatomically and physiologically.
targetString: Biragaragara ko uducurama tumenyerana neza na CoV mu rwego rw’imiterere y’umubiri.

sourceString: For example, defects in the activation of pro-inflammatory response in bats efficiently reduce the pathology triggered by CoVs.
targetString: Urugero: Kudakora neza kwa molekire zirwanya indwara mu ducurama bigabanya neza indwara ziterwa na virusi ya CoV.

sourceString: Besides, the natural killer cell activity in bats is suppressed due to upregulation of inhibitory natural killer cell receptor NKG2/CD94 and low expression level of major histocompatibility complex class I molecules.
targetString: Kandi ingirangingofatizo zica virusi mu buryo karemano mu ducurama zaretse gukora bitewe no kongeramo ingirangingofatizo zakira virusi za NKG2/CD94 no kutagaragara cyane kwa molekire igenga imikoranire ya tisi yo mu bwoko bwa I.

sourceString: Moreover, the high level of reactive oxygen species (ROS) generated from high metabolic activity of bats could both suppress CoV replication and affects proofreading by exoribonuclease, thus providing the selection pressure for the generation of virus strains highly pathogenic when introduced into a new host.
targetString: Kandi, urugero rwo hejuru rw’ibinyabutabire birimo ogisijeni (ROS) bituruka ku bikorwa byinshi by’umubiri w’uducurama bishobora guhagarika CoV ntiyikoremo utundi duce maze bikagira ingaruka mu gukosora ibyakozwe na anzime ihindura jene, bityo guhitamo jene za virusi bigatera indwara cyane igihe zigiye mu nyamaswa nshya.

sourceString: More pathogenic CoV strains might also evolve by recombination, leading to the acquisition of novel proteins or protein features for host adaptation.
targetString: Izindi jene zitera indwara za CoV nazo zirahinduka, hakaboneka poroteyine nshya cyangwa ibice byayo bituma inyamaswa imenyera iyo virusi.

sourceString: Thus, it is not by chance that three novel HCoVs have emerged in the past two decades.
targetString: Bityo, si amahirwe kuba virusi eshatu nshya za HCoV zaragaragaye mu myaka makumyabiri ishize.

sourceString: CoVs are non-pathogenic or cause mild symptoms in their reservoir hosts such as bats and camels.
targetString: CoV ntizitera indwara cyangwa ibimenyetso byoroheje inyamaswa zagize indiri nk’uducurama n’ingamiya.

sourceString: They replicate robustly without eliciting a strong host immune response.
targetString: Zihinduka cyane zitarwanyijwe bikomeye n’abasirikare b’umubiri zikuriramo.

sourceString: Herein lie the secrets of why asymptomatic carriers are seen and what causes the severe cases in human infection.
targetString: Aha ni ho hari ibanga ry’impamvu inyamaswa zirimo iyo virusi zitagaragaza ibimenyetso n’ibituma abantu barwara cyane.

sourceString: The severe symptoms are mainly due to the hyperactivation of immune response and the cytokine storm wherein the stronger the immune response, the more severe the lung damage.
targetString: Ibimenyetso bikomeye ahanini biterwa n’ikora cyane ry’abasirikare b’umubiri no kurekura sitokine nyinshi, uko abasirikare barushaho kurwanya indwara ni na ko ibihaha birushaho kwangirika.

sourceString: In contrast, in asymptomatic carriers, the immune response has been de-coupled from CoV replication.
targetString: Bikaba bitandukanye ku nyamaswa zitagaragaza ibimenyetso, aho abasirikare b’umubiri bikura kuri virusi ya CoV iri guhinduka.

sourceString: The same strategy of delinking the immune response might have beneficial effects in anti-SARS-CoV-2 therapy.
targetString: Kwitandukanya kw’abasirikare b’umubiri bishobora kugira akamaro mu kuvura virusi ya SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: The interferon response is particularly strong in bats.
targetString: Poroteyine irwanya virusi zirakomeye mu ducurama.

sourceString: Thus, administration of type I interferon at least in the early phase of SARS-CoV-2 infection in humans should be beneficial.
targetString: Bityo, gutanga poroteyine irwanya virusi yo mu bwoko bwa I byibuze umuntu acyandura SARS-CoV-2 byagira akamaro.

sourceString: In addition, NLRP3 inflammasome activation in bats is defective.
targetString: Na poroteyine ya NLRP3 irwanya virusi ntikora mu ducurama.

sourceString: By this reasoning, inhibition of NLRP3 inflammasome with MCC950 might be useful in the treatment of COVID-19.
targetString: Hakurikijwe ibi bitekerezo, kubuza poroteyine ya NLRP3 ifite MCC950 gukora byagira umumaro mu kuvura COVID-19.

sourceString: The emergence of SARS-CoV-2 follows the general theme by which SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV arose.
targetString: Kugaragara kwa SARS-CoV-2 gukurikira uko virusi SARS-CoV na MERS-CoV zaje.

sourceString: Whereas a bat beta-CoV sharing 95% nucleotide homology with SARS-CoV has been found, there also exists a bat-CoV sharing 96% nucleotide homology with SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Mu gihe byagaragaye ko beta-CoV yo mu gacurama bisangiye isanomuzi rya 95% na SARS-CoV, ni na ko isangiye isanomuzi rya 96% na SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Whereas civets and other animals in the markets have been found to harbour viruses identical to SARS-CoV, immediate intermediate hosts for SARS-CoV-2 have not been identified.
targetString: Mu gihe byasanzwe ko impimbi n’izindi nyamaswa zo mu masoko zirimo virusi zisa na SARS-CoV, ariko ntihagaragaye virusi SARS-CoV-2 ikuriramo.

sourceString: Pangolin beta-CoVs strikingly homologous to SARS-CoV-2 have been found, indicating that pangolins might serve as one of intermediate hosts or pangolin beta-CoVs could contribute gene fragments to the final version of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Hagaragaye beta-CoV yo mu gisamujyonjyo isa cyane na SARS-CoV-2, bikerekana ko ibisamujyonjyo bishobora kuba inyamaswa ikuriramo cyangwa beta-CoV yo mu gisamujyonjyo ikaba ari imwe mu bice bya jene byihuza bikavamo SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Although questions remain, there is no evidence that SARS-CoV-2 is man-made either deliberately or accidentally.
targetString: Nubwo hari ibikibazwa, nta gihamya ko SARS-CoV-2 yakozwe n’abantu ku bushake cyangwa ku bw’impanuka.

sourceString: CoVs have returned to the limelight due to the recent outbreak of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: CoV zongeye kuvugwaho bitewe ni uko haherutse kwaduka icyorerezo cya SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: The study of CoVs in bats and other animals has drastically changed our perception of the importance of zoonotic origins and animal reservoirs of HCoVs in human transmission.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi kuri CoV yo mu ducurama n’izindi nyamaswa bwahinduye cyane imyumvire yacu yerekeye inyamaswa zibamo HCoV mu kwanduza abantu.

sourceString: Pervasive evidence has shown that SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 have a bat origin and are transmitted to humans via intermediate hosts.
targetString: Ibimenyetso bikomeye bigaragaza ko SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV na SARS-CoV-2 zikomoka ku gacurama maze zikanduzwa abantu binyuze mu nyamaswa zikuriramo.

sourceString: Given that SARS-CoV infection originates from the contact between humans and civets in the markets, closing wet markets and killing civets therein could have effectively ended the SARS epidemic.
targetString: Kuba ubwandu bwa SARS-CoV buturuka mu kwegerena kw’abantu n’impimbi mu masoko abagirwamo inyamaswa, kuyafunga no kwica impimbi ziyarimo byari guhagarika neza icyorezo cya SARS.

sourceString: By the same reasoning, pangolins should be removed from wet markets to prevent zoonotic transmission, in view of the discovery of multiple lineages of pangolin beta-CoVs closely related to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Ni na ko ibisamujyonjyo bigomba gukurwa mu masoko abagirwamo inyamaswa mu kwirinda ko byanduza izindi nyamaswa, hakurikijwe ubushakashatsi ku nkomoko ya beta-CoV yo mu bisamujyonjyo ifitanye isano ya hafi na SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, whether and how SARS-CoV-2 is transmitted to humans through pangolins and other mammals remain to be clarified in future investigations.
targetString: Ariko uko abantu bandura virusi ya SARS-CoV-2 ivuye ku bisamujyonjyo n’izindi nyamabere bigomba gusobanurwa neza mu bushakashatsi buzakorwa.

sourceString: On the other hand, MERS-CoV has existed in dromedary camels for a long time.
targetString: Ku rundi ruhande, hashize igihe kirekire virusi ya MERS-CoV iba mu ngamiya.

sourceString: These camels serve as an important tool for transportation as well as a main source of meat, milk, leather and wool products for the local people.
targetString: Izo ngamiya ni inyamaswa z’ingenzi mu bwikorezi no gutanga inyama, amata, impu n’ubwoya bukorwamo imyenda ku batuye mu gace zibamo.

sourceString: They are widely distributed across the Middle East and Africa.
targetString: Zakwirakwiye cyane mu Burasirazuba bwo hagati n’Afurika.

sourceString: It is therefore impossible to sacrifice all camels for the control of MERS, as what was done in wild animal markets in China to prevent the spreading of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Bityo, ntawakwigomwa ingamiya zose mu kurwanya virusi ya MERS, nk’ibyakozwe mu masoko abagirwamo inyamaswa mu Bushinwa mu kwirinda ikwirakwira rya SARS-CoV na SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: To stop the recurrent outbreaks of MERS, a comprehensive approach should be taken to develop effective vaccines against MERS-CoV for camels, in combination with other infection control measures.
targetString: Mu rwego rwo guhagarika icyorezo cya MERS kigenda kigaruka, hagomba gufatwa ingamba zikomeye hamwe n’izindi ngamba zo kurwanya indwara hagakorwa urukingo rwa virusi ya MERS-CoV.

sourceString: As we are not able to eliminate these viruses, new genotypes might emerge to cause outbreaks.
targetString: Mu gihe tudashoboye kurimbura izo virusi, jenotipe nshya zishobora kugaragara maze zigateza ibyorezo.

sourceString: A variety of zoonotic CoVs are circulating in the wild.
targetString: CoV zitandukanye zifata inyamaswa zizenguruka mu mashyamba.

sourceString: Particularly, bat CoVs with zoonotic potential are so diverse.
targetString: By’umwihariko, CoV zo mu gacurama zifite ubushobozi butandukanye.

sourceString: There are plenty of opportunities that these zoonotic CoVs evolve and recombine, resulting in the emergence of new CoVs that are more transmissible and/or deadly in humans in future.
targetString: Mu minsi iri imbere, birashoboka cyane ko CoV ifata inyamaswa yahinduka, bigatuma hagaragara ubwoko bushya bwa CoV bwandura cyane cyangwa bwica abantu benshi.

sourceString: The culture of eating wild animals in some places of China should be abandoned to reduce unnecessary contact between humans and animals.
targetString: Umuco wo kurya inyamaswa z’ishyamba mu bice bimwe by’Ubushinwa ugomba gucika hakirindwa kwegerana kw’abantu n’inyamaswa bitari ngombwa.

sourceString: With the ordeals of SARS, MERS and COVID-19, a better preparedness and response plan should be in place.
targetString: Hakurikijwe ibibazo bikomeje guterwa na SARS, MERS na COVID-19, hakenewe gahunda isobanutse yo kurwanya izo virusi.

sourceString: In fact, many viruses have existed in the planet for a very long time.
targetString: Muri make, ku isi hagiye habaho virusi nyinshi kuva kera.

sourceString: They stay in their own natural reservoirs until there is a chance for spillover.
targetString: Ziguma mu nyamaswa zisanzwe zibamo kugeza zibonye amahirwe yo gusohoka.

sourceString: Although bats have many features that favours the spreading of viruses, the chance for humans to be in contact with bats and other wildlife species can be minimized if people are educated to stay away from them.
targetString: Nubwo uducurama dufite imiterere myinshi ituma dukwirakwiza virusi, ibyago by’uko abantu bahura n’uducurama n’andi moko y’inyamaswa z’ishyamba bishobora kugabanywa igihe abantu bigishijwe kutabyegera.

sourceString: Continuous surveillance in mammals is necessary for better understanding of the ecology of CoVs and their natural hosts, which will prove useful in preventing animal-to-human transmission and future outbreaks.
targetString: Gukomeza gukurikirana inyamabere ni ngombwa mu kurushaho gusobanukirwa ubuturo bwa CoV n’inyamaswa ikuriramo, bikaba ingirakamaro mu kwirinda ko inyamaswa zakwanduza abantu no gukumira ibyorezo by’ahazaza.

sourceString: To conclude, the most effective way to prevent viral zoonosis is for humans to stay away from the ecological niches of the natural reservoirs of the zoonotic viruses.
targetString: Mu gusoza, uburyo bunoze bwo gukumira virusi zo mu nyamaswa ni uko abantu bakwiye kutegera ubutor bw’izo virusi n’inyamaswa zikuriramo.

sourceString: Several pieces in the puzzle of the zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2 are still missing.
targetString: Haracyari amoko menshi y’inyamaswa virusi ya SARS-CoV-2 ikomokaho ataramenyekana.

sourceString: First, if bats transmit an ancestral virus of SARS-CoV-2 to pangolins, it will be of interest to see under what circumstances bats and pangolins could share the same ecological niche.
targetString: Icya mbere, niba uducurama twanduza ibisamujyonjyo virusi yabyaye SARS-CoV-2, birashishikaje kureba igituma uducurama n’ibisamujyonjyo biba mu buturo bumwe.

sourceString: Second, if bats play a more direct role in human transmission, how humans get into contact with bats should be determined.
targetString: Icya kabiri, niba uducurama twanduza abantu virusi mu buryo butaziguye, uko abantu bahura n’uducurama bikwiye kugaragazwa.

sourceString: Third, if a third mammal acts as the true intermediate host, how it interacts with the different species including humans, bats and pangolins has to be clarified.
targetString: Icya gatatu, niba inyamabere ya gatatu ikora nk’inyamaswa ikuriramo koko, ni gute ibana n’amoko y’inyamaswa atandukanye twavuga nk’abantu, uducurama n’ibisamujyonjyo bigomba gusobanuka.

sourceString: Finally, since many mammals including domestic animals might be susceptible to SARS-CoV-2, both surveillance and experimental infection should be conducted.
targetString: Hanyuma, mu gihe inyamabere nyinshi harimo inyamaswa zororerwa mu rugo zishobora kwandura SARS-CoV-2, kuzikurikirana no kureba uko zandura indwara bigomba gukorwa.

sourceString: Should it be a bat, a pangolin or another mammal, it is expected that SARS-CoV-2 or its parental viruses that are almost identical will be identified in its natural hosts in future.
targetString: Abaye ari agacurama, igisamujyonjyo cyangwa indi nyamabere, hitezwe ko SARS-CoV-2 cyangwa virusi ziyibyara zijya gusa cyane zizagaragara mu nyamaswa zikuriramo mu gihe kiri imbere.

sourceString: Continued investigations in this area will elucidate the evolutionary pathway of SARS-CoV-2 in animals, with important implications in the prevention and control of COVID-19 in humans.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi bukomeje kuri izi nyamaswa buzasobanura inzira y’imihindagurikire ya SARS-CoV-2 mu nyamaswa, bikazagira uruhare runini mu kwirinda no kurwanya COVID-19 mu bantu.

sourceString: Updating the diagnostic criteria of COVID-19 “suspected case” and “confirmed case” is necessary
targetString: Kuvugurura ibigenderwaho mu gusuzuma COVID-19 “abakekwaho uburwayi” n'“abemejwe ko barwaye” ni ngombwa

sourceString: On 6 February 2020, our team had published a rapid advice guideline for diagnosis and treatment of 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) infection, and this guideline provided our experience and make well reference for fighting against this pandemic worldwide.
targetString: Ku ya 6 Gashyantare 2020, itsinda ryacu ryatangaje imirongo ngenderwaho yihuse ikubiyemo inama zo gusuzuma no kuvura indwara ya koronavirusi nshya yo mu 2019 (2019-nCoV), kandi imirongo ngenderwaho yaduhaye ubunararibonye kandi itanga ibisobanuro byiza byo kurwanya iki cyorezo ku isi hose.

sourceString: However, the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge are gradually increasing based on the ongoing research findings and clinical practice experience; hence, the strategies of diagnosis and treatment are also continually updated.
targetString: Nyamara, indwara ya koroanvirusi 2019 (COVID-19) ni indwara nshya, imyumvire n'ubumenyi byacu kuri yo bigenda byiyongera buhoro buhoro dushingiye ku bushakashatsi burimo gukorwa n'ibikorwa byo mu buvuzi; bityo rero ingamba zo gusuzuma no kuvura nazo zikomeza kuvugururwa.

sourceString: In this letter, we answered one comment on our guideline and provided the newest diagnostic criteria of “suspected case” and “confirmed case” according to the latest Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (seventh version) that issued by the National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China.
targetString: Muri iyi baruwa, twasubije igitekerezo kimwe ku murongo ngenderwaho wacu kandi dutanga ibipimo bishya bigenderwaho mu gusuzuma “ukekwaho uburwayi” n'“abemejwe ko barwaye” dukurikije amabwiriza aheruka yo gusuzuma no kuvura ya COVID-19 (icyiciro cya karindwi) yashyizwe ahagaragara na komite y'igihugu ishinzwe ubuzima ya Repubulika ya Rubanda y’Ubushinwa.

sourceString: In December 2019, the 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) has caused an outbreak, which is now officially named as the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the virus has been named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Mu Kuboza 2019, koronavirusi nshya yo mu 2019 (2019-nCoV) yateje icyorezo, ubu ku mugaragaro kikaba cyitwa indwara ya koronavirusi 2019 (COVID-19) kandi virusi yiswe icyorezo cy'ubuhumekero gikomeye cya koronavirusi 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: On 11 March 2020, WHO characterized COVID-19 as a pandemic.
targetString: Tariki ya 11 Werurwe 2020, Ishami ry’Umuryango w'Abibumbye ryita ku Buzima ryatangaje ko COVID-19 ari icyorezo cyugarije isi.

sourceString: In order to fight against the SARS-CoV-2 infection, our team has developed a rapid advice guideline and that has been published online in Military Medical Research on 06 February 2020.
targetString: Mu rwego rwo kurwanya ubwandu bwa SARS-CoV-2, itsinda ryacu ryashyizeho imirongo ngenderwaho y’inama zihutirwa kandi yatangajwe ku rubuga rwa interineti mu bushakashatsi bw’ubuvuzi bwa Gisirikare ku ya 06 Gashyantare 2020.

sourceString: It has attracted a great attention since published.
targetString: Kuva yasohoka yashishikaje abantu benshi.

sourceString: Note however that COVID-19 is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge is gradually increasing based on the ongoing research findings and clinical practice experience; hence, the strategies of diagnosis and treatment are also continually updated.
targetString: Ariko ni ngombwa kumenya ko COVID-19 ari indwara nshya, imyumvire yacu n'ubumenyi bigenda byiyongera buhoro buhoro dushingiye ku bushakashatsi burimo gukorwa n'ibikorwa by'ubuvuzi; bityo rero, ingamba zo gusuzuma no kuvura nazo zikomeza kuvugururwa.

sourceString: For instance the Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 issued by the National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), among 16 January 2020 to 3 March 2020, has issued a total of seven editions with some contexts being substantively changed.
targetString: Dutanze urugero, Amabwiriza yo gusuzuma no kuvura COVID-19 yatanzwe na Komite y'ubuzima yo ku rwego rw'igihugu ya Repubulika ya Rubanda y’Ubushinwa (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), hagati ya 16 Mutarama 2020 kugeza ku ya 3 Werurwe 2020, yasohoye ibitabo birindwi harimo bimwe mu bice byahindutse ku buryo bugaragara.

sourceString: Now our guideline received a comment by Zhou et al., they introduced a simple scoring proposal based on their clinical experience.
targetString: Noneho umurongo ngenderwaho wacu wakiriye igitekerezo cya Zhou n'abandi, batangije uburyo bworoshye bwo gutanga amanota hashingiwe ku byo bahuye nabyo mu buvuzi.

sourceString: Their work added new evidence for our guideline and also make valuable reference for this pandemic worldwide.
targetString: Ibikorwa byabo byongeyeho ibimenyetso bifatika bishya byerekana umurongo ngenderwaho wacu kandi binatanga ibisobanuro by'ingirakamaro kuri iki cyorezo cyugarije isi.

sourceString: We endorse their significant work and express our thanks.
targetString: Dushyigikiye umurimo ukomeye bakoze kandi turabibashimiye.

sourceString: However, their work also needs update according to the latest Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (Trial seventh version) and recently studies.
targetString: Ariko, ibyo bakoze bigomba kandi kuvugururwa ukurikije amabwiriza aheruka gushyirwaho yo gusuzuma no kuvura COVID-19 (Igerageza ry'icyiciro cya karindwi) ndetse n'ubushakashatsi buherutse.

sourceString: According to the seventh edition (3 March 2020), to confirm the suspected case needs to combine any one item of epidemiological history features with two items of clinical manifestations to make a comprehensive analysis, or needs to meet three items of clinical manifestations if without clear epidemiological history:
targetString: Nk’uko bigaragara mu gitabo cya karindwi (3 Werurwe 2020) kwemeza abakekwaho uburwayi bigomba guhuzwa na kimwe mu biranga amateka y’ibyorezo n’ibintu bibiri byerekana uburwayi kugira ngo hakorwe isesengura ryuzuye, cyangwa bigomba guhura n’ibintu bitatu byerekana uburwayi niba amateka ajyanye n'ibyorezo adasobanutse:

sourceString: Epidemiological history: (1) a history of travel or residence in Wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where COVID-19 cases had been reported in the last 14 days before symptom onset; (2) a history of contact with SARS-CoV-2 infectious cases (with positive nucleic acid test); (3) a history of contacting with patients with fever or respiratory symptoms from Wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where COVID-19 had been reported in the last 14 days before symptom onset; (4) a history of contacting with cluster of confirmed cases (≥ 2 cases with fever and/or respiratory symptoms occurred within 2 weeks in small areas, such as home, office, class of school, etc).
targetString: Amateka ajyanye n'icyorezo: (1) Kuba harabayeho gukorera urugendo cyangwa gutura mu mujyi wa Wuhan no mu turere tuwukikije, cyangwa ahandi hari abarwaye COVID-19 bagaragaye mu minsi 14 ishize mbere y'uko ibimenyetso bitangira; (2) Kuba harabaye guhura n'abanduye SARS-CoV-2 (hamwe n'ibipimo bigaragaza ko afite aside nikileyike); (3) Kuba harabaye guhura n’abarwayi bafite umuriro cyangwa ibimenyetso by’ubuhumekero baturutse mu mujyi wa Wuhan no mu turere tuwukikije, cyangwa ahandi hari abarwaye COVID-19 bagaragaye mu minsi 14 ishize mbere y'uko ibimenyetso bitangira; (4) kuba harabayeho guhura n'abarwaye biganje mu gace runaka (abarwaye barenze 2 bafite umuriro cyangwa ibimenyetso byo guhumeka nabi byagaragaye mu gihe cy'ibyumweru 2 ahantu hato, nko mu rugo, mu biro, mu ishuri n'ahandi).

sourceString: Clinical manifestations: (1) fever and/ or respiratory symptoms; (2) with imaging features of COVID-19 infection; (3) total white blood cell counts showing normal, decreased, or reduced lymphocyte count in the early onset stage.
targetString: Ibimenyetso by'uburwayi: (1) umuriro cyangwa ibimenyetso byo guhumeka nabi; (2) hamwe n'ibimenyetso bigaragaza ubwandu bwa COVID-19; (3) ingano rusange y'uturemangingo twera tw'amaraso tugaragaza umubare watwo usanzwe, utiyongera cyangwa ngo ugabanuke mu cyiciro kibanza.

sourceString: Diagnosing the confirmed case should base on suspected case with any one item of pathogenic or serological evidence as following: (1) real-time PCR test positive for SARS-CoV-2; (2) viral whole genome sequencing showing high homogeneity to the known novel coronaviruses; (3) positive for the specific IgM antibody and IgG antibody to SARS-CoV-2 in serum test; or a change of the SARS-CoV-2-specific IgG antibody from negative to positive, or titer rising ≥4 times in the recovery phase above that in the acute phase.
targetString: Gupima uwo byemejwe ko arwaye bigomba gushingira k'ukekwaho uburwayi ugaragaza kimwe mu bimenyetso by'indwara cyangwa bishingiye ku maraso bikurikira: (1) Igipimo cya PCR cyafashwe mu gihe nyacyo cyagaragaje uburwayi bwa SARS-CoV-2; (2) ikurikirana ry'uduce tw'ingenzi tugize virusi ryerekana ko hari aho ihuriye na koronavirusi nshya tuzi; (3) kugaragaza uburwayi ku turindamubiri twihariye twa IgM na IgG kuri SARS-CoV-2 mu gupima serumu; cyangwa impinduka y'akarindamubiri kihariye IgG ka SARS-CoV-2 kava mu batarwaye kajya mu barwaye, cyangwa ukwiyongerera ahantu hamwe kurenze inshuro 4 mu gice cyo gukira kirenze icyo mu gihe cy'uburwayi bukomeye.

sourceString: We can see that the real-time PCR test for nucleic acid in respiratory tract or blood samples was added to the second (18 January 2020) and third (22 January 2020) editions.
targetString: Tubona ko ibipimo by'aside nikileyike mu nzira y'ubuhumekero cyangwa ibipimo ngero by'amaraso bifatiwe igihe byongerewe mu gitabo cya kabiri (18 Mutarama 2020) n'icya gatatu (22 Mutarama 2020).

sourceString: The pathogenic detection of blood sample was added to the fourth (27 January 2020) and fifth (8 February 2020) editions; and then the serological evidence was added to the seventh edition.
targetString: Gutahura uburwayi mu bipimo ngero by’amaraso byongewe mu bitabo byasohotse ku nshuro ya kane (27 Mutarama 2020) n'iya gatanu (8 Gashyantare 2020); hanyuma ibimenyetso bishingiye ku maraso byongerwa ku cyasohotse ku nshuro ya karindwi.

sourceString: These modifications based on the researchers continued work that to search for an optimal nucleic acid detection kit for rapid diagnosis, as well as the samples from respiratory tract including blood sampling, which increased the availability of different specimens, and supported bringing the specific antibody positive result into the confirmed criteria.
targetString: Izi mpinduka zishingiye ku byakomeje gukorwa n'abashakashatsi bashakisha uburyo bwiza bwo kumenya aside nikileyike igaragara kugira ngo hakorwe isuzuma ryihuse, ndetse n'ibipimo ngero byo mu nzira y'ubuhumekero harimo ibipimo ngero by'amaraso, ibyo bikaba bituma haboneka ingero zitandukanye, kandi bigashyigikira kuzana uturindamubiri twihariye tw'uwanduye mu bigenderwaho byemejwe.

sourceString: Besides, there are more and more evidence that remind us to caution with the atypical symptomatic and asymptomatic patients.
targetString: Uretse ibyo, hari ibimenyetso byinshi cyane bitwibutsa kwitondera abarwayi badasanzwe bafite ibimenyetso n'abatabifite.

sourceString: Hence, the flow chart of Zhou et al. should be updated, as they classified the person without clinical symptoms as “low risk”.
targetString: Kubera iyo mpamvu, imbonerahamwe ya Zhou n'abandi igomba kuvugururwa, nk'uko bashyize mu byiciro umuntu udafite ibimenyetso by'uburwayi nk"ibyago bike".

sourceString: The score system also needs to be verified in further clinical practice and studies.
targetString: Uburyo bw'amanota nabwo bugomba kugenzurwa mu bindi bikorwa by'ubuvuzi n'ubushakashatsi.

sourceString: To conclude, we hope more direct evidence coming up and call for readers to provide their comments.
targetString: Mu gusoza, turizera ko ibindi bimenyetso bitaziguye bizagaragara kandi turanasaba abasomyi gutanga ibitekerezo byabo.

sourceString: For the diagnosis of “suspected case” and “confirmed case”, we suggest to trace and obey the newest guidelines of their home countries.
targetString: Ku bijyanye n'isuzuma "ry'abakekwaho indwara" n'"abemejwe ko barwaye", turasaba gukurikirana no kubahiriza amabwiriza mashya y'ibihugu byabo.

sourceString: Our team will also timely update our guideline to offer help.
targetString: Itsinda ryacu rizanavugururira ku gihe imirongo ngenderwaho yacu kugira ngo itange ubufasha.

sourceString: Bangladesh reports five new deaths due to COVID-19, a daily highest
targetString: Bangaladeshi yatangaje ko abantu batanu bashya bishwe na COVID-19, ukaba ari wo mubare munini mu munsi umwe

sourceString: Yesterday, Bangladesh has confirmed five new deaths due to COVID-19 on the day.
targetString: Ejo, Bangaladeshi yemeje ko abantu batanu bashya bishwe na COVID-19 uwo munsi.

sourceString: This is the highest number of fatalities in a day due to the virus.
targetString: Ni wo mubare munini w'abapfuye mu munsi umwe bishwe n’iyi virusi.

sourceString: As of yesterday, Bangladesh's Institute of Epidemiology, Disease Control and Research (IEDCR) reported the number of recorded infected cases included 114 active cases and 33 recovered cases who were staying home.
targetString: Kugeza ejo, Ikigo kirwanya ibyorezo, indwara kikanakora ubushakashatsi muri Bangaladeshi (IEDCR) cyatangaje ko umubare w’abanduye harimo 114 bakirwaye n’abakize 33 bari bari iwabo.

sourceString: A total of 17 deaths have been recorded.
targetString: Igiteranyo cy’abapfuye ni abantu 17.

sourceString: In an online news briefing, the director of IEDCR, Dr Meerjady Sabrina Flora, said the fatalities included four males and one female.
targetString: Mu makuru yatambutse kuri interineti, Umuyobozi wa IEDCR, Dr Meerjady Sabrina Flora, yavuze ko muri abo bapfuye harimo abagabo bane n’umugore umwe.

sourceString: According to Dr Meerjady, two cases were aged above 60, two between 51 and 60, and one 41-50 years old.
targetString: Nk’uko byavuzwe na Dr Meerjady, abapfuye babiri bari bafite imyaka irenga 60, babiri bari bafite hagati y’imyaka 51 na 60 n’umwe wari ufite hagati y’imyaka 41 na 50.

sourceString: She also said two of the victims were from Dhaka.
targetString: Yanatangaje ko babiri mu bahitanywe n’icyorezo bari baraturutse muri Dhaka.

sourceString: The World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic on March 11.
targetString: Ishami ry’Umuryango w’Abibumbye ryita ku buzima (OMS) ryatangaje ko COVID-19 ari icyorezo ku ya 11 Werurwe.

sourceString: A hospital official told Anadolu Agency, a local news outlet, that one of the deceased was Jalal Saifur Rahman, a director of Bengali Anti-Corruption Commission, who was cared for at the Kuwait Maitree Hospital.
targetString: Umukozi w’ibitaro yatangarije Ikigo cya Anadolu, ikinyamakuru cy’imbere mu gihugu, ko umwe mu bapfuye yitwaga Jalal Saifur Rahman, Umuyobozi wa Komisiyo yo kurwanya ruswa muri Bangaladeshi, akaba yaravurirwaga mu Bitaro bya Kuwait Maitree.

sourceString: On Saturday, in an online video announcement, Bangladeshi Road Transport and Bridges Minister Obaidul Quader said public transport would be shut down for longer than initially planned, until this coming Saturday.
targetString: Ku cyumweru, mu itangazo rya videwo ryanyuze kuri interineti, Minisitiri w’ubwikorezi muri Bangaladeshi, Obaidul Quader, yavuze ko gutwara abantu mu buryo rusange bihagaritswe igihe kirekire kurusha icyari cyarateganyijwe bikaba bizageza kuri uyu wa gatandatu.

sourceString: This public transport shutdown had initially started on March 26 and was planned to end on Saturday, April 4.
targetString: Uku guhagarika ingendo byari biteganyijwe ko bizatangira kuri 26 Werurwe maze bikarangira ku wa gatandatu, ku ya 4 Mata.

sourceString: Transport of essential goods -- medical, fuel and food -- was still allowed.
targetString: Ubwikorezi bw’ibicuruzwa by’ibanze harimo imiti, ibicanwa n’ibiribwa byo byari bicyemerewe gutwarwa.

sourceString: The first recorded incidents of COVID-19 infection in Bangladesh were on March 8, in two people who returned from Italy and also the wife of one of them.
targetString: Ubwandu bwa mbere bwa COVID-19 muri Bangaladeshi bwagaragaye tariki ya 8 Werurwe, ku bantu babiri bari bavuye mu Butaliyani n’umugore w’umwe muri bo.

sourceString: As of March 19, these three had already recovered.
targetString: Kugeza ku ya 9 Werurwe, abo bantu batatu bari bamaze gukira.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 surpasses one million infections worldwide
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 imaze kwanduza abantu barenga miriyoni ku isi

sourceString: On Thursday, the total number of cases of the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus infections surpassed one million worldwide, Johns Hopkins University data indicated.
targetString: Ku wa kane, igiteranyo cy’abamaze kwandura koronavirusi iterwa na SARS-CoV-2 barenze miriyoni imwe ku isi nk’uko amakuru ya Kaminuza ya Johns Hopkins abigaragaza.

sourceString: At least 52 thousand deaths were linked to COVID-19, the disease caused by the coronavirus.
targetString: Byibuze abantu bagera ku bihumbi 52 bishwe na COVID-19, indwara iterwa na koronavirusi.

sourceString: The milestone came the same day Malawi confirmed its first coronavirus infections and Zambia had its first coronavirus-related death.
targetString: Uwo mubare watangajwe umunsi umwe Malawi yatangarijeho umuntu wa mbere wanduye koronavirusi ari nabwo muri Zambiya umuntu wa mbere yahitanywe na koronavirusi.

sourceString: North Korea claimed, as of Thursday, it was one of the few countries remaining free of coronavirus infections.
targetString: Ku wa kane, Koreya ya Ruguru yatangaje ko ari kimwe mu bihugu bike bisigaye bitarimo ubwandu bwa koronavirusi.

sourceString: By yesterday, the World Health Organization reported 1,051,635 confirmed cases, including 79,332 cases in the twenty four hours preceding 10 a.m. Central European Time (0800 UTC) on April 4.
targetString: Ejo, Ishami ry’Umuryango w’Abibyumbye ryita ku buzima ryatangaje ko abantu 1 051 635 bemejwe ko barwaye, muri bo abagera kuri 79 332 banduye mu masaha makumyabiri n’ane abanziriza saa 10 z’isaha yo mu Burayi bwo hagati (08:00 GMT) ku ya 4 Mata.

sourceString: In the United States, over 244 thousand coronavirus cases were recorded, linking to at least 5,900 deaths.
targetString: Muri Amerika, hatangajwe ko abantu barenga ibihumbi 244 bamaze kwandura koronavirusi, muri bo abamaze gupfa ni 5 900.

sourceString: CBS News reported, citing Johns Hopkins University data, there were over 1,000 US deaths on Wednesday caused by coronavirus infections.
targetString: Igendeye ku makuru ya Kaminuza ya Johns Hopkins, CBS News yatangaje ko ku wa gatatu muri Amerika hapfuye abantu 1 000 bishwa na koronavirusi.

sourceString: Around the world, countries announced stricter measures to inhibit the disease from spreading.
targetString: Ku isi, ibihugu byatangaje ingamba zikomeye zo gukumira ikwirakwira ry’icyorezo.

sourceString: On Thursday, Sergei Sobyanin, the mayor of Moscow, extended the city lockdown to May 1.
targetString: Ku wa kane, Sergei Sobyanin, Meya wa Moscow yongereye igihe cyo kuguma mu rugo kigera ku ya 1 Gicurasi.

sourceString: Nationally, President Vladimir Putin declared Russians would continue to be paid without going to work until April 30.
targetString: Ku rwego rw’igihugu Perezida Vladimir Putin yatangaje ko Abarusiya bakomeza guhembwa batagiye ku kazi kugeza tariki ya 30 Mata.

sourceString: The parliament of Portugal voted to extend the national state of emergency by 15 days; the vote passed with 215 votes in favor, ten abstentions, and one vote against.
targetString: Inteko ishinga amategeko yo muri Poritigali yongereye iminsi 15 ku bihe bidasanzwe igihugu kirimo, mu matora yabaye ababyemeje ni 215, icumi barifashe naho umwe yatoye abyanga.

sourceString: Saudi Arabia extended curfews in the holy cities of Mecca and Medina to last the entire day; previously, the curfew was only in effect between 3 p.m. and 6 a.m.
targetString: Arabiya Sawudite yongereye igihe cy’imikwabo mu mijyi mitagatifu ya Maka na Madina aho izajya imara umunsi wose; mbere umukwabo wabaga hagati ya 15:00 kugeza saa 06:00.

sourceString: Thailand planned to implement a curfew between 10 p.m. and 4 a.m.
targetString: Tayilandi irateganya gushyiraho umukwabo uzajya uba hagati ya 22:00 na 04:00.

sourceString: The governor of Ohio, Mike DeWine, announced the state had extended its stay-at-home order until May 1.
targetString: Guverineri wa Ohio, Mike DeWine, yatangaje ko leta ayoboye yongereye igihe cya gahunda ya guma mu rugo kigera ku ya 1 Gicurasi.

sourceString: Stores in Australia lower toilet paper limits per transaction
targetString: Amaduka yo muri Ositaraliya yashyizeho umubare ntarengwa w’impapuro z’isuku umuntu yemerewe kugura

sourceString: On Sunday and Saturday evening, Australian store chains Woolworths and Coles lowered their purchase restrictions on toilet paper to two and one package per transaction in all stores on national level, respectively.
targetString: Mu ijoro ryo ku wa gatandatu rishyira ku cyumweru, amaduka ya Woolworths na Coles yo muri Ositaraliya yagabanyije umubare w’impapuro z’isuku ziba ebyiri kandi umuntu ntarenze ipaki imwe y’impapuro z’isuku muri ayo maduka yose mu gihugu.

sourceString: ALDI also introduced a one-pack limit, on Monday.
targetString: Ku wa mbere, ALDI na yo yatangaje ko umuntu atagomba kurenza ipaki imwe.

sourceString: These limitations were posted as messages on the checkouts, and on the chains' Facebook pages.
targetString: Iyo mibare ntarengwa yatangajwe nk’ubutumwa aho bishyurira, no kuri paji za Facebook z’ayo maduka.

sourceString: Buyers were reportedly stocking up due to fears of COVID-19 in case people need to self-isolate.
targetString: Byavugwaga ko abaguzi baguraga izo mpapuro z’isuku ku bwinshi bitewe n’ubwoba bwa COVID-19 igihe bibaye ngombwa ko umuntu yishyira mu kato.

sourceString: On Wednesday, Woolworths also limited toilet paper purchases for home delivery to one pack per order.
targetString: Ku wa gatatu, iduka rya Woolworths ryanagabanyije umubare w’impapuro z’isuku zigenda mu bicuruzwa byohorezwa mu ngo uba ipaki imwe kuri buri gutumiza.

sourceString: These changes followed the previous four-pack per transaction restriction introduced by Woolworths and Coles on March 4 and 5 respectively.
targetString: Izo mpinduka zakurikiye izavugaga ko nta muntu urenza ipaki imwe irimo impapuro z’isuku enye zari zashyizweho n’amaduka ya Woolworths na Coles tariki ya 4 n’iya 5 Werurwe.

sourceString: Coles, in its March 8 media release, reported that with the four-pack restriction in place, "many stores are still selling out within an hour of delivery", and called the demand "unprecedented", while ALDI, in a Facebook post on Tuesday, called it "unexpected".
targetString: Mu itangazo rigenewe abanyamakuru ryo muri Werurwe, iduka rya Coles ryatangaje ko hakurikijwe amabwiriza yashyizweho yo kutarenza ipaki imwe irimo impapuro z’isuku enye, “amaduka menshi ari kumara ibicuruzwa nyuma y’isaha bigemuwe”, maze ritangaza ko uko kugura "kutigeze kubaho", mu gihe ALDI ku wa kabiri yatangaje kuri Facebook ko ibyo "bitari byitezwe".

sourceString: Sales went up in a "sharp increase" last week, according to a Woolworths spokesperson.
targetString: Kugurisha ibicuruzwa "byarazamutse cyane" mu cyumweru gishize, hakurikijwe ibyavuzwe n’umuvugizi w’iduka rya Woolworths.

sourceString: Costco's store in Canberra also limited the allowed amount to two packs last week.
targetString: Iduka rya Costco ryo muri Canberra na ryo ryagabanyije umubare uba amapaki abiri y’impapuro z’isuku mu cyumweru gishize.

sourceString: To further alleviate the shortage, Coles ordered bigger packages from suppliers and increased delivery frequency, Woolworths ordered extra stock, while ALDI made stocks for a planned Wednesday special available early.
targetString: Mu kurushaho kugabanya ibura ry’impapuro z’isuku, iduka rya Coles ryatumije amapaki manini ku barigemurira rinongera incuro zo kugemura ibicuruzwa, naho Woolworths yasabye izindi mpapuro z’isuku, mu gihe ALDI yazanye muri sitokeibicuruzwa byari bigenewe poromosiyo yo ku wa gatatu bicuruzwa mbere.

sourceString: Russell Zimmerman, executive director of the Australian Retailers Association, said that retailers try to raise stock, but local council restrictions on the timing of truck-deliveries make it hard.
targetString: Russell Zimmerman, umuyobozi nshingwabikorwa w’Ishyirahamwe ry’abacuruzi muri Ositaraliya, yavuze ko abacuruzi bashobora kongera ibicuruzwa, ariko amabwiriza agenga amakamyo agemura ibicuruzwa yashyizweho n’inteko yaho yatumye bigorana.

sourceString: He expects rising production costs, as suppliers try to meet demand, and fewer specials.
targetString: Arizera ko ibiciro by’ibicuruzwa biziyongera, mu gihe abagemura bagerageza kubona ibyo abakiriya bakeneye, no kubaha poromosiyo nke.

sourceString: On Tuesday, ALDI announced that following the early release of stock, some stores can't run the Wednesday special.
targetString: Ku wa kabiri, ALDI yatangaje ko kuba ibicuruzwa byaraguzwe bigashira mu bubiko hakiri kare, amaduka amwe n’amwe ntashobora gutanga poromosiyo yo ku wa gatatu.

sourceString: In a News.com.au report, Dr Gary Mortimer, retail expert from Queensland University of Technology, said the stores fill the stock every night.
targetString: Mu makuru yo kuri News.com.au, Dr Gary Mortimer, impuguke mu by’ubucuruzi ya Kaminuza y’ikoranabuhanga ya Queensland, yavuze ko amaduka ashyira ibicuruzwa mu bubiko nijoro.

sourceString: He remarked toilet paper is a bulky item, leading to low quantity of stocks in numbers, and, when sold out, leaves vast shelf spaces empty, hardening the feeling of a shortage.
targetString: Yanatangaje ko impapuro z’isuku ari igicuruzwa kiba kiri mu ipaki, bituma biba ari bike mu bubiko, kandi iyo biguzwe bigashira, bisiga umwanya munini kuri za etajere ntakiriho, bigatuma abantu barushaho kumva ko ibicuruzwa byashize.

sourceString: "Coles and Woolworths have a view [that] if there was plenty of stuff on the shelf, if product like toilet rolls and sanitiser could be [bought] and are there in quantities, you would probably minimise the panic" said Russell Zimmerman per ABC News.
targetString: Russell Zimmerman ukorera ABC News ati: “Amaduka ya Coles na Woolworths atekereza ko kubona ibicuruzwa byinshi kuri za etajere nk’impapuro z’isuku n’imiti yica udukoko bihari ku bwinshi byagabanya ubwoba abantu bafite”.
