sourceString: Recycled toilet paper producer Who Gives a Crap said on last Wednesday they'd run out of stock.
targetString: Ikigo cya Who Gives a Crap gitunganya impapuro z’isuku zakoreshejwe, kivuga ko ku wa gatatu ushize ibicuruzwa byabashiranye mu bubiko.

sourceString: Kimberly-Clark, which makes Kleenex Toilet Tissue, and Solaris Paper which makes Sorbent, emphasized they were working 24/7 to maintain the supply, according to the News.com.au report.
targetString: News.com.au itangaza ko uruganda rwa Kimberly-Clark rukora udutambaro tw’isuku twa Kleenex na Solaris Paper ikora impapuro z’isuku za Sorbent, bashimangiye ko bari gukora amasaha 24/7 kugira ngo bahaze isoko.

sourceString: Domain.com, a real estate site, reported some property sellers offering free toilet paper to the first bidder on auctions in Melbourne, when fewer auctions were held because of buyers having time off on the long weekend of Labour Day.
targetString: Domain.com, urubuga rugurishirizwaho imitungo itimukanwa, rwatangaje ko abagurisha amazu bari no gutanga impapuro z’isuku z’ubuntu ku bageretse inzu bwa mbere muri cyamunara y’i Melbourne, ahakoreshejwe cyamunara nke kubera ko abaguzi bari bafite ikiruhuko cy’umunsi w’umurimo cyahuriranye na wikendi.

sourceString: The Thursday edition of NT News, a daily printed in Darwin, included an eight-page insert meant to be cut up and used as toilet paper.
targetString: Nomero yo ku wa kane ya NT News, ikimanyakuru cyandika ku mpapuro gisohoka buri munsi muri Darwin, cyongeyemo paji umunani zishobora gukatwa zigakoreshwa nk’urupapuro rw’isuku.

sourceString: The stores were originally reluctant to impose restrictions, according to a report from ABC Australia on March 3 in which they said they had no plans to introduce restrictions on the purchases.
targetString: Amaduka ntiyifuzaga gushyiraho amabwiriza, hakurikijwe ibikubiye muri raporo ya ABC Australia yo ku wa 3 Werurwe, aho ivuga ko atateganyaga gushyiraho amabwiriza ku byo umuntu agura.

sourceString: Russell Zimmerman added that other products are also in high demand, including masks, sanitiser, dried goods, handwash and flour.
targetString: Russell Zimmerman yakomeje avuga ko ibindi bicuruzwa na byo byagurishwaga cyane harimo udupfukamunwa, umuti wica udukoko, ibiribwa byumye, isabune yo koga mu ntoki n’ifarine.

sourceString: Similarly, outside of Australia, on Sunday evening online British supermarket Ocado was observed limiting purchases of Andres toilet paper to two 12-roll packs.
targetString: Ni nako byari bimeze hanze ya Ositaraliya, aho mu ijoro ryo ku cyumweru iduka ricururiza kuri interineti ryo mu Bwongereza ryitwa Ocado ryagabanyije impapuro z’isuku za Andres ku buryo zitarenga amapaki abiri arimo 12.

sourceString: World Health Organization declares COVID-19 pandemic
targetString: Ishami ry’Umuryango w’Abibumbye ryita ku buzima ryatangaje ko COVID-19 ari icyorezo

sourceString: On Wednesday, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the ongoing outbreak of COVID-19 — the disease caused by coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 — to be a pandemic.
targetString: Ku wa gatatu, Ishami ry’Umuryango w’Abibumbye ryita ku buzima (OMS) ryatangaje ko indwara iriho iki gihe ya COVID-19 iterwa na koronavirusi SARS-CoV-2 ari icyorezo.

sourceString: Although the word "pandemic" only refers to how widely a disease has spread, not how dangerous specific cases are, the WHO noted the need to drive governments to action:
targetString: Nubwo ijambo "icyorezo" rivuga ahanini uko iyo ndwara yageze mu bihugu byinshi, ntirivuga by’umwihariko ubukana bwayo, OMS yagaragaje ko ari ngombwa ko reta zigira uruhare mu kuyirwanya:

sourceString: "All countries can still change the course of this pandemic.
targetString: "Ibihugu byose bishobora guhindura aho iki cyorezo kigana.

sourceString: If countries detect, test, treat, isolate, trace and mobilize their people in the response," said Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, the Director-General of the WHO.
targetString: Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, Umuyobozi Mukuru wa OMS avuga ko: “Ibihugu bitahuye, bigapima, bikavura, bigashyira abanduye mu kato, bigakukirana abahuye n’abanduye bikanashishikariza abantu uko bakwiye kwirinda".

sourceString: "We are deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity and by the alarming levels of inaction."
targetString: "Duhangayikishijwe bikomeye n’umuvuduko w’ikwirakwira n’ubukana by’icyorezo no kuba nta kiri gukorwa mu kukirwanya”.

sourceString: According to Dr. Tom Frieden, formerly the director of the United States' Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the pandemic is "unprecedented."
targetString: Ku bwa Dr. Tom Frieden, wahoze ari Umuyobozi Mukuru w’kigo gishinzwe kugenzura no gukumira indwara cyo muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika, iki cyorezo "ntikigeze kibaho."

sourceString: He said, in remarks published by CNN in February, "other than influenza, no other respiratory virus has been tracked from emergence to continuous global spread."
targetString: Mu magambo ye yatangajwe na CNN muri Gashyantare yagize ati: “Usibye ibicurane, nta yindi virusi ifata imyanya y’ubuhumekero yarenze aho yagaragaye maze igakura ikaba icyorezo ku isi”.

sourceString: Ghebreyesus expressed a similar view, saying "we have never before seen a pandemic sparked by a coronavirus."
targetString: Ghebreyesus na we bajya guhuza ibitekerezo, aho yagize ati: “ntitwigeze tubona icyorezo cyatewe na koronavirusi”.

sourceString: He continued, "and we have never before seen a pandemic that can be controlled at the same time."
targetString: Akomeza agira ati: “kandi ntitwigeze tubona icyorezo gishobora kurwanywa mu buryo bugaragara”.

sourceString: The new status as a pandemic follows the WHO's decision in January to declare the outbreak a public health emergency of international concern.
targetString: Guhinduka icyorezo bije bikurikira icyemezo cya OMS cyo muri Mutarama cyo gutangaza ko icyo cyorezo ari amakuba abangamiye ubuzima rusange ahangayikishije isi.

sourceString: The United States' National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease's director, Dr. Anthony Fauci, said of the outbreak, "bottom line, it's going to get worse."
targetString: Umuyobozi Mukuru w’Ikigo cy'Amerika cyita ku ndwara zandura n'ingaruka zigira ku mubiri (NIAID), Dr. Anthony Fauci, yavuze ko: “Ikigaragara ni uko icyorezo gituma ibintu birushaho kuzamba”.

sourceString: As of Thursday, Associated Press reported there were at least 126,000 cases of COVID-19 worldwide, resulting in over 4,600 deaths.
targetString: Ku wa kane, Ibiro ntaramakuru bya Associated Press byatangaje ko byibuze abantu 126 000 bamaze kwandura COVID-19 ku isi, aho muri bo abarenga 4 600 bamaze gupfa.

sourceString: The 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic is an ongoing pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Icyorezo cya koronavirusi yo mu 2019–20 ni icyorezo kiriho ubu cy’indwara ya koronavirusi yo mu 2019 (COVID-19), iterwa na koronavirusi itera ibicurane bikaze cyane (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: The outbreak was identified in Wuhan, China, in December 2019, declared to be a Public Health Emergency of International Concern on 30 January 2020, and recognized as a pandemic on 11 March 2020.
targetString: Mu Kuboza 2019, icyorezo cyagaragaye muri Wuhan, mu Bushinwa; tariki ya 30 Mutarama 2020, hatangazwa ko ari amakuba abangamiye ubuzima rusange ahangayikishije isi, naho tariki ya 11 Werurwe 2020 hatangazwa ko ari icyorezo.

sourceString: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 1.61 million cases of COVID-19 have been reported in 210 countries and territories, resulting in approximately 97,000 deaths.
targetString: Kugeza ku ya 10 Mata 2020, hafi abantu bagera kuri miriyoni 1,61 bari bamaze kwandura COVID-19 mu bihugu n’uturere 210, muri bo hafi 97 000 barapfuye.

sourceString: About 364,000 people have recovered.
targetString: Hafi abantu 364 000 barakize.

sourceString: The case fatality rate has been estimated to be 4% in China, while globally ranging from 13.04% in Algeria to .08% in New Zealand.
targetString: Igipimo cy’abapfa kiri kuri 4% mu Bushinwa, mu gihe ku isi kiri hagati ya 13,04% muri Alijeriya na 0,8% muri Nuveli Zelande.

sourceString: Common symptoms include fever, cough and shortness of breath.
targetString: Ibimenyetso birimo kugira umuriro, gukorora no guhumeka nabi.

sourceString: Complications may include pneumonia and acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: Ibimenyetso bikomeye harimo umusonga n’ibibazo bikomeye byo guhumeka.

sourceString: The time from exposure to onset of symptoms is typically around five days, but may range from two to fourteen days.
targetString: Igihe wahuye n’indwara gutangira kugaragaza ibimenyetso biba hafi mu minsi itanu, ariko binashobora kuva ku minsi ibiri kugeza ku minsi cumi n’ine.

sourceString: There is no known vaccine or specific antiviral treatment.
targetString: Nta rukingo nta n’umuti bizwi bivura iyi virusi.

sourceString: Primary treatment is symptomatic and supportive therapy.Recommended preventive measures include hand washing, covering one's mouth when coughing, maintaining distance from other people, and monitoring and self-isolation for people who suspect they are infected.
targetString: Ubuvuzi bw’ibanze ni ukuvura ibimenyetso no gufasha umurwayi kutaremba. Amabwiriza ya ngombwa mu kwirinda harimo gukaraba intoki, kwipfuka umunwa igihe ukoroye, gusiga intera hagati yawe n’abandi, gukurikirana no kwishyira mu kato ku bantu bikekwa ko banduye.

sourceString: Authorities worldwide have responded by implementing travel restrictions, quarantines, curfews, workplace hazard controls, and facility closures.
targetString: Abayobozi ku isi bahangaye n’icyorezo bahagarika ingendo, bashyiraho akato, imikwabo, kurwanya icyorezo ahakorerwa akazi no gufunga ibigo.

sourceString: The pandemic has led to severe global socioeconomic disruption, the postponement or cancellation of sporting, religious, political and cultural events, and widespread shortages of supplies exacerbated by panic buying.
targetString: Icyorezo cyatumye ibikorwa by’ubukungu n’imibereho bihungabana, hasubikwa cyangwa hahagarikwa ibikorwa bya siporo, amadini, poritiki n’umuco ndetse kinatuma habaho ibura ry’ibicuruzwa ku isi byatewe n’abaguze ibicuruzwa ku bwinshi kubera gutinya icyorezo.

sourceString: Schools and universities have closed either on a nationwide or local basis in 193 countries, affecting approximately 99.4 percent  of the world's student population.
targetString: Amashuri na za kaminuza byarafunze haba ku rwego rw’igihugu cyangwa uturere mu bihugu 193, bigira ingaruka hafi kuri 99,4 ku ijana by’abanyeshuri bo ku isi.

sourceString: Misinformation about the virus has spread online, and there have been incidents of xenophobia and discrimination against Chinese people, other people of East and Southeast Asian descent and appearance, and others from areas with significant virus cases.
targetString: Amakuru y’ibihuha kuri virusi na yo yakwiriye kuri interineti, hari n’ahagiye hagaragara ibikorwa by’urugomo cyangwa ivangura byibasira abanyamahanga cyane cyane abashinwa, abakomoka mu burasirazuba n’amajyepfo y’uburasirazuba bw’Aziya, n’abandi baturuka mu bice virusi yiganjemo.

sourceString: Due to reduced travel and closures of heavy industry, there has been a decrease in air pollution and carbon emissions.
targetString: Bitewe n’igabanyuka ry’ingendo no gufunga inganda zikomeye, ihumana ry’ikirere n’umwuka uhumanya ikirere byaragabanutse.

sourceString: Health authorities in Wuhan, China (the capital of Hubei province) reported a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 31 December 2019, and an investigation was launched in early January 2020.
targetString: Tariki ya 31 Ukuboza 2019, Inzego z’ubuzima muri Wuhan, mu Bushinwa (umurwa mukuru w’intara ya Hubei) zatangaje abantu barwaye umusonga watewe n’ikintu kitazwi, maze mu ntangiriro za Mutarama 2020 isuzuma riratangira.

sourceString: The cases mostly had links to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market and so the virus is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
targetString: Abo barwaye bafite aho bahuriye n’isoko rya Huanan Seafood Wholesale, aho bikekwa ko virusi yaturutse mu nyamaswa.

sourceString: The virus that caused the outbreak is known as SARS-CoV-2, a newly discovered virus closely related to bat coronaviruses, pangolin coronaviruses, and SARS-CoV.The earliest known person with symptoms was later discovered to have fallen ill on 1 December 2019, and that person did not have visible connections with the later wet market cluster.
targetString: Virusi yateje icyorezo izwi nka SARS-CoV-2, virusi nshya yavumbuwe isa na koronavirusi zo mu ducurama, ibisamujyonjyo na SARS-CoV. Umuntu wa mbere uzwiho kugaragaza ibimenyetso byamenyekanye ko yarwaye tariki ya 1 Ukuboza 2019, kandi uwo muntu ntaho yari ahuriye n’abo kuri iryo soko ribagirwamo inyamaswa.

sourceString: Of the early cluster of cases reported in December 2019, two-thirds were found to have a link with the market.
targetString: Abandi bantu barwaye bwa mbere batangajwe mu Kuboza 2019, aho bibiri bya gatatu byabo bafite aho bahuriye n’iryo soko.

sourceString: On 13 March 2020, an unverified report from the South China Morning Post suggested that a case traced back to 17 November 2019, in a 55-year-old from Hubei province, may have been the first.On 26 February 2020, the WHO reported that, as new cases reportedly declined in China but suddenly increased in Italy, Iran, and South Korea, the number of new cases outside China had exceeded the number of new cases within China for the first time.
targetString: Ku ya 3 Werurwe 2020, amakuru ataremejwe yatangajwe n’ikinyamakuru cya South China Morning Post yavuze ko ubwandu bwagaragaye tariki ya 17 Ugushyingo 2019, bugaragara ku muntu ufite imyaka 55 wo mu ntara ya Hubei, ushobora kuba ari we wa mbere. Ku ya 26 Gashyantare 2020, OMS yatangaje ko abandura bashya bagabanutse mu Bushinwa ariko bakiyongera bikabije mu Butaliyani, Irani na Koreya y’Epfo, umubare w’abanduye bashya hanze y’Ubushinwa urenga abanduye bashya mu Bushinwa bwa mbere.

sourceString: There may be substantial underreporting of cases, particularly among those with milder symptoms.
targetString: Birashoboka ko hari abanduye benshi batatangajwe; by’umwihariko, abafite ibimenyetso byoroheje.

sourceString: By 26 February, relatively few cases had been reported among youths, with those 19 and under making up 2.4% of cases worldwide.The United Kingdom's chief scientific adviser, Patrick Vallance, estimated that 60% of the British population would need to become infected before effective herd immunity could be achieved.
targetString: Kugeza tariki ya 26 Gashyantare, hatangajwe umubare ugiye kuba muto w’abanduye mu rubyiruko, aho muri bo abafite n’abatagejeje imyaka 19 banganaga na 2,4% by’abanduye ku isi. Umujyanama mu bya siyansi wa leta y’Ubwongereza, Patrick Vallance, avuga ko 60% by’abatuye mu Bwongereza bashobora kwandura mbere yo kubona urukingo.

sourceString: Cases refers to the number of people who have been tested for COVID-19, and whose test has been confirmed positive according to official protocols.
targetString: Ababanduye ni umubare w’abantu bapimwe bakabasangamo COVID-19, kandi ibyo bipimo bikaba byaremejwe hakurikijwe porotokore za leta.

sourceString: As of 23 March, no country had tested more than 3% of its population, and many countries have had official policies not to test those with only mild symptoms, such as Italy, the Netherlands, Spain, and Switzerland.
targetString: Kugeza ku itariki ya 23 Werurwe, nta gihugu cyari cyagapimye 3% by’abaturage bacyo, kandi ibihugu byinshi nk’Ubutaliyani, Ubuholandi, Esipanye n’Ubusuwisi byashyizeho amabwiriza yo kudapima abafite ibimenyetso byoroheje.

sourceString: A study published on 16 March found that in China, up to 23 January, an estimated 86% of COVID-19 infections had not been detected, and that these undocumented infections were the infection source for 79% of documented cases.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi bwatangajwe tariki ya 16 Werurwe bwagaragaje ko kugeza tariki ya 23 Mutarama, mu Bushinwa 86% by’abanduye COVID-19 bataribakabonetse, naho abanduye batanditswe bakaba ari bo banduje abanditswe bagera kuri 79%.

sourceString: A statistical analysis published 30 March estimated that numbers of infections in Italy were considerably greater than the reported cases.
targetString: Isesengura ry’imibare ryatangajwe tariki ya 30 Werurwe ryagaragaje ko umubare w’abanduye mu Butaliyani warutaga abatangajwe.

sourceString: The initial estimates of the basic reproduction number (R0) for COVID-19 were 1.4 to 2.4.
targetString: Imibare y’ubwandu bushya (R0) bwa COVID-19 yari kuva kuri 1,4 kugera kuri 2,4.

sourceString: A study published by the US Center for Disease Control and Prevention has concluded that it may be 5.7.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi bwatangajwe n’Ikigo gishinzwe kugenzura no gukumira indwara cyo muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika bwanzuye ko iyo mibare ishobora kuba ari 5,7.

sourceString: Most people with COVID-19 recover.
targetString: Abenshi mu barwaye COVID-19 barakira.

sourceString: For those who do not, the time from development of symptoms to death has been between 6 and 41 days, with the most common being 14 days.
targetString: Ku badakira, igihe ibimenyetso byatangiriye kugaragara kugeza uyirwaye apfuye ni hagati y’iminsi 6 na 41, ariko isanzwe cyane ni iminsi 14.

sourceString: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 97,000 deaths had been attributed to COVID-19.
targetString: Kugeza tariki ya 10 Mata 2020, hafi abantu 97 000 bishwe na COVID-19.

sourceString: In China, as of 5 February about 80% of deaths were in those over 60, and 75% had pre-existing health conditions including cardiovascular diseases and diabetes.Official tallies of deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic generally refer to dead people who tested positive for COVID according to official protocols.
targetString: Mu Bushinwa, kugeza tariki ya 5 Gashyantare 80% by’abapfuye bari barengeje imyaka 60, naho 75% bari basanzwe barwaye izindi ndwara harimo indwara z’umutima na diyabete. Imibare yatangajwe na leta y’abishwe n’icyorezo cya COVID-19 ahanini yabaga ari iy’abantu bapimwe bakabasangamo COVID hakurikijwe porotokore za leta.

sourceString: The number of true fatalities from COVID-19 may be much higher, as it may not include people who die without testing - e.g. at home, in nursing homes, etc.
targetString: Imibare y’abishwe mu by’ukuri na COVID-19 ishobora kuba iruta iyatangajwe, kuko itarimo abapfuye badasuzumwe, urug.: abapfiriye mu rugo, mu bigo byita ku basheshakanguhe n’ahandi.

sourceString: Partial data from Italy found that the number of excess deaths during the pandemic exceeded the official COVID death tally by a factor of 4-5x.
targetString: Amwe mu makuru aturuka mu Butaliyani avuga ko umubare w’abapfuye benshi muri iki gihe cy’icyorezo uruta uwatangajwe na leta ko bishwe na COVID ku bwikube bwa 4-5.

sourceString: A spokeswoman for the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) acknowledged "We know that [the stated death toll] is an underestimation", a statement corroborated by anecdotal reports of undercounting in the U.S. Such underestimation often occurs in pandemics, such as the 2009 H1N1 swine flu epidemic.The first confirmed death was in Wuhan on 9 January 2020.
targetString: Umuvugizi w’Ikigo gishinzwe kugenzura no gukumira indwara cyo muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika (CDC) yagize ati: “Tuzi ko umubare utangazwa w’abapfuye uba udahuye n’umubare nyakuri w’abapfuye”, ibyo yatangaje bikaba bihura n’amakuru yagiye atangazwa ko muri Amerika hatabarwa abishwe n’ciyorezo bose. Akenshi uko kutabara abapfuye bose bibaho mu gihe cy’ibyorezo nko mu gihe cy’icyorezo cya 2009 H1N1 cy’ibicurane by’ingurube. Tariki ya 9 Mutarama 2020 ni bwo hemejwe ko umuntu wa mbere yahitanwe n’icyorezo.

sourceString: The first death outside mainland China occurred on 1 February in the Philippines, and the first death outside Asia was in France on 14 February.
targetString: Tariki ya 1 Gashyantare, ni bwo umuntu wa mbere yapfuye hanze y’Ubushinwa muri Filipine, naho uwa mbere wapfuye hanze y’Aziya yapfiriye mu Bufaransa tariki ya 14 Gashyantare.

sourceString: By 28 February, outside mainland China, more than a dozen deaths each were recorded in Iran, South Korea, and Italy.
targetString: Ku wa 28 Gashyantare, hanze y’Ubushinwa, abantu barenga cumi na babiri mu gihugu cya Irani, Koreya y’Epfo no mu Butaliyani bari bamaze gupfa.

sourceString: By 13 March, more than forty countries and territories had reported deaths, on every continent except Antarctica.Several measures are commonly used to quantify mortality.
targetString: Ku wa 13 Werurwe, ibihugu n’uturere birenga mirongo ine byatangaje ko hari abapfuye, ku migabane yose uretse Antaragitika. Hari ingamba nyinshi ziri gukoreshwa ahantu hatandukanye mu kubara umubare w’abapfa.

sourceString: These numbers vary by region and over time, and are influenced by the volume of testing, healthcare system quality, treatment options, time since initial outbreak, and population characteristics such as age, sex, and overall health.The death-to-case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases within a given time interval.
targetString: Iyo mibare iratandukanye bitewe n’akarere n’igihe, kandi iterwa n’ibipimo byafashwe, imikorere y’inzego z’ubuvuzi, imivurire, igihe gishizie icyorezo giteye n’imimerere y’abaturage nk’imyaka, igitsina n’ubuzima bwabo muri rusange. Impuzandengo y’abapfa mu banduye igaragaza umubare w’abapfuye ugabanyije umubare w’abanduye mu gihe runaka.

sourceString: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global death-to-case ratio is 6.0% (97,039/1,617,204) as of 10 April 2020.
targetString: Hashingiwe ku mibare ya Kaminuza ya Johns Hopkins, impuzandengo y’abapfa mu banduye ni 6,0% (97 039/1 617 204) kugeza tariki ya 10 Mata 2020.

sourceString: The number varies by region.
targetString: Imibare ihinduka bitewe n’akarere.

sourceString: In China, estimates for the death-to-case ratio decreased from 17.3% (for those with symptom onset 1–10 January 2020) to 0.7% (for those with symptom onset after 1 February 2020).Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percent of diagnosed people who die from a disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percent of infected (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die from a disease.
targetString: Mu Bushinwa, imibare y’impuzandengo y’abapfa mu banduye yaragabanutse iva kuri 17,3% (abagaragaje ibimenyetso bakirwaye ku itariki ya 1–10 Mutarama 2020) igera kuri 0,7% (ku bagaragaje ibimenyetso bamaze kurwara nyuma y’itariki ya 1 Gashyantare 2020). Izindi ngamba zirimo igipimo cy’abapfa (CFR), kigaragaza ijanisha ry’abasanzwemo indwara bapfuye bishwe na yo, naho igipimo cy’ubwandu (IFR), kikagaragaza ijanisha ry’abanduye (yaba abapimwe cyangwa abatarapimwe) bakicwa n’indwara.

sourceString: These statistics are not timebound and follow a specific population from infection through case resolution.
targetString: Iyo mibare ntishingiye ku gihie kandi ikurikirana abantu runaka bihariye kuva banduye kugeza bakize cyangwa bapfuye.

sourceString: A number of academics have attempted to calculate these numbers for specific populations.
targetString: Kaminuza nyinshi zagerageje kubara iyo mibare y’abantu runaka.

sourceString: The University of Oxford's Centre for Evidence-Based Medicine estimates that the infection fatality rate for the pandemic as a whole is between 0.1% and 0.39%.
targetString: Ikigo cy’ubuvuzi bushingiye kubimenyetso cya Kaminuza ya Oxford kivuga ko igipimo cy’ubwandu bw’icyorezo muri rusange kiri hagati ya 0,1% na 0,39%.

sourceString: The upper estimate of this range is consistent with the results from the first random testing for COVID-19 in Germany, and a statistical study analysing the impact of testing on CFR estimates.
targetString: Imibare yo hejuru y’icyo cyiciro ihura neza n’ibyavuye mu isuzuma rya mbere rya COVID-19 ry’abantu batombowe mu Budage n’imibare yo mu bushakashatsi igaragaza igipimo cy’abapfa hashingiwe ku bapimwa.

sourceString: The WHO asserts that the pandemic can be controlled.
targetString: OMS ivuga ko icyorezo gishobora kurwanywa.

sourceString: The peak and ultimate duration of the outbreak are uncertain and may differ by location.
targetString: Igihe handura abantu benshi n’igihe icyorezo kimara ntibizwi neza kandi bishobora guhinduka bitewe n’agace runaka.

sourceString: Maciej Boni of Penn State University stated, "Left unchecked, infectious outbreaks typically plateau and then start to decline when the disease runs out of available hosts.
targetString: Maciej Boni ukorera Kaminuza ya Penn State yagize ati: “Hatabayeho igenzura, ibyorezo bitera indwara akenshi biraza bikaguma ku rugero runaka maze bigatangira gucogora igihe indwara zibuze abo zanduza.

sourceString: But it's almost impossible to make any sensible projection right now about when that will be".
targetString: Ariko biragoye guteganya kuri ubu iby’igihe kizarangirira”.

sourceString: The Chinese government's senior medical adviser Zhong Nanshan argued that "it could be over by June" if all countries can be mobilized to follow the WHO's advice on measures to stop the spread of the virus.
targetString: Umujyanama mukuru mu by’ubuvuzi wa leta y’Ubushinwa, Zhong Nanshan, yatangaje ko: “iki cyorezo gishobora kuba cyarangiye muri Kamena" igihe ibihugu byose byubahirije inama bigirwa ku mabwiriza ya OMS yo guhagarika ikwirakwira ry’icyorezo.

sourceString: On 17 March, Adam Kucharski of the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine stated that SARS-CoV-2 "is going to be circulating, potentially for a year or two".
targetString: Ku wa 17 Werurwe, Adam Kucharski ukorera Ishuri ryigisha iby’isuku n’imiti yo muri toropike i Londere (London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine) yavuze ko SARS-CoV-2 “izagenda iva mu gace kamwe ijya mu kandi, bishoboke ko izamara umwaka umwe cyangwa ibiri.”

sourceString: According to the Imperial College study led by Neil Ferguson, physical distancing and other measures will be required "until a vaccine becomes available (potentially 18 months or more)".
targetString: Hakurikijwe ubushakashatsi bwakozwe n’ishuri rikuru rya Imperial College bwayobowe na Neil Ferguson, kutegerana kw’abantu n’izindi ngamba bigomba kubahirizwa "kugeza urukingo rubonetse (mu mezi 18 cyangwa kurenza)".

sourceString: William Schaffner of Vanderbilt University stated, "I think it's unlikely that this coronavirus—because it's so readily transmissible—will disappear completely" and it "might turn into a seasonal disease, making a comeback every year".
targetString: William Schaffner ukorera Kaminuza ya Vanderbilt yagize ati: “Ndatekereza ko bidashoboka ko iyi koronavirusi, kubera ko yandura cyane, izacika burundu” kandi “ishobora guhindukamo indwara iza mu gihe runaka, maze ikajya igaruka buri mwaka”.

sourceString: The virulence of the comeback would depend on herd immunity and the extent of mutation.
targetString: Kugaruka kw’iyi virusi yandura cyane bizaterwa n’ubudahangarwa bw’umubiri w’umuntu ndetse n’imihindagurikire ya virusi.

sourceString: Symptoms of COVID-19 can be relatively non-specific and infected people may be asymptomatic.
targetString: Ibimenyetso bya COVID-19 bishobora kuba bitihariye kandi abantu banduye bashobora kutagaragaza ibimenyetso.

sourceString: The two most common symptoms are fever (88%) and dry cough (68%).
targetString: Ibyinshi mu bimenyetso bikunze kugaragara ni umuriro (88%) n’inkorora y’akayi (68%).

sourceString: Less common symptoms include fatigue, respiratory sputum production (phlegm), loss of the sense of smell, shortness of breath, muscle and joint pain, sore throat, headache, chills, vomiting, hemoptysis, diarrhea, or cyanosis.The WHO states that approximately one person in six becomes seriously ill and has difficulty breathing.
targetString: Ibimenyetso bidakunze kugaragara ni umunaniro, kuzana igikororwa, kudahumurirwa, guhumeka nabi, kubabara imikaya n’ingingo, kubabara mu muhogo, kuribwa umutwe, kugira imbeho, kuruka, gukorora ukazana amaraso, impiswi cyangwa kugira uruhu rw’ubururu. OMS itangaza ko hafi umuntu umwe mu bantu batandatu azahazwa n’iyo virusi akanagira ibibazo byo guhumeka.

sourceString: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) lists emergency symptoms as difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, sudden confusion, difficulty waking, and bluish face or lips; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms are present.Further development of the disease can lead to severe pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, sepsis, septic shock and death.
targetString: Ikigo gishinzwe kugenzura no gukumira indwara cyo muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika (CDC) kigaragaza ibimenyetso byerekana ko umuntu arwaye harimo ibibazo byo guhumeka, gukunda kubabara cyangwa kuribwa mu gatuza, gucanganyikirwa bya hato na hato, kubyuka bigoranye, kubabuka mu maso cyangwa iminwa, abafite ibyo bibazo bagirwa inama yo guhita bajya kwa muganga igihe ibimenyetso bidakize. Iyo indwara ikomeje gukura ishobora gutuma uzahazwa n’umusonga, ibibazo bikomeye byo guhumeka, kuvira imbere, ibibazo by’aside yo mu mubiri n’urupfu.

sourceString: Some of those infected may be asymptomatic, with no clinical symptoms but with test results that confirm infection, so researchers have issued advice that those with close contact to confirmed infected people should be closely monitored and examined to rule out infection.
targetString: Iyo bamwe mu banduye bashobora kutagaragaza ibimenyetso, mu gihe nta bimenyetso bagaragaza ariko ibisubizo by’ibizamini bikagaragaza ko banduye, ni ho abashakashatsi batanga inama z’uko abahuye n’abo byemejwe ko banduye bagomba gukurikiranirwa hafi bagasuzumwa kugira ngo harebwe niba bataranduye.

sourceString: Chinese estimates of the asymptomatic ratio range from few to 44%.
targetString: Ubushinwa buvuga ko igipimo cy’abatagaragaza ibimenyetso kiva ku bantu bake kikagera kuri 44%.

sourceString: The usual incubation period (the time between infection and symptom onset) ranges from one to 14 days; it is most commonly five days.As an example of uncertainty, the estimate of the fraction of people with COVID-19 who lost their sense of smell was initially 30% and later fell to 15%.
targetString: Igihe gisanzwe cyo kugaragaza ibimenyetso (igihe kiri hagati yo kwandura no gutangira kugaragaza ibimenyetso) ni kuva ku munsi umwe kugera ku minsi 14; bikunze kuba ari iminsi mike. Urugero rugaragaza gushidikanya ni uko imibare y’abafite COVID-19 batacyumva impumuro mbere yari 30% iramanuka igera kuri 15%.

sourceString: Some details about how the disease is spread are still being determined.
targetString: Amwe mu makuru y’uko indwara yanduramo ntaramenyekana neza.

sourceString: The disease is believed to be primarily spread during close contact and by small droplets produced during coughing, sneezing, or talking; with close contact being within 1 to 2 metres (3 to 6 feet).
targetString: Hatekerezwa ko ahanini indwara yandura mu kwegerana cyane n’amatembabuzi aza iyo umuntu akoroye, yitsamuye cyangwa yegereye undi cyane muri metero zitageze kuri 1 cyangwa 2.

sourceString: Studies have found that an uncovered coughing can lead to droplets travelling up to 4.5 metres (15 feet) to 8.2 metres (27 feet).
targetString: Ubushakashatsi bwagaragaje ko gukorora utipfutse bishobora gutuma amatembabuzi agenda metero kuva kuri 4,5 kugeza ku 8,2.

sourceString: Some have proposed that the virus may also be transmitted by small droplets that stay for more prolonged periods in the air, that may be generated during speech.Respiratory droplets may also be produced during breathing out, including when talking, though the virus is not generally airborne.
targetString: Abandi bavuga ko virusi ishobora kuba yandura biturutse ku matembabuzi aguma igihe kirekire mu mwuka, ashobora gusohoka igihe umuntu ari kuvuga. Amatembabuzi yo mu nzira z’ubuhumekero anashobora gusohoka igihe umuntu asohoye umwuka igihe ari kuvuga, ahanini virusi yandurira mu mwuka.

sourceString: The droplets can land in the mouths or noses of people who are nearby or possibly be inhaled into the lungs.
targetString: Ayo matembabuzi ashobora kugwa mu kanwa cyangwa mu mazuru y’abantu bari hafi cyane cyangwa bayahumetse akajya mu bihaha.

sourceString: Some medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may cause respiratory secretions to be aerosolized and thus result in airborne spread.
targetString: Bimwe mu bikorwa by’ubuvuzi nko kwinjiza umuheha wo guhumekeramo mu bihaha no kuzanzamura umuntu (CPR) bishobora gutuma ayo matembabuzi yo mu buhumekero agera mu mwuka maze indwara igakwirakwira binyuze mu mwuka.

sourceString: It may also spread when one touches a contaminated surface, including skin, and then touches their eyes, nose, or mouth.
targetString: Inashobora gukwirakwira igihe umuntu akoze ahantu hari virusi nko ku ruhu maze akikora mu maso, ku mazuru cyangwa mu kanwa.

sourceString: While there are concerns it may spread by faeces, this risk is believed to be low.
targetString: Mu gihe hari impungenge z’uko ishobora kwandura binyuze mu musarane, hatekerezwa ko ibi byago ari bike cyane.

sourceString: The Government of China denied the possibility of faecal-oral transmission of SARS-CoV-2.The virus is most contagious during the first three days after onset of symptoms, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease.
targetString: Leta y’Ubushinwa yahakanye ko SARS-CoV-2 yandura iturutse mu musarani w’uyirwaye maze udukoko tukajya mu kanwa k’uwandujwe. Virusi yandura cyane mu minsi itatu ya mbere ibimenyetso bimaze kugaragara, nubwo ikwirakwira rishoboka mbere yo gutangira kugaragaza ibimenyetso n’igihe indwara ikaze.

sourceString: People have tested positive for the disease up to three days before onset of symptoms suggesting transmission is possible before developing significant symptoms.
targetString: Abantu bapimwe bakabasangamo indwara mu minsi itatu mbere yo kugaragaza ibimenyetso, birashoboka ko banduza iyo ndwara mbere yo kugaragaza ibimenyetso bifatika.

sourceString: Only few reports of laboratory-confirmed asymptomatic cases exist, but asymptomatic transmission has been identified by some countries during contact tracing investigations.
targetString: Hari raporo nke z’abanduye batagaragaza ibimenyetso bikemezwa na raboratwari gusa, ariko kwanduza indwara utagaragaza ibimenyetso byagiye bigaragara mu bihugu bimwe na bimwe mu gihe hakorwaga isuzuma mu gukurikirana abahuye n’abanduye.

sourceString: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) states that while it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three others.The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.
targetString: Ikigo gishinzwe kurwanya no gukumira indwara mu Burayi (ECDC) gitangaza ko bitagaragara neza uko indwara ishobora kwandura byoroshye, uwayanduye ashobora kwanduza abandi babiri cyangwa batatu. Virusi imara amasaha cyangwa iminsi ahantu runaka.

sourceString: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and 304 stainless steel, for one day on cardboard, and for up to four hours on copper.
targetString: By’umwihariko, virusi ishobora kumara kugeza ku minsi itatu ku gikoresho cya purasitike (poriporopirene) n’iminsi 304 ku cyuma kitagwa ingese, umunsi umwe ku ikarito no kugeza ku minsi ine ku cyuma cy’umuringa.

sourceString: This, however, varies based on the humidity and temperature.Pets and other animals have tested positive for COVID-19.
targetString: Ariko, bigenda bitandukana hashingiye ku buhehere n’ubushyuhe. Amatungo yo mu rugo n’izindi nyamaswa byarapimwe bisangwamo COVID-19.

sourceString: There is no evidence animals can pass the virus on to humans, though British authorities advise washing one's hands after contact with animals, like after contact with other surfaces infected people could have touched.
targetString: Nta kimenyetso kigaragaza ko inyamanswa zishobora kwanduza iyo virusi abantu, nubwo inzego z’ubuyobozi z’Ubwongereza zigira abantu inama yo gukaraba intoki bamaze gukora ku matungo n’igihe bamaze gukora ahantu abantu banduye bashobora kuba bakoze.

sourceString: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel virus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.
targetString: Koronavirusi itera ibicurane bikaze cyane (SARS-CoV-2) ni virusi nshya, yakuwe mu bantu batatu bari barwaye umusonga ufite aho uhuriye n’indwara y’ibicurane by’igikatu muri Wuhan.

sourceString: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in related coronaviruses in nature.Outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which dissolves its protective envelope.SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.
targetString: Imiterere yose ya virusi nshya ya SARS-CoV-2 isa neza n’iya koroanavirusi. Itari mu mubiri w’umuntu, iyo virusi yicwa n’isabune ikoreshwa mu rugo ishwanyaguza akugara kayitwikira. Virusi ya SARS-CoV-2 isa cyane na virusi yakomotseho ya SARS-CoV.

sourceString: It is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
targetString: Bikekwa ko yakomotse ku nyamaswa.

sourceString: Genetic analysis has revealed that the coronavirus genetically clusters with the genus Betacoronavirus, in subgenus Sarbecovirus (lineage B) together with two bat-derived strains.
targetString: Isesengura rya jene ryagaragaje ko koronavirusi iri mu itsinda rimwe na Betakoronavirusi, iri mu muryango wa Saribekovirusi (umuryango wa B) zombi zikaba zarakomotse ku ducurama.

sourceString: It is 96% identical at the whole genome level to other bat coronavirus samples (BatCov RaTG13).
targetString: Bisa ku rugero rwa 96% na jenome z’ibindi bipimo bya koronavirusi yo mu gacurama (BatCov RaTG13).

sourceString: In February 2020, Chinese researchers found that there is only one amino acid difference in certain parts of the genome sequences between the viruses from pangolins and those from humans.
targetString: Muri Gashyantare 2020, abashakashatsi bo mu Bushinwa babonye ko bitandukaniye kuri aside amino imwe gusa y’imiterere ya jenome hagati ya virusi yakuwe mu bisamujyonjyo n’iyakuwe mu bantu.

sourceString: Whole-genome comparison to date has found at most 92% of genetic material shared between pangolin coronavirus and SARS-CoV-2, which is insufficient to prove pangolins to be the intermediate host.
targetString: Kugeza ubu, kugereranya jenome zose bimaze kugaragaza ko kugeza kuri 92% by’ibigize jenome ya koronavirusi yo mu bisamujyonjyo na SARS-CoV-2, bidahagije mu kwemeza ko ibisamujyonjyo ari byo byandujwe bwa mbere.

sourceString: Infection by the virus can be provisionally diagnosed on the basis of symptoms, though confirmation is ultimately by reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) of infected secretions or CT imaging.
targetString: Ubwandu bwa virusi bushobora gupimwa by’agateganyo hagendewe ku bimenyetso, mugihe hategerejwe kwemezwa burundu hakoreshejwe uburyo bwo muri raburatwari bwa rRT-PCR bw’amatembabuzi yanduye cyangwa uburyo bwa CT.

sourceString: A study comparing PCR to CT in Wuhan has suggested that CT is significantly more sensitive than PCR, though less specific, with many of its imaging features overlapping with other pneumonias and disease processes.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi bugereranya PCR na CT bwakorewe muri Wuhan bwagaragaje ko CT igaragaza neza imiterere ya virusi kurusha PCR, nubwo bitasobanuwe neza, bimwe mu biranga ubu buryo bwo muri raburatwari bufite aho buhuriye n’ibindi bikorwa byo gupima umusonga n’izindi ndwara.

sourceString: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT should not be used to screen for or as a first-line test to diagnose COVID-19".
targetString: Kugeza muri Werurwe 2020, Koleje yo muri Amerika yigisha ibyo gusuzuma indwara hakoreshejwe kunyura mu cyuma ivuga ko: “uburyo bwa CT butagomba gukoreshwa mu gusuzuma cyangwa ngo bukoreshwe nk’uburyo bw’ibanze bwo gusuzuma COVID-19”.

sourceString: The WHO has published several RNA testing protocols for SARS-CoV-2, with the first issued on 17 January.
targetString: OMS yatangaje porotokore nyinshi zo gusuzuma RNA za SARS-CoV-2, aho iya mbere yasohotse ku ya 17 Mutarama.

sourceString: The test uses real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).
targetString: Isuzuma rikoresha uburyo bwo muri raburatwari bwa rRT-PCR bukoreshwa mu gihe nyacyo.

sourceString: The test can be done on respiratory or blood samples.
targetString: Isuzuma rishobora gukorerwa ku bipimo byakuwe mu nzira y’ubuhumekero cyangwa amaraso.

sourceString: Results are generally available within a few hours to days.
targetString: Muri rusange, ibisubizo biboneka mu masaha cyangwa iminsi mike.

sourceString: Generally this test is carried out on a nasopharyngeal swab though a throat swab may also be used.A number of laboratories and companies are developing serological tests, which detect antibodies.
targetString: Ubusanzwe iri suzuma rikorwa hifashishijwe agakoresho gafata ibipimo byo mu mazuru nubwo ibyo mu muhogo na byo byakoreshwa. Raboratwari nyinshi n’amasosiyete menshi biri gukora uko hafatwa ibipimo by’amaraso binagaragaza abasirikare b’umubiri.

sourceString: As of 6 April 2020, none of these has been proved sufficiently accurate to be approved for widespread use.
targetString: Kugeza tariki ya 6 Mata 2020, nta na bumwe muri ubwo buryo bwaragaje ko butanga ibipimo by’ukuri ku buryo bwakoreshwa ahantu henshi.

sourceString: In the US a serological test developed by Cellex has been approved for emergency use by certified laboratories only.
targetString: Muri Amerika, uburyo bwo gupima amaraso bwakozwe na Cellex bwemejwe nk’uburyo bwo kwitabaza ariko bugakoreshwa na raboratwari zibyemerewe gusa.

sourceString: Characteristic imaging features on radiographs and computed tomography (CT) of people who are symptomatic include asymmetric peripheral ground glass opacities and absent pleural effusions.
targetString: Gusuzuma imiterere hakoreshejwe icyuma n’uburyo bwa CT bukoreshwa mu gupima abantu bagaragaza ibimenyetso harimo kureba niba batarwaye indwara ya GGO cyangwa bafite amazi mu bihaha.

sourceString: The Italian Radiological Society is compiling an international online database of imaging findings for confirmed cases.
targetString: Ishyirahamwe ry’ubuvuzi bukoresha kunyura mu cyuma ryo mu Butaliyani riri gukora ububiko bw’amakuru bwo ku rwego mpuzamahanga rw’ibisubizo by’ibizamini byo mu cyuma byakorewe ku bemejwe ko barwaye.

sourceString: Due to overlap with other infections such as adenovirus, imaging without confirmation by PCR is of limited specificity in identifying COVID-19.
targetString: Bitewe no kugira aho bihuriye n’izindi ndwara nka adenovirusi, ibipimo byo mu cyuma bitemejwe hifashishijwe PCR ntibishobora kugaragaza by’umwihariko ubwandu bwa COVID-19.

sourceString: A large study in China compared chest CT results to PCR and demonstrated that though imaging is less specific for the infection, it is faster and more sensitive, suggesting its consideration as a screening tool in epidemic areas.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi bwagutse bwakorewe mu Bushinwa bwagereranyije ibisubizo by’ibizamini byo mu gatuza hakoreshejwe uburyo bwa CT n’ubwa PCR maze hagaragazwa ko nubwo ibyo bizamini byo mu cyuma bitagaragaza neza indwara, birihuta kandi bigaragaza neza imiterere ya virusi, bukaba bwatekerezwaho nk’uburyo bwo gupima mu rwego rw’ibyorezo.

sourceString: Artificial intelligence-based convolutional neural networks have been developed to detect imaging features of the virus with both radiographs and CT.
targetString: Uburyo bwa CNN bushingiye ku bwenge bw’ubukorano bwarakozwe mu gutahura imiterere y’ishusho ya virusi hakoreshejwe icyuma n’uburyo bwa CT.

sourceString: Strategies for preventing transmission of the disease include maintaining overall good personal hygiene, washing hands, avoiding touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands, and coughing or sneezing into a tissue and putting the tissue directly into a waste container.
targetString: Ingamba zo kurwanya ikwirakwira ry’indwara muri rusange zigizwe no kugira isuku ikwiye yo ku mubiri, gukaraba intoki, kwirinda kwikora mu maso, amazuru cyangwa ku munwa utakarabye intoki, no gukorora cyangwa kwitsamura ukoresheje agatambaro no guhita ujugunya ako gatambaro ahashyirwa imyanda.

sourceString: Those who may already have the infection have been advised to wear a surgical mask in public.
targetString: Abamaze kwandura bagirwa inama yo kwambara agapfukamunwa igihe bari ahahurira abantu benshi.

sourceString: Physical distancing measures are also recommended to prevent transmission.Many governments have restricted or advised against all non-essential travel to and from countries and areas affected by the outbreak.
targetString: Ingamba zo kwirinda kwegerana ni ingenzi mu kwirinda ikwirakwira. Leta nyinshi zabujije cyangwa zasabye abantu kudakora ingendo zitari ngombwa bajya cyangwa bava mu bihugu n’ahantu hari icyorezo.

sourceString: However, the virus has reached the stage of community spread in large parts of the world.
targetString: Ariko, mu bice byinshi byo ku isi virusi yageze aho umuturage ayanduza mugenzi we.

sourceString: This means that the virus is spreading within communities, and some community members don't know where or how they were infected.Health care providers taking care of someone who may be infected are recommended to use standard precautions, contact precautions, and eye protection.Contact tracing is an important method for health authorities to determine the source of an infection and to prevent further transmission.
targetString: Bivuze ko virusi ikwirakwira mu baturage, kandi bamwe mu baturage ntibazi aho banduriye n’uburyo banduyemo. Abatanga serivisi z’ubuvuzi bari kuvura umuntu ushobora kuba yaranduye bagirwa inama yo kubahiriza amabwiriza yo kwirinda asanzwe, amabwiriza yo kwirinda kwegerana, kwikingira mu maso. Gukurikirana abo uwanduye yahuye na bo ni uburyo bw’ingenzi ku nzego z’ubuzima mu kumenya aho ubwandu buturuka no kwirinda ko habaho irindi kwirakwira.

sourceString: The use of location data from mobile phones by governments for this purpose has prompted privacy concerns, with Amnesty International and over 100 other organizations issuing a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.
targetString: Kuba leta ikoresha amakuru y’ahantu yo muri telefone zigendanwa byateye impungenge z’ubuzima bwite aho Umuryango mpuzamahanga uharanira uburenganzira bwa muntu (Amnesty International) n’indi miryango irenga 100 yasohoye amatangazo isaba ko hahagarikwa ubu buryo bwo kugenzura abantu.

sourceString: Various mobile apps have been implemented or proposed for voluntary use, and as of April 7, 2020, over a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
targetString: Hashyizweho porogaramu zitandukanye cyangwa zasabwe gukoreshwa ku bushake, noneho ku itariki ya 7 Mata 2020, amatsinda y’inzobere arenga cumi n’abiri yashakaga igisubizo kitabangamiye ubuzima bwite nko gukoresha ikoranabuhanga rya Bluetooth habikwa amakuru ya telefone zigendanwa zagiye zegerana.

sourceString: Users then receive a message if they've been in close contact with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19.Misconceptions are circulating about how to prevent infection; for example, rinsing the nose and gargling with mouthwash are not effective.
targetString: Abakoresha izo telefone bakira ubutumwa niba bigeze kwegera umuntu wapimwe bakamusangamo COVID-19. Hari amakuru atari yo ari gukwirakwizwa ku buryo bwo kwirinda kwandura; urugero, kunyuguza mu mazuru no kujundika imiti yoza mu kanwa ntibyica virusi.

sourceString: There is no COVID-19 vaccine, though many organizations are working to develop one.
targetString: Nta rukingo rwa COVID-19, ariko hari ibigo byinshi biri kurukora.

sourceString: Hand washing is recommended to prevent the spread of the disease.
targetString: Gukaraba intoki ni ngombwa mu kwirinda ikwirakwira ry’indwara.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that people wash hands often with soap and water for at least twenty seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty; before eating; and after blowing one's nose, coughing, or sneezing.
targetString: CDC isaba ko abantu bakaraba intoki kenshi bakoresheje isabune n’amazi byibuze amasegonda makumyabiri; by’umwihariko, bavuye mu bwiherero cyangwa bigaragara ko intoki zabo zanduye, mbere yo gufata amafunguro, umuntu amaze kwipfuna, gukorora cyangwa kwitsamura.

sourceString: This is because outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.
targetString: Ibi bikorwa ku mpamvu y’uko igihe virusi itari mu mubiri w’umuntu yicwa n’isabune ikoreshwa mu rugo, ifite ububasha bwo gusenya utwugara dutwikiriye virusi.

sourceString: CDC further recommended using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol by volume when soap and water are not readily available.
targetString: CDC inasaba ko hakoreshwa umuti wagenewe gusukura intoki urimo arukoro byibuze ku kigero cya 60% igihe isabune n’amazi bidahari.

sourceString: The WHO advises people to avoid touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.
targetString: OMS igira abantu inama yo kwirinda kwikora mu maso, mu mazuru cyangwa ku munwa bakoresheje intoki zisa nabi.

sourceString: Surfaces may be decontaminated with a number of solutions (within one minute of exposure to the disinfectant for a stainless steel surface), including 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2–7.5% povidone-iodine.
targetString: Udukoko dutera virusi turi ahantu hatandukanye dushobora kwicwa hakoreshejwe imiti yabugenewe (mu munota umwe tumaze guhura n’umuti wica udukuko uri ku cyuma kitagwa ingese), harimo 62–71% bya etanoro, 50–100% bya isoporopanoro, 0,1% bya sodiyumu hipokororite, 0,5% bya hidorogene perogiside na 0,2–7,5% bya povidone iyodine.

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chrohexidine gluconate, are less effective.
targetString: Indi miti nka benzarikoniyumu kororide na korohexigisidine gurukonate, ntabwo yica udukuko neza.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that if a COVID case is suspected or confirmed at a facility such as an office or day care, all areas such as offices, bathrooms, common areas, shared electronic equipment like tablets, touch screens, keyboards, remote controls, and ATM machines used by the ill persons, should be disinfected.
targetString: CDC isaba ko niba hari ukekwa cyangwa byemejwe ko yanduye COVID ahantu nko mu biro cyangwa irerero, ahantu hose nko mu biro, ubwogero, ahahurira abantu benshi, ibikoresho by’ikoranabuhanga bisangirwa nka taburete, ekara zikorwamo, igice cya mudasobwa bandikisha, terekomande n’icyuma cya ATM zakoreshejwe n’abarwaye, bigomba guterwa umuti wica udukoko.

sourceString: Health organizations recommended that people cover their mouth and nose with a bent elbow or a tissue when coughing or sneezing, and disposing of any tissue immediately.
targetString: Ibigo by’ubuzima bisaba ko abantu bapfuka umunwa n’amazuru bakoresheje imfuruka y’inkokora yabo cyangwa agatambaro igihe bakoroye cyangwa bitsamuye no guhita bata ako gatambaro ahabugenewe.

sourceString: Surgical masks are recommended for those who may be infected, as wearing a mask can limit the volume and travel distance of expiratory droplets dispersed when talking, sneezing, and coughing.
targetString: Udupfukamunwa dukoreshwa kwa muganga ni two twiza ku bashobora kuba baranduye, kuko kwambara agapfukamunwa bikumira ingano n’intera by’amatembabuzi arekurwa igihe uvuze, witsamuye unakoroye.

sourceString: The WHO has issued instructions on when and how to use masks.
targetString: OMS yatangaje amabwiriza yerekeye igihe n’uburyo bwo kwambara udupfukamunwa.

sourceString: According to Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, "Wearing a mask can reduce the propensity [of] people to touch their faces, which is a major source of infection without proper hand hygiene."Masks have also been recommended for use by those taking care of someone who may have the disease.
targetString: Nk’uko Stephen Griffin, impuguke mu bumenyi bwa virusi wo muri Kaminuza ya Leeds, abivuga, “Kwambara agapfukamunwa bigabanya uko abantu bakunda kwikora mu maso, ari ho indwara ikunda kwinjirira igihe intoki zidasukuye mu buryo bukwiye”. Udupfukamunwa tunakoreshwa n’abita ku muntu ushobora kuba urwaye.

sourceString: The WHO has recommended the wearing of masks by healthy people only if they are at high risk, such as those who are caring for a person with COVID-19, although they also acknowledge that wearing masks may help people avoid touching their face.
targetString: OMS isaba abantu batarwaye kwambara udupfukamunwa gusa iyo bafite ibyago byinshi byo kwandura, nk’abita ku muntu ufite COVID-19, kandi inemera ko kwambara udupfukamunwa birinda abantu kwikora mu maso.

sourceString: Several countries have started to encourage the use of face masks by members of the public.
targetString: Ibihugu byinshi byatangiye gushishikariza abaturage babyo gukoresha udupfukamunwa.

sourceString: In the U.S., the CDC recommends wearing non-medical face mask made out of cloth.China has specifically recommended the use of disposable medical masks by healthy members of the public, particularly when coming into close contact (1 metre (3 ft) or less) with other people.
targetString: Muri Amerika, CDC isaba abantu kwambara udupfukamunwa dukoze mu myenda tutari utwo kwa muganga. By’umwihariko, Ubushinwa busaba abaturage batarwaye gukoresha udupfukamunwa two kwa muganga tujugunywa tumaze gukoreshwa cyane cyane iyo begereye abandi mu ntera itageze muri metero 1.

sourceString: Hong Kong recommends wearing a surgical mask when taking public transport or staying in crowded places.
targetString: Hongukongo isaba abantu kwambara udupfukamunwa two ka muganga igihe bari gukora ingendo cyangwa bari ahahurira abantu benshi.

sourceString: Thailand's health officials are encouraging people to make cloth facemasks at home and wash them daily.
targetString: Abayobozi b’inzego z’ubuzima muri Tayilandi bari gushishikariza abantu gukorera mu rugo udupfukamunwa dukoze mu myenda no kutumesa buri munsi.

sourceString: The Czech Republic and Slovakia banned going out in public without wearing a mask or covering one's nose and mouth.
targetString: Muri Repubulika ya Ceke na Silovakiya babujije abantu kujya hanze batambaye agapfukamunwa cyangwa batipfutse amazuru n’umunwa.

sourceString: On 16 March, Vietnam requested everyone to wear a face mask when going to public areas in order to protect themselves and others.
targetString: Ku ya 16 Werurwe, Viyetinamu yasabye buri wese kwambara agapfukamunwa agiye ahahurira abantu benshi mu kwirinda no kurinda abandi.

sourceString: The Austrian government mandated that everyone entering a grocery store must wear a face mask.
targetString: Leta ya Ositaraliya yategetse ko buri wese winjiye mu iduka ry’ibiribwa agomba kwambara agapfukamunwa.

sourceString: Israel has asked all residents to wear face masks when in public.
targetString: Isiraheli yasabye abaturage bose kwambara agapfukamunwa igihe bari ahahurira abantu benshi.

sourceString: Taiwan, which has been producing ten million masks per day since mid-March, required passengers on trains and intercity buses to wear face masks on 1 April.
targetString: Tariki ya 1 Mata; Tayiwani, ikora udupfukamunwa turenga miriyoni icumi ku munsi, yasabye abagenda muri gari ya moshi na bisi zihuza imijyi kwambara agapfukamunwa.

sourceString: Panama has made it obligatory to wear a face mask whenever going outside, while also recommending the manufacture of a homemade face mask for those who cannot purchase face masks.
targetString: Panama yashyizeho itegeko ryo kwambara agapfukamunwa igihe cyose ugiye hanze, inasaba ko hakorwa udupfukamunwa dukorewe mu rugo ku badafite ubushobozi bwo kugura utwakorewe mu nganda.

sourceString: Face masks have also been widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, and Singapore.
targetString: Udupfukamunwa tunakoreshwa henshi mu Buyapani, Koreya y’Epfo, Maleziya na Singapuru.

sourceString: Social distancing (also known as physical distancing) includes infection control actions intended to slow the spread of disease by minimizing close contact between individuals.
targetString: Kwirinda kwegerana (binazwi nko gusiga intera hagati yawe n’undi) hakubiyemo ibikorwa bigamije kwirinda kwandura mu rwego rwo kugabanya ikwirakwira rya virusi hongerwa intera hagati y’abantu.

sourceString: Methods include quarantines; travel restrictions; and the closing of schools, workplaces, stadiums, theatres, or shopping centres.
targetString: Uburyo burimo akato, guhagarika ingendo no gufunga amashuri, ahakorerwa akazi, amasitade, aho bakinira ikinamico cyangwa amaduka.

sourceString: Individuals may apply social distancing methods by staying at home, limiting travel, avoiding crowded areas, using no-contact greetings, and physically distancing themselves from others.
targetString: Abantu ku giti cyabo bashobora gukoresha uburyo bwo kwirinda kwegerana baguma mu rugo, bagabanya ingendo, birinda kujya ahahurira abantu benshi, bakoresha uburyo bwo gusuhuzanya badakoranyeho no gusiga intera hagati yabo n’abandi.

sourceString: Many governments are now mandating or recommending social distancing in regions affected by the outbreak.
targetString: Kuri ubu, ibihugu byinshi biri gutegeka cyangwa gusaba abantu bari mu turerere twiganjemo icyorezo kwirinda kwegerana.

sourceString: The maximum gathering size recommended by US government bodies and health organizations was swiftly reduced from 250 people (if there was no known COVID-19 spread in a region) to 50 people, and later to 10 people.
targetString: Umubare ntarengwa w’abantu bateraniye hamwe usabwa n’inzego za leta muri Amerika n’ibigo by’ubuzima wagabanyijwe byihuse uva ku bantu 250 (igihe bizwi ko nta bwandu bwa COVID-19 buri muri ako gace) baba 50, nyuma baragabanywa baba abantu 10.

sourceString: On 22 March 2020, Germany banned public gatherings of more than two people.Older adults and those with underlying medical conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, hypertension, and compromised immune systems face increased risk of serious illness and complications and have been advised by the CDC to stay home as much as possible in areas of community outbreak.In late March 2020, the WHO and other health bodies began to replace the use of the term "social distancing" with "physical distancing", to clarify that the aim is to reduce physical contact while maintaining social connections, either virtually or at a distance.
targetString: Tariki ya 22 Werurwe 2020, Ubudage bwabujije abantu guterana barenze babiri. Abageze mu zabukuru n’abafite izindi ndwara nka diyabete, indwara y’umutima, indwara y’ubuhumekero, umuvuduko w’amaraso ukabije, n’abasirikare b’umubiri badakora neza bafite ibyago byo kuzahazwa n’indwara n’ingorane z’ubuzima bagiriwe inama n’Ikigo cya CDC yo kuguma mu rugo bishoboka mu gihe bashobora kwanduzwa na bagenzi babo. Mu mpera za Werurwe 2020, OMS n’indi miryango y’ubuzima yatangiye gusimbuza ikoreshwa ry’ijambo "kwirinda kwegerana" riba "gusiga intera hagati yawe na mugenzi wawe", mu gusobanura neza ko ikigamijwe ari kwirinda gukoranaho mu gihe muri gusabana hasigwa intera igaragara hagati y’abantu.

sourceString: The use of the term "social distancing" had led to implications that people should engage in complete social isolation, rather than encouraging them to stay in contact with others through alternative means.Some authorities have issued sexual health guidelines for use during the pandemic.
targetString: Ikoreshwa ry’ijambo "kwirinda kwegerana" ryatumye abantu batekereza ko bagomba kwigunga, aho kubashishikariza gukomeza gusabana n’abandi hakoreshejwe ubundi buryo. Zimwe mu nzego zatangaje amabwiriza agenga ibikorwa mpuzabitsina mu buryo bwiza muri iki gihe cy’icyorezo.

sourceString: These include recommendations to only have sex with someone you live with, who does not have the virus or symptoms of the virus.
targetString: Ayo mabwiriza arimo ko ugomba gukorana imibonano mpuzabitsina n’uwo mubana gusa, udafite virusi cyangwa ibimenyetso bya virusi.

sourceString: Self-isolation at home has been recommended for those diagnosed with COVID-19 and those who suspect they have been infected.
targetString: Kwishyira mu kato mu rugo ni ngombwa ku bantu bapimwe bagasanga bafite COVID-19 n’abekwa kuba baranduye.

sourceString: Health agencies have issued detailed instructions for proper self-isolation.Many governments have mandated or recommended self-quarantine for entire populations living in affected areas.
targetString: Ibigo by’ubuzima byatanze amabwiriza asobanuye neza ku buryo bwiza bwo kwishyira mu kato. Ibihugu byinshi byategetse cyangwa byasabye ko abantu bose baba mu duce turimo ubwandu bishyira mu kato.

sourceString: The strongest self-quarantine instructions have been issued to those in high risk groups.
targetString: Amabwiriza yo kwishyira mu kato akomeye yahawe abari mu matsinda afite ibyago byinshi byo kwandura.

sourceString: Those who may have been exposed to someone with COVID-19 and those who have recently travelled to a country or region with widespread transmission have been advised to self-quarantine for 14 days from the time of last possible exposure.
targetString: Abashobora kuba barahuye n’umuntu ufite COVID-19 n’abaherutse kugirira ingendo mu bihugu cyangwa uturere turangwamo ubwandu bagiriwe inama yo kwishyira mu kato iminsi 14 bahereye ku munsi wa nyuma bashobora kuba barahuye n’ubwandu.

sourceString: Strategies in the control of an outbreak are containment or suppression, and mitigation.
targetString: Ingamba zo kurwanya icyorezo ni ukugikumira cyangwa guhagarika no kugabanya ikwirakwira ryacyo.

sourceString: Containment is undertaken in the early stages of the outbreak and aims to trace and isolate those infected as well as introduce other measures of infection control and vaccinations to stop the disease from spreading to the rest of the population.
targetString: Gukumira bikorwa icyorezo kigitangira kandi bigamije gukurikirana no gushyira abanduye mu kato ndetse no kuzana izindi ngamba zo kurwanya ubwandu no gushaka inkingo mu guhagarika indwara ntikomeze gukwirakwira mu bandi baturage.

sourceString: When it is no longer possible to contain the spread of the disease, efforts then move to the mitigation stage: measures are taken to slow the spread and mitigate its effects on the healthcare system and society.
targetString: Iyo bitagishoboka gukumira ikwirakwira ry’icyorezo, noneho imbaraga zishyirwa mu kugabanya ikwirakwira: ingamba zifatwa mu kugabanya ikwirakwira no kugabanya ingaruka z’icyorezo ku nzego z’ubuvuzi na sosiyete.

sourceString: A combination of both containment and mitigation measures may be undertaken at the same time.
targetString: Ingamba zo gukumira no kugabanya ikwirakwira bishobora gufatirwa icyarimwe.

sourceString: Suppression requires more extreme measures so as to reverse the pandemic by reducing the basic reproduction number to less than 1.Part of managing an infectious disease outbreak is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as flattening the epidemic curve.
targetString: Guhagarika icyorezo byo bisaba ingamba zikomeye zo guhagarika icyorezo hagabanywa umubare w’abandura bashya ukaba munsi ya 1. Kimwe mu bigize ibikorwa byo guhangana n’icyorezo cy’indwara yandura ni ukugerageza kugabanya ubwiyongere bukabije bw’abandura bizwi nko kugabanya imibare mishya y’ubwandu.

sourceString: This decreases the risk of health services being overwhelmed and provides more time for vaccines and treatments to be developed.
targetString: Bigabanya ibibazo bya serivisi z’ubuzima byo kurengerwa n’umubare w’abarwayi no kubona igihe gihagije cyo gushaka urukingo n’umuti.

sourceString: Non-pharmaceutical interventions that may manage the outbreak include personal preventive measures, such as hand hygiene, wearing face-masks, and self-quarantine; community measures aimed at physical distancing such as closing schools and cancelling mass gathering events; community engagement to encourage acceptance and participation in such interventions; as well as environmental measures such surface cleaning.More drastic actions aimed at containing the outbreak were taken in China once the severity of the outbreak became apparent, such as quarantining entire cities and imposing strict travel bans.
targetString: Uburyo bwo kurwanya ubwandu hadakoreshejwe imiti harimo guhangana n’icyorezo hakoreshejwe ingamba bwite zo kwirinda nko kugira isuku y’inkoti, kwambara udupfukamunwa no kwishyira mu kato; ingamba mu baturage zo kutegerena nko gufunga amashuri no guhagarika ibikorwa rusange; bisaba kubikangurira abaturage bakabyumva bakanabyitabira; n’ingamba zijyanye n’ibidukikije nko guhanagura ahakorwa cyane. Hari izindi ngamba zikomeye zafashwe mu rwego rwo gukurwanya icyerozo mu Bushinwa ubwo ubukana bw’icyorezo bwari butangiye kugaragara nko gushyira mu kato imijyi yose no gushyiraho amabwiriza akaze yo guhagarika ingendo.

sourceString: Other countries also adopted a variety of measures aimed at limiting the spread of the virus.
targetString: Ibindi bihugu na byo byagiye bikoresha ingamba zitandukanye zigamije guhagarika ikwirakwira rya virusi.

sourceString: South Korea introduced mass screening and localized quarantines, and issued alerts on the movements of infected individuals.
targetString: Koreya y’Epfo yatangiye gupima abantu benshi no gushyira mu kato ibice bimwe na bimwe no gutangaza ingendo z’abanduye.

sourceString: Singapore provided financial support for those infected who quarantined themselves and imposed large fines for those who failed to do so.
targetString: Singapuru yahaye inkunga y’amafaranga abanduye bishyize mu kato inashyiraho amande menshi ku batabikoze.

sourceString: Taiwan increased face mask production and penalized hoarding of medical supplies.Simulations for Great Britain and the United States show that mitigation (slowing but not stopping epidemic spread) and suppression (reversing epidemic growth) have major challenges.
targetString: Tayiwani yongereye ikorwa ry’udupfukamunwa no guhana abikubira ibikoresho by’ubuvuzi. Ni na ko Ubwongereza n’Amerika byagaragaje ko kugabanya ubwandu (kugabanya umubare w’abandura bitari guhagarika ikwirakwira ry’icyorezo) no kubuuhagarika (kugabanya umubare mushya w’abandura) byagiye bigira imbogamizi zikomeye.

sourceString: Optimal mitigation policies might reduce peak healthcare demand by 2/3 and deaths by half, but still result in hundreds of thousands of deaths and health systems being overwhelmed.
targetString: Ingamba zo kugabanya umubare w’abandura zishobora kugabanya ubwiyongereye bukabije bw’abakenera serivisi z’ubuvuzi ho 2/3 n’umubare w’abapfa ukagabanukaho icya kabiri, ariko ntibibuza ibihumbi n’ibihumbi by’abantu gupfa na serivisi z’ubuvuzi zikomeza kwakira umubare mwinshi w’abarwayi.

sourceString: Suppression can be preferred but needs to be maintained for as long as the virus is circulating in the human population (or until a vaccine becomes available, if that comes first), as transmission otherwise quickly rebounds when measures are relaxed.
targetString: Guhagarika icyorezo ni byo byaba byiza ariko bigomba gukomeza gukorwa igihe cyose visuri igitembera mu bantu (cyangwa kugeza igihe habonekeye urukingo, bitewe n’icyabaye mbere), ibanduza naho ubundi virusi ihita igaruka iyo izo ngamba zorohejwe.

sourceString: Long-term intervention to suppress the pandemic causes social and economic costs.
targetString: Ibikorwa by’igihe kirekire mu guhagarika icyorezo bibangamira imibereho n’ubukungu.

sourceString: There are no specific antiviral medications approved for COVID-19, but development efforts are underway, including testing of existing medications.
targetString: Nta miti yihariye yemejwe ko igabanya ubukana bwa COVID-19, ariko ibikorwa byo kuyikora birakomeje, harimo gusuzuma imiti isanzwe igabanya ubukana bwa virusi.

sourceString: Taking over-the-counter cold medications, drinking fluids, and resting may help alleviate symptoms.
targetString: Gufata imiti y’ibicurane utandikiwe na muganga, kunywa amazi menshi no kuruhuka bishobora kugufasha kugabanya ibimenyetso.

sourceString: Depending on the severity, oxygen therapy, intravenous fluids, and breathing support may be required.
targetString: Bitewe n’ubukana, kuvurwa hifashishijwe ogisijeni, guterwa imiti y’amazi no gufashwa mu guhumeka biba ari ngombwa.

sourceString: The use of steroids may worsen outcomes.
targetString: Gukoresha imiti ya siteroyide bishobora gutuma uremba.

sourceString: Several compounds that were previously approved for treatment of other viral diseases are being investigated for use in treating COVID-19.
targetString: Imiti myinshi yari yaremejwe ko ivura izindi ndwara ziterwa na virusi iri gukorwaho ubushakashatsi harebwa niba yakoreshwa mu kuvura COVID-19.

sourceString: The WHO also stated that some "traditional and home remedies" can provide relief of the symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.
targetString: OMS yatangaje ko: “imiti ya gakondo n’ikorerwa mu rugo” ishobora kugabanya ubukana bw’ibimenyetso biterwa na SARS-CoV-19.

sourceString: Increasing capacity and adapting healthcare for the needs of COVID-19 patients is described by the WHO as a fundamental outbreak response measure.
targetString: Kongera ubushobozi no guhindura imikorere harebwa ibyo inzego z’ubuvuzi zikeneye mu kuvura abarwayi ba COVID-19 bisobanurwa na OMS nk’ingamba z’ibanze mu kurwanya icyorezo.

sourceString: The ECDC and the European regional office of the WHO have issued guidelines for hospitals and primary healthcare services for shifting of resources at multiple levels, including focusing laboratory services towards COVID-19 testing, cancelling elective procedures whenever possible, separating and isolating COVID-19 positive patients, and increasing intensive care capabilities by training personnel and increasing the number of available ventilators and beds.
targetString: ECDC n’Ibiro by’akarere k’Uburayi bya OMS byatangaje amabwiriza agenewe ibitaro n’abatanga serivisi z’ubuvuzi b’ibanze mu guhindura ibyakoreshwaga mu bikorwa by’izindi nzego, nko gutuma serivisi za raboratwari zibanda ku gupima COVID-19, guhagarika ibikorwa by’ubuvuzi bitari ngombwa, gutandukanya no gushyira mu kato abagaragaweho COVID-19, no kongerera ubushobozi serivisi zita ku ndembe hahugurwa abaganga no kongera umubare w’ibyuma byongerera umwuka abarwayi n’ibitanda.

sourceString: There are various theories about where the very first case (the so-called patient zero) may have originated.
targetString: Hari amakuru atandukanye avuga aho ubwandu bwa mbere (uwagaragaweho bwa mbere virusi) bwakomotse.

sourceString: The first known case of the novel coronavirus may trace back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei, China.
targetString: Ubwandu bwa mbere buzwi bwa koronavirusi nshya ni ubwo ku ya 1 Ukuboza 2019 muri Wuhan, Hubei, mu Bushinwa.

sourceString: Within a month, the number of coronavirus cases in Hubei gradually increased.
targetString: Mu kwezi kumwe, umubare w’abanduye koronavirusi muri Hubei wagiye wiyongera.

sourceString: These were mostly linked to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, which also sold live animals, and one theory is that the virus came from one of these kinds of animals; or, in other words, has a zoonotic origin.A pneumonia cluster of unknown cause was observed on 26 December and treated by the doctor Zhang Jixian in Hubei Provincial Hospital, who informed the Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: Ahanini, abo banduye bari bafite aho bahuriye n’isoko rya Huanan Seafood Wholesale rinagurisha inyamaswa nzima, naho andi makuru avuga ko virusi yavuye kuri zimwe muri izo nyamaswa; mu yandi magambo, yakomotse ku nyamaswa. Abarwaye umusonga watewe n’ikintu kitazwi bikaba byarasuzumwe ku ya 26 Ukuboza maze bavurwa na muganga Zhang Jixian ukorera mu bitaro by’intara ya Hubei, abitangariza Ikigo cya Wuhan Jianghan CDC tariki ya 27 Ukuboza.

sourceString: On 30 December, a group of doctors at Wuhan Central Hospital alerted their colleagues of a "SARS-like coronavirus".
targetString: Ku ya 30 Ukuboza, itsinda ry’abaganga b’ibitaro bya Wuhan Central Hospital bamenyesheje bagenzi babo ko hari indwara ya "SARS imeze nka koronavirusi".

sourceString: Eight of these doctors, including Li Wenliang, were admonished by the police for spreading false rumours, and another, Ai Fen, was reprimanded by her superiors for raising the alarm.
targetString: Umunani muri abo baganga, harimo Li Wenliang, baganirijwe na Polisi ku bwo gukwiza ibihuha, naho undi witwa Ai Fen, yihanangirijwe n’abayobozi be ku bwo kugaragaza icyo kibazo.

sourceString: The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission later released a public notice on 31 December and informed the WHO.
targetString: Komisiyo ishinzwe ubuzima mu mujyi wa Wuhan yaje gusohora itangazo rusange tariki ya 31 Ukuboza inaha amakuru OMS.

sourceString: Enough cases of unknown pneumonia had been reported to health authorities in Wuhan to trigger an investigation in early January.During the early stages of the outbreak, the number of cases doubled approximately every seven and a half days.
targetString: Inzego z’ubuzima zamenyeshejwe ko hari abantu benshi barwaye umusonga hatazwi ikiwutera muri Wuhan, bituma hatangizwa isuzuma mu ntangiriro za Mutarama. Icyorezo kigitangira, abacyanduye bagiye bikuba kabiri hafi buri minsi irindwi n’igice.

sourceString: In early and mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other Chinese provinces, helped by the Chinese New Year migration and Wuhan being a transport hub and major rail interchange.
targetString: Mu ntangiriro no hagati muri Mutarama 2020, virusi yakwiriye mu zindi ntara z’Ubushinwa, ibifashijwemo n’ingendo z’ubunani mu Bushinwa no kuba Wuhan ari yo ihuriramo kandi ari yo ikomeye mu ngendo za gari ya moshi zijya mu ntara zitandukanye.

sourceString: On 20 January, China reported nearly 140 new cases in one day, including two people in Beijing and one in Shenzhen.
targetString: Ku ya 20 Mutarama, Ubushinwa bwatangaje ko hafi abantu bashya 140 banduye mu munsi umwe, harimo babiri bo muri Beijing n’umwe wo muri Shenzhen.

sourceString: Later official data shows that 6,174 people had already developed symptoms by 20 January 2020.As of 26 March, the United States has overtaken China and Italy with the highest number of confirmed cases in the world.As of 9 April 2020, more than 1.61 million cases have been reported worldwide; more than 97,000 people have died and more than 364,000 have recovered.
targetString: Nyuma amakuru yatangajwe na leta yagaragaje ko abantu 6 174 bagaragaje ibimenyetso tariki ya 20 Mutarama 2020. Kugeza tariki ya 26 Werurwe, Amerika yari imaze kurenga ku Bushinwa n’Ubutaliyani mu kugira umubare munini w’abemejwe ko banduye ku isi. Kugeza tariki ya 9 Mata 2020, hatangajwe ko abantu barenga miriyoni 1,61 banduye ku isi; aho abarenga 97 000 bapfuye abandi barenga 364 000 barakira.

sourceString: Around 200 countries and territories have had at least one case.
targetString: Hafi ibihugu n’intara 200 byari birimo byibuze umuntu umwe wanduye.

sourceString: Due to the pandemic in Europe, many countries in the Schengen Area have restricted free movement and set up border controls.
targetString: Kubera icyorezo cyageze mu Burayi, ibihugu biri mu karere ka Schengen byagabanyije ingendo binashyiraho uburyo bwo gukumira indwara ku mipaka.

sourceString: National reactions have included containment measures such as quarantines (known as stay-at-home orders, shelter-in-place orders, or lockdown) and curfews.As of 2 April, nearly 300 million people, or about 90% of the population, are under some form of lockdown in the United States, more than 50 million people are in lockdown in the Philippines, about 59 million people are in lockdown in South Africa, and 1.3 billion people are in lockdown in India.
targetString: Ibihugu byashyizeho ingamba zo kurwanya icyorezo nk’akato (binazwi nka gahunda ya guma mu rugo) n’imikwabo. Kugeza tariki ya 2 Mata, hafi miriyoni 300 z’abantu cyangwa hafi 90% by’abaturage bari bari kubahiriza gahunda imeze nk’iya guma mu rugo muri Amerika, naho abarenga miriyoni 50 muri Filipine, hafi miriyoni 59 z’abantu muri Afurika y’Epfo n’abantu miriyari 1,3 mu Buhinde bari bari muri gahunda ya guma mu rugo.

sourceString: On 26 March, 1.7 billion people worldwide were under some form of lockdown, which increased to 2.6 billion people two days later—around a third of the world's population.
targetString: Ku wa 26 Werurwe, abantu miriyari 1,7 ku isi bari bari muri gahunda imeze nk’iya guma mu rugo, aho biyongeye bagera kuri miriyari 2,6 nyuma y’imitsi ibiri, hafi kimwe cya gatatu cy’abaturage b’isi yose.

sourceString: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 has been traced back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan; one unconfirmed report suggests the earliest case was on 17 November.
targetString: Uwa mbere byemejwe ko yanduye COVID-19 yagaragaye bwa mbere tariki ya 1 Ukuboza 2019 muri Wuhan; amakuru adafitiwe gihamya avuga ko uwa mbere yagaragaye tariki ya 17 Ugushyingo.

sourceString: Doctor Zhang Jixian observed a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 26 December, upon which her hospital informed Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: Muganga Zhang Jixian yakurikiranye abantu barwaye umusonga watewe n’ikintu kitazwi ku ya 26 Ukuboza, ibitaro akorera bibimenyesha ikigo cya Wuhan Jianghan CDC ku wa 27 Ukuboza.

sourceString: Initial genetic testing of patient samples on 27 December 2019 indicated the presence of a SARS-like coronavirus.
targetString: Isuzuma ry’ibanze rya jene ryakorewe abarwayi ku ya 27 Ukuboza 2019 rigaragaza ko harimo SARS imeze nka koronavirusi.

sourceString: A public notice was released by Wuhan Municipal Health Commission on 31 December.
targetString: Itangazo rusange ryasohowe na Komisiyo y’ubuzima y’umujyi wa Wuhan tariki ya 31 Ukuboza.

sourceString: The WHO was informed on the same day.
targetString: OMS na yo yahawe ayo makuru kuri uwo munsi.

sourceString: As these notifications occurred, doctors in Wuhan were warned by police for "spreading rumours" about the outbreak.
targetString: Muri uko gutangaza ibyabaye, abaganga bo muri Wuhan bihanangirijwe na Polisi kubera "gukwirakwiza ibihuha" byerekeye icyorezo.

sourceString: The Chinese National Health Commission initially claimed that there was no "clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.
targetString: Komisiyo y’igihugu y’ubuzima mu Bushinwa yabanje gutangaza ko nta "bimenyetso bifatika" by’uko umuntu ayanduza mugenzi we.

sourceString: In late January, the Chinese government launched a radical campaign later described by the Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping as a "people's war" to contain the spread of the virus.
targetString: Mu mpera za Mutarama, leta y’Ubushinwa yatangaje ko yatangiye ubukangurambaga bukomeye, bwaje gusobanurwa n’Umunyamabanga Mukuru w’Ishyaka rya gikomunisite ry’Ubushinwa, Xi Jinping, ko "abantu ari bo bagomba kurwana intambara" yo gukumira ikwirakwira rya virusi.
