sourceString: Deworming twice a year, supplemented with washing hands daily with soap, brushing teeth daily with fluoride, is at the core of this national program.
targetString: Gufata imiti y'inzoka zo mu nda inshuro ebyiri mu mwaka, bifatanyije no gukaraba intoki buri munsi ukoresheje isabune, koza amenyo buri munsi ukoresheje fuliwore, ni ryo shingiro ry'iyi gahunda y'igihugu.

sourceString: It has also been successfully implemented in Indonesia.
targetString: Yashyizwe mu bikorwa neza muri Indoneziya.

sourceString: Removal of microorganisms from skin is enhanced by the addition of soaps or detergents to water.
targetString: Kuvana mikorobe ku ruhu byongerwa imbaraga no kongera mu mazi amasabune cyangwa imiti y'isuku.

sourceString: The main action of soaps and detergents is to reduce barriers to solution, and increase solubility.
targetString: Akamaro gakomeye k'amasabune n'imiti y'isuku ni kugabanya ibibuza kuyonga no kongera ubushobozi bwo kuyonga.

sourceString: Water alone is an inefficient skin cleanser because fats and proteins, which are components of organic soil, are not readily dissolved in water.
targetString: Amazi yonyine ntasukura neza uruhu kubera amavuta n'ibinure, bisa n'ibigize ubutaka, bidapfa gushonga mu mazi.

sourceString: Cleansing is, however, aided by a reasonable flow of water..
targetString: Gukora isuku, bijyana no gukoresha amazi ahagije..

sourceString: Solid soap, because of its reusable nature, may hold bacteria acquired from previous uses.
targetString: Amasabune atari ay'amazi, bitewe n'uko ashobora kongera gukoreshwa, ashobora kugumana udukoko twanduza indwara yavuye ku bayakoresheje mbere.

sourceString: A small number of studies which have looked at the bacterial transfer from contaminated solid soap have concluded transfer is unlikely as the bacteria are rinsed off with the foam.
targetString: Umubare muto w'ubushakashatsi wasuzumye uburyo bwo kwanduza k'udukoko twanduza indwara zivuye mu isabune yanduye maze hanzurwa ko kwanduzwabidashoboka kuko utwo dukoko twanduza tuba twahanaguwe n'ifuro.

sourceString: The CDC still states "liquid soap with hands-free controls for dispensing is preferable".
targetString: Ikigo gishinzwe kugenzura indwara (CDC) kiracyavuga ko "isabune y'amazi hamwe n'aho kuyikoreshereza hadasaba ko ukoraho uyisohora ari bwo buryo bwiza".

sourceString: Antibacterial soaps have been heavily promoted to a health-conscious public.
targetString: Isabune yica udukoko twanduza indwara yashimiwe cyane abantu bashishikajwe no kwita ku buzima bwabo.

sourceString: To date, there is no evidence that using recommended antiseptics or disinfectants selects for antibiotic-resistant organisms in nature.
targetString: Kugeza ubu, nta kimenyetso cyerekana ko gukoresha imiti irinda ubwandu cyangwa imiti yica udukoko duhitamo imiti ihangana n'udukoko tuzwiho kwihanganira imiti yica bagiteri.

sourceString: However, antibacterial soaps contain common antibacterial agents such as triclosan, which has an extensive list of resistant strains of organisms.
targetString: Nyamara, amasabune yica udukoko twanduza arimo imiti yica udukoko nka triclosan, ifite urutonde runini rw'udukoko tudapfa guhangarwa.

sourceString: So, even if antibiotic resistant strains aren't selected for by antibacterial soaps, they might not be as effective as they are marketed to be.
targetString: Bityo rero, nubwo imiti irinda ubwandu bw'indwara itatoranyijwe mu miti y'isabune zica udukoko twanduza, ishobora kuba idakora neza cyane nk'uko yamamazwa.

sourceString: Besides the surfactant and skin-protecting agent, the sophisticated formulations may contain acids (acetic acid, ascorbic acid, lactic acid) as pH regulator, antimicrobially active benzoic acid and further skin conditioners (aloe vera, vitamins, menthol, plant extracts).A comprehensive analysis from the University of Oregon School of Public Health indicated that plain soaps are as effective as consumer-grade anti-bacterial soaps containing triclosan in preventing illness and removing bacteria from the hands.
targetString: Usibye kuba yarinda ahantu hadatwikiriye ndetse n'uruhu, iyo miti ishobora kuba irimo za aside (aside asetike, aside asikorbike, aside lakitiki) nko kuringaniza ingano ya Idolojene, aside benzoyike irwanya udukoko twanduza indwara n'izindi zirinda uruhu (igikakarubamba, intungamubiri, menthol, n'indi miti ikomoka ku bimera). Ubusesenguzi bwimbitse bwakozwe na Kaminuza y'Ishuri ry'ubuvuzi rusange rya Oregon bwagaragaje ko amasabune asanzwe afite ubushobozi bwo kurinda indwara no gukura ku ntoki udukoko twanduza indwara ku rwego rumwe n'amasabune yagenewe kurwanya udukoko twanduza indwara.

sourceString: Hot water that is comfortable for washing hands is not hot enough to kill bacteria.
targetString: Amazi ashyushye ashobora gukoreshwa mu gukaraba intoki ntabwo aba ashyushye bihagije kugira ngo yice udukoko twanduza indwara.

sourceString: Bacteria grow much faster at body temperature (37 °C).
targetString: udukoko twanduza indwara dukura vuba cyane ku gipimo cy'ubushyuhe bw'umubiri (37 ° C).

sourceString: However, warm, soapy water is more effective than cold, soapy water at removing natural oils which hold soils and bacteria.
targetString: Nyamara, amazi ashyushye, arimo isabune afite akamaro kuruta amazi akonje, arimo isabune mu gukuraho amavuta karemano afite ubutaka n'udukoko twanduza.

sourceString: Contrary to popular belief however, scientific studies have shown that using warm water has no effect on reducing the microbial load on hands.
targetString: Bitandukanye n'uko abantu benshi babyemera, ubushakashatsi bwa siyansi bwerekanye ko gukoresha amazi ashyushye ntacyo bimara mu kugabanya ingano ya mikorobe ku ntoki.

sourceString: A hand sanitizer or hand antiseptic is a non-water-based hand hygiene agent.
targetString: Umuti usukura intoki cyangwa umuti urinda ubwandu bw'intoki ni umuti w'isuku y'intoki utarimo amazi.

sourceString: In the late 1990s and early part of the 21st century, alcohol rub non-water-based hand hygiene agents (also known as alcohol-based hand rubs, antiseptic hand rubs, or hand sanitizers) began to gain popularity.
targetString: Mu mpera z'umwaka wa 1990 no mu ntangiriro z'ikinyejana cya 21 gukaraba intoki hifashishije imiti yagenewe kwica udukoko twanduza indwara (isanzwe izwi nk'imiti yo gusukura intoki irimo arukoro) byatangiye kumenyekana no gukundwa n'abantu benshi.

sourceString: Most are based on isopropyl alcohol or ethanol formulated together with a thickening agent such as Carbomer (polymer of acrylic acid) into a gel, or a humectant such as glycerin into a liquid, or foam for ease of use and to decrease the drying effect of the alcohol.
targetString: Inyinshi iba ikozwe muri arukoro ya "isopropyl" cyangwa "ethanol" ikorwa havanzwe ibyo bita Carbomer mu mavuta buzi cyangwa yongera ubuhehere nka giriserini ikabihinduramo ibisukika cyangwa ifuro mu rwego rwo koroshya ikoreshwa ryayo no kugabanya ingaruka z'arukoro zituma umuntu yumagana.

sourceString: Adding diluted hydrogen-peroxide increases further  the antimicrobial activity.Hand sanitizers containing a minimum of 60 to 95% alcohol are efficient germ killers.
targetString: Kongeramo Idolojene-peroxide ifunguye byongera ubushobozi bwo kurwanya mikorobe. Imiti isukura intoki irimo nibura 60 kugera kuri 95% by'arukoro, ishobora gukora neza mu kwica mikorobe.

sourceString: Alcohol rub sanitizers kill bacteria, multi-drug resistant bacteria (MRSA and VRE), tuberculosis, and some viruses (including HIV, herpes, RSV, rhinovirus, vaccinia, influenza, and hepatitis) and fungi.
targetString: Imiti yo gusukura intoki irimo arukoro yica udukoko twanduza indwara, udukoko duhangana n'imiti myinshi (MRSA na VRE), igituntu, n'izindi virusi (zirimo virusi itera SIDA, herpes, RSV, rinovirusi, vakisiniya, ibicurane, na hepatite) ndetse na virusi itera ibimeme.

sourceString: Alcohol rub sanitizers containing 70% alcohol kill 99.97% (3.5 log reduction, similar to 35 decibel reduction) of the bacteria on hands 30 seconds after application and 99.99% to 99.999% (4 to 5 log reduction) of the bacteria on hands 1 minute after application.Hand sanitizers are most effective against bacteria and less effective against some viruses.
targetString: Imiti yifashishwa mu gusukura intoki ifite 70% yica 99,97% (3,5 by'igabanuka, bingana n'igabanuka rya desibeli 35) y'udukoko two ku ntoki mu masegonda 30 nyuma yo kuwukoresha na 99,99% kugera kuri 99,999% (igabanuka riri hagati ya 4 na 5) y'udukoko two ku ntoki nyuma y'umunota 1 nyuma yo gukoreshwa. Imiti yifashishwa mu gusukura intoki ikora neza cyane mu kurwanya udukoko twanduza indwara ariko ikaba idafite ubushobozi bwinshi bwo kurwanya za virusi.

sourceString: Alcohol-based hand sanitizers are almost entirely ineffective against norovirus (or Norwalk) type viruses, the most common cause of contagious gastroenteritis.Enough hand antiseptic or alcohol rub must be used to thoroughly wet or cover both hands.
targetString: Imiti yifashishwa mu gusukura intoki isa nkaho nta bushobozi ifite bwo kurwanya norovirusi (Norwalk) ikunze gutera indwara z'igifu. Imiti yifashishwa mu gusukura intoki igomba gukoreshwa ku buryo itosa cyangwa ikwira ku biganza byombi.

sourceString: The front and back of both hands and between and the ends of all fingers are rubbed for approximately 30 seconds until the liquid, foam or gel is dry.
targetString: Imbere n'inyuma h'ibiganza no hagati no ku mpera h'intoki zose harakubwa hafi mu gihe cy'amasegonda 30 kugeza amazi, ifuro cyangwa umuti usukura byumye.

sourceString: Finger tips must be washed well too, rubbing them in both palms.The US Center for Disease Control and Prevention recommends hand washing over hand sanitizer rubs, particularly when hands are visibly dirty.
targetString: Ni ngombwa gukaraba neza imitwe y'intoki uyikubira hamwe mu biganza byombi. Ikigo gishinzwe kugenzura no gukumira ibyorezo cya Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika gisaba abantu gukaraba bakoresheje imiti yica udukoko mu biganza cyane cyane iyo bigaragara ko ibiganza byanduye.

sourceString: The increasing use of these agents is based on their ease of use and rapid killing activity against micro-organisms; however, they should not serve as a replacement for proper hand washing unless soap and water are unavailable.
targetString: Gukomeza gukoresha ubu buryo bishingiye ku kuba bworoshye gukoresha no kuba bwica vuba udukoko twanduza; gusa, ubu buryo ntibukwiye gusimbura uburyo bwagenwe bwo gukaraba intoki keretse mu gihe isabune n'amazi bidahari.

sourceString: Frequent use of alcohol-based hand sanitizers can cause dry skin unless emollients and/or skin moisturizers are added to the formula.
targetString: Gukoresha kenshi imiti isukura intoki irimo arukoro bishobora gutuma uruhu rwuma keretse muri iyo miti hongewemo iyo koroshya uruhu cyangwa ituma rudakanyarara.

sourceString: The drying effect of alcohol can be reduced or eliminated by adding glycerin and/or other emollients to the formula.
targetString: Uko kuma kw'uruhu bitewe na arukoro bishobora kugabanyuka cyangwa bikavanwaho na giliseline cyangwa undi muti woroshya uruhu.

sourceString: In clinical trials, alcohol-based hand sanitizers containing emollients caused substantially less skin irritation and dryness than soaps or antimicrobial detergents.
targetString: Mu bushakashatsi bwo kwa muganga, imiti isukura intoki irimo arukoro ariko ikanabamo umuti woroshya uruhu ituma uruhu rudakomera cyane kurusha amasabune cyangwa imiti yica mikorobe.

sourceString: Allergic contact dermatitis, contact urticaria syndrome or hypersensitivity to alcohol or additives present in alcohol hand rubs rarely occur.
targetString: Gufurutwa kw'uruhu, kuzana uduheri cyangwa kwivumbagatanya k'umubiri bitewe n'arukoro iri mu muti usukura intoki bibaho gake.

sourceString: The lower tendency to induce irritant contact dermatitis became an attraction as compared to soap and water hand washing.
targetString: Kuba hari ibyago bike byo kwangiza uruhu bituma ubu buryo bukoreshwa cyane ugereranije no gukaraba intoki ukoresheje isabune n'amazi.

sourceString: Despite their effectiveness, non-water agents do not cleanse the hands of organic material, but simply disinfect them.
targetString: N'ubwo bikora neza, ibisukura intoki bitarimo amazi ntibisukura intoki ngo bimareho umwanda wose, ahubwo bikuraho udukoko twanduza gusa.

sourceString: It is for this reason that hand sanitizers are not as effective as soap and water at preventing the spread of many pathogens, since the pathogens still remain on the hands.
targetString: Niyo mpamvu rero umuti wo gusukura intoki udakora neza nk'isabune n'amazi mu kurinda ikwirakwizwa rya virusi nyinshi, kubera ko virusi ikomeza kuba ku ntoki.

sourceString: Alcohol-free hand sanitizer efficacy is heavily dependent on the ingredients and formulation, and historically has significantly under-performed alcohol and alcohol rubs.
targetString: Imikorere myiza y'imiti isukura intoki itarimo arukoro ishingiye cyane cyane ku biyigize, kandi kera yahoze idakora neza nk'arukoro n'ibindi bisiga bikomoka kuri arukoro.

sourceString: More recently, formulations that use benzalkonium chloride have been shown to have persistent and cumulative antimicrobial activity after application, unlike alcohol, which has been shown to decrease in efficacy after repeated use, probably due to progressive adverse skin reactions.
targetString: Vuba aha, imiti ikoresha chloride ya benzalkonium yagaragaje ko ifite ubushobozi buhoraho bwo guhangana na mikorobe nyuma yo kuyikoresha, bitandukanye n'arukoro, byagaragaye ko umusaruro itanga ugenda ugabanuka nyuma yo kuyikoresha inshuro nyinshi, bitewe wenda n'ingaruka igenda igira ku ruhu.

sourceString: Many people in low-income communities cannot afford soap and use ash or soil instead.
targetString: Abantu benshi mu bafite imibereho iciriritse ntibashobora kubona isabune bityo bagakoresha ivu cyangwa itaka.

sourceString: Ash or soil may be more effective than water alone, but may be less effective than soap.
targetString: Gukoresha ivu cyangwa itaka ni ubundi buryo bwiza buruta gukoresha amazi gusa, ariko nanone si bwiza cyane nko gukoresha isabune.

sourceString: One concern is that if the soil or ash is contaminated with microorganisms it may increase the spread of disease rather than decrease it.
targetString: Impungenge imwe ihari ni uko ivu cyangwa itaka bigizwe n'utunyabuzima duto cyane dushobora kwanduza bityo bikaba byakongera ikwirakwizwa ry'icyorezo kurusha uko byarigabanya.

sourceString: Like soap, ash is also a disinfecting agent because in contact with water, it forms an alkaline solution.
targetString: Kimwe n'isabune, ivu naryo ryica udukoko twanduza kubera ko iyo rihuye n'amazi rikora aside.

sourceString: WHO recommended ash or sand as alternative to soap when soap is not available.
targetString: Mu gihe isabune itabonetse, Ishami ry'Umuryango w'Abibumbye ryita ku Buzima risaba ko hakoreshwa ivu cyangwa umusenyi.

sourceString: Correct handwashing technique recommended by the US Centers for Disease Control  for prevention of transmission of disease includes the following steps:
targetString: Uburyo bukwiye bwo gukaraba intoki bwasabwe n'Ikigo gishinzwe kugenzura no gukumira indwara muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika mu rwego rwo gukumira ikwirakwizwa ry'iki cyorezo ni ubu bukurikira:

sourceString: Wet hands with warm or cold running water.
targetString: Tosa intoki ukoresheje amazi akonje cyangwa ashyushe kandi atemba.

sourceString: Running water is recommended because standing basins may be contaminated, while the temperature of the water does not seem to make a difference.
targetString: Amazi atemba ni yo agomba gukoreshwa kuko amazi ari mu ibase ashobora kubamo ubwandu, kandi igipimo cy'ubushyuhe bw'amazi ntacyo gihindura cyane.

sourceString: Lather hands by rubbing them with a generous amount of soap, including the backs of hands, between fingers, and under nails.
targetString: Karaba intoki zizeho ifuro, uzikuba cyane ukoresheje isabune nyinshi, ukarabe inyuma y'ikiganza, hagati y'intoki no munsi y'inzara.

sourceString: Soap lifts germs from the skin, and studies show that people tend to wash their hands more thoroughly when soap is used rather than water alone.
targetString: Isabune ikura ku ruhu udukoko dutera indwara, kandi ubushakashatsi bwagaragaje ko abantu bakaraba neza intoki iyo bakoresheje isabune kurusha uko bakaraba bakoresheje amazi gusa.

sourceString: Scrub for at least 20 seconds.
targetString: Kuba intoki nibura mu gihe cy'amasegonda 20.

sourceString: Scrubbing creates friction, which helps remove germs from skin, and scrubbing for longer periods removes more germs.
targetString: Gutsirita intoki cyane bituma habaho kwikubanaho, bigafasha mu gukura ku ruhu udukoko twanduza indwara, kandi kuzikuba cyane bikuraho utwo dukoko twinshi.

sourceString: Rinse well under running water.
targetString: Tosa neza intoki ukoresheje amazi atemba.

sourceString: Rinsing in a basin can recontaminate hands.
targetString: Gutohereza intoki mu ibase bishobora kongera kwanduza intoki.

sourceString: Dry with a clean towel or allow to air dry.
targetString: Umutsa intoki ukoresheje igitambaro gisukuye cyangwa uzumutse ukoresheje umwuka.

sourceString: Wet and moist hands are more easily recontaminated.The most commonly missed areas are the thumb, the wrist, the areas between the fingers, and under fingernails.
targetString: Intoki zitose cyangwa zitumutse neza zishobora kongera kwandura ku buryo bworoshye. Ahantu hakunze kwibagirana ni ku gikumwe, mu bujana, mu mwanya uri hagati y'intoki, ndetse no munsi y'inzara zo ku ntoki.

sourceString: Artificial nails and chipped nail polish may harbor microorganisms.
targetString: Inzara z'inkorano cyangwa inzara ziteye amabara zishobora kuba indiri ya za mikorobe.

sourceString: Moisturizing lotion is often recommended to keep the hands from drying out; dry skin can lead to skin damage which can increase the risk for the transmission of infection.
targetString: Amavuta y'amazi yo koroshya uruhu ni yo abantu basabwa gukoresha kugira ngo intoki zidakanyarara; uruhu rwumye cyane rushobora kwangirika kandi ibyo bikongera ibyago byo gukwirakwira kw'icyorezo.

sourceString: Various low-cost options can be made to facilitate hand washing where tap-water and/or soap is not available e.g. pouring water from a hanging jerrycan or gourd with suitable holes and/or using ash if needed in developing countries.In situations with limited water supply (such as schools or rural areas in developing countries), there are water-conserving solutions, such as "tippy-taps" and other low-cost options.
targetString: Hari ubundi buryo buciriritse bushobora gukoreshwa mu rwego rwo koroshya igikorwa cyo gukaraba intoki mu gihe uburyo bwo gukoresha robine cyangwa isabune budahari, urugero nko gusuka amazi hakoreshejwe ijerikani imanitse ku giti (kandagirukarabe) cyangwa se igicuma kirimo imyenge yabugenewe cyangwa hagakoreshwa ivu igihe bibaye ngombwa mu bihugu biri mu nzira y'amajyambere. Mu gihe hari ibibazo by'amazi (nko ku bigo by'amashuri cyangwa mu bice by'icyaro mu bihugu biri mu nzira y'amajyambere), hari uburyo bwo gufata amazi nka kandagirukarabe n'ubundi buryo buhendutse.

sourceString: A tippy-tap is a simple technology using a jug suspended by a rope, and a foot-operated lever to pour a small amount of water over the hands and a bar of soap.
targetString: Kandagirukarebe ni ikoranabuhanga ryoroshye rikoresha ijagi imanitse ku mugozi, isuka amazi hakoreshejwe ikirenge, ugakaraba amazi make make mu ntoki n'isabune.

sourceString: Effective drying of the hands is an essential part of the hand hygiene process, but there is some debate over the most effective form of drying in public washrooms.
targetString: Kumutsa intoki mu buryo bukwiye ni igice cy'ingenzi cyane mu kugirira isuku intoki, ariko ubu haracyari impaka ku buryo bwiza cyane bwakoreshwa mu kumutsa intoki mu bwiherero rusange.

sourceString: A growing volume of research suggests paper towels are much more hygienic than the electric hand dryers found in many washrooms.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi bwinshi bugaragaza ko impapuro zikoreshwa mu kwihanagura ziba zifite isuku cyane kurusha ibyuma byumutsa intoki bikoresha amashanyarazi biri mu bwiherero bwinshi.

sourceString: In 2008, a study was conducted by the University of Westminster, London, and sponsored by the paper-towel industry the European Tissue Symposium, to compare the levels of hygiene offered by paper towels, warm-air hand dryers and the more modern jet-air hand dryers.
targetString: Mu 2008, Kaminuza ya Westminster i Londere itewe inkunga n'uruganda rukora uduhanaguzo rwitwa "The European Tissue Symposium", yakoze ubushakashatsi bugamije kugereranya ikigero cy'isuku itangwa n'uduhanaguzo, utwumutsantoki n'akuma kagezweho kumutsa intoki.

sourceString: After washing and drying hands with the warm-air dryer, the total number of bacteria was found to increase on average on the finger pads by 194% and on the palms by 254%.
targetString: Nyuma yo gukaraba no kumutsa intoki ukoresheje icyuma cyumutsa intoki gikoresheje umwuka ushyushye, byagaragaye ko ingano rusange y'udukoko dutera indwara yiyongera ku mpuzandengo ya 194% ahashyirwa intoki ndetse no hagati mu kiganza ku mpuzandengo 254%.

sourceString: Drying with the jet-air dryer resulted in an increase on average of the total number of bacteria on the finger pads by 42% and on the palms by 15%.
targetString: Kumutsa intoki ukoresheje icyuma gihuha umwuka byatumye ingano rusange y'udukoko dutera indwara yiyongera ku mpuzandengo ya 42% ahashyirwa intoki ndetse no hagati mu kiganza ku mpuzandengo 15%.

sourceString: After washing and drying hands with a paper towel, the total number of bacteria was reduced on average on the finger pads by up to 76% and on the palms by up to 77%.The scientists also carried out tests to establish whether there was the potential for cross contamination of other washroom users and the washroom environment as a result of each type of drying method.
targetString: Nyuma yo gukaraba intoki no kuzumutsa hakoreshejwe impapuro zabugenewe, umubare wose w'agakoko wagabanyijweho ku mpuzandengo ya 76% ku duhanagurantoki no kuri 77% ku biganza. Abahanga kandi bakoze ubushakashatsi kugira ngo barebe niba habaho kwanduzanya hagati y'abantu bakoresha ubwogero ndetse n'ahabukikije bitewe na buri bwoko bw'uburyo bwo kumutsa.

sourceString: The jet-air dryer, which blows air out of the unit at claimed speeds of 180 m/s (650 km/h; 400 mph), was capable of blowing micro-organisms from the hands and the unit and potentially contaminating other washroom users and the washroom environment up to 2 metres away.
targetString: Agakoresho kumutsa, ka kandi gasohora umwuka ku gipimo cy'umuvuduko wa 180m/s (650km/h; 400mph), kashoboraga gukura ku ntoki n'ibindi bice udukoko twanduza ndetse n'ubushobozi bwo kwanduza abandi bakoresha ubwogero ndetse no kwigizayo utwo dukoko mu ntera igera kuri metero 2.

sourceString: Use of a warm-air hand dryer spread micro-organisms up to 0.25 metres from the dryer.
targetString: Gukoresha icyuma cyumutsa intoki gikoresheje umwuka ushyushye bitumura mikorobe kugeza muri metero 0.25 uvuye aho icyuma kiri.

sourceString: Paper towels showed no significant spread of micro-organisms.In 2005, in a study conducted by TÜV Produkt und Umwelt, different hand drying methods were evaluated.
targetString: Uduhanaguzo dukoze mu mpapuro twagaragaje ko tudakwirakwiza cyane mikorobe.Mu 2005, mu bushakashatsi bwakozwe TÜV Produkt und Umwelt, hasuzumwe uburyo bunyuranye bwo kumutsa intoki.

sourceString: The following changes in the bacterial count after drying the hands were observed:
targetString: Impinduka zikurikira zagaragaye mu mubare w'udukoko twanduza indwara nyuma yo kumutsa intoki:

sourceString: Many different hand dryer manufacturers exist, and hand driers have been compared against drying with paper towels.
targetString: Hariho abakora ibikoresho byo kumutsa intoki benshi, kandi ibikoresho byumatsa intoki byagereranyijwe n'impapuro z'isuku zumutsa intoki.

sourceString: Hand washing using hand sanitizing wipes is an alternative during traveling in the absence of soap and water.
targetString: Gukaraba intoki ukoresheje umuti wabugenewe usukura intoki ni ubundi buryo bwakoreshwa mu gihe umuntu ari mu rugendo adafite amazi n'isabune.

sourceString: Alcohol-based hand sanitizer should contain at least 60% alcohol.
targetString: Arukoro yagenewe gusukura intoki igomba kuba igizwe nibura na 60% by'arukoro.

sourceString: Medical hand-washing became mandatory long after Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis discovered its effectiveness (in 1846) in preventing disease in a hospital environment.
targetString: Gukaraba intoki kwa muganga byabaye itegeko nyuma y'uko umuganga wo muri Hongiriya witwa Ignaz Semmelweis avumburiye akamaro kabyo (muri 1846) mu kwirinda indwara mu bitaro.

sourceString: There are electronic devices that provide feedback to remind hospital staff to wash their hands when they forget.
targetString: Hari ibikoresho by'ikoronabuhanga byibutsa abakozi bo kwa muganga gukaraba intoki iyo babyibagiwe.

sourceString: One study has found decreased infection rates with their use.
targetString: Hari ubushakashatsi bwagaragaje ko kubikoresha byagabanyije igipimo cy'ubwandu.

sourceString: Medical hand-washing is for a minimum of 15 seconds, using generous amounts of soap and water or gel to lather and rub each part of the hands.
targetString: Gukaraba intoki mu rwego rw'ubuvuzi bimara nibura amasegonda 15, hakoreshejwe isabune nyinshi n'amazi cyangwa umuti wabugenewe utuma haboneka ifuru maze ugakubira hamwe ibiganza byombi.

sourceString: Hands should be rubbed together with digits interlocking.
targetString: Intoki zigomba gukubirwa hamwe zinyuranamo ku buryo bwegeranye cyane.

sourceString: If there is debris under fingernails, a bristle brush may be used to remove it.
targetString: Niba hari umwanda munsi y'inzara, uburoso bwabigenewe bushobora kuwukuramo.

sourceString: Since germs may remain in the water on the hands, it is important to rinse well and wipe dry with a clean towel.
targetString: Kuko udukoko twanduza indwara tuguma mu mazi ari ku ntoki, ni ngombwa gutosa neza no kumutsa cyane intoki ukoresheje igitambaro gisukuye.

sourceString: After drying, the paper towel should be used to turn off the water (and open any exit door if necessary).
targetString: Nyuma yo kumutsa intoki, agahanaguzo gakozwe mu mpapuro kagomba gukoreshwa mu gufunga amazi (ndetse no gufungura umuryango usohoka niba ari ngombwa).

sourceString: This avoids re-contaminating the hands from those surfaces.
targetString: Ibi birinda intoki kongera kwanduzwa n'aho zakoze.

sourceString: The purpose of hand-washing in the health-care setting is to remove pathogenic microorganisms ("germs") and avoid transmitting them.
targetString: Impamvu yo gukaraba intoki ahatangirwa serivisi z'ubuvuzi ni ukugira ngo hakurweho mikorobe zishobora gutera indwara no kwirinda kuzikwirakwiza.

sourceString: The New England Journal of Medicine reports that a lack of hand-washing remains at unacceptable levels in most medical environments, with large numbers of doctors and nurses routinely forgetting to wash their hands before touching patients, thus transmitting microorganisms.
targetString: Ikinyamakuru cyandika ku buzima kitwa "The New England Journal of Medicine" gitangaza ko gukaraba intoki mu mavuriro bikiri ingorabahizi, aho usanga umubare munini w'abaganga n'abaforomo bakunze kwibagirwa gukaraba intoki mbere yo gukora ku barwayi; ibi bikaba bituma udukoko twanduza indwara dukwirakwira.

sourceString: One study showed that proper hand-washing and other simple procedures can decrease the rate of catheter-related bloodstream infections by 66 percent.The World Health Organization has published a sheet demonstrating standard hand-washing and hand-rubbing in health-care sectors.
targetString: Hari ubushakashatsi bwagaragaje ko gukaraba intoki n'ubundi buryo bworoshye bishobora kugabanya ikigero cy'indwara zandurira mu nzira y'amaraso ku kigero cya 66%. Ishami ry'Umuryango w'Abibumbye ryita ku buzima ryashyize ahagaragara inyandiko igaragaza uburyo bwizewe bwo gukaraba intoki no gukoresha imiti yifashishwa mu gusukura intoki mu nzego z'ubuzima.

sourceString: The draft guidance of hand hygiene by the organization can also be found at its website for public comment.
targetString: Umushinga w'amabwiriza y'isuku y'intoki atangwa n'ikigo ashobora kuboneka ku rubuga rwacyo kugira ngo abantu bayatangeho ibitekerezo.

sourceString: A relevant review was conducted by Whitby et al.
targetString: Ivugurura ry'ingenzi ryakozwe na Whitby n'abandi.

sourceString: Commercial devices can measure and validate hand hygiene, if demonstration of regulatory compliance is required.
targetString: Ibikoresho by'ubucuruzi bishobora gupima no kwemeza isuku y'intoki, niba hasabwe kugaragaza ibisabwa n'amabwiriza.

sourceString: The World Health Organization has "Five Moments" for washing hands:
targetString: Ishami ry'Umuryango w'Abibumbye ryita ku Buzima rigena "Ibihe bitanu" byo gukaraba intoki:

sourceString: after exposure to blood/body fluids
targetString: nyuma yo kugira aho uhurira n'amaraso/amatembabuzi

sourceString: before an aseptic task, and
targetString: mbere y'igikorwa cyo kuvura, na

sourceString: after patient care.The addition of antiseptic chemicals to soap ("medicated" or "antimicrobial" soaps) confers killing action to a hand-washing agent.
targetString: nyuma yo kwita ku murwayi.Kongera imiti yica indwara ku isabune (amasabune "akoreshwa nk'imiti" cyangwa "ayica mikorobe") bituma gukaraba intoki bidufasha kwica udukoko twanduza.

sourceString: Such killing action may be desired prior to performing surgery or in settings in which antibiotic-resistant organisms are highly prevalent.To 'scrub' one's hands for a surgical operation, it is necessary to have a tap that can be turned on and off without touching it with the hands, some chlorhexidine or iodine wash, sterile towels for drying the hands after washing, and a sterile brush for scrubbing and another sterile instrument for cleaning under the fingernails.
targetString: Ubwo buryo bwo kwica mikorobe, bushobora gukenerwa mbere yo kubaga cyangwa ahantu higanje cyane ibinyabuzima bihangana n'imiti irwanya indwara.Kugira ngo ukube intoki neza mbere yo kubaga, ni ngombwa kugira robine ishobora gufungwa no gufungurwa udakoresheje intoki, umuti w'isuku wa chlorhexidine cyangwa iodine, igitambaro gifite isuku cyo kumutsa intoki nyuma yo kuzikaraba, ndetse n'uburoso bufite isuku bwo gukuba intoki ndetse n'ikindi gikoresho gifite isuku cyo gusukura inzara zo ku ntoki.

sourceString: All jewelry should be removed.
targetString: Ugomba kwiyambura imitako yose.

sourceString: This procedure requires washing the hands and forearms up to the elbow, usually 2–6 minutes.
targetString: Ubu buryo busaba gukaraba intoki n'amaboko kugeza ku nkokora, akenshi hagati y'iminota 2 kugeza kuri 6.

sourceString: Long scrub-times (10 minutes) are not necessary.
targetString: Gukuba intoki igihe kirekire(iminota 10) si ngombwa.

sourceString: When rinsing, water on the forearms must be prevented from running back to the hands.
targetString: Mu gihe uri gutosa amaboko, irinde ko amazi ari ku maboko yongera kumanukira ku ntoki.

sourceString: After hand-washing is completed, the hands are dried with a sterile cloth and a surgical gown is donned.
targetString: Nyuma yo kurangiza gukaraba intoki, zihanaguze igitambaro gisukuye maze wambare umwambaro wo mu cyumba cy'imbagwa.

sourceString: To reduce the spread of germs, it is better to wash the hands or use a hand antiseptic before and after tending to a sick person.
targetString: Mu rwego rwo kugabanya udukoko twanduza, ni byiza gukaraba intoki cyangwa gukoresha umuti woza intoki mbere na nyuma yo kwita ku murwayi.

sourceString: For control of staphylococcal infections in hospitals, it has been found that the greatest benefit from hand-cleansing came from the first 20% of washing, and that very little additional benefit was gained when hand cleansing frequency was increased beyond 35%.
targetString: Mu bugenzuzi bwakorewe ibitaro bivura indwara ziterwa n'udukoko twitwa "sitafilokoke", byagaragaye ko inyungu nyinshi iva mu gusukura intoki ituruka muri 20% ya mbere yo gukaraba, naho inyungu nkeya yiyongeraho ikaboneka iyo inshuro zo gusukura intoki zongerewe kugera hejuru ya 35%.

sourceString: Washing with plain soap results in more than triple the rate of bacterial infectious disease transmitted to food as compared to washing with antibacterial soap.Comparing hand-rubbing with alcohol-based solution with hand washing with antibacterial soap for a median time of 30 seconds each showed that the alcohol hand-rubbing reduced bacterial contamination 26% more than the antibacterial soap.
targetString: Gukaraba ukoresheje isabune isanzwe bitanga umusaruro urenze inshuro eshatu mu kigero cy'indwara ziterwa n'udukoko two mu biribwa ugerereranyije no gukaraba ukoresheje isabune yagenewe kwica udukoko twandura. Iyo ugerereranyije gukoresha umuti basiga mu ntoki n'isabune yagenewe kwica udukoko twandura mu gihe cy'amasegonda 30, byose byagaragaje ko gukoresha imiti yifashishwa mu gusukura intoki bigabanya kwandura udukoko ku kigero cya 26% ugerereranyije n'isabune yagenewe kwica udukoko twandura.

sourceString: But soap and water is more effective than alcohol-based hand rubs for reducing H1N1 influenza A virus and Clostridium difficile spores from hands.Interventions to improve hand hygiene in healthcare settings can involve education for staff on hand washing, increasing the availability of alcohol-based hand rub, and written and verbal reminders to staff.
targetString: Ariko gukaraba ukoresheje isabune n'amazi ni byo byiza kurusha gukoresha imiti yifashishwa mu gusukura intoki mu rwego rwo kugabanya virusi y'ibicurane bya A/H1N1 n'utundi dukoko dufite ubukana dusigara mu ntoki. Ibikorwa byo kunoza isuku y'intoki mu mavuriro bishobora kubamo no kwigisha abakozi gukaraba intoki, kongera imiti yifashishwa mu gusukura intoki no kubyibutsa abakozi mu buryo bwanditse ndetse no mu magambo.

sourceString: There is a need for more research into which of these interventions are most effective in different healthcare settings.
targetString: Hakenewe gukorwa ubushakashatsi bwinshi bugaragaza uburyo ubu bufasha ari ingirakamaro cyane mu kwita ku buzima ahantu henshi hatandukanye.

sourceString: In developing countries, hand washing with soap is recognized as a cost-effective, essential tool for achieving good health, and even good nutrition.
targetString: Mu bihugu bikiri mu nzira y'amajyambere, gukaraba intoki n'isabune bifatwa nk'uburyo bw'ingenzi kandi buhendutse bwo kugera ku buzima bwiza, ndetse n'imirire myiza.

sourceString: However, a lack of reliable water supply, soap or hand washing facilities in people's homes, at schools and at the workplace make it a challenge to achieve universal hand washing behaviors.
targetString: Nyamara, kutabona amazi ku buryo buhoraho, isabune cyangwa ibikoresho bifasha mu gukaraba intoki mu ngo z'abantu, ku mashuri n'aho abantu bakorera ni imbogamizi ikomeye ituma kugira imyitwarire yo gukaraba intoki ku bantu bose bitagerwaho.

sourceString: For example, in most of rural Africa hand washing taps close to every private or public toilet are scarce, even though cheap options exist to build hand washing stations.
targetString: Dutanze urugero, mu bice byinshi by'icyaro muri Afurika, robine zo gukarabiraho intoki ziri hafi y'ubwiherero rusange cyangwa bw'abantu ku giti cyabo ziracyari nkeya, nubwo hari ubundi buryo buhendutse bwo kubaka ahantu ho gukarabira intoki.

sourceString: However, low hand washing rates rather can also be the result of engrained habits rather than due to a lack of soap or water.
targetString: Ariko, umubare muto w’abakaraba intoki unashobora guterwa n’umuco wabaye karande wo kudakaraba aho guterwa no kubura isabune cyangwa amazi.

sourceString: The promotion and advocacy of hand washing with soap can influence policy decisions, raise awareness about the benefits of hand washing and lead to long-term behavior change of the population.
targetString: Guteza imbere no gushishikariza abantu gukaraba intoki bakoresheje isabune bishobora kugira icyo bihindura mu gufata ingamba, gutuma abantu bamenya ibyiza byo gukaraba intoki bikanatuma abaturage bahindura imyitwarire by’igihe kirekire.

sourceString: For this to work effectively, monitoring and evaluation are necessary.
targetString: Kugira ngo ibi bikorwe mu buryo bunoze, kubikurikirana no kubisuzuma ni ngombwa.

sourceString: A systematic review of 70 studies found that community-based approaches are effective at increasing hand washing in LMICs, while social marketing campaigns are less effective.One example for hand washing promotion in schools is the "Three Star Approach" by UNICEF that encourages schools to take simple, inexpensive steps to ensure that students wash their hands with soap, among other hygienic requirements.
targetString: Isuzuma ry’ubushakashatsi 70 ryasanze uburyo bushingiye ku baturage butanga umusaruro mu kongera ibikorwa byo gukaraba intoki muri LMICs, mu gihe kumenyekanisha ibikorwa ku mbuga nkoranyambaga bidatanga umusaruro. Urugero rumwe ni aho guteza imbere ibikorwa byo gukaraba intoki mu mashuri ari "Uburyo bwahawe inyenyeri eshatu" na UNICEF mu gushishikariza amashuri gukoresha uburyo bworoheje, budahenze mu guharanira ko abanyeshuri bakaraba intoki bakoresheje isabune, hamwe n’ibindi bikoresho by’isuku.

sourceString: When minimum standards are achieved, schools can move from one to ultimately three stars.
targetString: Iyo ibipimo by’ibanze bigezweho, amashuri ashobora kuva ku nyenyeri imwe akagera ku nyenyeri eshatu.

sourceString: Building hand washing stations can be a part of hand washing promotion campaigns that are carried out in order to reduce diseases and child mortality.
targetString: Kubaka aho abantu bakarabira intoki bishobora kuba bumwe mu buryo bw’ubukangurambaga bwo guteza imbere umuco wo gukaraba intoki bukorwa mu rwego rwo kugabanya indwara n’impfu z’abana.

sourceString: Global Hand washing Day is another example of an awareness-raising campaign that is trying to achieve behavior change.As a result of the 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, UNICEF promoted the adoption of a handwashing emoji.
targetString: Umunsi mpuzamahanga wo gukaraba intoki ni urundi rugero rw’ubukangurambaga bwo gushishikariza abantu gukaraba intoki mu rwego rwo kugera ku ntego zo guhindura imyitwarire. Bitewe n’icyorezo cya koronavirusi cyo mu 2019-20, UNICEF yateje imbere emoji yo gukaraba intoki.

sourceString: Few studies have considered the overall cost effectiveness of hand washing in developing countries in relationship to DALYs averted.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi buke bwagaragaje muri rusange umusaruro wo gukaraba intoki mu bihugu biri mu nzira y’amajyambere bigereranyijwe n’igipimo cya DALYs.

sourceString: However, one review suggests that promoting hand washing with soap is significantly more cost-effective than other water and sanitation interventions.
targetString: Cyakora, isuzuma rimwe rigaragaza ko guteza imbere umuco wo gukaraba intoki n’isabune byatanze umusaruro kurusha ibindi bikorwa byo gukoresha amazi n’isukura.

sourceString: The importance of hand washing for human health – particularly for people in vulnerable circumstances like mothers who had just given birth or wounded soldiers in hospitals – was first recognized in the mid 19th century by two pioneers of hand hygiene: the Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis who worked in Vienna, Austria and Florence Nightingale, the English "founder of modern nursing".
targetString: Akamaro ko gukaraba intoki mu buzima bwa muntu; by’umwihariko, abantu bafite intege nke nk’ababyeyi bakimara kubyara cyangwa abasirikare bakomerekeye ku rugamba bari mu bitaro, kagaragaye hagati mu kinyejana cya 19 kagaragajwe n’abantu babiri batangije isuku yo mu ntoki: Umuganga w’umunyahongiriya witwa Ignaz Semmelweis wakoraga i Viyene, muri Otirishe na Florence Nightingale, umwongerezakazi "watangije uburyo bushya bwo gukora umwuga w’ubuforomo".

sourceString: At that time most people still believed that infections were caused by foul odors called miasmas.
targetString: Icyo gihe abantu benshi bari bakibwira ko indwara zandura ziterwa n’impumuro mbi yitwa miyazima.

sourceString: In the 1980s, foodborne outbreaks and healthcare-associated infections led the United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to more actively promote hand hygiene as an important way to prevent the spread of infection.
targetString: Muri za 1980, ibyorezo biterwa n’ibiribwa n’ubwandu bushamikiye ku buvuzi bwatumye Ikigo cya CDC cy’Amerika kirushaho kongera imbaraga mu gukangurira abantu kugira isuku yo mu ntoki nk’uburyo bw’ingenzi mu kwirinda ikwirakwira ry’indwara.

sourceString: The outbreak of swine flu in 2009 and the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020 led to increased awareness in many countries of the importance of washing hands with soap to protect oneself from such infectious diseases.
targetString: Icyorezo cy’ibicurane by’ingurube cyo mu 2009 n’icyorezo cya COVID-19 cyo mu 2020 byatumye ibihugu birushaho gusobanukirwa neza akamaro ko gukaraba intoki n’isabune mu kwirinda kwandura izo ndwara zandura.

sourceString: For example, posters with "correct hand washing techniques" were hung up next to hand washing sinks in public toilets and in the toilets of office buildings and airports in Germany.
targetString: Urugero, inyandiko nini zanditseho "uburyo bwiza bwo gukaraba intoki" zamanitswe iruhande rwa ravabo zo gukarabiramo intoki mu bwiherero rusange bw’inyubako z’ibiro n’ibibuga by’indege mu Budage.

sourceString: The phrase "washing one's hands of" something, means declaring one's unwillingness to take responsibility for the thing or share complicity in it.
targetString: Ijambo "gukaraba intoki" ku kintu runaka, bisobanura ubushake buke bw’umuntu bwo kutemera ibyo yakoze cyangwa kutemera ubugambanyi muri icyo gikorwa.

sourceString: It originates from the bible passage in Matthew where Pontius Pilate washed his hands of the decision to crucify Jesus Christ, but has become a phrase with a much wider usage in some English communities.
targetString: Byakomotse mu Gitabo cyo muri Bibiliya cya Matayo aho Ponsiyo Pilato yakarabye intoki ze amaze gufata icyemezo cyo kubamba Yezu Kristu, ariko iyo nteruro ikomeza gukoreshwa cyane mu bavuga ururimi rw’Icyongereza.

sourceString: In Shakespeare's Macbeth, Lady Macbeth begins to compulsively wash her hands in an attempt to cleanse an imagined stain, representing her guilty conscience regarding crimes she had committed and induced her husband to commit.
targetString: Mu ikinamico ya Macbeth yanditswe na Shakespeare, Madamazera Macbeth yatangiye kujya akaraba intoki ze mu rwego rwo gukuraho ikizinga yatekerezaga ko afite, bigaragaza ko umutima wamukomangaga ku bw’ibyaha yakoze n’ibyo yatumye umugabo we akora.

sourceString: It has also been found that people, after having recalled or contemplated unethical acts, tend to wash hands more often than others, and tend to value hand washing equipment more.
targetString: Byagaragaye ko abantu, iyo bamaze kwibuka cyangwa gutekereza gukora ibikorwa bidakwiye, bagerageza gukaraba intoki inshuro nyinshi kurusha abandi, no guha agaciro ibikoresho byo gukaraba intoki kurusha ibindi.

sourceString: Furthermore, those who are allowed to wash their hands after such a contemplation are less likely to engage in other "cleansing" compensatory actions, such as volunteering.
targetString: Kandi, abemererwa gukaraba intoki bamaze gutekereza ibyo bikorwa bibi bakunda kutongera gukora ibindi bikorwa byo "kwisukura" bihana nko gukora ibikorwa by’ubukorerabushake.

sourceString: Religions prescribe hand washing for both hygienic and symbolic purposes.Symbolic hand washing, using water but no soap to wash hands, is a part of ritual hand washing featured in many religions, including Bahá'í Faith, Hinduism, tevilah and netilat yadayim in Judaism, Lavabo in Christianity, and Wudhu in Islam.Religions also prescribe hygienic hand washing, especially after certain actions.
targetString: Hari amadini asaba ko abayoboke bayo bakaraba intoki mu rwego rw’isuku no kugaragaza imigenzo y’idini. Gukaraba intoki hagaragazwa imigenzo y’idini, hakoreshejwe amazi gusa nta sabune ukaraba intoki, ni kimwe mu bigize umuco uranga amadini menshi atandukanye, harimo ababahayi, abahindu, abatevira n’abanetirati yadayimu mu Idini rya Kiyahudi, ravabo mu bemera Yezu, na wudu muri Isiramu. Amadini anasaba abayoboke bayo kugira isuku bakaraba intoki, cyane cyane nyuma yo gukora ibikorwa byihariye.

sourceString: Hinduism, Judaism and Islam mandate washing of hands after using the toilet.
targetString: Abahindu, Idini rya Kiyahudi na Isiramu bategeka gukaraba intoki nyuma yo kuva mu bwiherero.

sourceString: And, Hinduism, Buddhism, Sikhism, Judaism and Islam mandate washing of hands before and after every meal.
targetString: Kandi Abahindu, Ababuda, Abasiki, Idini rya Kiyahudi na Isiramu bategeka gukaraba intoki mbere na nyuma ya buri gufata amafunguro.

sourceString: Workplace hazard controls for COVID-19
targetString: Ingamba zo kurwanya icyorezo cya COVID-19 ahakorerwa akazi

sourceString: Workplace hazard controls for COVID-19 are the application of occupational safety and health methodologies for hazard controls to the prevention of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).
targetString: Ingamba zo kurwanya icyorezo cya COVID-19 ahakorerwa akazi ni zo za ngombwa mu gushaka umutekano n’ubuzima bwiza ahakorerwa akazi mu rwego rwo kwirinda indwara ya koronavirusi yo mu 2019 (COVID-19).

sourceString: The proper hazard controls in the workplace depend on the worksite and job task, based on a risk assessment of sources of exposure, disease severity in the community, and risk factors of individual workers who may be vulnerable to contracting COVID-19.
targetString: Ingamba nziza zo kurwanya icyorezo ahakorerwa akazi ziterwa n’aho abantu bakorera n’akazi bakora, hashingiwe ku isesengurangaruka ry’ahashobora guturuka indwara, ubukana bw’indwara mu baturage n’ibyago abakozi ku giti cyabo bafite intege nke bafite byo kwandura COVID-19.

sourceString: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers, for which basic infection prevention measures are recommended, including hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.
targetString: Hakurikijwe Urwego rw’Amerika rushinzwe umutekano n’ubuzima bwiza ahakorerwa akazi (OSHA), akazi karimo ibyago bike byo kwandura virusi kaba ari akazi aho abakozi bategerana cyane n’abantu n’abandi bakozi bakorana, aho ingamba z’ibanze zo kwirinda ubwandu zitegetswe, harimo gukaraba intoki, gushishikariza abakozi kuguma mu rugo igihe barwaye, amabwiriza yo kwirinda indwara z’ubuhumekero no gukora isuku bihoraho no gutera imiti yica udukuko ahakorerwa akazi.

sourceString: Medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact with people who are not known or suspected with COVID-19, but may be infected due to ongoing community transmission or international travel.
targetString: Akazi karimo ibyago biringaniye byo kwandura virusi kaba ari akazi kagusaba guhura kenshi cyangwa kwegerana n’abantu hatazwi cyangwa bikekwa ko banduye COVID-19, ariko bashobora kuba baranduye bitewe ni uko abantu bari kwanduza bagenzi babo cyangwa barakoze ingendo mu mahanga.

sourceString: This includes workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high-population-density work environments, and some high-volume retail settings.
targetString: Harimo abakozi begerena n’abantu muri rusange nk’abakora mu mashuri, abakorera ahaba hari abantu benshi n’amaduka yakira abakiriya benshi.

sourceString: Hazard controls for this group, in addition to basic infection prevention measures, include ventilation using high-efficiency air filters, sneeze guards, and having personal protective equipment available in case a person with COVID-19 is encountered.
targetString: Kurwanya icyorezo kuri abo bakozi byiyongera ku mabwiriza y’ibanze yo kurwanya indwara, harimo gutanga umwuka uhagije hakoreshejwe ibyuma biyungurura umwuka, ibikoresho bigukingira iyo witsamuye no kuba hari imyenda y’ubwirinzi yabugenewe mu gihe uhuye n’umuntu wanduye COVID-19.

sourceString: OSHA considers healthcare and mortuary workers exposed to known or suspected person with COVID-19 to be at high exposure risk, which increases to very high exposure risk if workers perform aerosol-generating procedures on, or collect or handle specimens from, known or suspected person with COVID-19.
targetString: Urwego rwa OSHA rusaba ko abakora mu buvuzi n’uburuhukiro bahuye n’uwanduye cyangwa bikekwa ko yanduye COVID-19 baba bafite ibyago byinshi byo kwandura, bikaba bibongerera ibyago byinshi iyo abo bakozi bakora ibikorwa byo kongerera abarwayi umwuka, gufata cyangwa gusuzuma ibipimo by’umuntu uzwi cyangwa bikekwa ko afite COVID-19.

sourceString: Hazard controls appropriate for these workers include engineering controls such as negative pressure ventilation rooms, and personal protective equipment appropriate to the job task.
targetString: Uburyo bwiza bwo kurwanya icyorezo kuri abo bakozi harimo gukoresha ibikoresho byabugenewe nk’ibyumba bitageramo umwuka n’imyenda y’ubwirinzi yabugenewe ijyanye n’akazi bakora.

sourceString: COVID-19 outbreaks can have several effects within the workplace.
targetString: Icyorezo cya COVID-19 gishobora kugira ingaruka nyinshi ahakorerwa akazi.

sourceString: Workers may be absent from work due to becoming sick, needing to care for others, or from fear of possible exposure.
targetString: Abakozi bashobora kutaza ku kazi bitewe no kurwara, bakeneye kwita ku bandi cyangwa bafite ubwoba bwo kuba bakwandura.

sourceString: Patterns of commerce may change, both in terms of what goods are demanded, and the means of acquiring these goods (such as shopping at off-peak hours or through delivery or drive-through services).
targetString: Imiterere y’ubucuruzi ishobora guhinduka, yaba mu byerekeye uko ibicuruzwa bitumizwa n’uburyo bwo kugura ibyo bicuruzwa (nko guhaha ibicuruzwa mu masaha bitari kugurwa cyane cyangwa serivisi zo kugemura cyangwa gushyikirizwa ibicuruzwa mu modoka).

sourceString: Lastly, shipments of items from geographic areas severely affected by COVID-19 may be interrupted.An infectious disease preparedness and response plan can be used to guide protective actions.
targetString: Hanyuma, kohereza ibicuruzwa bivuye mu duce twashegeshwe n’icyorezo cya COVID-19 bishobora gukomwa mu nkokora. Gahunda yo kwitegura guhangana no kurwanya indwara yandura bishobora kwifashishwa mu bikorwa byo kwirinda.

sourceString: Plans address the levels of risk associated with various worksites and job tasks, including sources of exposure, risk factors arising from home and community settings, and risk factors of individual workers such as old age or chronic medical conditions.
targetString: Gahunda zigaragaza ibyago biri ahantu henshi hakorerwa akazi n’akazi ubwako, harimo aho ushobora kwandura biturutse, ibyago byaturuka mu rugo no mu baturage n’ibyago abakozi bafite ubwabo bitewe n’ubusaza cyangwa kurwara indwara zidakira.

sourceString: They also outline controls necessary to address those risks, and contingency plans for situations that may arise as a result of outbreaks.
targetString: Zinagaragaza imirongo ya ngombwa mu kurwanya indwara hakurwaho ibyo byago n’izindi ngamba zakoreshwa biramutse bitagenze neza mu gihe cy’icyorezo.

sourceString: Infectious disease preparedness and response plans may be subject to national or subnational recommendations.
targetString: Gahunda zo kwitegura no kurwanya indwara yandura zishobora gukurikizwa ku rwego rw’igihugu cyangwa akarere.

sourceString: Objectives for response to an outbreak include reducing transmission among staff, protecting people who are at higher risk for adverse health complications, maintaining business operations, and minimizing adverse effects on other entities in their supply chains.
targetString: Ingamba zo kurwanya icyorezo mu bantu runaka harimo kugabanya kwanduzanya hagati y’abakozi, kurinda abantu bafite ibyago byinshi bitewe n’izindi ndwara barwaye, gukomeza gufungura ibikorwa by’ubucuruzi no kugabanya ingaruka byagira ku bindi bigo mu bikorwa byo gutunganya no kugemura ibicuruzwa.

sourceString: The disease severity in the community where the business is located affects the responses taken.
targetString: Ubukana bw’indwara mu baturage aho ibikorwa by’ubucuruzi biherereye bishobora kugira ingaruka ku ngamba zafashwe.

sourceString: The hierarchy of hazard controls is a framework widely used in occupational safety and health to group hazard controls by effectiveness.
targetString: Urukurikirane rw’ingamba zo kurwanya icyorezo rukoreshwa cyane mu kurwanya icyorezo harindwa umutekano n’ubuzima bwiza bw’ahakorerwa akazi hakurikijwe umusaruro zitanga.

sourceString: Where COVID-19 hazards cannot be eliminated, the most effective controls are engineering controls, followed by administrative controls, and lastly personal protective equipment.
targetString: Aho bidashoboka guhashya icyorezo cya COVID-19, uburyo butanga umusaruro mu kurwanya icyorezo ni ugukoresha ibikoresho byabugenewe, bigakurikirwa n’ingamba z’ubuyobozi n’imyenda y’ubwirinzi yabugenewe.

sourceString: Engineering controls involve isolating employees from work-related hazards without relying on worker behavior, and can be the most cost-effective solution to implement.
targetString: Kurwanya ubwandu hakoreshejwe ibikoresho byabugenewe ni ukurinda abakozi ibyago bijyanye n’akazi hatagendewe ku myitwarire y’umukozi kandi bishobora kudahenda mu kubishyira mu bikorwa.

sourceString: Administrative controls are changes in work policy or procedures that require action by the worker or employer.
targetString: Ingamba z’inzego z’ubuyobozi ni impinduka mu mabwiriza agenga akazi cyangwa imikorere bisaba ko bishyirwa mu bikorwa n’umukozi cyangwa umukoresha.

sourceString: Personal protective equipment (PPE) is considered less effective than engineering and administrative controls, but can help prevent some exposures.
targetString: Imyenda y’ubwirinzi yabugenewe (PPE) ni yo ifatwa ko idatanga umusaruro cyane nk’izo ngambwa ebyiri zabanje, ariko ishobora gufasha mu kwirinda kuba umuntu yakwandura.

sourceString: All types of PPE must be selected based upon the hazard to the worker, properly fitted as applicable (e.g., respirators), consistently and properly worn, regularly inspected, maintained, and replaced, as necessary, and properly removed, cleaned, and stored or disposed of to avoid contamination.
targetString: Amoko yose ya PPE agomba gutoranywa hashingiwe ku byago umukozi afite, bijyanye neza n’akazi akora (urug.: uduhumekero), kuyambara buri gihe kandi neza, guhora igenzurwa, igafatwa neza inahindurwa uko bibaye ngombwa kandi ikavanwamo, igasukurwa ikabikwa cyangwa ikajugunywa mu kugira ngo hirindwekwandura.

sourceString: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers.
targetString: Hakurikijwe ibivugwa n’Urwego rwa OSHA muri Amerika, akazi karimo ibyago bike byo kwandura ni akazi karimo kutegerena cyane n’abantu muri rusange cyangwa n’abo mukorana.

sourceString: Basic infection prevention measures recommended for all workplaces include frequent and thorough hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette including covering coughs and sneezes, providing tissues and trash receptacles, preparing for telecommuting or staggered shifts if needed, discouraging workers from using others' tools and equipment, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.
targetString: Ingamba z’ibanze zo kwirinda ubwandu zigomba kubahirizwa n’ahakorerwa akazi hose kandi harimo gukaraba intoki kenshi, gushishikariza abakozi kuguma mu rugo igihe barwaye, amabwiriza yo kwirinda indwara z’ubuhumekero harimo kwipfuka igihe ukoroye cyangwa witsamuye, gutanga udutumbaro tw’isuku n’aho tujugunywa habugenewe, gutegura guhanahana amakuru hakoreshejwe ikoranabuhanga, kwirinda ko abakozi basimburanwa ku kazi binjirira cyangwa basohokera rimwe niba bikenewe, kubuza abakozi gukoresha ibikoresho bya bagenzi babo no gusukura no gutera umuti wica udukoko kenshi ahakorerwa akazi.

sourceString: Prompt identification and isolation of potentially infectious individuals is a critical step in protecting workers, customers, visitors, and others at a worksite.
targetString: Guhita umenya ukanashyira mu kato abantu bashobora kuba banduye ni igikorwa cy’ingenzi mu kurinda abakozi, abakiriya, abasura n’abandi bari ahakorerwa akazi.

sourceString: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends that employees who have symptoms of acute respiratory illness are to stay home until they are free of fever, signs of a fever, and any other symptoms for at least 24 hours without the use of fever-reducing or other symptom-altering medicines, and that sick leave policies are flexible, permit employees to stay home to care for a sick family member, and that employees are aware of these policies.
targetString: Ikigo cya CDC cyo muri Amerika gisaba ko abakozi bafite ibimenyetso by’indwara y’ubuhumekero ikaze baguma mu rugo kugeza batagifite umuriro, ibimenyetso by’umuriro n’ibindi bimenyetso byibuze bakamara amasaha 24 badakoresheje imiti igabanya umuriro cyangwa indi miti ivura ibimenyetso bafite no koroshya ingamba zo gusaba ikiruhuko cy’uburwayi, guha uruhushya abakozi bakaguma mu rugo hari uwo mu muryango wabo urwaye no kumenyesha abakozi iby’izo ngamba.

sourceString: According to OSHA, medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact within six feet (1.8 m) of people who are not known or suspected COVID-19 patients, but may be infected with SARS-CoV-2 due to ongoing community transmission around the business location, or because the individual has recent international travel to a location with widespread COVID-19 transmission.
targetString: Ku bw’Urwego rwa OSHA, akazi karimo ibyago biringaniye byo kwandura virusi ni akazi kagusaba guhura kenshi cyangwa kwegerana mu ntera itageze muri m 1,8 n’abantu hatazwi cyangwa bikekwa ko banduye COVID-19, ariko bashobora kuba barwaye virusi ya SARS-CoV-2 bitewe no kwanduzanya hagati y’abantu bari ahakorerwa ibikorwa by’ubucuruzi cyangwa kubera ko abantu baherutse gukorera ingendo ahantu harangwa ubwandu bwa COVID-19.

sourceString: These include workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high-population-density work environments, and some high-volume retail settings.Engineering controls for this and higher risk groups include installing high-efficiency air filters, increasing ventilation rates, installing physical barriers such as clear plastic sneeze guards, and installing a drive-through window for customer service.Administrative controls for this and higher risk groups include encouraging sick workers to stay at home, replacing face-to-face meetings with virtual communications, establishing staggered shifts, discontinuing nonessential travel to locations with ongoing COVID-19 outbreaks, developing emergency communications plans including a forum for answering workers’ concerns, providing workers with up-to-date education and training on COVID-19 risk factors and protective behaviors, training workers who need to use protecting clothing and equipment how to use it, providing resources and a work environment that promotes personal hygiene, requiring regular hand washing, limiting customers' and the public's access to the worksite, and posting signage about hand washing and other COVID-19 protective measures.Depending on the work task, workers with at least medium exposure risk may need to wear personal protective equipment including some combination of gloves, a gown, a face shield or face mask, or goggles.
targetString: Harimo abakozi bakunda kwegerana n’abantu muri rusange nk’abakora mu mashuri, abakorera ahaba hari abantu benshi n’amaduka yakira abakiriya benshi. Kurwanya ubwandu hakoreshejwe ibikoresho byabugenewe kuri aba bakozi n’andi matsinda afite ibyago byinshi byo kwandura harimo ibyuma biyungurura umwuka, kongera umubare w’ibyuma bitanga umwuka, no gushyiraho ibigaragaza aho umuntu atarenga nk’ibikoze muri purasitike bigukingira iyo witsamuye no gushyiraho idirishya rigenewe abakiriya bahaha batavuye mu modoka. Ingamba z’ubuyobozi mu kurwanya ubwandu muri aba bakozi n’andi matsinda y’abakozi afite ibyago byinshi byo kwandura harimo gushishikariza abakozi barwaye kuguma mu rugo, guhindura inama zabaga imbonankubone zikaba hakoreshejwe ikoranabuhanga, kwirinda ko abakozi basimburanwa ku kazi binjirira cyangwa basohokera icyarimwe, guhagarika ingendo zitari ngombwa ujya ahari icyorezo cya COVID-19, gushyiraho gahunda yo guhanahana amakuru mu buryo bwihutirwa harimo ihuriro risubiza impungenge z’abakozi, guha abakozi ubumenyi bugezweho n’amahugurwa ku byago byo kwandura no kwirinda COVID-19, guhugura abakozi bakeneye gukoresha imyenda y’ubwirinzi yabugenewe, ubaha ibikoresho n’aho gukorera habafasha kugira isuku bwite isaba gukaraba intoki kenshi, kugabanya umubare w’abakiriya n’abagera ahantu rusange ku kazi no gushyiraho ibyapa bikangurira abantu gukaraba intoki n’izindi ngamba zo kwirinda COVID-19. Bitewe n’akazi, abakozi byibuze bafite ibyago biringaniye byo kwandura virusi bashobora kwambara imyenda y’ubwirinzi yabugenewe harimo kwambarira icyarimwe uturindantoki, ikanzu, masike cyangwa agapfukamunwa cyangwa amataratara.

sourceString: Workers in this risk group rarely require use of respirators.
targetString: Abakozi bari muri iri tsinda ry’abafite ibyago basabwa gake gukoresha agahumekero.

sourceString: If a person becomes sick on an airplane, proper controls to protect workers and other passengers include separating the sick person from others by a distance of 6 feet, designating one crew member to serve the sick person, and offering a face mask to the sick person or asking the sick person to cover their mouth and nose with tissues when coughing or sneezing.
targetString: Iyo umuntu arwaye ari mu ndege, hagomba gushyirwaho ingamba ziboneye zo kurinda abakozi n’abandi bagenzi harimo gushyira umurwayi ahawenyine ntakomeze kuba hamwe n’abandi agasigamo intera ya metero 2, hagashyirwaho ukora mu ndege umwe akaba ari we uha umurwayi ibyo akeneye, kumuha agapfukamunwa cyangwa kumusabai kwipfuka umunwa n’amazuru akoresheje udutambaro igihe akoroye cyangwa yitsamuye.

sourceString: Cabin crew should wear disposable medical gloves when tending to a sick traveler or touching body fluids or potentially contaminated surfaces, and possibly additional personal protective equipment if the sick traveler has fever, persistent cough, or difficulty breathing.
targetString: Abakora mu ndege bagomba kwambara uturindantoki two kwa muganga dutabwa tumaze gukoreshwa igihe bari gufasha umurwayi uri mu ndege cyangwa gukora ku matembabuzi yo mu mubiri cyangwa gukora ahantu hashobora kuba handuye no kwambara imyenda y’ubwirinzi yabugenewe igihe ari ngombwa iyo umurwayi uri mu ndege afite umuriro, inkorora y’akayi cyangwa guhumeka nabi.

sourceString: Gloves and other disposable items should be disposed of in a biohazard bag, and contaminated surfaces should be cleaned and disinfected afterwards.For commercial shipping, including cruise ships and other passenger vessels, hazard controls include postponing travel when sick, and self-isolating and informing the onboard medical center immediately if one develops a fever or other symptoms while on board.
targetString: Uturindantoki n’ibindi bikoresho bitabwa bimaze gukoreshwa bigomba gushyirwa mu ishashi yabugenewe kandi ahantu handuye hagomba guhanagurwa no guterwa umuti wica udukoko nyuma yo kuhakoresha. Ku mato atwara abagenzi, harimo n’amato atembereza ba mukerarugendo n’andi mato atwara abagenzi, kurwanya virusi harimo gusubika ingendo igihe hari urwaye no kwishyira mu kato no kubimenyesha ivuriro ryo mu bwato ako kanya iyo hari umuntu ugize umuriro cyangwa ugaragaje ibindi bimenyetso ari mu bwato.

sourceString: Ideally, medical follow-up should occur in the isolated person's cabin.For schools and childcare facilities, CDC recommends short-term closure to clean or disinfect if an infected person has been in a school building regardless of community spread.
targetString: Ibyiza ni uko yakurikiranwa n’abaganga igihe uwo muntu yashyizwe mu cyumba cya wenyine. Ku bigo by’amashuri n’amarerero, Ikigo cya CDC gisaba ko afungwa by’igihe gito kugira ngo asukurwe cyangwa aterwemo umuti wica udukoko igihe umuntu wanduye agaragaye mu nyubako y’ishuri hatitwawe ku kuba umuntu yanduza mugenzi we.

sourceString: When there is minimal to moderate community transmission, social distancing strategies can be implemented such as canceling field trips, assemblies, and other large gatherings such as physical education or choir classes or meals in a cafeteria, increasing the space between desks, staggering arrival and dismissal times, limiting nonessential visitors, and using a separate health office location for children with flu-like symptoms.
targetString: Nubwo haba hari umubare muto cyangwa munini wo kwanduzanya hagati y’abantu, ingamba zo kwirinda kwegerana zishobora gukurikizwa hahagarikwa ingendoshuri n’amateraniro y’abantu benshi nk’imyitozo ngororamubiri cyangwa amasomo yo kuririmba muri korari cyangwa gufatira amafunguro muri kantine, kongera umwanya hagati y’intebe n’indi, gusiga umwanya hari uwinjiye cyangwa usohotse, kureka ibyo gusura bitari ngombwa no gukoresha ivuriro riri ahandi ku bana bagaragaza ibimenyetso bimeze nk’iby’ibicurane.

sourceString: When there is substantial transmission in the local community, in addition to social distancing strategies, extended school dismissals may be considered.For law enforcement personnel performing daily routine activities, the immediate health risk is considered low by CDC.
targetString: Iyo hari ukwanduzanya mu baturage bo mu gace runaka, usibye ingamba zo kwirinda kwegerana gufunga amashuri igihe kirekire bishobora gutekerezwaho. Ku bakora mu nzego z’umutekano bakora buri munsi akazi gahoraho, ibyago byo kwandura ako kanya ni bike hakurikijwe ibitangazwa n’Ikigo cya CDC.

sourceString: Law enforcement officials who must make contact with individuals confirmed or suspected to have COVID-19 are recommended to follow the same guidelines as emergency medical technicians, including proper personal protective equipment.
targetString: Abashinzwe umutekano bahuye n’umuntu byemejwe ko yanduye cyangwa bikekwa ko afite COVID-19 basabwa kubahiriza amabwiriza amwe nk’ay’abaganga bakora aho bikomeye, harimo kwambara imyenda y’ubwirinzi yabugenewe.

sourceString: If close contact occurs during apprehension, workers should clean and disinfect their duty belt and gear prior to reuse using a household cleaning spray or wipe, and follow standard operating procedures for the containment and disposal of used PPE and for containing and laundering clothes.
targetString: Iyo habayeho kwegerana mu gihe cyo gufata umuntu, abakozi bagomba guhanagura no gutera umuti wica udukuko imikandara baba bambaye n’ibikoresho byabo mbere yo kongera kubikoresha bakoresheje imiti ihanagura ikoreshwa mu rugo cyangwa udutambaro duhanagura no gukurikiza amabwiriza asanzwe yo kubika no guta imyenda y’ubwirinzi yabugenewe yakoreshejwe no kubika no kumesa imyenda.

sourceString: OSHA considers certain healthcare and mortuary workers to be at high or very high categories of exposure risk.
targetString: Urwego rwa OSHA rusaba ko bamwe mu bakora mu nzego z’ubuzima n’uburuhukiro bari mu byiciro byo hejuru cyangwa hejuru cyane byo kuba bafite ibyago byo kwandura.

sourceString: High exposure risk jobs include healthcare delivery, support, laboratory, and medical transport workers who are exposed to known or suspected COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Akazi karimo ibyago byinshi byo kwandura harimo abakora mu buvuzi, muri raboratwari, n’abatwara abagiye cyangwa bavuye kwa muganga bashobora kuba bahuye n’umuntu bizwi ko arwaye cyangwa bikweka ko arwaye COVID-19.

sourceString: These become very high exposure risk if workers perform aerosol-generating procedures on, or collect or handle specimens from, known or suspected COVID-19 patients.
targetString: Abo baba bafite ibyago byinshi byo kwandura iyo abakora ako kazi bakora ibikorwa birimo kongerera abarwayi umwuka, gufata cyangwa gusuzuma ibipimo by’umuntu bizwi ko arwaye cyangwa bikekwa ko arwaye COVID-19.

sourceString: Aerosol-generating procedures include intubation, cough induction procedures, bronchoscopies, some dental procedures and exams, or invasive specimen collection.
targetString: Ibikorwa byo kongerera abarwayi umwuka harimo kumushyira uduheha mu mubiri, gutuma akorora, kumushyiramo uduheha ahumekeramo, bumwe mu buvuzi bw’amenyo no kuyasuzuma cyangwa gufata ibipimo by’imbere mu mubiri.

sourceString: High exposure risk mortuary jobs include workers involved in preparing the bodies of people who had known or suspected cases of COVID-19 at the time of their death; these become very high exposure risk if they perform an autopsy.Additional engineering controls for these risk groups include isolation rooms for patients with known or suspected COVID-19, including when aerosol-generating procedures are performed.
targetString: Ibyago byinshi byo kwandurira mu buruhukiro bifitwe n’abakozi bategura imibiri y’abantu bazwiho cyangwa bikekwa ko banduye COVID-19 ubwo bapfaga; bagira ibyago biri hejuru igihe bakora ibizamini byo kureba ikishe umuntu. Kandi kurwanya ubwandu hakoreshejwe ibikoresho byabugenewe harimo amatsinda y’ibyago hakubiyemo ibyumba by’akato ku barwayi bazwiho kurwara cyangwa bakekwaho kurwara COVID-19, harimo gukora ibikorwa byo kongerera umwuka abarwayi.

sourceString: Specialized negative pressure ventilation may be appropriate in some healthcare and mortuary settings.
targetString: Igikoresho gitanga umwuka cyihariye gishobora kuba kiboneye kuri bamwe mu bavuzi n’abakora mu buruhukiro.

sourceString: Specimens should be handled with Biosafety Level 3 precautions.
targetString: Ibipimo bigomba gufatwa hakurikijwe amabwiriza yo mu rwego rwa 3 rw’umutekano wo kwa muganga.

sourceString: The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends that incoming patients be separated into distinct waiting areas depending on whether they are a suspected COVID-19 case.In addition to other PPE, OSHA recommends respirators for those who work within 6 feet of patients known to be, or suspected of being, infected with SARS-CoV-2, and those performing aerosol-generating procedures.
targetString: OMS isaba ko abarwayi baza mu bitaro bashyirwa ukwabo aho bategerereza bitewe no kuba bakekwaho COVID-19. Kandi yaba imyenda y’ubwirinzi yabugenewe, Urwego rwa OSHA rusaba gukoresha uduhumekero ku bakorera mu ntera itageze muri metero 2 y’abazwiho kurwara cyangwa bikekwa ko barwaye, banduye virusi ya SARS-CoV-2 n’abakora ibikorwa byo kongerera umwuka abarwayi.

sourceString: In the United States, NIOSH-approved N95 filtering facepiece respirators or better must be used in the context of a comprehensive, written respiratory protection program that includes fit-testing, training, and medical exams.
targetString: Muri Amerika, uduhumekero twemejwe n’Urwego rwa NIOSH two mu bwoko bwa N95 cyangwa utwiza kurushaho tugomba gukoreshwa hakurikijwe gahunda iboneye, yanditse yo kwirinda hakoreshejwe uduhumekero harimo gusuzuma ko gakwiye ukambara, guhugurwa uko kambarwa n’ibizamini byo kwa muganga.

sourceString: Other types of respirators can provide greater protection and improve worker comfort.The WHO does not recommend coveralls, as COVID-19 is a respiratory disease rather than being transmitted through bodily fluids.
targetString: Ubundi bwoko bw’uduhumekero dushobora kurinda utwambaye neza kurushaho no gutuma umukozi yumva yisanzuye kurushaho. OMS ntisaba ko abakozi bambara amakanzu kuko COVID-19 ari indwara y’ubuhumekero aho kuba ari indwara yandura binyuze mu matembabuzi y’umubiri.

sourceString: WHO recommends only a surgical mask for point-of-entry screening personnel.
targetString: OMS isaba ko hambarwa gusa udupfukamunwa two kwa muganga ku bakozi bakira abagana ibigo bitandukanye.

sourceString: For those who are collecting respiratory specimens from, caring for, or transporting COVID-19 patients without any aerosol-generating procedures, WHO recommends a surgical mask, goggles, or face shield, gown, and gloves.
targetString: Ku bafata ibipimo byo mu myanya y’ubuhumekero, abita ku barwayi, cyangwa abatwara abarwayi ba COVID-19 batabongerera umwuka, OMS isaba ko bambara agapfukamunwa ko kwa muganga, amataratara cyangwa kasike, ikanzu n’uturindantoki.

sourceString: If an aerosol-generating procedure is performed, the surgical mask is replaced with an N95 or FFP2 respirator.
targetString: Iyo hakozwe igikorwa cyo kongerera umwuka umurwayi, agapfukamunwa ko kwa muganga gasimburwa n’uduhumekero twa N95 cyangwa FFP2.

sourceString: Given that the global supply of PPE is insufficient, WHO recommends minimizing the need for PPE through telemedicine, physical barriers such as clear windows, allowing only those involved in direct care to enter a room with a COVID-19 patient, using only the PPE necessary for the specific task, continuing use of the same respirator without removing it while caring for multiple patients with the same diagnosis, monitoring and coordinating the PPE supply chain, and discouraging the use of masks for asymptomatic individuals.
targetString: Bitewe ni uko kugemura imyenda y’ubwirinzi yabugenewe (PPE) bidahagije ku isi, OMS isaba ko hagabanywa ibituma hakenerwa imyenda y’ubwirinzi yabugenewe hagakoreshwa ubuvuzi bw’iyakure, gushyiraho ibituma abantu bategerena nk’amadirishya abonerana, no gutuma abatanga ubuvuzi butaziguye ari bo bonyine binjira mu cyumba kirimo umurwayi wa COVID-19, gukoresha PPE igihe ari ngombwa gusa mu kazi kihariye, gukomeza gukoresha agahumekero kamwe nta kukavanamo igihe uri kwita ku barwayi benshi barwaye kimwe, kubakurikirana no guhuza ibikorwa byo gukora no kugemura PPE no kubuza ikoreshwa ry’udupfukamunwa ku batagaragaza ibimenyetso.

sourceString: FROM: Katherine Maher, Wikimedia Foundation CEO
targetString: BYANDITSWE NA: Katherine Maher, Umuyobozi Mukuru wa Wikimedia Foundation

sourceString: TO: All Wikimedia Foundation staff
targetString: BYANDIKIWE: Abakozi ba Wikimedia Foundation bose

sourceString: SUBJECT LINE: [Covid-19] Lightening the load and preparing for the future
targetString: IMPAMVU: [Covid-19] Kugabanya umutwaro no kwitegura ahazaza

sourceString: SEND DATE/TIME: 14 March, 2020, 00:24 UTC
targetString: ISAHA/ITARIKI BYOHEREREJWEHO: 14 Werurwe 2020, 00:24 UTC

sourceString: LICENSING: CC0: No rights reserved
targetString: URUHUSHYA: CC0: Nta burenganzira bwihariye bw’umuhanzi

sourceString: We find ourselves in remarkable circumstances this month.
targetString: Twisanze mu bihe bidasanzwe muri uku kwezi.

sourceString: The COVID-19 epidemic is something that makes clear our global human interconnectedness and the responsibilities we have to one another.
targetString: Icyorezo cya COVID-19 ni ikintu kigaragaza neza ko isi yabaye umudugudu kandi ko tugomba gufashanya.

sourceString: We don’t have precedent for its challenges, but we do know that our best response relies on the sort of global empathy, cooperation, and community building that sits at the heart of this organization.
targetString: Ntabwo twigeze duhura n’izi mbogamizi, ariko tuzi ko guhangana n’icyorezo mu buryo bwiza ari ukumva ibibazo biri hirya no hino ku isi, gufatanya no gukomeza kunga ubumwe muri uyu muryango.

sourceString: The camaraderie and care we have seen among all of our colleagues over email, calls, and chats is a remarkable validation of the incredible humans we are fortunate enough to work with.
targetString: Ubusabane no kwita ku bandi twabonye mu bo dukorana bose hakoreshejwe imeyiri, guhamagara no kuganira ni ikigaragaza ubumuntu budasanzwe twagize amahirwe yo gukorana namwe bihagijea.

sourceString: I couldn’t be more grateful and proud to count you all as colleagues.
targetString: Ntabwo nabona uko mbashimira cyangwa ngongaragaze uko ntewe ishema namwe mwese nk’abantu dukorana.

sourceString: Last week, someone shared with me their appreciation for our work.
targetString: Icyumweru gishize, hari umuntu wangaragarije uko yishimira akazi dukora.

sourceString: They reminded me how meaningful it is for the world to be able to turn to Wikipedia right now, and what a powerful symbol it is for this critical resource to remain online and available to all.
targetString: Yanyibukije uko muri iki gihe isi yose iri kwifashisha cyane Wikipedia, bikaba ari ikimenyetso gikomeye cy’uko ari urubuga rutanga amakuru y’ingirakamaro kandi rugomba kuguma kuri interineti no kuboneka kuri bose.

sourceString: Your work makes this possible, whether you keep the sites stay up or our colleagues paid or our communities safe.
targetString: Akazi mukora ni ko gatuma bishoboka, yaba ari ugukomeza gutuma urubuga rukora cyangwa abo dukorana bishyurwa cyangwa aho dukorera hagira umutekano.

sourceString: The world needs the information that Wikipedia provides, now more than ever.
targetString: Isi ikeneye amakuru atangwa na Wikipedia muri iki gihe kurusha igihe cyabayeho cyose.

sourceString: This is a moment in which not only what we do, but how we do it, will make a meaningful impact on the world.
targetString: Iki ni igihe kitari ukureba gusa ibyo dukora, ahubwo tunareba uko tubikoramo, bizatuma tugira impinduka y’ingirakamaro ku isi.

sourceString: Because of the importance of this mission and your role in it, we will be making some significant adjustments to how we work together, starting this coming week.
targetString: Kubera akamaro k’izi nshingano n’uruhare ubifitemo, tugiye kugira ibyo duhindura bya ngombwa byerekeye uko dukorana, guhera mu cyumweru gitaha.

sourceString: Adjustments to our work and schedules
targetString: Kugira ibyo duhindura ku byo dukora n’ingengabihe yacu

sourceString: As Robyn mentioned previously, the c-team met last night to discuss our approach and schedule for the coming days and months.
targetString: Nk’uko Robyn yabivuze, itsinda ryacu ryahuye mu ijoro ryakeye mu kungurana ibitekerezo ku buryo bwacu n’ingengabihe yacu y’iminsi n’amezi biri imbere.

sourceString: In that conversation, we considered what we thought would be an appropriate response to what we’re facing and the best way to keep the organization sustainable during this time.
targetString: Muri icyo kiganiro, twasuzumye ibyo twatekereje ko byaba ari igisubizo kiboneye ku byo turi guhurana na byo n’uburyo bwiza bwo gukomeza gutuma umuryango uramba muri ibi bihe.

sourceString: Overwhelmingly we wanted to remove stress and support our mission for the long term.
targetString: Mu buryo budasanzwe, twifuzaga kuvanaho imbogamizi no gushyigikira inshingano zacu igihe kirekire.

sourceString: If you need to dial back, that’s okay.
targetString: Niba wifuza guhamagara, ntacyo bitwaye.

sourceString: For all staff, contractors, and contract workers:
targetString: Ku bakozi, abahawe amasezerano n’abakorera ku masezerano bose:

sourceString: our daily working expectations will be about 4 hours a day, or 20 hours a week until further notice.
