targetString: amasaha twiteze ko umuntu azajya akora buri munsi ni amasaha 4 cyangwa amasaha 20 mu cyumweru kugeza hatanzwe andi mabwiriza.

sourceString: We’re not declaring a holiday - if you are able to work more normal hours, the mission can use you.
targetString: Ntitwavuga ko ari ikiruhuko; niba ushoboye gukora amasaha asanzwe twakwifashisha mu nshingano dufite.

sourceString: However, the world is unpredictable right now, and whether you need to care for loved ones, get groceries, or go to the doctor, your well-being is our priority.
targetString: Ariko, muri iki gihe ibibera ku isi biri gutungurana kandi ubaye ukeneye kwita ku bo ukunda, guhaha ibiribwa cyangwa kujya kwa mu ganga; ubuzima bwawe ni bwo bushyizwe imbere.

sourceString: We are not tracking your time.
targetString: Ntituri gukurikirana igihe ukora.

sourceString: If you are sick, do not work.
targetString: Niba urwaye, ntujye ku kazi.

sourceString: This should go without saying, but we’re saying it.
targetString: Ntibyakavuzwe ariko tubikomojeho.

sourceString: No sick days or PTO required - just tell your manager and help your team revise calendars and schedules to make sure key areas of work are covered.
targetString: Si ngombwa ko usaba ikiruhuko cy’uburwayi cyangwa cyishyurwa, ukwiye kubibwira umuyobozi wawe maze agafasha itsinda ryawe gusubiramo indangaminsi n’ingengabihe ku buryo akazi k’ibanze gakomeza gukorwa.

sourceString: (If you are diagnosed positive for COVID-19, please let Bryan within T&C Ops know so T&C can help with support and make sure your situation gets appropriate attention from management).
targetString: (Iyo upimwe bakagusangamo COVID-19, bimenyeshe Bryan ukora muri T&C Ops kugira ngo T&C iguhe ubufasha mu kibazo ufite no kwitabwaho n’ubuyobozi mu buryo bukwiye).

sourceString: Hourly folks will be fully paid.
targetString: Abishyurwa ku isaha bazishyurwa amafaranga yose.

sourceString: We have already said, and are recommitting to honor our commitments to our contractors and hourly staff colleagues.
targetString: Twabigarutseho kandi twongeye kwiyemeza kubahiriza inshingano zacu dufitiye abo twagiranye amasezerano na bagenzi bacu bishyurwa ku isaha.

sourceString: Everyone will be paid on the basis of their usual hours worked during normal circumstances.
targetString: Buri wese azishyurwa hashingiwe ku masaha nyirizina yakoze mu bihe bisanzwe.

sourceString: This includes if you are sick and unable to work.
targetString: Harimo n’igihe urwaye utanabasha gukora.

sourceString: If you want to work, we support you.
targetString: Niba wifuza gukora, turagushyigikiye.

sourceString: Many people use work as a way of channeling their stress with the world around us.
targetString: Abantu benshi bifashisha akazi nk’uburyo bwo kwiyibagiza umuhangayiko ubagaragiye muri iyi isi.

sourceString: What we do can be incredibly rewarding, especially during times like this.
targetString: Ibyo dukora bishobora kugira akamaro kanini cyane by’umwihariko muri ibi bihe.

sourceString: Again, this is about your self-care.
targetString: Na none, ikigamijwe ni uko wiyitaho.

sourceString: Our ask is that you communicate with your manager, so we know what to expect and can adjust accordingly.
targetString: Inshangano zacu ni uko wavugana n’umuyobozi wawe, kugira ngo tumenye icyo twakwitega no guhindura imikorere mu buryo bukwiye.

sourceString: Some work is considered essential.
targetString: Hari akazi gafatwa nk’ingenzi.

sourceString: There are some things that we must keep doing.
targetString: Hari ibintu dukwiye gukomeza gukora.

sourceString: The SRE, HR Ops, Trust & Safety, and Fundraising teams (among others) do critical work that may need additional support.
targetString: Amatsinda ya SRE, HR Ops, Trust & Safety n’ashinzwe gukusanya inkunga (hamwe n’ayandi) akora akazi k’ingenzi gakenera ubundi bufasha.

sourceString: We’ll begin a process with all departments to assess current objectives and shift our focus to supporting what’s essential for our mission.
targetString: Tuzatangira kugenzura mu mashami yose kugira ngo dusuzume intego ziriho no guhindura ibyo twibandaho mu rwego rwo gufasha iby’ingenzi mu nshingano dufite.

sourceString: There’s plenty to do for all of us, we just will all focus on the most essential projects.
targetString: Hari iby’ingenzi twese tugomba gukora, ariko hari imishinga y’ingenzi tugomba kwibandaho.

sourceString: Slowing now won’t hurt later.
targetString: Gukora ibikorwa bike ubu nta ngaruka bizateza.

sourceString: We do not plan to go “double-time to catch up” once the pandemic has passed.
targetString: Ntiduteganya “gukora hafi inshuro ebyiri kugira ngo twisubize igihe twatakaje” icyorezo nikirangira.

sourceString: You will not be expected to work extra hours to meet deadlines which are now unrealistic.
targetString: Ntiwitezweho gukora amasaha y’ikirenga kugira ngo igihe wahawe kitakurengana kuko ubu bitashoboka.

sourceString: We accept that circumstances have changed, and will work to set new targets and timelines where appropriate.
targetString: Twemera ko ibintu byahindutse kandi tuzakora kugira ngo dushyireho intego n’ingengabihe bishya aho biboneye.

sourceString: What happens with the APP (Annual Planning)?
targetString: Bizagenda bite ku igenamigambi ry’umwaka?

sourceString: To adjust to our new reality and daily working hour expectations, we intend to adjust the timeline for the delivery of our 2020-2021 Annual Plan.
targetString: Kugira ngo duhindure duhuze ni uko ibintu bisigaye bimeze n’amasaha y’akazi ya buri munsi, turifuza guhindura ingengabihe y’igenamigambi ry’umwaka wa 2020-2021.

sourceString: Our intention is to propose an extension of our 2019-2020 plan that allows more time for budgeting to allow employees to prioritize critical work, self-care, and care for loved ones while accommodating those who need or wish to work a reduced schedule over the next few weeks.
targetString: Icyo tugamije ni ugusaba ko igihe cy’igenamigambi ryo mu 2019-2020 cyongerwa kugira ngo haboneke igihe cyo kugena ingengo y’imari mu gutuma abakozi bashyira imbere akazi k’ibanze, kwiyitaho no kwita ku bo bakunda mu gihe dufasha abashaka cyangwa abifuza gukora amasaha make mu byumweru bike biri imbere.

sourceString: This timeline extension greatly reduces current planning workloads and pressure across the whole organization.
targetString: Uko kongera ingengabihe bigabanya cyane akazi kari gateganyijwe n’igitutu mu muryango wose.

sourceString: We will introduce our proposal to the Board next week and will update delegates and teams on the next steps as soon as we have confirmation.
targetString: Tuzageza icyifuzo cyacu ku Nama y’ubuyobozi mu cyumweru gitaha kandi nzaha amakuru mashya abahagarariye abandi n’amatsinda ku mabwiriza akurikiyeho vuba bishoboka nibimara kwemezwa.

sourceString: Thank you to the APP team for your leadership in this.
targetString: Itsinda rishinzwe igenamigambi ryagize neza ku bushobozi bw’imiyoborere ryagaragaje.

sourceString: Office status, exposure, and cleaning
targetString: Imimerere y’ibiro, uko abantu bashobora kwandura indwara no gukora isuku

sourceString: Last week, we learned that one of our SF-based colleagues may have been exposed to the COVID-19 virus.
targetString: Mu cyumweru gishize, twamenye ko umwe mu bo dukorana ukorera muri SF yahuye n’umuntu ushobora kuba waramwanduje virusi ya COVID-19.

sourceString: However, out of an abundance of caution, we employed an antiviral cleaning crew to disinfect all surfaces in the San Francisco office.
targetString: Ariko, bitewe no kwitwararika cyane, twahaye akazi itsinda rishinzwe isuku yo kurwanya virusi kugira ngo ritere umuti wica udukuko ahantu hose mu biro byo muri San Francisco.

sourceString: They utilized a hospital-grade anti-viral solution to disinfect every surface, as well as the lobby and elevator banks accessing our floor.
targetString: Bakoresheje uburyo bwo kurwanya virusi buri ku rwego rw’ibitaro maze bica udukuko ahantu hose, aho abantu binjirira no muri esanseri za banki zigera kuri etaje dukoreramo.

sourceString: The building is employing its own duty-of-care protocol utilizing products that support the safety of their tenants.
targetString: Inyubako iri gukoresha amabwiriza yo kurwanya virusi hakoreshejwe ibikoresho bibungabunga umutekano w’ababikoresha.

sourceString: We feel comfortable that the office will be well-prepared for when we decide to return.
targetString: Dufite icyizere ko ibiro bizaba biteguye neza niduhitamo kubisubiramo.

sourceString: Our DC office is located in a WeWork, which has shared its COVID-19 protocol with us and all DC-based staff members.
targetString: Ibiro byo muri DC byacu biherereye muri WeWork, byasangije porotokore yabyo yo kurwanya COVID-19 natwe ndetse n’abakozi bose bakorera muri DC.

sourceString: As of last week, our DC office moved to a fully remote setup in line with the guidance shared with San Francisco.
targetString: Kugeza mu cyumweru gishize, ibiro byacu byo muri DC byarahinduye bikora ku buryo busesuye hakoreshejwe iyakure mu rwego rwo kubahiriza amabwiriza yatanzwe na San Francisco.

sourceString: As some of our NYC-based colleagues know, we have also been in discussion about leasing a location in Brooklyn.
targetString: Nk’uko bamwe mu bo dukorana bakorera muri NYC babizi, twari twatangiye ibiganiro byo gukodesha inzu muri Brooklyn.

sourceString: These discussions are continuing but may be delayed.
targetString: Ibyo biganiro birakomeje ariko bishobora gutinda.

sourceString: Some of our colleagues are working remotely for the first time.
targetString: Bamwe mu bo dukorana bari gukora hakoreshejwe iyakure ku nshuro yabo ya mbere.

sourceString: Our long-time remote colleagues know that it can be an adjustment, and wanted to offer you some advice:
targetString: Abo dukorana basanzwe bakoresha iyakure barabizi ko bishobora guhindurwa kandi turifuza kubagira inama:

sourceString: Limit the length of meetings to at most one or two hour increments.
targetString: Mugabanye igihe inama imara ijye imara isaha imwe cyangwa ebyiri igihe yatinze.

sourceString: If longer sessions are required, consider how they can be broken up over the course of several days.
targetString: Niba sesiyo zitagikenewe, mwatekereza uko mwazigabanya mo amasomo yigwa mu minsi myinshi.

sourceString: Clearly define the meeting, have an agenda, and send reading materials in advance.
targetString: Gusobanura neza inama, kugira umurongo w’ibyigwa usobanuye neza no kohereza inyandiko zayo mbere y’igihe.

sourceString: Make video the default, with tools like Google Docs and Zoom to facilitate live collaboration and connection.
targetString: Reka gukoresha videwo ari byo biba iby’ibanze ukoresheje porogaramu nka Google Docs na Zoom mu koroshya imikoranire no gusangira amakuru mu buryo bw’ako kanya.

sourceString: Have a lead to facilitate every meeting, someone to monitor the chat for questions and track the speaker list, and someone to help take notes (or do collaborative note-taking).
targetString: Kureka umuyobozi mukuru akaba ari we uyobora buri nama, hakagira umuntu ureba ku biganiro ahabazwa ibibazo no gukurikirana urutonde rw’abari buvuge n’umuntu ufata ibyavugiwe mu nama (cyangwa ufatanya n’abandi mu kwandika ibyavugiwe mu nama.

sourceString: Send an email to tech support if you need a comfortable headset.
targetString: Koherereza imeyiri abatanga ubufasha mu bya tekiniki igihe ukeneye ekuteri zivuga neza.

sourceString: Use your wellness reimbursement for snacks.
targetString: Gufata amafunguro yoroheje kugira ngo ukomeze kugira ubuzima bwiza.

sourceString: Join the #remoties channel in Slack to talk with your colleagues about distributed work
targetString: Kujya ku muyoboro wa #remoties kuri porogaramu ya Slack kugira ngo uvuge imbogamizi uhura na zo mu gukora akazi wahawe

sourceString: The HR Operations team is looking into webinar-based ergonomics guidance to support the increase in distributed work across the Foundation.
targetString: Ibikorwa by’itsinda rishinzwe abakozi risuzuma amabwiriza agenga imigendekere y’amahugurwa atangirwa kuri interineti mu rwego rwo gufata ubufasha no kongera akazi gatangwa mu Muryango.

sourceString: This past week we asked all community grant recipients to cancel Wikimedia-funded public events, such as editathons, until the WHO declares the pandemic to be over.
targetString: Iki cyumweru gishize, twasabye ibigo byose bihabwa inkunga guhagarika ibikorwa rusange bigamije gushakira inkunga Wikimedia nk’amahugurwa yo guhugura abanditsi bo kuri interineti bashya, kugeza OMS itangaje ko icyorezo kirangiye.

sourceString: We let them know that we understood that our request for cancellations and other restrictions could make it impossible to complete their agreed-upon grant activities and that no one would be penalized for having to delay or modify those goals.
targetString: Twababwiye ko tuzi ko kubasaba guhagarika ibyo bikorwa no kubahiriza andi mabwiriza bituma bitoroha na gato gusoza ibikorwa byo gukusanya inkunga biyemeje kandi nta muntu n’umwe uzabahanira ko batinze cyangwa bahinduye intego bari bihaye.

sourceString: This coming week we will follow up with additional guidance on Wikimania and other regional and thematic community conferences.
targetString: Icyumweru gitaha, tuzakurikirana andi mabwiriza kuri Wikimania n’izindi nama zo mu karere n’izihariye mu duce runaka.

sourceString: The general sentiment from around the global community seems to be both sadness at the disruption but relief at the clarity and ability to focus on their own communities, Wikimedia and otherwise.
targetString: Imitekerereze rusange ku miryango yo ku isi ni akababaro ku bwo guhagarika ibikorwa ariko hari ihumure, gusobanukirwa neza n’ubushobozi bwo kwibanda ku miryango yabo bwite, Wikimedia n’indi.

sourceString: Going forward, the CRT is working to set up a page on Meta-Wiki to provide a space for the community to monitor the impact and follow our communications with them.
targetString: Bityo, CRT iri gushyiraho paji kuri Meta-Wiki kugira ngo ihe umwanya umuryango wo gukurikirana ingaruka no gukurikirana amakuru duhana nawo.

sourceString: Staying in touch around COVID-19 related issues
targetString: Gukomeza guhanahana amakuru ku bibazo bya COVID-19

sourceString: We’ll be sending an invitation to your calendars for next Thursday, 14:00 UTC/07:00 PT for a special staff meeting.
targetString: Tuzohereza ubutumire ku ndangaminsi yawe ku wa kane utaha, saa 14:00 UTC/07:00 PT ku nama idasanzwe y’abakozi.

sourceString: We’ll use this time to share additional updates, answer your questions and spend some time connecting with each other.
targetString: Tuzifashisha uwo mwanya mu kubagezaho amakuru mashya, gusubiza ibibazo mufite no kumarana undi mwanya duhanahana amakuru.

sourceString: We’re in this together and here to help however we can.
targetString: Twese twifatanyije muri iki cyorezo kandi turahari kugira ngo dufatanye uko dushoboye.

sourceString: In the meantime, you can continue to find the information from this email, and all other essential COVID-19 related information, on Office Wiki.
targetString: Hagati aho, ushobora gukomeza kubona amakuru akubiye muri iyi imeyiri n’andi makuru ya ngombwa yerekeye COVID-19 ku Biro bya Wiki.

sourceString: The CRT will keep these pages updated and all the information in one place.
targetString: CRT izakomeza gutuma izi paji zishyirwaho amakuru mashya kandi amakuru yose azaba ari ahantu hamwe.

sourceString: We are also working to maintain regular communications with staff who reside in countries that are currently significantly affected.
targetString: Turi noi gushaka uburyo twakomeza guhana amakuru n’abakozi batuye mu bihugu kuri ubu byugarijwe n’icyorezo.

sourceString: If you have any questions about travel, events, a major workstream, or coverage challenge, or anything else you may need help with, please don’t hesitate to notify and work with the CRT.
targetString: Niba ufite ikibazo ku byerekeye ingendo, ibikorwa, imikorere cyangwa ikibazo cya interineti cyangwa ikindi icyo ari cyo cyose ukeneye gufashwamo, ntutinde kubitumenyesha no gukorana na CRT.

sourceString: We’re here to help provide support and liaise as needed.
targetString: Turi hano kugira ngo tuguhe ubufasha tunahuze ibikorwa mu buryo bukenewe.

sourceString: If you have a confidential or sensitive matter, please email Bryan Judan - Director of HR International Global Operations.
targetString: Niba ufite ikibazo cy’ibanga cyangwa kigomba kwitonderwa, oherereza imeyiri Bryan Judan, Umuyobozi Mukuru ushinzwe abakozi n’ibikorwa ku rwego rw’isi.

sourceString: None of these changes should be seen as an abandonment of our work and obligations.
targetString: Nta mpinduka n’imwe muri izi igomba kubonwa nko kureka akazi dukora cyangwa inshingano dufite.

sourceString: Rather, they are a recognition that at this moment, our work and obligations will likely need to adapt in a way we have not in the past.
targetString: Ahubwo ni ukugaragaza ko muri iki gihe, akazi dukora n’inshingano dufite bishoboka cyane ko byahinduka mu buryo butigeze bubaho mu minsi ishize.

sourceString: These are the steps we believe are necessary to support this one another so that we can continue to work, provide our movement with the support they need, and the world with the service they rely on.
targetString: Izo ni zo ngamba twizera ko ari ngombwa mu gufashanya kugira ngo dukomeze gukora, dukora akazi dushinzwe hakurikijwe ubufasha bakeneye no guha isi serivisi ishobora kugenderaho.

sourceString: Our planned work will be there waiting for us when the time comes.
targetString: Akazi twari twarateganyije kazaba kagihari kadutegereje kugeza igihe nikigera.

sourceString: For now, it is time to support one another and create space for the important work that will be coming in the weeks and potentially months ahead.
targetString: Kugeza ubu, turi mu gihe cyo gufashanya no gushaka umwanya wo gukora akazi k’ingenzi kazaza mu byumweru biri imbere biranashoboka ko kaza mu mezi ari imbere.

sourceString: We need all of you to make that happen, and so we need you all to take care of yourself and your families so that you can be at your best when the need arises.
targetString: Turabakeneye mwese kugira ngo bigerweho kandi tunakeneye ko mwiyitaho mukanita ku miryango yanyu kugira ngo mube mumeze neza nimukenerwa.

sourceString: Now, please -- wash your hands and don’t touch your face!
targetString: None ubu, mukwiye gukaraba intoki no kutikora mu maso!

sourceString: Katherine, the CRT (Amanda K, Amy V, Bryan J, Doreen D, Gregory V, Jaime V, Joel L, Lynette L, Ryan M, and Tony S), and the rest of the Leadership Team (Grant I, Heather W, Jaime V, Janeen U, Lisa S, Robyn A, Ryan M, and Toby N).
targetString: Katherine, CRT (Amanda K, Amy V, Bryan J, Doreen D, Gregory V, Jaime V, Joel L, Lynette L, Ryan M, and Tony S), n’abandi bose bagize Itsinda ry’ubuyobozi (Grant I, Heather W, Jaime V, Janeen U, Lisa S, Robyn A, Ryan M na Toby N).

sourceString: b'Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) is an enzyme attached to the outer surface (cell membranes) of cells in the lungs, arteries, heart, kidney, and intestines.
targetString: b'Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) is ni poroteyine ikora imisemburo yometse ku gice cyo hanze (utwugara tw’ingirangingo) k’ingirangingo zo mu buhaha, mu mijyana y’amaraso, mu mutima, mu mpyiko, no mu mara.

sourceString: ACE2 counters the activity of the related angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) by reducing the amount of angiotensin-II and increasing Ang(1-7) making it a promising drug target for treating cardiovascular diseases.ACE2 also serves as the entry point into cells for some coronaviruses.
targetString: ACE2 ishyira ku gipimo nyacyo igikorwa cya poroteyine ikora imisemburo angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) mu kugabanya umubare w’angiotensin-II no kongera Ang(1-7) bigakora umuti utanga ikizere ugamije kuvura indwara y’umutima.ACE2 ifasha kandi kuba urwinjiriro rugana mu ngirangingo kuri ya za coronaviruses zimwe na zimwe.

sourceString: The human version of the enzyme is often referred to as hACE2.
targetString: Verisiyo ya muntu kuri poroteyine ikora imisemburo akenshi bayita hACE2.

sourceString: Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 is a zinc containing metalloenzyme located on the surface of endothelial and other cells.
targetString: Poroteyine ikora imisemburo y’Angiotensin-con 2 ni zinc irimo metalloenzyme iherereye ku buso bwa endothelial no ku zindi ngirangingo.

sourceString: ACE2 protein contains an N-terminal peptidase M2 domain and a C-terminal collectrin renal amino acid transporter domain.
targetString: poroteyine ya ACE2 irimo n’igice cya N-terminal cya peptidase M2 hamwe n’igice cya C-terminal collectrin gitwara aside yo mu miti inyuze mu mpyiko.

sourceString: ACE2 is a single-pass type I membrane protein, with its enzymatically active domain exposed on the surface of cells in lungs and other tissues.
targetString: ACE2 ni akugara ka poroteyine ubwoko bwa I igira inzira imwe, ifite igice cyayo cya poroteyine ikora imisemburo gikora kiba hejuru ku ngirangingo z’ibihaha no ku zindi ngirabuzimafatizo.

sourceString: The extracellular domain of ACE2 is cleaved from the transmembrane domain by another enzyme known as sheddase, and the resulting soluble protein is released into the blood stream and ultimately excreted into urine.
targetString: Igice kiri hanze y’ingirabuzima cya of ACE2 gisaturwa ku gice cy’akugara kambukiranya n’indi poroteyine ikora imisemburo izwi ku izina rya sheddase, na poroteyine ishonga ivamwo yinjira mu nzira y’amarazo nyuma igasohokera mu nkari.

sourceString: ACE2 is present in most organs: ACE2 is attached to the cell membrane of mainly lung type II alveolar cells, enterocytes of the small intestine, arterial and venous endothelial cells and arterial smooth muscle cells in most organs.
targetString: ACE2 iboneka mu bice byinshi by’umubiri: ACE2 ifata ku kugara k’ingirabuzima ahanini k’ingirabuzima z’ubwoko bwa II z’umutsi wo ku bihaha, ku ngirabuzima zo mu bura buto, mu ngirabuzima zo mu mujyana w’amaraso no mu dutsi tw’amaraso no mu ngirabuzima zo mu mitsi isennye yo mu bice byinshi by’umubiri.

sourceString: ACE2 mRNA expression is also found in the cerebral cortex, striatum, hypothalamus, and brainstem.
targetString: ACE2 mRNA expression uyisanga ku gafubiko k’ubwonko, kuri striatum, kuri hypothalamus, no ku nkondo y’ubwonko.

sourceString: The primary function of ACE2 is to act as a counter balance to ACE.
targetString: Umurimo wa mbere wa ACE2 ni ugushyira ku gipimo nyacyo ACE.

sourceString: ACE cleaves angiotensin I hormone into the vasoconstricting  angiotensin II.
targetString: ACE ica mu misemburo y’angiotensin I mo   angiotensin II igira mito imiheha itwara amaraso ikagabanya umuvuduko.

sourceString: ACE2 in turn cleaves the carboxyl-terminal amino acid phenylalanine from angiotensin II (Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-Phe) and hydrolyses it into the vasodilator angiotensin (1-7), (H-Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-OH).
targetString: ACE2 nayo ikura phenylalanine ya aside ya carboxyl-terminal amino muri angiotensin II (Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-Phe) na hydrolyses muri angiotensin igira minini imiheha itwara amaraso (1-7), (H-Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-OH).

sourceString: ACE2 can also cleave a number of other peptides including [des-Arg9]-bradykinin, apelin, neurotensin, dynorphin A, and ghrelin.
targetString: ACE2 ishobora kandi kugabanyamo ibice peptides nka [des-Arg9]-bradykinin, apelin, neurotensin, dynorphin A, na ghrelin.

sourceString: ACE2 also regulates the membrane trafficking of the neutral amino acid transporter SLC6A19 and has been implicated in Hartnup's disease.
targetString: ACE2 ituma kandi akugara gatwara aside itivanga y’amino igendamo SLC6A19 ikora neza kandi ikagira n’uruhare mu ndwara ya Hartnup ituma hari poroteyine umubiri utakira.

sourceString: As a transmembrane protein, ACE2 serves as the main entry point into cells for some coronaviruses, including HCoV-NL63; SARS-CoV (the virus that causes SARS); and SARS-CoV-2 (the virus that causes COVID-19).
targetString: Nka poroteyine yambukiranya akugara, ACE2 ikora nk’urwinjiriro rw’ingenzi ku ngirabuzima rucamo coronaviruses zimwe na zimwe, ari zo HCoV-NL63; SARS-CoV (virusi itera SARS); na SARS-CoV-2 (virusi itera COVID-19).

sourceString: More specifically, the binding of the spike S1 protein of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV2 to the enzymatic domain of ACE2 on the surface of cells results in endocytosis and translocation of both the virus and the enzyme into endosomes located within cells.
targetString: Mu buryo busobanutse kurushaho, isano yo kuzamuka kwa poroteyine S1 ya SARS-CoV na SARS-CoV2 ikajya mu gice cy’imisemburo cya ACE2 ku ngirabuzima bitanga uburyo bwo kwibangurira bita endocytosis no kwimuka kw’izo virusi ziva mu mwanya zari zirimo na poroteyine zitanga imisemburo zigahinduka ingirabuzima zigemura ziba mu nda y’ingirabuzima.

sourceString: This entry process also requires priming of the S protein by the host serine protease TMPRSS2, the inhibition of which is under current investigation as a potential therapeutic.This has led some to hypothesize that decreasing the levels of ACE2, in cells, might help in fighting the infection.
targetString: Ubu buryo bwo kwinjira kandi butegura poroteyine S kugira icyo ikora mu kubanyamo ibice TMPRSS2, ubushakashatsi bukaba burimo bushakisha uko bayibuza gukora bikaba uburyo bw’ingenzi bwo kuyivura.Ibi byabagejeje ku gitekerezo ko kugabanya ibipimo bya ACE2, mu ngirabuzima, byafasha kurwanya iyi ndwara.

sourceString: However, multiple professional societies and regulatory bodies have recommended continuing standard ACE inhibitor and ARB therapy.
targetString: Nyamara, sosiyete nyinshi z’abanyamwuga n’ibigo ngenzuramikorere zasabye ko hakomeza uburyo bwo kubuza ACE gukora ku gipimo kemewe no kuvuza ARB.

sourceString: A systematic review and meta-analysis published on July 11, 2012, found that "use of ACE inhibitors was associated with a significant 34% reduction in risk of pneumonia compared with controls."
targetString: Inyigo isubiramo ntacyo isize inyuma n’isesengura ryagutse cyane yatangajwe ku wa 11 Nyakanga 2012, yatahuye ko "gukoresha imiti ibuza ACE gukora byasanishijwe n’igabanuka ku geza kuri 34% ry’ibyago byo kwandura umusonga ugereranyije n’abakorewe igenzura."

sourceString: Moreover, "the risk of pneumonia was also reduced in patients treated with ACE inhibitors who were at higher risk of pneumonia, in particular those with stroke and heart failure.
targetString: Ikindi kandi, "ibyago byo kwandura umusonga byaragabanutse ku barwayi bari bugarijwe cyane no kuwandura bavuwe hifashishijwe imiti ibuza ACE gukora ku buryo bw’umwihariko abarwayi b’umutima, n’abafite umutima udakora neza.

sourceString: Use of ACE inhibitors was also associated with a reduction in pneumonia related mortality, although the results were less robust than for overall risk of pneumonia."
targetString: Ikoreshwa ry’imiti ibuza ACE ryasanishijwe kandi n’igabanuka ry’abapfa bazira indwara y’umusonga, n’ubwo ibyavuyemo bitari bihambaye cyane kuruta ibyago byo kwandura umusonga muri rusange."

sourceString: Recombinant human ACE2 (rhACE2) is surmised to be a novel therapy for acute lung injury, and appeared to improve pulmonary hemodynamics and oxygen saturation in piglets with a lipopolysaccharide-induced acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: ACE2 (rhACE2) ibifatanyije byose ifatawa nk’aho ari wo muti mushya uvura indwara y’gikomere k’igikatu mu bihaha, kandi bigaragara ko yongera mu buryo bwiza bwo gutembera kw’amaraso mu bihaha no kongera umwuka uhagije mu bice byazahajwe na bagiteri itera ibihaha guhishira.

sourceString: The half-life of rhACE2 in human beings is about 10 hours and the onset of action is 30 minutes in addition to the course of effect (duration) of 24 hours.
targetString: Igice k’igihe cy’ubuzima umuti wa rhACE2 umara mu biremwa muntu ni amasaha 10 kandi utangira gukora hashize iminota 30 hejuru y’igihe ingaruka z’icyo wakoze zitangira kugaragarira (igihe) mu masaha 24.

sourceString: Several findings suggest that rhACE2 may be a promising drug for those with intolerance to classic renin-angiotensin system inhibitors (RAS inhibitors) or in diseases where circulating angiotensin II is elevated.Infused rhACE2 has been evaluated in clinical trials for the treatment of acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi bwinshi bwatahuye ko rhACE2 ushobora kuba umuti utanga ikizere ku bantu bafite umubiri utihanganira sisitemu ibuza gukora renin-angiotensin (Imiti ibuza RAS gukora) cyangwa ku ndwara aho angiotensin II itembera mu maraso iri ku rwego rwo hejuru. Gutera umuti wa rhACE2 byaragenzuwe mu igerageza ryo kwa muganga mu kuvura indwara y’igikatu ifata inzira z’ubuhumekero.

sourceString: b'COVID-19 apps are mobile software applications designed to aid contact tracing in response to the 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, i.e. the process of identifying persons ("contacts") who may have been in contact with an infected individual.
targetString: b'COVID-19 ni porogaramu zinjizwa muri telefoni ngendanwa z’ikoranabuhanga zakozwe ku buryo zifasha kuvumbura abantu umuntu yabonanye na bo mu gushakira igisubizo icyorezo cya coronavirus 2019-20, urugero mu gikorwa cyo gutahura abantu ("nomero") bashobora kuba barabonanye n’umuntu wanduye.

sourceString: Numerous applications were developed or proposed, with official government support in some territories and jurisdictions.
targetString: Porogaramu nyinshi zarakozwe cyangwa abantu benshi basabwe kuzikoresha, guverinema zibishyigikiye mu ntara zimwe na zimwe no mu turere tumwe na tumwe bayobora.

sourceString: Several frameworks for building contact tracing apps have been developed.
targetString: Kadere nyinshi zo kubaka porogaramu itahura uko abantu bagiye bahura zashyizweho.

sourceString: Privacy concerns have been raised, especially about systems that are based on tracking the geographical location of app users.
targetString: Impungenge zo kuvogera amakuru bwite y’ubuzima bw’umuntu zaragaragajwe, cyane ku byerekeranye za sisitemu zishingiye ku gutahura ahantu umuntu aherereye ku bakoresha porogaramu.

sourceString: Less intrusive alternatives include the use of Bluetooth signals to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
targetString: Ubundi buryo butinjirira umuntu cyane busimbura ubwo ngubwo burimo gukoresha ihanahana makuru ryifashisha Bluetooth kugira ngo winjiremo umenye telefone zindi ngendanwa ukoresha porogaramu yegeranye na zo.

sourceString: On 10 April 2020, Google and Apple jointly announced that they would integrate functionality to support such Bluetooth-based apps directly into their Android and iOS operating systems.
targetString: Ku itariki ya 10 Mata 2020, Google na Apple batangarije hamwe ko bagiye kwinjizamo iyo mikoreshereze kugira ngo bashyigikire porogaramu zishingiye ku ihanamakuru rya Bluetoothigahita yinjizwa ako kanya muri sisitemu zikoresha Android na iOS.

sourceString: In China, the Chinese government, in conjunction with Alipay, has deployed an app that allows citizens to check if they have been in contact with people that have COVID-19.
targetString: Mu Bushinwa, Leta y’Ubushinwa, ifatanyije na Alipay, yakwirakwije porogaramu ituma abenegihugu babasha niba barabonanye n’abantu banduye COVID-19.

sourceString: It is in use across more than 200 Chinese cities.In Singapore, an app called TraceTogether is being used.
targetString: Ikoreshwa mu migi irenga 200 y’Ubushinwa.Muri Singapore, porogaramu bise TraceTogether irimo irakoreshwa.

sourceString: The app was developed by local IT community, released as open source and will be handed over to the government.North Macedonia launched "StopKorona!", a Bluetooth-based app to trace exposure with potentially infected persons and  provide a fast response to healthcare authorities.
targetString: Iyo porogaramu yakozwe n’umuryango mugari w’abahanga mu Ikoranabuhanga n’Itumanaho IT , yashyizwe hanze nk’isoko y’amakuru ifunguye kuri buri wese kandi izashyikirizwa Leta. North Macedonia yasohoye "StopKorona!", porogaramu yifashisha Bluetooth kugira ngo itahure ko wegeranye n’abantu banduye ku buryo bukomeye kandi igaha abayobozi mu rwego rw’ubuzima igisubizo kihuse.

sourceString: The app was developed by the Ministry of Communication and Technology and Ministry of Health.
targetString: Iyo porogaramu yakozwe na Minisiteri y’Itumanaho n’Ikoranabuhanga na Minisiteri y’Ubuzima.

sourceString: As of 14 April 2020, the app was awaiting approval by the Google Play Store and Apple App Store.
targetString: Guhera tariki 14 Mata 2020, iyo porogaramu itegereje kwemerwa muri Google Play Store no muri Apple App Store.

sourceString: On 12 April, the government stated that the contact tracing app was in an advanced stage of development, and would be available for deployment within weeks.A similar app is planned in Ireland, and in France ("StopCovid").
targetString: Ku itariki 12 Mata, Leta yavuze ko iyo porogaramu itahura abo umuntu yabonanye na bo yari igeze ku rwego rwisumbuye itegurwa, kandi ko yagombaga kuba yabonetse kugira ngo ikwirakwizwe mu byumweru bikurikira. Porogaramu nka bene iyo irimo irategurwa gukorwa muri Ireland, no mu Bufaransa ("StopCovid").

sourceString: Both Australia and New Zealand are considering apps based on Singapore's TraceTogether app and BlueTrace protocol.Russia intends to introduce a geofencing app for patients diagnosed with COVID-19 living in Moscow, designed to ensure they do not leave home.
targetString: Australia na New Zealand barimo baratekereza gukora porogaramu zo muri telefoni bagendeye ku rugero rwa porogaramu yo muri Singapore yitwa TraceTogether na porogaramu y’Uburusiya yitwa BlueTrace. Uburusiya burateganya gutangiza porogaramu izitira aho umuntu atarenga ku barwayi ba COVID-19 baba i Moscow, ikoze ku buryo bamenya neza ko batavuye mu rugo.

sourceString: Ross Anderson, professor of security engineering at Cambridge University, listed a number of potential practical problems with app-based systems, including false positives and the potential lack of effectiveness if takeup of the app is limited to only a small fraction of the population.
targetString: Ross Anderson, umwarimu wigisha ishyirwa mu bikorwa ry’ingamba zo kurinda umutekano muri Kaminuza ya Cambridge, yashyize ku rutonde umubare w’ibibazo bifatika sisitemu zishingiye kuri porogaramu zishyirwa muri telefoni ziteza, harimo abo zerekana ko barwaye kandi ari bazima no kuba zidakora nyabyo icyo zashyiriweho niba gukoresha izi porogaramu bigarukira ku mubare muto w’abaturage.

sourceString: Addressing concerns about the spread of misleading or harmful "coronavirus" apps, Apple set limits on which types of organizations could add coronavirus-related apps to its App Store, limiting them to only "official" or otherwise reputable organizations.
targetString: Kumara izi mpungene ku birebana n’ikwirakwira z’izi porogaramu ziyobya cyangwa zonona zigenzura "coronavirus", Apple yshyizeho urugero ntarengwa rw’ubwoko bw’imiryango yinjiza porogaramu zigenzura coronavirusmuri App Store, ikemerera gusa "izemewe ku mugaragaro" cyangwa mu yandi magambo imiryango yizewe.

sourceString: Google and Amazon have implemented similar restrictions.
targetString: Google na Amazon nabo bashyizeho bene ayo amabwiriza akumira.

sourceString: Privacy campaigners voiced their concern regarding the implications of mass surveillance using coronavirus apps, in particular about whether surveillance infrastructure created to deal with the coronavirus pandemic will be dismantled once the threat has passed.
targetString: Abantu ku giti cyabo bagaragaje impungenge bafite ku bijyanye no kugenzura abantu benshi hifashishijwe ikoranabuhanga ryo muri telefoni, by’umwihariko bibaza niba ibikorwaremezo byashyiriweho kugenzura icyorezo cya koronavirusi bizakurwaho igihe icyorezo kizaba cyarangiye.

sourceString: Amnesty International and over 100 other organizations issued a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.
targetString: Umuryango Mpuzamahanga Uharanira Uburenganzira Bwa Muntu witwa “Amnesty International” hamwe n’indi miryango irenga 100 yasohoye inyandiko isaba ko ikoreshwa ry’ubu buryo bw’igenzura ryagabanywa.

sourceString: The organisations declared eight conditions on governmental projects:
targetString: Iyi miryango yatangaje ibintu umunani za guverinoma zigomba kugenderaho ku bijyanye n’imishinga yazo:

sourceString: surveillance would have to be "lawful, necessary and proportionate";
targetString: Igenzura rigomba kuba ryubahirije amategeko, ari ngombwa kandi riri ku kigero kingana nicyo rigamije ";

sourceString: extensions of monitoring and surveillance would have to have sunset clauses;
targetString: kongera igihe cy’izuzuma n’igenzura bigomba kuba bikubiyemo ingingo zigaragaza igihe bizarangirira;

sourceString: the use of data would have to be limited to COVID-19 purposes;
targetString: amakuru akwiye gukoreshwa gusa ku mpamvu zijyanye na COVID-19;

sourceString: data security and anonymity would have to be protected and shown to be protected based on evidence;
targetString: umutekano n’ibanga ku makuru bigomba kurindwa no kugaragazwa kugira ngo arindwe hashingiwe ku bimenyetso;

sourceString: digital surveillance would have to avoid exacerbating discrimination and marginalisation;
targetString: igenzura rikoresha ikoranabuhanga rigomba kutarangwa n’ ivangura cg iteshagaciro;

sourceString: any sharing of data with third parties would have to be defined in law;
targetString: ihererekanyamakuru iryo ari ryo ryose rigomba kuba rishingiye ku itegeko;

sourceString: there would have to be safeguards against abuse and the rights of citizens to respond to abuses;
targetString: hakwiye kubaho uburyo bwo kurwanya ihohoterwa kandi bufasha abaturage kuryirinda;

sourceString: meaningful participation by all "relevant stakeholders" would be required, including that of public health experts and marginalised groups.The German Chaos Computer Club (CCC) and Reporters Without Borders (Reporter ohne Grenzen) (RSF) also issued checklists.
targetString:
harasabwa uruhare rufatika” rwa buri “bafatanyabikorwa bakenewe”, habariwemo inzobere mu buvuzi rusange n’ amatsinda y’abantu basigajwe inyuma Ikigo cy’ikoranabuhanga cy’Abadage (CCC) hamwe n’Abanyamakuru batagira umupaka (RSF) nabo hari urutonde rw’ibigomba kwitabwaho bagragaje.	wiki_7:2465	https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COVID-19_apps	CC_BY-SA_3.0	User 03

en	rw	In South Korea, a non-app-based system was used to perform contact tracing.	Muri Koreya y’Amagepfo, uburyo budashingiye ku ikoranabuhanga ryo muri telefoni bwarakoreshejwe mu rwego rwo gushakisha abahuye n’ubwandu.	wiki_7:2471	https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COVID-19_apps	CC_BY-SA_3.0	User 03
en	rw	Instead of using a dedicated app, the system gathered tracking information from a variety of sources including mobile device tracking data and card transaction data, and combined these to generate notices via text messages to potentially-infected individuals.	Aho gukoresha ikoranabuhanga ryabugenewe rishyirwa muri telefoni, hakusanyijwe amakuru hifashishijwe uburyo butandukanye burimo no gukoresha telefoni ngendanwa, ibyo wakoreye kuri simukadi hamwe no kumenyesha abantu bafite ibibazo bikomeye by’ubwandu hakoreshejwe ubutumwa bugufi kuri telefoni zabo .	wiki_7:2472	https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COVID-19_apps	CC_BY-SA_3.0	User 03
en	rw	In addition to using this information to alert potential contacts, the government has also made the location information publicly available, something permitted because of far-reaching changes to information privacy laws after the MERS outbreak in that country.	Uretse gukoresha aya makuru mu rwego rwo kumyesha abahuye n’ubwandu, guverinoma kandi yashyizeho uburyo umuntu wese ashobora kubona amakuru ya buri gace, ibi bikaba byarakozwe kubera impinduka zabayeho mu bijyanye n’amategeko agenga amakuru y’ubuzima bwite bw’umuntu nyuma yuko icyorezo cya MERS kigera muri icyo gihugu .	wiki_7:2473	https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COVID-19_apps	CC_BY-SA_3.0	User 03
en	rw	This information is available to the public via a number of apps and websites.Countries including Germany considered using both centralized and privacy-preserving systems.	Umuntu wese ashobora kubona aya makuru akoresheje uburyo butandukanye bw’ikoranabuhanga ryo muri telefoni n’imbuga zitandukanye. Ibihugu birimo Ubudage byakoresheje uburyo bwombi yaba ubwo ku rwego rw’igihugu nubwo kubaha amakuru ajyanye n’ubuzima bwite bw’umuntu. 	wiki_7:2474	https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COVID-19_apps	CC_BY-SA_3.0	User 03
en	rw	As of 6 April 2020, the details had not yet been released.	Guhera tariki 6 Mata 2020, ibisobanuro ntibirasohoka.	wiki_7:2475	https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COVID-19_apps	CC_BY-SA_3.0	User 03
en	rw	Privacy-preserving contact tracing is a well-established concept, with a substantial body of research literature dating back to at least 2013.As of 7 April 2020, over a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.	Uburyo bwo gushakisha abahuye n’ubwandu hubahwa amakuru y’ubuzima bwite bw’umuntu bwizweho neza, hashingiwe ku makuru afatika ajyanye na byo nibura yo guhera 2013. Kuwa 7 Mata 2020, amatsinda arenga 12 y’inzobere yakoze ubushakashatsi ku cyakorwa mu rwego rwo kutavogera ubuzima bwite bw’umuntu, nko kuba hakoreshwa uburyo bwa bulutufu (BLE) butuma ubukoresha ashobora guhererekanya amakuru na telefoni zimuri hafi.	wiki_7:2476	https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COVID-19_apps	CC_BY-SA_3.0	User 03
en	rw	However, PEPP-PT is a co-ordination effort which contains both centralised and decentralised approaches, and is not a single protocol.Decentralised protocols include Decentralized Privacy-Preserving Proximity Tracing (DP-PPT/DP-3T), Temporary Contact Numbers (TCN, fka Contact Event Numbers, CEN), Privacy Sensitive Protocols and Mechanisms for Mobile Contact Tracing (PACT) and others.	Nyamara, PEPP-PT ni imbaraga zihuza uburyo bwo ku rwego rw’igihugu n’ubwegerejwe abaturage kandi ntikora mu buryo bumwe. Uburyo bwegerejwe abaturage bukubiyemo uburyo bwo gushakisha abahuye n’ubwandu hubahwa amakuru bwite y’abantu (DP-PPT), Imibare y’igihe gito y’abahuye n’uwanduye (TCN), Imibare y’abahuriye mu minsi mikuru (CEN), Uburyo bwubaha amakuru ku buzima bwite bw’umuntu bwo gushakisha abahuye n’ubwandu (PACT) ndetse n’ubundi.	wiki_7:2477	https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COVID-19_apps	CC_BY-SA_3.0	User 03
en	rw	In these protocols, identifiable personal data never leaves the device, and all matching happens on-device.	 Muri ubu buryo, amakuru bwite y’abantu bagaragaye ntajya hanze, kandi n’ibijyanye no kumenya abo bahuye bikorerwa mu ikoranabuhanga.	wiki_7:2478	https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COVID-19_apps	CC_BY-SA_3.0	User 03
en	rw	The Privacy Group at MIT Media Lab has been developing SafePaths, a platform for using privacy-preserving techniques when collecting and using location or path intersection data to track the spread of COVID-19.	 Itsinda rishinzwe amakuru y’ibanga cyo muri Laboratwari ya MIT Media gikomeje gushakisha uburo bwizewe bwo kubuka amakuru, uburyo buzatuma amakuru bwite y’abantu akomeza kugirwa ibanga ndetse no gukoresha uburyo bwo gushakisha abhuye n’ubwandu hagendewe ku gace baturukamo mu rwego rwo kubona amakuru ajyanye n’ikwirakwira rya COVID-19 .	wiki_7:2479	https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COVID-19_apps	CC_BY-SA_3.0	User 03
en	rw	It is based on research from the whitepaper Apps Gone Rogue: Maintaining Personal Privacy in an Epidemic" released in March 2020.Another similar effort is the SafeTrace platform by Enigma MPC, a company developing privacy technologies that was also originally founded at the MIT Media Lab.
stringID: Ibi bishingiye ku bushakashatsi bwakozwe na “Apps Gone Rogue: Kubungabunga amakuru ajyanye n’ubuzima bwite bw’abantu” bwasohotse muri Werurwe 2020. Ubundi buryo bwatangajwe ni ubwo Gushakisha abahuye n’ubwandu bwakozwe na Enigma MPC, ikigo gkora ikoranabuhanga ribungabunga amakuru y’ibanga y’abantu ku giti cyabo, iki kigo nacyo cyarashinzwe na Laboratwari ya MIT Media.

sourceString: SafeTrace utilizes secure hardware technologies to allow users to share sensitive location and health data with other users and officials, without compromising the privacy of that data.
targetString: Uburyo bwizewe bwo gushakisha abahuye n’ubwandu bukoresha ibyuma by’ikoranabuhanga mu gufasha ababikoresha guhererekanya amakuru y’ahantu hari ubwandu n’ajyanye n’ubuzima n’ababishinzwe hatabayeho kuvogera ubuzima bwite bw’abantu.

sourceString: On 5 April 2020, the global TCN Coalition was founded by groups that had coalesced around what was essentially the same approach and largely overlapping protocols, with the goal to reduce fragmentation, and enable global interoperability of tracing and alerting apps, a key aspect of achieving widespread adoption.
targetString: Kuwa 5 Mata 2020, amatsinda yari ahuriye ku buryo bumwe kandi yagiye ahura n’ikibazo akenshi kijyanye n’ibigomba kubahirizwa yashinze Ihuriro mpuzamahanga rya TCN, hakaba hari hagamijwe guhuza imbaraga no gutuma habaho uburyo bw’imikoranire ku isi ku bijyanye n’ikoranabuhanga ryo muri telefoni rikoreshwa mu gushakisha abahuye n’ubwandu, ibi bikaba byatumahabaho uburyo bwagutse bwakoreshwa .

sourceString: On 9 April 2020, the Singaporean government announced that it had open-sourced the BlueTrace protocol used by its official government app.
targetString: Ku itariki ya 9 Mata 2020, guverinoma ya Singapuru yatangaje ko yashyizeho uburyo bwo gushakisha abahuye n’ubwandu bukoreshwa n’ikoranabuhanga rya leta .

sourceString: On 10 April 2020, Google and Apple, the companies that control the Android and iOS mobile platforms, announced an initiative for contact tracing, which they claimed would preserve privacy, based on a combination of Bluetooth Low Energy technology and privacy-preserving cryptography.
targetString: Kuwa 10 Mata 2020, ibigo bigenzura ikoranabuhanga ryo muri telefoni rya Android na iOS, ari byo Google na Apple, byatangaje ko bifite uburyo bwo gushakisha abahuye n’ubwandu, uburyo ibyo bigo byavugaga ko bwubahirije amahame agenga ubuzima bwite bw’abantu, ubwo buryo bukaba bushingira ku guhuza ikoranabuhanga rikoresha bulutufu rizwi nka Bluetooth Low Energy n’ubundi buryo bwa mudasobwa butuma amakuru ajyanye n’ubuzima bwite bw’abantu atavogerwa .

sourceString: They also published specifications of the core technologies used in the system.
targetString: Banatangaje ibyo iryo karanabuhanga rizajya rikora muri iyo gahunda.

sourceString: According to Apple and Google, the system is intended to be rolled out in three stages:
targetString: Google na Apple batangaza ko ubu buryo bugamije gukoreshwa mu byiciro bitatu:

sourceString: rollout of tools to enable governments to create official privacy-preserving coronavirus tracing apps
targetString: kwegeranya ibikoresho bizafasha leta gushyiraho ikoranabuhanga ryubahiriza amahame y’ubuzima bwite bw’abantu rizayifasha gushakisha abahuye n’ubwandu

sourceString: integration of this functionality directly into iOS and AndroidGoogle and Apple plan to address the take-up and persistent surveillance problems by first distributing the system through operating system updates, and later removing it in the same way once the threat has passed.
targetString: gushyira ubu buryo mu ikoranabuhanga rya iOs na Android Google na Apple ziteganya gutangiza mu rwego rwo guhangana n’ibibazo by’igenzura mbere na mbere hakwirakwizwa ubu buryo mu rindi koranabuhanga rihari, hanyuma ubwo buryo bukazkurwaho igihe icyorezo kizaba cyarangiye.

sourceString: b'Drug repositioning (also known as drug repurposing, re-profiling, re-tasking or therapeutic switching) is the repurposing of an approved drug for the treatment of a different disease or medical condition than that for which it was originally developed.
targetString: Gukoresha umuti mu kuvura indwara utagenewe kuvura bizwi nka “drug repurposing, re-profiling, re-tasking or therapeutic switching” mu Cyongereza, ni uburyo bwo gufata umuti wemewe mu kuvura indwara runaka ukawukoresha uvura indi ndwara itandukanye nayo cyangwa iteye ku buryo butandukanye n’indwara wakorewe kuvura.

sourceString: This is one line of scientific research which is currently being pursued to develop safe and effective COVID-19 treatments.
targetString: Uyu niwo murongo w’ubushakatsi burimo gukorwa mu rwego rwo gukora umuti wizewe kandi ufite ubushobozi bwo kuvura COVID-19.

sourceString: Other research directions include the development of a COVID-19 vaccine and convalescent plasma transfusion.SARS-CoV-2 has about 66 druggable proteins, each of which has multiple ligand binding sites.
targetString: Ubundi bushakashatsi bugamije ibirimo gukora urukingo rwa COVID-19 n’umuti waterwa mu maraso. SARS-CoV-2 ifite imiti ibarirwa muri 66 irimo kugeragerezwa ahantu hatandukanye.

sourceString: Analyzing those binding sites provide the reasonable project of developing effective antiviral drug against COVID-19 proteins.
targetString: Isesengura ry’aho hantu ritanga umushinga wo gukora umuti ushobora guhangana n’uturemangingo twa COVID-19.

sourceString: Of the most important SARS-CoV-2 target proteins are papain-like protease, RNA dependent RNA polymerase, helicase, S protein, and ADP ribophosphatase.
targetString: Tumwe mu turemangingo dukomeye twa SARS-CoV-2 turimo gukorwaho ubushakashatsi ni utumeze nk’utuboneka mu mbuto z’amapapayi, udufitanye isano na RNA, “helicase”, “S protein”, na “ADP ribophosphatase”.

sourceString: Hussein A A, et al studied several candidate compounds which then optimized and analyzed for their skeleton similarity with the highest similar approved drugs in order to accelerate a potent anti-SARS-CoV-2 drug development in his preclinical study to be recommended in a clinical study design.
targetString: Hussein A A, n’abo bafatanyije, bakoze ubushakashatsi ku miti bagaragaje ko ifite imiterere imeze kimwe n’iy’imiti isanzwe ikoreshwa mu buvuzi mu rwego rwo kwihutisha ikorwa ry’umuti ufite ubushobozi bwo kuvura SARS-CoV-2 mu bushakashatsi bwe bw’ibanze hagamijwe kuwushyira ku rutonde rw’imiti igomba kwigwaho .

sourceString: Chloroquine is an anti-malarial medication that is also used against some auto-immune diseases.
targetString: Chloroquine ni umuti uvura malaria ariko ukaba ushobora kuvura n’izindi ndwara zituruka ku mikorere y’abasirikari b’umubiri.

sourceString: On 18 March, the WHO announced that chloroquine and the related hydroxychloroquine would be among the four drugs studied as part of the Solidarity clinical trial.
targetString: Kuwa 18 Werurwe, WHO yatangaje ko “chloroquine” na “hydroxychloroquine” ishobora kujya ku rutonde rw’imiti ine irimo gukorwaho ubushakashatsi n’ihuriro rikora igerageza ry’imiti rizwi ku izina rya “Solidarity” .

sourceString: New York governor Andrew Cuomo announced that New York State trials of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine would begin on 24 March.On 28 March, the FDA authorized the use of hydroxychloroquine sulfate and chloroquine phosphate under an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA).
targetString: Guverineri wa New York Andrew Cuomo yatangaje ko leta ya New York State izatangira kugerageza chloroquine na hydroxychloroquine kuwa 24 Werurwe. Kuwa 28 Werurwe, FDA yatanze uburenganzira bwo gukoresha hydroxychloroquine sulfate na chloroquine phosphate mu gihe nta wundi muti uraboneka mucyo bise “Emergency Use Authorization” (EUA) mu rurimi rw’icyongereza.

sourceString: The treatment has not been approved by the FDA's clinical trials process and is authorized under the EUA only as an experimental treatment for emergency use in patients who are hospitalized but are not able to receive treatment in a clinical trial.
targetString: Uyu muti ntiwigeze wemezwa burundu n’igeragezwa ryakozwe na FDA, ukoreshwa gusa mu rwego rwa EUA, nk’umuti ukirimo gukorerwaho ubushakashatsi kugira ngo ube ukoreshwa mu kuvura ku barwayi bari mu bitaro ariko badashobora kuvurirwa aho kugeragerezwaho umuti.

sourceString: The CDC has said that "the use, dosing, or duration of hydroxychloroquine for prophylaxis or treatment of SARS-CoV-2 infection" are not yet established.
targetString: CDC yavuze ko “ikoreshwa, ingano, cyangwa igihe umuntuashobor akumara afata umuti wa hydroxychloroquine mu kwirinda cyangwa kuvura SARS-CoV-2 bitaratangazwa.

sourceString: Doctors have said they are using the drug when "there's no other option".
targetString: abaganga batangaje ko uyu muti ukoreshwa iyo "nta yandi mahitamo ahari".

sourceString: A Turkish research team in Istanbul is conducting a small study on the use of chloroquine in combination with zinc, vitamin A, vitamin C and vitamin D.
targetString: Itsinda ry’abashakashatsi bo muri Turukiya i Istanbul ririmo gukora inyigo yoroheje ku ikoreshwa rya chloroquine iri kumwe na “zinc”, vitamini A, vitamini C na vitamini D.

sourceString: Large studies are underway at Duke University and the University of Oxford.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi bwimbitse burimo gukorwa muri kaminuza ya Duke and n’iya Oxford.

sourceString: NYU Langone Medical School is conducting a trial on the safety and efficacy of preventative use of hydroxychloroquine.
targetString: Ishuri ry’ubuvuzi ryitwa NYU Langone Medical School ririmo gukora igerageza ku buziranenge n’ubushobozi bw’umuti wa hydroxychloroquine mu kuvura abantu.

sourceString: Chinese clinical trials in Wuhan and Shenzhen claimed to show favipiravir was "clearly effective".
targetString: Igeragezwa ryo mu Bushinwa ryakorewe ntara ya Wuhan na Shenzhen ryatangaje ko umuti wa favipiravir wari ufite "ubushobozi ntashidikanywaho” bwo kuvura iki cyorezo.

sourceString: 35 patients in Shenzhen tested negative in a median of 4 days, while the length of illness was 11 days in the 45 patients who did not receive it.
targetString: Abarwayi 35 bo muri Shenzhen bagaragaje ko bakize mu minsi 4, mu gihe abarwayi 45 batahawe uyu muti byabatwaye iminsi 11 kugira ngo bakire.

sourceString: In a study conducted in Wuhan on 240 patients with pneumonia, half were given favipiravir and half received umifenovir.
targetString: Mu nyigo yakorewe I Wuhan ku barwayi 240 bafite ibibazo by’ubuhumekero, kimwe cya kabiri bahawe umuti wa” favipiravir” naho ikindi gice bahabwa “umifenovir”.

sourceString: The Italian Pharmaceutical Agency reminded the public that the existing evidence in support of the drug is scant and preliminary.
targetString: Ikigo Gishinzwe iby’imiti cyo mu Butariyani kibukije abantu ko ibishingirwaho mu kwemeza uyu muti bidakwiye guhabwa agaciro kandi ko bikiri mu bushakashatsi bw’ibanze.

sourceString: On 2 April, Germany announced that it would purchase the drug from Japan for its stockpile, and use the military to deliver the drug to university hospitals, where the drug will be used to treat COVID-19 patients.
targetString: kuwa 2 Mata, Ubudage bwatangaje ko bushobora kugura uyu muti mu Bushinwa bakaba bawufite mu bubiko bwabo, hanyuma bagakoresha igisirikari mu kuwugeza ku bitaro bya Kaminuza, aho umuti uzakoreshwa mu kuvura abarwayi ba COVD-19.

sourceString: According to the South China Morning Post, Shinzo Abe has made overtures to the Trump administration about purchasing the drug.The drug may be less effective in severe cases of illness where the virus has already multiplied.
targetString: Nkuko bitangazwa na South China Morning Post, Shinzo Abe yagiriye inama ubutegetsi bwa Trump ijyanye no kugura uyu muti. Uyu muti ushobora kugaragaza ubushobozi buke mu kuvura ku bantu bazahajwe n’icyorezo mu duce tumaze kugira imibare myinshi y’abanduye.

sourceString: It may not be safe for use by pregnant women or those trying to conceive.
targetString: si byiza gukoresha uyu muti ku bagore batwite cyangwa bitegura gusama.

sourceString: One study of lopinavir/ritonavir (Kaletra), a combination of the antivirals lopinavir and ritonavir, concluded that "no benefit was observed".
targetString: Ubushakashatsi bwakozwe kuri lopinavir/ritonavir (Kaletra), kuvanga lopinavir na ritonavir, bwanzuye ko "nta musaruro byatanze".

sourceString: The drugs were designed to inhibit HIV from replicating by binding to the protease.
targetString: Iyi miti yakorewe guhagarika iyororoka rya Virusi itera Sida.

sourceString: A team of researchers at the University of Colorado are trying to modify the drugs to find a compound that will bind with the protease of SARS-CoV-2.There are criticisms within the scientific community about directing resources to repurposing drugs specifically developed for HIV/AIDS.
targetString: Itsinda ry’abashakashatsi ryo muri Kaminuza ya Colorado ririmo kugerageza kuvugurura iyi miti hagamijwe gukora umuti wazitira iyororoka rya SARS-CoV-2. Hari abahanga benshi banenga iki kemezo cyo gukoresha iyi miti yakorewe kurwanya agakoko gatera SIDA.

sourceString: The WHO included lopinavir/ritonavir in the international Solidarity trial.
targetString: WHO yashyize lopinavir/ritonavir ku rutonde rw’imiti igomba gukorewa igeragezwa ku rwego rw’isi

sourceString: Remdesivir was created and developed by Gilead Sciences as a treatment for Ebola virus disease and Marburg virus infections . Gilead Sciences subsequently discovered that Remdesivir had antiviral activity in vitro against multiple filo-, pneumo-, paramyxo-, and corona- viruses .
targetString: Remdesivir yakozwe n’ikigo cyitwa “Gilead Sciences”, ugenewe kuvura icyorezo cya virusi ya Ebola na Marburg. “Gilead Sciences” yavumbuye kandi ko umuti wa Remdesivir ushobora kurwanya virusi itarinjira mu mubiri w’ikinyabuzima, izo virusi zimo izishobora kororoka, izo mu buhumekro-, izisenya ubwirizi bw’umubiri-, n’izo mu bwoko bwa korona.

sourceString: One issue with antiviral treatment is the development of resistance through mutations that can lead to more severe disease and transmission.
targetString: Ikibazo gikunze kubaho mu kuvura indwara ziterwa na virusi ni uburyo ziba zifite ubushobozi bwo gusuzugura imiti bitewe nuko zigenda zihindura imiterere bigatuma indwara irushaho kugira ubukana no kwandura.

sourceString: Some early pretrial studies suggest remdesivir may have a high genetic barrier to resistance.There are several clinical trials underway, including two conducted by Cleveland University Hospitals; one for people with moderate illness and another for those with more severe illness.
targetString: Inyigo za vuba zigaragaza ko remdesivir ishobora kuba ifite imitrere ikomeye ituma ihangara indwara. Hari ubushakashatsi bwinshi bukirimo gukorwa, harimo bubiri bwakozwe n’ ibitaro bya kaminuza ya Clevaland; bumwe bukorerwa ku bantu bafite uburwayi butarakomera naho ubundi bukorerwa ku ndembe.

sourceString: There are three ongoing clinical trials of intravenous vitamin C for people who are hospitalized and severely ill with COVID-19; two placebo controlled (China, Canada) and one with no control (Italy).
targetString: Hari igeragezwa ry’ubwoko butatu ry’imiti ririmo gukorerwa kuri Vitamini C ishobora guterwa mu maraso , rikaba ririmo gukorerwa ku bantu bari mu bitaro n’indembe za COVID-19; ubwoko bwa mbere bw’igerageza bukaba bugenzurwa ( Ubushinwa, Canada) naho ubundi buka butagenzurwa (Ubutariyani).

sourceString: New York State began trials for the antibiotic azithromycin on 24 March 2020.
targetString: Kuwa 24 Werurwe, Leta ya New York yatangiye kugerageza umiti wica udukoko witwa azithromycin.

sourceString: Japan's National Center for Global Health and Medicine (NCGM) is planning a clinical trial for Teijin's Alvesco (ciclesonide), an inhaled corticosteroid for asthma, for the treatment of pre-symptomatic patients infected with the novel coronavirus.
targetString: Ikigo cy’igihugu cyita ku buzima cyo mu Buyapani (NCGM) kirimo guteganya kugerageza umuti witwa „Teijin's Alvesco” (ciclesonide ), uvura indwara ya asima mu kuvura abarwayi ba Koronavirusi bataragaza ibimenyetso.

sourceString: A form of angiotensin-converting enzyme 2, a Phase II trial is underway with 200 patients to be recruited from severe, hospitalized cases in Denmark, Germany, and Austria to determine the effectiveness of the treatment.
targetString: Uburyo bwa 2 bw’uturemangingo two mu miyoboro y’amaraso, hari igeragezwa ririmo gukorerwa ku barwayi 200 bazatoranywa mu ndembe, abari mu bitaro by muri Denmark, Ubudage, na Austria bugamije kwerekana ubushobozi bw’umuti mu kuvura.

sourceString: Researchers from the Montreal Heart Institute in Canada are currently studying the role of colchicine in reducing inflammation and pulmonary complications in patients suffering from mild symptoms of COVID-19.
targetString: Abashakashatsi bo mu ishuri rikuru rya Montreal Heart muri Canada barimo gukora ubushakashatsi ku muti wa colchicine mu rwego rwo kugabanya umuriro n’ibibazo by’ubuhumekero bigaragara ku barwayi bazahazwe n’ibimenyetso bikaze bya COVID-19.

sourceString: The study, named COLCORONA, is recruiting 6000 adults aged 40 and over who were diagnosed with COVID-19 and experience mild symptoms not requiring hospitalization.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi, bwiswe COLCORONA, burimo gushaka abantu 6000 bafite imyaka 40 no hejuru basanzwemo COVID-19 kandi bakagaragaza ibimenyetso bizakakaye ariko akaba atri ngombwa ko bajyanywe mu bitaro.

sourceString: Women who are pregnant or breastfeeding or who do not have an effective contraceptive method are not eligible.
targetString: Abagore batwite cyangwa bonsa cyangwa badakoresha uburyo bwizewe bwo kuboneza urubyaro ntibarebwa n’ubu bushakashatsi.

sourceString: Several anticoagulants are being tested in Italy.
targetString: Imiti myinshi ifasha mu gutuma amaraso atavura irimo kugeragezwa mu Butariyani.

sourceString: Low-molecular-weight heparin is being widely used to treat patients, prompting the Italian Medicines Agency to publish guidelines on its use.
targetString: Imiti ifasha mu gutuma amaraso atavura izwi nka „Low-molecular-weight heparin” mu rurimi rw’Icyongereza, irimo gukoreshwa cyane mu kuvura abarwayi, ibi bikaba birimo gushyira igitutu ku bigo by’ubuzima mu Butariyani cyo gutangaza amabwiriza ku ikoreshwa ry’uyu muti.

sourceString: A multicenter study on 300 patients researching the use of enoxaparin sodium at prophylaxis and therapeutic dosages was announced in Italy on April 14.
targetString: Kuwa 14 Mata mu Butariyani hatangajwe ubushakashatsi bwakorewe mu bigo bitandukanye ku barwayi 300 ku ikoreshwa ry’umuti wa enoxaparin sodium mu rwego rw’ubwirinzi n’ingano y’umuti umuntu akwiye gufatwa mu kuvura indwara.

sourceString: Since SARS-CoV-2 is a virus, considerable scientific attention has been focused on repurposing approved anti-viral drugs that were developed for prior outbreaks such as MERS, SARS, and West Nile virus.
targetString: Kuva byatangazwa ko SARS-CoV-2 ari virusi, ubushakashatsi bwinshi bukomeje kwibanda ku miti yemejwe ko ivura indwara ziterwa na virusi yari yarakozwe mbere yo kwaduka kwa virusi nka MERS, SARS, na West Nile.

sourceString: Ribavirin: ribavirin was recommended for COVID-19 treatment according to Chinese 7th edition guidelines
targetString: Ribavirin: ribavirin mu mabwiriza yo ku nshuro ya 7 yo mu gihugu cy’Ubushinwa, byatangajwe ko ushobora kwifashishwa mu kuvura COVID-19

sourceString: Umifenovir: umifenovir was recommended for COVID-19 treatment according to Chinese 7th edition guidelines
targetString: Umifenovir: umifenovir mu mabwiriza yo ku nshuro ya 7 yo mu gihugu cy’Ubushinwa, byatangajwe ko ushobora kwifashishwa mu kuvura COVID-19

sourceString: Some antibiotics that have been identified as potentially repurposable as COVID-19 treatments:
targetString: Byatangajwe ko imiti imwe ya antibiyotike ishobora kwifashishwa mu kuvura COVID-19:

sourceString: Tocilizumab (Anti-IL-6 receptor): Approved by China.
targetString: Tocilizumab (Anti-IL-6 receptor): Wemejwe n’Ubushinwa .

sourceString: Also trials in Italy and China. and see Tocilizumab#COVID-19.
targetString: Ndetse n’igeragezwa ryo mu Butariyani. Reba Tocilizumab#COVID-19.

sourceString: b'A COVID-19 vaccine is a hypothetical vaccine against coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).
targetString: Urukingo rwa b'A COVID-19 ni igitekerezo cyo gushaka urukingo rw’icyorezo cya koronavirusi cya 2019 ( COVID-19).

sourceString: Although no vaccine has completed clinical trials, there are multiple attempts in progress to develop such a vaccine.
targetString: Nubwo nta rukingo ruraboneka, hari ubushakatsi bwinshi burimo gukorwa hagerazwa icyavamo uro rukingo.

sourceString: In late February 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) said it did not expect a vaccine against SARS-CoV-2, the causative virus, to become available in less than 18 months.
targetString: Mu mpera za Gashyantare 2020, Umuryango mpuzamahanga wita ku buzima (WHO) yatangaje ko nta rukingo itegereje rwa SARS-CoV-2, igitera iyo virusi, mbere y’amezi 18.

sourceString: Five vaccine candidates were in Phase I safety studies in April.
targetString: inkingo eshanu zari zikiri mu cyiciro cya I cy’igeragezwa muri Mata.

sourceString: COVID-19 was identified in December 2019.
targetString: COVID-19 yagaragaye mu kwezi k’Ukuboza 2019.

sourceString: A major outbreak spread around the world in 2020, leading to considerable investment and research activity to develop a vaccine.
targetString: Yatangiye gusakara ku isi hose mu w‘2020, bituma hashorwa amafaranga menshi, hanatangira ibikorwa by’ubushakashatsi mu rwego rwo gushakisha urukingo.

sourceString: Many organizations are using published genomes to develop possible vaccines against SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Ibyinshi mu bigo birimo kwifashisha imiti yari isanzwe ihari mu gukora urukingo rushobora guhangana na SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Stated in April, imperatives of the CEPI initiative for vaccine development are speed, manufacturing capacity, deployment at scale, and global access.
targetString: Guhera muri Mata, ibyo CEPI yibandaho cyane mu gushaka urukingo ni umuvuduko, ubushobozi bwo kurukora, gushaka abakozi, no kurugeza hose ku isi.

sourceString: In April, CEPI scientists reported that 10 different technology platforms were under research and development during early 2020 to create an effective vaccine against COVID-19.
targetString: Muri Mata, inzobere za CEPI zatangaje ko hari uburyo 10 butandukanye bw’ikoranabuhanga burimo gukorerwaho ubushakashatsi no gukorwa mu ntangiriro za 2020 mu rwego rwo gukora urukingo rufite ubushobozi bwo guhangana na COVID-19.

sourceString: Major platform targets advanced into Phase I safety studies include:
targetString: Mu buryo burimo gukorwaho bukiri mu cyiciro cya I cy’ubushakashatsi burimo:

sourceString: nucleic acid (DNA and RNA) (Phase I developer and vaccine candidate: Moderna, mRNA-1273)
targetString: Uturemangingo two mu maraso (DNA na RNA) turi mu cyiciro I cy’ubushakashatsi ku rukingo ni: Moderna, mRNA-1273)

sourceString: viral vector (Phase I developer and vaccine candidate: CanSino Biologics, adenovirus type 5 vector)
targetString: Uturemangingo two muri virusi (cyiciro I cy’ubushakashatsi ku rukingo: CanSino Biologics, adenovirus type 5 vector)

sourceString: As reported by CEPI scientists in April, 115 total vaccine candidates are in early stages of development, with 78 confirmed as active projects (79, according to the Milken Institute), and 37 others announced, but with little public information available (presumed to be in planning or being designed).
targetString: Nkuko bitangazwa na n’inzobere za CEPI muri Mata, ubushakashatsi ku rukingo bugera kuri 115 nibwo bugitangira, harimo 78 byemejwe ko imishinga yabwo yatangiye (79, nkuko bitangazwa n’ikigo cya Milken), n’ubundi 37 bwatangajwe, ariko amakuru yabwo akaba ataramenyekana neza (bikekwa ko hari gahunda yabyo cyangwa burimo gutunganywa).

sourceString: A Phase I-II trial conducts preliminary safety and immunogenicity testing, is typically randomized, placebo-controlled, and at multiple sites, while determining more precise, effective doses.
targetString: Igerageza ryo mu kiciro cya I-II ripima ubuziranenge n’ubushobozi, rikorwa muri rusange, rigakurikiranirwa hafi, rigakorerwa ahantu henshi, mu gihe haba hirindwa kwibeshya, no gushaka ingano ishobora gukoreshwa.

sourceString: Phase III trials typically involve more participants, including a control group, and test effectiveness of the vaccine to prevent the disease, while monitoring for adverse effects at the optimal dose.
targetString: Ikiciro cya III k’igerageza gisaba abantu benshi, harimo itsinda rishinzwe igenzura, no gupima ubushobozi bw’urukingo mu kurinda indwara, mu gihe harimo gusuzumwa ko izindi ngaruka zaterwa n’urukingo zagabanywa zikagera ku kigero cyo kwihanganirwa.

sourceString: Of 79 vaccine candidates in active development (confirmed as of early April 2020), 74 were not yet in human evaluation (still in "preclinical" research).
targetString: Mu nkingo 79 zirimo gukorwaho ( byemejwe mu ntangiriro za Mata 2020), 74 ntizari zagatangiye kugeragerezwa ku bantu (ziracyari mu bushakashatsi bw‘“ibanze).

sourceString: Around 24 January 2020 in Australia, the University of Queensland announced that it is investigating the potential of a molecular clamp vaccine that would genetically modify viral proteins in order to stimulate an immune reaction.
targetString: Ahagana tariki ya 24 Mutarama 2020 muri Australia, Kaminuza ya Quensland yatangaje ko ari ubushakashatsi ku kurukingo rushobora guhindura imiterere y’uturemangingo twa virusi mu rwego rwo gufasha umubiri gukora ubwirinzi.

sourceString: Around 24 January 2020 in Canada, the International Vaccine Centre (VIDO-InterVac) at the University of Saskatchewan announced the commencement of work on a vaccine, aiming to start human testing in 2021.
targetString: Ahagana tariki ya 24 Mutarama 2020 muri Canada, Ikigo mpuzamahanga gishinzwe inkingo (VIDO-InterVac) muri Kaminuza ya Saskatchewan yatangaje ko imirimo yo gukora urukingo yatangiye, ko ruzatangira kugeragerezwa ku bantu mu mwaka wa 2021.

sourceString: Vaccine development projects were announced at the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention on 26 January 2020, and the University of Hong Kong on 28 January.
targetString: Kuwa 26 Mutarama 2020 mu Kigo cyo mu Bushinwa gishinzwe gukurikirana no kwirinda indwara hatangajwe imishinga ku ikorwa ry’urukingo, naho muri Kaminuza ya Hong Kong itangazwa kuwa 28 Mutarama.

sourceString: Around 29 January 2020, Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies, led by Hanneke Schuitemaker, announced that it had begun work on developing a vaccine.
targetString: Ahagana tariki ya 29 Mutarama 2020, Kompanyi zishinzwe imiti ziyobowe na Hanneke Schuitemaker, zatangaje ko zatangiye ibikorwa byo gukora urukingo.

sourceString: Janssen is co-developing an oral vaccine with its biotechnology partner, Vaxart.
targetString: Janssen kandi, ifatanyije n’umufatanyabikorwa wayo Vaxart, irimo gukora urukingo rwajya rutangwa runyujijwe mu kanwa.

sourceString: On 18 March 2020, Emergent BioSolutions announced a manufacturing partnership with Vaxart to develop the vaccine.
targetString: Kuwa 18 Gashyantare 2020, Emergent BioSolutions yatangaje ubufatanyabikorwa mu by’inganda na Vaxart mu gukora urukingo.

sourceString: On 8 February 2020, the laboratory OncoGen in Romania published a paper on the design of a vaccine with similar technology to the one used for cancer neoantigen vaccination therapy.
targetString: Kuwa 8 Gashyantare 2020, laboratwari OncoGen muri Romania yasohoye ubushakashatsi ku miterere y’urukingo rufite ikoranabuhanga risa n’iry’uruvura kanseri.

sourceString: On 25 March the head of the research institute announced that they had finalized the synthesis of the vaccine and were beginning the tests.
targetString: Kuwa 25 Werurwe uhagarariye ikigo cy’ubushakashatsi yatangaje ko yarangije iby’ingenzi ku rukingo, ikaba yari igiye gutangira kurugerageza.

sourceString: On 27 February 2020, a Generex subsidiary company, NuGenerex Immuno-Oncology, announced they were beginning a vaccine project to create an Ii-Key peptide vaccine against COVID-19.
targetString: Kuwa 27 Gashyantare 2020, ikigo gishamikiye kuri kompanyi ya Generex, NuGenerex Immuno-Oncology, cyatangaje ko cyari kigiye gutangira umushinga wo gukora urukingo mu rwego rwo kubona urukingo rushingiye ku turemangingo dushobora guhanga na COVID-19.

sourceString: They wanted to produce a vaccine candidate that could be tested in humans "within 90 days."
targetString: Bari bagamije gukora urukingo rushobora kugeragerezwa ku bantu „mu gihe cy’iminsi 90“

sourceString: On 5 March 2020, Washington University in St. Louis announced its projects to develop a vaccine.
targetString: Kuwa 25 Werurwe 2020, Kaminuza ya Washington muri St. Louis yatangaje imishinga yabo mu gukora urukingo.

sourceString: On 5 March 2020, the United States Army Medical Research and Materiel Command at Fort Detrick and the Walter Reed Army Institute of Research in Silver Spring, both in western Maryland, announced they were working on a vaccine.
targetString: Kuwa 5 Werurwe 2020,Ikigo cya gisirikari cyo muri Leta Zunze ubumwe z’Amerika gishinzwe ubushakashatsi ku buzima n’ibikoresho bya gisirikari i Fort Detrick n’Ishuri rikuru rya gisirikare cya Walter Reed gishinzwe ubushakashatsi ku byuma, byombi biherereye mu burengerazuba bwa Maryland, byatangaje ko birimo gukora ku rukingo.

sourceString: Around 10 March 2020, Emergent Biosolutions announced that it had teamed with Novavax Inc.
targetString: Ahagana tariki ya 10 Werurwe 2020, Emergent Biosolutions yatangaje ko yatangiye imikoranire na Novavax Inc.

sourceString: in the development and manufacture of a vaccine.
targetString: mu bikorwa byo gukora urukingo.

sourceString: The partners further announced plans for preclinical testing and a Phase I clinical trial by July 2020.
targetString: Abafatanyabikorwa batangaje kandi ko bafite gahunda zo gupima urukingo no gutangira igerageza ryawo ku rwego rwo mu kiciro cya I bitarenze Nyakanga 2020.

sourceString: On 12 March 2020, India's Health Ministry announced they are working with 11 isolates, and that even on a fast track it would take at least around one-and-a-half to two years to develop a vaccine.
targetString: Kuwa 5 Werurwe 2020, Minisiteri y’ubuzima mu Buhinde yatangaje ko irimo gukora miti 11 kandi ko ku ikubitiro bizatwara nibura hagati y’umwaka umwe n’umwaka n’igice n’imyaka ibiri kugira ngo urukingo rukorwe.

sourceString: On 12 March 2020, Medicago, a biotechnology company in Quebec City, Quebec, reported development of a coronavirus-like particle under partial funding from the Canadian Institutes for Health Research.
targetString: Kuwa 5 Werurwe 2020,Medicago, kompanyi y’ubuzima yo mu mugi wa Quebec muri Quebec, yatangaje ikorwa ry’umuti ushobora guhangana na koronavirusi ibitewemo inkunga n’Ikigo cy’ubushakashatsi mu by’ubuzima cyo muri Canada.

sourceString: The vaccine candidate is in laboratory research, with human testing planned for July or August 2020.
targetString: Urukingo ruracyakorwaho ushakashatsi muri laboratwari, rukaba ruteganya kurugeregereza ku bantu muri Nyakanga cyangwa Kanama 2020.

sourceString: Earlier that week, The Guardian reported that the US President Donald Trump had offered CureVac "'large sums of money' for exclusive access to a Covid-19 vaccine", against which the German government protested.
targetString: Mbere gato muri icyo cyumweru, The Guardian yatangaje ko Perezida wa Leta Zunze ubumwe z’Amerika Donald Trump yatanze “amafaranga menshi agenewe gusa ibikorwa byo kubona urukingo rwa Covid-19 ikintu cyamaganiwe kure guverinoma y’Ubudage.

sourceString: On 17 March 2020, American pharmaceutical company Pfizer announced a partnership with German company BioNTech to jointly develop a mRNA-based vaccine.
targetString: Kuwa 5 Werurwe 2020, Kompanyi y’imiti yitwa Pfizer yatangaje ubufatanye na kompanyi y’Abadage yitwa BioNTech mu rwego rwo gukora urukingo rushingiye ku turemangingo twa mRNA .

sourceString: mRNA-based vaccine candidate BNT162, currently in pre-clinical testing with clinical trials expected to begin in April 2020.
targetString: Urukingo rushingiye ku turemangingo twa mRNA rufite izina rya BNT162, kugeza ubu rukiri gupimwa kandi igeragezwa ryarwo rirateganya gutangira muri Mata 2020.

sourceString: In Italy on 17 March 2020, Takis Biotech, an Italian biotech company announced they will have pre-clinical testing results in April 2020 and their final vaccine candidate could begin human testing by fall.
targetString: Kuwa 17 Werurwe 2020, mu Butariyani, Kompanyi y’ubuzima yitwa Takis Biotech, yatangaje ko izabona ibisubizo by’ibipimo byafashwe muri Mata 2020 hanyuma urukingo rukazahita rutangira kugeragerezwa ku bantu.

sourceString: In France on 19 March 2020, the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI) announced a US$4.9 million investment in a COVID-19 vaccine research consortium involving the Institut Pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Vienna, Austria), and the University of Pittsburgh, bringing CEPI's total investment in COVID-19 vaccine development to US$29 million.
targetString: Kuwa 19 Werurwe 2020 mu Bufaransa, Ihuriro rya gahunda yo kurwanya ibiza (CEPI) ryatangaje ko hashowe miliyoni US$4.9 mu bushakashatsi ku rukingo rw COVID-19 burimo gukorwa na Institut Pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Vienna, Austria), na Kaminuza ya Pittsburgh, bituma umubare w’amafaranga CEPI imaze gushora mu gushaka urukingo rwa COVID-19 ugera kuri miliyoni US$29.

sourceString: CEPI's other investment partners for COVID-19 vaccine development are Moderna, Curevac, Inovio, Novavax, the University of Hong Kong, the University of Oxford, and the University of Queensland.
targetString: Abandi bafatanyabikorwa ba CEPI bashoye imari mu gukora urukingo rwa COVID-19 ni Moderna, Curevac, Inovio, Novavax, Kaminuza ya Hong Kong, Kaminuza ya Oxford, na Kaminuza ya Queensland.

sourceString: On 20 March 2020, Russian health officials announced that scientists have begun animal testing of six different vaccine candidates.
targetString: Kuwa Werurwe 2020, abayobozi b’inzego z’ubuzima mu Burusiya batangaje ko inzobere zatangiye gupima inyamaswa zakoreweho igeragezwa ry’inkingo esheshstu.

sourceString: Imperial College London researchers announced on 20 March 2020 that they are developing a self-amplifying RNA vaccine for COVID-19.
targetString: Abashakashatsi muri Imperial College London batangaje kuwa 20 Werurwe 2020 ko barimo gukora urukingo rwa COVID-19 rushingiye ku turemangingo two mu maraso .

sourceString: The vaccine candidate was developed within 14 days of receiving the sequence from China.
targetString: Urukingo rwakozwe mu minsi 14 nyuma yo gushyikirizwa n’igihugu cy‘Ubushinwa ibikenerwa.

sourceString: In late March, the Canadian government announced C$275 million in funding for 96 research projects on medical countermeasures against COVID-19, including numerous vaccine candidates at Canadian companies and universities, such as the Medicago and University of Saskatchewan initiatives.
targetString: Mu mpera za Werurwe, guverinoma ya Canada yatangaje miliyoni C$275 yo gutera inkunga imishinga 96 ku ngamba zo guhangana na COVID-19, harimo ikora ku nkingo zitandukanye mu bigo na za kaminuza zo muri Canada, nk’izirimo gukorwa na Medicago na Kaminuza ya Saskatchewan.

sourceString: Around the same time, the Canadian government announced C$192 million specifically for developing a COVID-19 vaccine, with plans to establish a national "vaccine bank" of several new vaccines that could be used if another coronavirus outbreak occurs.
targetString: Ahagana muri cyo gihe, guverinoma ya Canada yatangaje ko hari miliyoni C$192 zagenewe gusa gukora urukingo rwa COVID-19 , hagamijwe gushyiraho “ububiko bw’urukingo” bubitse inkingo nyinshi zishobora kwifashishwa igihe haba hadutse ikindi cyorezo cya koronavirusi .
