sourceString: On 2 April 2020, researchers at the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine reported on testing of PittCoVacc, a possible COVID-19 vaccine in mice, stating that "MNA delivered SARS-CoV-2 S1 subunit vaccines elicited potent antigen-specific antibody responses [in the mice] that were evident beginning 2 weeks after immunization."
targetString: Kuwa 2 Mata 2020, abashakashatsi bo ku Ishuri ry’ubuvuzi ryo muri Kaminuza ya Pittsburgh batangaje ko barimo kugeragereza mu mbeba urukingo rwa PittCoVacc, rushobora kuvamo urukingo rwa COVID-19, batangaza ko “uduce tw’urukingo rwa SARS-CoV-2 S1 duturuka mu turemangingo dutangwa na MNA twagaragaje ubushobozi bwo gukora abasirikari barinda umubiri [mu mbeba], bikaba byaratangiye kugaragara guhera mu ntangiriro z’ibyumweru 2 nyuma yo kurukoresha."

sourceString: In Canada on 16 April 2020, the University of Waterloo School of Pharmacy announced design of a DNA-based vaccine candidate as a possible nasal spray.
targetString: Kuwa 16 Mata 2020, mu ishuri ryigisha iby’imiti ryo muri Kaminuza ya Waterloo batangaje ko barimo gukora urukingo rushingiye kuri DNA rushobora kuzajya runyuzwa mu mazuru.

sourceString: Using bacteriophages, the DNA will be designed to replicate inside human bacteria to produce harmless virus-like particles, which may stimulate the immune system to produce antibodies against the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
targetString: Hakoreshejwe virusi yica udukoko, DNA izakorwa ku buryo yinjizwa mu gakoko kugira ngo ibyare uduce dusa na virusi idatera ibibazo, utu tukazatuma ubwirinzi bw’umubiri bukanguka bugatuma hakorwa abasirikari b’umubiri bo kurwanya virusi ya SARS-CoV-2 .

sourceString: In March 2020, the US government, industry, and three universities pooled resources to access supercomputers from IBM, combined with cloud computing resources from Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Amazon, Microsoft, and Google.
targetString: Muri Werurwe 2020, guverinoma ya Leta Zunze Ubumwe z’Amerika, uruganda, na kaminuza eshatu bakusanyije amakuru agamije kubona za mudasobwa kabuhariwe za IBM, hamwe n’ibindi bintu by’ikoranabuhanga rya mudasobwa rya Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Amazon, Microsoft, na Google.

sourceString: Some vaccines have heterologous effects, also called non-specific effects.
targetString: Inkingo zimwe zifite ingaruka z’ubwoko butandukanye, zikunze kwitwa ingaruka zitazwi.

sourceString: That means they can have benefits beyond the disease they prevent.
targetString: Ibi bivuze ko zishobora kugira ingaruka nziza ziyongera ku ndwara zirinda.

sourceString: A further randomized trial in Australia is seeking to enrol 4,170 healthcare workers.
targetString: Irindi gerageza ryo muri Australia rimo gushaka abaganga 4,170 bo kwifashisha.

sourceString: It is possible vaccines in development will not be safe or effective.
targetString: Birashoboka ko inkingo zirimo gukorwa zizaba zidafite ubuziranenge cyangwa zikaba nta bushobozi zifite.

sourceString: Early research to assess vaccine efficacy using COVID-19-specific animal models, such as ACE2-transgenic mice, other laboratory animals, and non-human primates, indicate a need for biosafety-level 3 containment measures for handling live viruses, and international coordination to ensure standardized safety procedures.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi bwa vuba bwo gusuzuma ubushobozi bw’urukingo hakoreshejwe inyamashwa zatoranyijwe za COVID-19, nk’imbeba zo mu bwoko bwa ACE2 n’inguge, zigaragaza ko hakenewe ingamba zijyanye no kubungabunga ubuziranenge bwo mu rwego rwa 3, mu rwego rwo guhangana na virusi ihari, n’ubufatanye bwo ku rwego mpuzamahanga hagamijwe kubahiriza amabwiriza ajyanye n’ubuziranenge.

sourceString: Vaccines against SARS and MERS have been tested in non-human animal models.
targetString: Inkingo zo kurwanya SARS na MERS zageragerejwe ku nyamaswa.

sourceString: As of 2020, there is no cure or protective vaccine for SARS that has been shown to be both safe and effective in humans.
targetString: kugeza ubu muri 2020,nta muti cyangwa urukingo bya SARS na MERS byari byagaragara ko bifite ubuziranenge n’ubushobozi mu mubiri w’umuntu .

sourceString: According to research papers published in 2005 and 2006, the identification and development of novel vaccines and medicines to treat SARS was a priority for governments and public health agencies around the world.There is also no proven vaccine against MERS.
targetString: Nkuko byatangajwe n’ubushakashatsi bwo mu myaka ya 2005 na 2006, kuvumbura no gukora inkingo n’imiti bya SARS byari ibintu byihutirwa muri gahunda ya leta n’ibigo by’ubuzima ku isi hose. Nta n’urukingo rwa MERS rwari rwemezwa.

sourceString: When MERS became prevalent, it was believed that existing SARS research may provide a useful template for developing vaccines and therapeutics against a MERS-CoV infection.
targetString: Igihe MERS yari yasakaye, hari hitezwe ko ubushakashatsi bwarimo gukorwa bwashoboraga ugutanga buryo bufatika bwo gukora inkingo n’imiti byo kwirinda ubwandu bwa MERS-CoV.

sourceString: As of March 2020, there was one (DNA based) MERS vaccine which completed phase I clinical trials in humans, and three others in progress, all of which are viral-vectored vaccines, two adenoviral-vectored (ChAdOx1-MERS,  BVRS-GamVac), and one MVA-vectored (MVA-MERS-S).
targetString: Kugera muri Werurwe 2020, hari urukingo rwa MERS (rushingiye kuri DNA) rwari rumaze kurangiza ikiciro cya I k’igeragezwa rikorewe ku bantu, n’izindi eshatu zari zigikorwaho, izo zose akaba ari izitangwa mu buryo bwa virusi, ebyiri zo mu bwoko bwa virusi yitwa “Adenoviridae” (ChAdOx1-MERS, BVRS-GamVac),  na rumwe rwo mu bwoko bwa MVA (MVA-MERS-S).

sourceString: Social media posts have promoted a conspiracy theory claiming the virus behind COVID-19 was known and that a vaccine was already available.
targetString: Imbuga nkoranyambaga zakwirakwije ibihuha bivuga ko COVID-19 yari isanzwe izwi kandi ko n’urukingo rwayo rwari rusanzwe ruhari.

sourceString: The patents cited by various social media posts reference existing patents for genetic sequences and vaccines for other strains of coronavirus such as the SARS coronavirus.
targetString: Ibyibanzweho n’imbuga nkoranyambaga ni ibijyanye no kuba hasanzwe hariho uturemangingo n’inkingo by’ibindi bibazo bya koronavirusi nka koronavirusi yo mu bwoko bwa SARS.

sourceString: b'Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Icyorezo cya koronavirusi ya 2019 (COVID-19) ni indwara yandura itera virusi ifata mu myanya y’ubuhumekero yo mu bwoko bwa 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: Common symptoms include fever, cough, and shortness of breath.
targetString: Ibimenyetso ikunze kugaragaza ni umuriro mwinshi, inkorora, no kubura umwuka.

sourceString: Other symptoms may include fatigue, muscle pain, diarrhea, sore throat, loss of smell, and abdominal pain.
targetString: Ibindi bimenyetso by’iyi ndwara birimo umunaniro, kubabara mu mitsi, impiswi, kubabara mu muhogo, gutakaza ubushobozi bwo guhumurirwa no kunukirwa, no kubabara mu nda.

sourceString: The time from exposure to onset of symptoms is typically around five days but may range from two to fourteen days.
targetString: Umuntu wayanduye agaragaza ibimenyetso mu gihe k’iminsi itanu ariko gishobora kuba hagati y’iminsi ibiri na cumi n’ine.

sourceString: While the majority of cases result in mild symptoms, some progress to viral pneumonia and multi-organ failure.
targetString: Mu gihe abenshi mu banduye iyi virusi bagaragaza ibimenyetso byorohereje, bamwe bagira ibibazo byo guhumeka no kumva ingingo nyinshi z’umubiri zacitse intege.

sourceString: As of 17 April 2020, more than 2.24 million cases have been reported across 210 countries and territories, resulting in more than 153,000 deaths.
targetString: Kugeza ku itariki ya 17 Mata 2020, abantu barenga miliyoni 2,24 bari bamaze kwandura mu bihugu n’uduce 210, bituma abagera kuri 153.000 babura ubuzima.

sourceString: More than 568,000 people have recovered.The virus is primarily spread between people during close contact, often via small droplets produced by coughing, sneezing, or talking.
targetString: Abarenga 568,000 barakize. Iyi virusi yandurira mu kwegerana, akenshi binyuze mu matembabuzi asohoka igihe umuntu akoroye, yitsamuye cyangwa avuga .

sourceString: While these droplets are produced when breathing out, they usually fall to the ground or onto surfaces rather than being infectious over long distances.
targetString: Mu gihe aya matembabuzi asohoka igihe umuntu ahumeka, ubusanzwe ahita agwa hasi cyangwa ku kintu aho kuba yakwanduza umuntu uri mu ntera nini.

sourceString: People may also become infected by touching a contaminated surface and then touching their eyes, nose, or mouth.
targetString: Abantu bashobora kwandura iyi ndwara kandi igihe bakoze ahari iyi virusi hanyuma bakikora mu maso, ku mazuru cyangwa ku munwa .

sourceString: The virus can survive on surfaces up to 72 hours.
targetString: Virusi ishobora kumara hanze amasaha agera kuri 72 ikiri nzima.

sourceString: It is most contagious during the first three days after the onset of symptoms, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease.The standard method of diagnosis is by real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) from a nasopharyngeal swab.
targetString: Iba yandura cyane mu minsi itatu ya mbere nyuma yo kugaragaza ibimenyetso, nubwo ishobora no kwandura mbere yo kugaragaza ibimenyetso no mu gihe ubwandu buba butaragiraubukana.Uburyo bwizewe bwo kuyipima ni ubwo bita “real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR)” ikorwa bakoresheje ibizamini byafatiwe mu mazuru.

sourceString: The use of masks is recommended for those who suspect they have the virus and their caregivers.
targetString: NI ngombwa ko umuntu ukekwaho ubwandu n’umwitaho bambara udupfukamunwa.

sourceString: Recommendations for mask use by the general public vary, with some authorities recommending against their use, some recommending their use, and others requiring their use.
targetString: Amabwiriza ajyanye no kwambara agapfukamunwa ku bantu bose agenda atandukana, hari bamwe mu bayobozi bagira abantu inama yo kutatwakambara, abandi bagasaba abantu kukambara.

sourceString: Currently, there is no vaccine or specific antiviral treatment for COVID-19.
targetString: Kugeza ubu, nta rukingo cyangwa umuti wihariye uvura COVID-19 bizwi.

sourceString: Local transmission of the disease has been recorded in most countries across all six WHO regions.
targetString: Hari ubwandu hagati y’abantu bari mu gace kamwe byagaragaye mu turere dutandatu twose twa WHO.

sourceString: Those infected with the virus may be asymptomatic or develop flu-like symptoms such as fever, cough, fatigue, and shortness of breath.
targetString: Abanduye iyi virusi bashobora kutagaragaza ibimenyetso cyangwa bakagaragaza ibimenyetso bisa n’iby’ibicurane birimo nko guhinda umuriro, gukorora, kugira umunaniro, no kubura umwuka.

sourceString: Emergency symptoms include difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, confusion, difficulty waking, and bluish face or lips; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms are present.
targetString: Ibimenyetso bikomeye birimo kugira ingorane mu guhumeka, kugira ububabare buhoraho cyangwa kuremererwa mu gatuza, kugira ibikezikezi mu maso, kunanirwa kugenda, gutukura mu maso cyangwa iminwa; bikaba ari ngomwa guhita umuntu yihutira kujya kwa muganga igihe aagaragaje ibi bimenyetso.

sourceString: Less commonly, upper respiratory symptoms such as sneezing, runny nose or sore throat may be seen.
targetString: Ntibikunze kunaho ko wagira ibimenyetso birimo kugira ibibazo byo mu myanya y’ubuhumekero nko kwitsamura, gupfunagura cyangwa kubabara mu muhogo.

sourceString: Gastrointestinal symptoms such as nausea, vomiting and diarrhoea have been observed in varying percentages.
targetString: Ibimenyetso byo myanya yo mu rwungano ngogozi nko kugira isesemi, kuruka no guhitwa bikunze kugaragara ku ijanisha riri hejuru.

sourceString: Some cases in China initially presented only with chest tightness and palpitations.
targetString: Abarwayi bo mu Bushinwa baragaje bwa mbere ibimenyetso byo gufungana mu gatuza no gutera cyane k’umutima.

sourceString: In some, the disease may progress to pneumonia, multi-organ failure, and death.
targetString: Kuri bamwe, indwara ishobora kugira ubukana bwinshi bikagera aho umuntu abura umwuka, ingingo nyinshi z’umubiri zigahagarara gukora ndetse hakazamo n’urupfu.

sourceString: This is called the incubation period.
targetString: Ibi nibyo bita igihe cyo kwigaragaza kw’indwara.

sourceString: The incubation period for COVID-19 is typically five to six days but may range from two to 14 days.
targetString: igihe cyo kwigaragaza kw’indwara ya COVID-19 ubusanzwe ni iminsi itandatu ariko ishobora kuba hagati y’ibiri na 14.

sourceString: 97.5% of people who develop symptoms will do so within 11.5 days of infection.Reports indicate that not all who are infected develop symptoms.
targetString: 97.5% by’abantu bagaragaza ibimenyetso icyo gihe gishobora kuba mu minsi 11,5 umuntu ahuye n’ubwandu. Raporo zivuga ko umuntu wese wandye atari ko agaragaza ibimenyetso.

sourceString: The role of these asymptomatic carriers in transmission is not yet fully known; however, preliminary evidence suggests that they may contribute to the spread of the disease.
targetString: Uruhare rw’abanduye batagaragaza ibimenyetso ntabwo ruramenyekana kugezaubu; nyamara, amakuru ahari y’ibanze ni uko bashobora kwanduza abandi.

sourceString: The proportion of infected people who do not display symptoms is currently unknown and being studied, with the Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) reporting that 20% of all confirmed cases remained asymptomatic during their hospital stay.
targetString: Umubare w’abantu batajya bagaragaza ibimenyetso kugeza ubu nturamenyekana ariko urimo kwigwaho, hashingiwe ku makuru atangazwa n’Ikigo cyo muri Koreya gishinzwe gukurikirana no kurwanya indwara (KCDC) avuga ko 20% y’abantu bose banduye barinda basezererwa mu bitaro nta bimenyetso bagaragaje.

sourceString: China's National Health Commission began including asymptomatic cases in its daily cases on 1 April; of the 166 infections on that day, 130 (78%) were asymptomatic at the time of testing.
targetString: Komisiyo y’igihugu y’ubuzima yo mu gihugu cy’Ubushinwa kuwa 1 Mata yatangiye gushyira abo bantu ku mibare y’abanduye itangaza buri munsi; mu bantu 166 batangajwe kuri uwo munsi, 130 (78%) nta bimenyetso bagaragazaga igihe bapimwaga.

sourceString: Both sputum and saliva can carry large viral loads.
targetString: Igikororwa n’amacandwe bishobora gutwara ingano nini ya virusi.

sourceString: Loud talking releases more droplets than normal talking.
targetString: Kuvuga cyane bituma hasohoka amatembabuzi menshi kurusha iyo umuntu avuga gahoro.

sourceString: A study in Singapore found that an uncovered cough can lead to droplets travelling up to 4.5 meters (15 feet).
targetString: Ubushakashatsi bwo muri Singapuru ko gukorora utipfutse ku munwa bishobora gutuma amatembabuzi agenda akagera mu ntera ya metero 4,5 (15 feet).

sourceString: Though the virus is not generally airborne, the National Academy of Science has suggested that bioaerosol transmission may be possible and air collectors positioned in the hallway outside of people's rooms yielded samples positive for viral RNA.
targetString: Nubwo virusi itandurira mu mwuka, Ikigo k’igihugu cy’ubumenyi kivuga ko bishoboka kandi umwuka wasohotse mu byumba by’abantu batandukany wakusanyijwe warapimwe basangamo virusi .

sourceString: Some medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may cause respiratory secretions to be aerosolised and thus result in airborne spread.
targetString: Uburyo bwa kiganga burimo nko gushyira agatiyo mu muhogo no kongera umwuka (CPR) bushobora gutuma hari umwuka usohoka bikaba byatuma umuntu yakwanduzwa nawo.

sourceString: While there are concerns it may spread via feces, this risk is believed to be low.The virus is most contagious when people are symptomatic; while spread may be possible before symptoms emerge, the risk is low.
targetString: mu gihe hari abibaza niba umubyeyi ashobora kwanduza umwana atwite, nta kintu kinini kirabyemeza. Virusi iba ishobora kwandura iyo abantu bagaragaza ibimenyetso byayo; mu gihe hari amahirwe make yo kuba umuntu yakwanduza mbere y’uko ibimenyetso bigaragara,.

sourceString: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) says while it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three others.The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.
targetString: Ikigo gishinzwe kurinda no gukurikirana indwara cyo mu Burayi (ECDC) kivuga ko nubwo uburyo virusi yandura ku buryo bworoshye butaramenyekana, umuntu ashobora kwanduza abantu bari hagati ya babiri na batatu. Viusi imara hanze igihe kibarirw mu masaha kugeza ku minsi.

sourceString: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for one day on cardboard, for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and stainless steel (AISI 304), and for up to four hours on 99% copper.
targetString: By’umwihariko, virusi yamaze umunsi umwe ku kibaho, iminsi igera kuri itatu kuri pulasitiki (polypropylene) no ku byuma bikomeye(AISI 304), n’amasaha ane ku byuma bigondeka byoroshye ku kigero cya 99%.

sourceString: This, however, varies depending on the humidity and temperature.
targetString: Ibi nyamara bishobora guhinduka bitewe n’ubukonje ndetse n’ubushyuhe.

sourceString: Soap and detergent are also effective if correctly used; soap products degrade the virus' fatty protective layer, deactivating it, as well as freeing them from skin and other surfaces.
targetString: Isabune n’imiti yica udukoko, iyo bikoreshejwe neza, bishobora kwica virusi; isabune yangiza” ikinure kirinda virusi”, ikakibuza gukora ndetse ikanagikura ku mubiri cyangwa ahandu hantu iyo virusi iri.

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chlorhexidine gluconate (a surgical disinfectant), are less effective.In a Hong Kong study, saliva samples were taken a median of two days after the start of hospitalization.
targetString: Ibindi bikoreshwa birimo imiti yitwa benzalkonium chloride na chlorhexidine gluconate( umuti wica udukoko), ariko nta bushobozi bwinshi ifite. Mu bushakashatsi bwo muri Hong Kong, hafashwe ibizamini by’amacandwe mu gihe k’iminsi ibiri nyuma yo kujyanwa mu bitaro.

sourceString: In five of six patients, the first sample showed the highest viral load, and the sixth patient showed the highest viral load on the second day tested.
targetString: Batanu mu barwayi batandatu, ikizamini cya mbere cyagaragayemo ingano nini ya virusi, hanyuma uwa gatandatu yagaragayemo ingano nini ya virusi mu bipimo byo ku munsi wa kabiri .

sourceString: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.
targetString: Indwara ikomeye y’igikatu ya coronavirus 2 SARS-CoV-2 ni virusi nshya izahaza imyanya yo mu buhumekero, yagaragaye bwa mbere I Wuhan ku bantu batatu bari bafite ibibazo byo guhumeka bifitanye isano n’indwara z’ubuhumekero.

sourceString: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in related coronaviruses in nature.
targetString: Ibintu byose biranga virusi ya SARS-CoV-2 bigaragara mu bwoko bwa koronavirusi.

sourceString: Outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.
targetString: Hanze y’umubiri w’umuntu, virusi yicwa n’isabune ikoreshwa mu rugo, yica ikinure kirinda virusi. SARS-CoV-2 ifitanye isano ya hafi na SARS-CoV ya mbere.

sourceString: The lungs are the organs most affected by COVID-19 because the virus accesses host cells via the enzyme angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2), which is most abundant in the type II alveolar cells of the lungs.
targetString: COVID-19 yibasira cyane cyane ibihaha, kubera ko virusi igera inyuze mu cyo bita “enzyme angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2)”, igaraga ku bwinshi mu bihaha.

sourceString: The virus uses a special surface glycoprotein called a "spike" (peplomer) to connect to ACE2 and enter the host cell.
targetString: Virusi ikoresha igice cyayo k’inyuma kitwa “spike” (ikinure gikoze nk’ihembe) kikayihuza na ACE2 hanyuma ikinjira mu kinyabuzima.

sourceString: Acute cardiac injury was found in 12% of infected people admitted in hospital in Wuhan, China, and is more frequent in severe disease.
targetString: 12% y’abanduye bakajyanwa mu bitaro byo muri Wuhanm, mu gihugu cy’Ubushinwa, basanganywe ibibazo bikomeye by’umutima kandi ibi bikunze kugaragara no mu ndwara zikomeye.

sourceString: Rates of cardiovascular symptoms is high, owing to the systemic inflammatory response and immune system disorders during disease progression, but acute myocardial injury may also be related to ACE2 receptors in the heart.
targetString: Ikigero cy’abantu bagaragaza ibimenyetso by’ibibazo by’umutima kiri hejuru, bitewe no kubyimba no kwangirika kw’uburinzi bw’umubiri bihita bibaho uko indwara igenda igira ubukana, ariko ibibazo byo kwangirika kw’imitsi yo ku mutima bishobora kugirana isano n’umutima w’uwanduye ACE2 receptors.

sourceString: ACE2 receptors are highly expressed in the heart and are involved in heart function.
targetString: Virusi ya ACE2 ihita yirukira mu mutima kandi ikagira uruhare mu mikorere y’umutima.

sourceString: A high incidence of thrombosis (31%) and venous thromboembolism (25%) have been found in ICU patients with COVID-19 infections and may be related to poor prognosis.Autopsies of people who died of COVID-19 have found diffuse alveolar damage (DAD), and lymphocyte-containing inflammatory infiltrates within the lung.
targetString: Abarwayi bo muri ICU banduye COVID-19 bagaragaje ibibazo Kubanagamira itembera ry’amaraso (31%) no kwangiza inzira z’amaraso (25%), bikaba bifitanye isano n’amahirwe make yo gukira. Ibizamini byafashwe ku bantu bishwe na COVID-19 byerekanye kwangirika kw’imyanya y’ubuhumekero (DAD), hamwe n’ibibyimba byo mu bihaha.

sourceString: Although SARS-COV-2 has a tropism for ACE2-expressing epithelial cells of the respiratory tract, patients with severe COVID-19 have symptoms of systemic hyperinflammation.
targetString: Nubwo SARS-COV-2 ishobora kubana ACE2-mu mubiri na iherereye mu turemangingo two mu myanya y’ubuhumekero, abarwayi ba COVID-19 baagaragaza ibimenyetso byo kubyimba gukabije.

sourceString: In particular, pathogenic GM-CSF-secreting T-cells were shown to correlate with the recruitment of inflammatory IL-6-secreting monocytes and severe lung pathology in COVID-19 patients.
targetString: By’umwihariko, uturemangingo twaT dusohorwa n’indwara ya GM-CSF byagaragaye ko dukorana n’uturemangingo IL-6-dutera kubyimba mu barwayi ba COVID-19.

sourceString: Lymphocytic infiltrates have also been reported at autopsy.
targetString: Ipimwa ryagaragaje uturemangingo tw’ubwirinzi mu mubiri w’uwahitanywe n’iyo virusi.

sourceString: The WHO has published several testing protocols for the disease.
targetString: Ishami ry’Umuryango w’Abibumbye ryita ku Buzima WHO ryatangaje uburyo bwinshi bwo gupima icyorezo.

sourceString: The standard method of testing is real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).
targetString: Uburyo bwizewe bwo gupima icyorezo ni ubwitwa “real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR)”.

sourceString: The test is typically done on respiratory samples obtained by a nasopharyngeal swab; however, a nasal swab or sputum sample may also be used.
targetString: Ibipimo bikorerwa ku bizamini byafatiwe mu myanya y’ubuhumekero hakoreshejwe amatembabuzi yo mu mazuru; nyamara , ibimwira n’igikororwa nabyo bishobora gukoreshwa .

sourceString: Results are generally available within a few hours to two days.
targetString: Ibisubizo biboneka mu gihe gikera ku masaha make kugeza mu minsi ibiri.

sourceString: Blood tests can be used, but these require two blood samples taken two weeks apart and the results have little immediate value.
targetString: Hashobora gupimwa amaraso, ariko bisaba ibipimo bibiri by’amaraso byafaswhe mu byumweru bibiri bitandukanye kandi ibisubizo biba bifite agaciro gake ako kanya.

sourceString: Chinese scientists were able to isolate a strain of the coronavirus and publish the genetic sequence so laboratories across the world could independently develop polymerase chain reaction (PCR) tests to detect infection by the virus.
targetString: Inzobere zo mu Bushinwa zashoboye gushyira ku ruhande uturemangingo twa koronavirusi hanyuma igatangariza isi yose ibyavuye muri laboratwari kugirango ishobore mu bwisanzure gukora uturemangingo (PCR) twakoreshwa mu gupima ubwandu bwa virusi.

sourceString: As of 4 April 2020, antibody tests (which may detect active infections and whether a person had been infected in the past) were in development, but not yet widely used.
targetString: Kugeza kuwa 4 Mata 2020,hari ibipimo byarimo gukorwa ku basirikari barinda umubiri ( bishobora kwerekana ubwandu bukiri mu mubiri cyangwa niba umuntu yabayarahuye n’ubwandu mu gihe cyashize) ,ariko ntibyari byagatingiye gukoreshw ahantu henshi.

sourceString: The Chinese experience with testing has shown the accuracy is only 60 to 70%.
targetString: Ubunararibonye bw’abashinwa mu gupima bwagaragaje ubushobozi bwo ku kigero cya 60% kugeza kuri 70%.

sourceString: The FDA in the United States approved the first point-of-care test on 21 March 2020 for use at the end of that month.Diagnostic guidelines released by Zhongnan Hospital of Wuhan University suggested methods for detecting infections based upon clinical features and epidemiological risk.
targetString: Ikigo gishinzwe ubuziranenge bw’ibiribwa n’imiti (FDA) cyo muri Leta Zunze z’Amerika cyemeje ahantu ho gupimira kuwa 21 Werurwe 2020 hagomba gutangira gukoreshwa mu mpera z’ukwezi. Amabwiriza ajyanye no gupima yatangajwe n’Ibitaro bya Zhongnan bya kaminuza ya Wuhan byagaragaje uburyo bwo gupima ubwandu hashingiwe kubigaragazwa no kwa muganga mdetse n’ibijyanye n’ingaruka z’icyorezo .

sourceString: Bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacities with a peripheral, asymmetric and posterior distribution are common in early infection.
targetString: Mu ntangiriro ubwandu bukunze kurangwa no kwihisha k’uturemangingo twa virusi, tukirunda hamwe, tukitandukanya n’umubiri twinjiyemo nyuma tukazakwirakwira hose.

sourceString: Subpleural dominance, crazy paving (lobular septal thickening with variable alveolar filling), and consolidation may appear as the disease progresses.
targetString: Uko icyorezo kigenda gikura, kigenda gikwira mu myanya y’ubuhumekero, kigakora inzira (kubyimbisha imyanya y’ubuhumekero gikoresheje gufunga inzira z’umwuka) no kwibumbira hamwe.

sourceString: Few data are available about microscopic lesions and the pathophysiology of COVID-19.
targetString: Hari amakuru make ajyanye n’ifoto yo muri mikorosikopi ndetse n’imiterere bya COVID-19.

sourceString: The main pathological findings at autopsy are:
targetString: Iby’ingezi bushakashatsi ku miterere ya virusi bwakorewe ku murambo ni :

sourceString: Macroscopy: pleurisy, pericarditis, lung consolidation and pulmonary oedema
targetString: Ibigaragarira amaso: ibibyimba mu myanya y’ubuhumekero, kubyimba kw’ibice bikikije umutima,gufungana kw’inzira z’ubuhumekero

sourceString: Four types of severity of viral pneumonia can be observed:
targetString: hagaragaye ubwoko butatu bw’ibibazo bikomeye by’ubumekero biterwa na virusi:

sourceString: mild pneumonia: pulmonary oedema, pneumocyte hyperplasia, large atypical pneumocytes, interstitial inflammation with lymphocytic infiltration and multinucleated giant cell formation
targetString: Kubura umwuka byoroheje: utubyimba turimo amazi mu bihaha, kwiyongera k’’uturemangingo two mu myanya y’ubuhumekero, ibibyimba bidasanzwe mu buhumekero, guturika k’utubyimba no kwirema k’uturemangingo dutandukanye

sourceString: severe pneumonia: diffuse alveolar damage (DAD) with diffuse alveolar exudates.
targetString: umusonga ukaze: ukwirakwiza ukwangirika kw’inzira zinyuramo umwuka (DAD) maze amashyira agakwirakwira.

sourceString: DAD is the cause of acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and severe hypoxemia.
targetString: DAD niyo nyirabayazana y’indwara zikomeye zifata imyanya y’ubuhumekero (ARDS) no gufungana kw’inzira z’amaraso.

sourceString: healing pneumonia: organisation of exudates in alveolar cavities and pulmonary interstitial fibrosis
targetString: Indwara zo mu buhumekero zitangiye koroha: kwirunda hamwe kw’amashyira mu myanya y’ubuhumekero no mu bihaha

sourceString: Blood: disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC); leukoerythroblastic reaction
targetString: Amaraso: kuvira imbere (DIC); kwirema k’uturemangingo dushya mu maraso

sourceString: Preventive measures to reduce the chances of infection include staying at home, avoiding crowded places, washing hands with soap and water often and for at least 20 seconds, practising good respiratory hygiene and avoiding touching the eyes, nose or mouth with unwashed hands.
targetString: Mu ngamba zo kugabanya ikwirakwira ry’ubwandu harimo kuguma mu rugo, kwirinda kujya ahantu hateraniye abantu benshi, gukaraba kenshi intoki ukoresheje isabune n’amazi kandi bigakorwa nibura mu gihe cy’amasegonda 20, kugirira isuku imyanya y’ubuhumekero no kwirinda kwikora ku maso, amazuru cyangwa ku munwa utakarabye intoki.

sourceString: The CDC recommends covering the mouth and nose with a tissue when coughing or sneezing and recommends using the inside of the elbow if no tissue is available.
targetString: CDC igira abantu inama yo kwipfuka umunwa ukoresheje agatambaro gasukuye mu gihe ukoroye cyangwa witsamuye cyangwa ugashyira ku munwa igice cy’akaboko kiri imbere y’inkokora igihe nta gatambaro gahari .

sourceString: Proper hand hygiene after any cough or sneeze is encouraged.
targetString: Ni ngombwa gukaraba intoki igihe cyose umaze gukorora cyangwa kwitsamura.

sourceString: The CDC has recommended the use of cloth face coverings in public settings, in part to limit transmission by asymptomatic individuals.Social distancing strategies aim to reduce contact of infected persons with large groups by closing schools and workplaces, restricting travel and cancelling large public gatherings.
targetString: CDC ikangurira abantu kwambara agapfukamunwa igihe bavuye mu rugo, mu rwego rwo gukumira ikwirakwira ry’ubwandu rikozwe n’abantu batajya bagaragaza ibimenyetso. Uburyo bwo guhana intera bugamije kugabanya iyegerana ry’abantu bazima n’abafite ubwandu hafungwa amashuri, aho abantu bakorera akazi, guhagarika ingendo no kubuza abantu guteranira ahantu hamwe .

sourceString: Distancing guidelines also include that people stay at least 6 feet (1.8 m) apart.
targetString: Amabwiriza avuga ko abantu bagomba guhana intera ya 6 feet ingana na metero 1,8.

sourceString: There is no medication known to be effective at preventing COVID-19.As a vaccine is not expected until 2021 at the earliest, a key part of managing COVID-19 is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as "flattening the curve".
targetString: Nta muti uzwi uvura COVID-19. Kubera ko urukingo biteganyijwe ko hafi rwaboneka ari muri 2021uburyo bwiza kwo guhangana n’iki cyorezo ni ugushyiraho ingamaba zituma ubwandu bushya bwa COVID-19 bugabanuka buzwi ku izina rya "flattening the curve" mu rurimi rw’Icyongereza.

sourceString: The CDC also recommends that individuals wash hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty, before eating and after blowing one's nose, coughing or sneezing.
targetString: CDC ikangurira abantu gukaraba kenshi intoki ukoresheje isabune n’amazi kandi bigakorwa nibura mu gihe cy’amasegonda 20, cyane cyane nyuma yo kuva mu bwiherero cyangwa igihe bigaragara ko intoki zanduye, mbere yo kurya, nyuma yo kwipfuna, gukorora cyangwa kwitsamura.

sourceString: It further recommends using an alcohol-based hand sanitiser with at least 60% alcohol, but only when soap and water are not readily available.For areas where commercial hand sanitisers are not readily available, the WHO provides two formulations for local production.
targetString: CDC kandi ikangurira abntu gukoresha imiti yabugenewe yica udukoko ifite arukoru niba yo ku kigero cya 60%, ari iyi igakoreshwa igihe nta mazi cyangwa isabune bihari. Mu duce dufite ibibazo byo kubona iyo miti, WHO yashyizeho ubundi bwoko bubiri bw’imiti bwakoreshwa.

sourceString: In these formulations, the antimicrobial activity arises from ethanol or isopropanol.
targetString: muri ubwo bwoko bw’imiti hari imiti yica udukoko izwi ku izina rya ethanol cyangwa isopropanol.

sourceString: Hydrogen peroxide is used to help eliminate bacterial spores in the alcohol; it is "not an active substance for hand antisepsis".
targetString: Umuti witwa Hydrogen peroxide wirukana udukoko; ntabwo ar "umuti uvura indwara zo mu ntoki".

sourceString: Glycerol is added as a humectant.
targetString: Umuti witwa Glycerol nawo wongerewe ku miti yakwifashishwa.

sourceString: People are managed with supportive care, which may include fluid therapy, oxygen support, and supporting other affected vital organs.
targetString: Abantu bavurwa hakoreshejwe uburyo butandukanye, burimo ubukoresha amatembabuzi, kongererwa umwuka, no kongerera imbaraga izindi ngingo zashegeshwe n’ubwandu.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that those who suspect they carry the virus wear a simple face mask.
targetString: Ikigo Gishinzwe gukurikirana indwara cyo muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z’Amerika (CDC) gikangurira abantu bakeka ko bafite ubwandu kwambara agapfukamunwa.

sourceString: Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) has been used to address the issue of respiratory failure, but its benefits are still under consideration.
targetString: Uburyo bwo kongerera abarwayi umwuka (ECMO) bwakomeje gukoreshwa mu rwego rwo guhangana n’ikibazo cyo kubura umwuka, kandi na nubu buracyahabwa agaciro.

sourceString: Personal hygiene and a healthy lifestyle and diet have been recommended to improve immunity.
targetString: Abantu bakangurirwa kugira isuku, kwita ku buzima bwawe no gufata indyo yuzuye mu rwego rwo kwiyongerera ubwirinzi bw’umubiri.

sourceString: Supportive treatments may be useful in those with mild symptoms at the early stage of infection.The WHO and Chinese National Health Commission have published recommendations for taking care of people who are hospitalised with COVID-19.
targetString: Ubundi buryo by’inyunganizi mu buvuzi bushobora gukoreshwa ku bantu bafite bakigarahaza ibimenyetso byoroheje by’ubwandu. WHO na Komisiyo y’igihugu y’ubuzima mu Bushinwa batangaje uburyo abarwayi ba COVI-19 bari mu bitaro bagomba kwitabwaho.

sourceString: Intensivists and pulmonologists in the U.S. have compiled treatment recommendations from various agencies into a free resource, the IBCC.
targetString: Abaganga b’abarwayi b’indembe n’abindwara zo mu buhumekero bo muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z’Amerika bakusanyije amakuru ajyanye n’ubuvuzi bw’iyi ndwara yaturutse mu bigo bitandukanye (IBCC) maze bayashyira ahagaragara.

sourceString: As of April 2020, there is no specific treatment for COVID-19.
targetString: Kugeza muri Mata 2020, nta muti wa COVID-19 uramenyekana.

sourceString: For symptoms, some medical professionals recommend paracetamol (acetaminophen) over ibuprofen for first-line use.
targetString: Mu guhangana n’ibimenyetso, inzobere mu buganga zivuga ko hakoreshwa umuti witwa paracetamol (acetaminophen) mu mwanya wa ibuprofen mu minsi ya mbere y’uburwayi.

sourceString: Precautions must be taken to minimise the risk of virus transmission, especially in healthcare settings when performing procedures that can generate aerosols, such as intubation or hand ventilation.
targetString: Hakwiye gufatwa ingamba zo kugabanya ikwirakwira ry’ubwandu, cyane cyane mu mavuriro igihe bari gukora ibikorwa bishobora gusohora umwuka, zirimo nko gushyira udutiyo mu myanya y’ubuhumekero cyangwa kongerera abarwayi umwuka hakoreshejwe intoki.

sourceString: For healthcare professionals caring for people with COVID-19, the CDC recommends placing the person in an Airborne Infection Isolation Room (AIIR) in addition to using standard precautions, contact precautions and airborne precautions.The CDC outlines the guidelines for the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) during the pandemic.
targetString: CDC igira abaganga bita ku barwayi ba COVID-19 inama yo kubashyira mu cyumba cyabugenewe kizwi ku izina rya , Airborne Infection Isolation Room (AIIR) hakomeza kubahiriza amabwiriza yatanzwe, kwirinda kwegerena no kwamabara agapfukamunwa. CDC igaragaza urutonde rw’amabwiriza akwiye kubahirizwa mu ikoreshwa ry’imyambaro y’ubwirinzi yabugenewe (PPE) ikoreshwa mu kwirinda icyorezo.

sourceString: The recommended gear is: PPE gown, respirator or facemask, eye protection, and medical gloves.When available, respirators (instead of facemasks) are preferred.
targetString: Iyo myambaro ni: Ikanzu ya PPE, agahumekero cyangwa agapfukamunwa , udupfukasura, ndetse n’udupfukantoki. Byaba byiza hakoreshejwe Uduhumekero, iyo duhari, aho kwambara udupfukamunwa .

sourceString: N95 respirators are approved for industrial settings but the FDA has authorised the masks for use under an Emergency Use Authorisation (EUA).
targetString: Uduhumekero two mu bwoko bwa N95 twemerewe gukoreshwa mu nganda, ariko FDA yemeye ko udupfukamunwa twakoreshwa mu rwego rwo kwitabara (EUA).

sourceString: They are designed to protect from airborne particles like dust but effectiveness against a specific biological agent is not guaranteed for off-label uses.
targetString: Twakozwe mu rwego rwo kurinda utwambaye imyanda yo mu mwuka nk’ivumbi ariko ubushobozi bwatwo mu kurinda ubwandu bwa virusi ntibwizewe neza.

sourceString: When masks are not available, the CDC recommends using face shields or, as a last resort, homemade masks.
targetString: Mu gihe udupfukamunwa tudahari, CDC igira abantu inama yo gukoresha udushashi dupfuka isura, cyangwa , ku maburaburize, udupfukamunwa abantu bikoreye.

sourceString: Most cases of COVID-19 are not severe enough to require mechanical ventilation or alternatives, but a percentage of cases are.
targetString: Abarwayi benshi ba COVID-19 ntabwo bazahazwa cyane na yo ku rwego rwo kuba bakongererwa umwuka cyangwa bahabwa ubundi buryo bwo guhumeka ariko hari ababikenera.

sourceString: The type of respiratory support for individuals with COVID-19 related respiratory failure is being actively studied for people in hospital, with some evidence that intubation can be avoided with a high flow nasal cannula or bi-level positive airway pressure.
targetString: Hari ubushakashatsi burimo gukorwa mu bitaro ku bijyanye n’ubwoko bw’ibikoresho byakoreshwa mu kongerera umurwayi wa COVID-19 umwuka, hakaba haboneka uburyo bwatuma hadakoreshwa udutiyo cyangwa ibindi bintu bacomeka mu muntu kugira ngo abashe guhumeka .

sourceString: Whether either of these two leads to the same benefit for people who are critically ill is not known.
targetString: Ntibiramenyekana niba ubu buryo bwombi butanga umusaruro umwe ku ndembe.

sourceString: Some doctors prefer staying with invasive mechanical ventilation when available because this technique limits the spread of aerosol particles compared to a high flow nasal cannula.Severe cases are most common in older adults (those older than 60 years, and especially those older than 80 years).
targetString: Abaganga bamwe bahitamo gukomeza gukoresha ibyuma byongera umwuka iyo bihari kubera ko ubu buryo butuma hatabaho isohoka ry’umwuka ugereranyije n’uburyo bwo gukoresha udutiyo bohereza mu myanya y’ubuhumekero. Ubu bwandu bukunze kugaragara ku bantu bakuze cyane (bari hejuru y’imyaka 60 cyane cyane abarengeje imyaka 80).

sourceString: Many developed countries do not have enough hospital beds per capita, which limits a health system's capacity to handle a sudden spike in the number of COVID-19 cases severe enough to require hospitalisation.
targetString: Ibihugu byinshi byateye imbere bifite ibibazo by’ibitanda bidahagijje, ibi bigatuma havuka ikibazo kijyanye no guhangana no kwiyongera kw’imibare y’abantu barwaye COVID-19 barembye kandi bakeneye kujyanwa mu bitaro .

sourceString: One study in China found 5% were admitted to intensive care units, 2.3% needed mechanical support of ventilation, and 1.4% died.
targetString: Inyigo imwe mu Bushinwa yagaragaje ko 5% bajyanywe ahagenewe indembe, 2,3% bakaba bari bakeneye kongererwa umwuka naho 1,4% bakaba barapfuye.

sourceString: In China, approximately 30% of people in hospital with COVID-19 are eventually admitted to ICU.
targetString: Mu Bushinwa, abantu babarirwa kuri 30% barwariye COVID-19 mu bitaro bahabwa ubufasha bwa ICU.

sourceString: Mechanical ventilation becomes more complex as acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) develops in COVID-19 and oxygenation becomes increasingly difficult.
targetString: Uburyo bwo gukoresha ibyuma byongera umwuka bukomeje gukoreshwa bitewe n’ibibazo byo kubura umwuka biterwa na COVID-19 bigenda birushaho kuba ingorabahizi.

sourceString: Ventilators capable of pressure control modes and high PEEP are needed to maximise oxygen delivery while minimising the risk of ventilator-associated lung injury and pneumothorax.
targetString: Hakenewe ibikoresho byinshi byo mu bwoko bwa PEEP byo gufasha kongerera abarwayi umwuka mu rwego rwo kugabanya ibibazo byo gukomereka no kwifunga kw’imyanya y’ubuhumekero.

sourceString: High PEEP may not be available on older ventilators.
targetString: Uburyo ibi bikoresho bya PEEP bikoresha ntibuboneka bikoresho bya kera.

sourceString: Research into potential treatments started in January 2020, and several antiviral drugs are in clinical trials.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi ku miti ifite ubushobozi bwo kuvura iki cyorezo bwatangiye muri Mutarama 2020, kandi imiti myinshi yatangiye kugeragezwa.

sourceString: Remdesivir appears to be the most promising.
targetString: Remdesivir niwo muti urimo gutanga ikizere.

sourceString: Although new medications may take until 2021 to develop, several of the medications being tested are already approved for other uses or are already in advanced testing.
targetString: Nubwo bishobora kugeza mu mwaka wa 2021 kugira ngo haboneke imiti mishya, imiti itandukanye irimo kugeragezwa isanzwe ikoreshwa mu kuvura izindi ndwara cyangwa se isanzwe yari irimo gukorerwaho ubushakashatsi.

sourceString: Antiviral medication may be tried in people with severe disease.
targetString: Imiti irwanya virusi ishobora kugeragerezwa ku bantu barembye.

sourceString: The WHO recommended volunteers take part in trials of the effectiveness and safety of potential treatments.The FDA has granted temporary authorisation to convalescent plasma as an experimental treatment in cases where the person's life is seriously or immediately threatened.
targetString: WHO yasabye abakorerabushake kugira uruhare mu bushakashatsi bugamije kureba ubushobozi n’ubuziranenge bw’imiti iri mu igerageza. FDA yabaye itanze urushya rw’igihe gito rwo gukoresha imiti yongerera abarwayi imbaraga mu gihe bigaragara ko ubuzima bwe buri mu kaga .

sourceString: It has not undergone the clinical studies needed to show it is safe and effective for the disease.
targetString: Nta bushakashatsi iki kigo (FDA) cyakoze mu rwego rwo kwemeza niba ubu buryo bufite ubushobozi bwo kuvura indwra cyangwa se ubuziranenge.

sourceString: In February 2020, China launched a mobile app to deal with the disease outbreak.
targetString: Muri Gashyantare 2020, Ubushinwa bwatangije ikoranbuhanga ryo muri telefoni mu rwego rwo guhangana n’ikwirakwira ry’icyorezo.

sourceString: Users are asked to enter their name and ID number.
targetString: Abakoresha ubu buryo basabwa kwinjizamo amazina yabo na nomero y’indangamuntu.

sourceString: The app is able to detect 'close contact' using surveillance data and therefore a potential risk of infection.
targetString: Iri koranabuhanga rifite ubushobozi bwo kumenya niba ahantu urikoresha ari hari ubwandu, hifashishijwe amakuru aturuka mu igenzura, ku buryo uhegereye wakwandura.

sourceString: Every user can also check the status of three other users.
targetString: Umuntu wese ukoresha iri koranabuhanga ashobora no kureba uko abandi bantu batatu babukoresha bahagaze.

sourceString: If a potential risk is detected, the app not only recommends self-quarantine, it also alerts local health officials.Big data analytics on cellphone data, facial recognition technology, mobile phone tracking and artificial intelligence are used to track infected people and people whom they contacted in South Korea, Taiwan and Singapore.
targetString: Singapuru Iyo aho hantu bigaragaye ko hari ubwandu, usibye kuba iryo koranabuhanga rikugira inama yo kwishyira mu kato, rinamenyesha inzego z’ubuzima zo muri ako gace. Ibihugu bya Koreya Yepfo, Taiwan na bikoresha ikoranabuhanga risuzuma amkuru yo muri telefoni ngendanwa, ibyuma bigenzura abantu bikoresheje amasura yabo , gushakisha amakuru hifashishijwe telefoni ngendanwa ndetse no gukoresha ibyuma bikora nk’abantu, muri gahunda yo gushakisha abantu bahuye n’ubwandu.

sourceString: In March 2020, the Israeli government enabled security agencies to track mobile phone data of people supposed to have coronavirus.
targetString: Muri Werurwe 2020, guverinoma ya Isiraheli yahaye ibigo by’ikoranabuhanga ubushobozi bwo kugenzura za telefoni ngendanwa z’abantu bakekwaho ubwandu.

sourceString: The measure was taken to enforce quarantine and protect those who may come into contact with infected citizens.
targetString: Uyu mwanzuro wafashwe mu rwego rwo gushyira mu bikorwa gahunda y’akato no kurinda abashobora guhura n’abafite ubwandu.

sourceString: Also in March 2020, Deutsche Telekom shared aggregated phone location data with the German federal government agency, Robert Koch Institute, in order to research and prevent the spread of the virus.
targetString: Muri Werurwe 2020 na none, Deutsche Telekom yatanze uburyo bwo kugenzura amakuru yo muri za telefoni ngendanwa ibifashijwemo n’ikigo cya Leta y’Ubudage kitwa Robert Koch Institute, mu rwego rwo gukora ubushakashatsi no gukumira ikwirakira ry’icyorezo cya virusi.

sourceString: Russia deployed facial recognition technology to detect quarantine breakers.
targetString: Uburusiya bwakwirakwije ikoranabuhanga rigenzura amasura mu rwego rwo kumenya abarenze ku mabwiriza arebana n’akato.

sourceString: Italian regional health commissioner Giulio Gallera said he has been informed by mobile phone operators that "40% of people are continuing to move around anyway".
targetString: Komisiyoneri w’ubuzima mu karere mu Butaliyani witwa Giulo Gallera yabwiwe n’abafite ibigo by’itumanaho rya telefoni ko " abantu bagera kuri 40% bakomeje kwigendera uko babonye ".

sourceString: German government conducted a 48 hours weekend hackathon with more than 42.000 participants.
targetString: Guverinoma y’Ubudage ygiranye inama y’amasaha 48 n’abahanga mu bya mudasobwa barenga 42,000.

sourceString: Also the president of Estonia, Kersti Kaljulaid, made a global call for creative solutions against the spread of coronavirus.
targetString: Perezida wa Esitoniya, Kersti Kaljulaid, yahamagariye abantu batuye isi gushaka uburyo bwo guhangana n’ikwirakwira rya koronavirusi.

sourceString: Individuals may experience distress from quarantine, travel restrictions, side effects of treatment or fear of the infection itself.
targetString: Abantu bashobora kugira ibibazo by’agahinda gakabije bitewe no gushyirwa mu kato, kubuzwa gutembera, ingaruka z’imiti, cyangwa gutinya icyorezo ubwabyo.

sourceString: BBC quoted Rory O'Connor in saying, "Increased social isolation, loneliness, health anxiety, stress and an economic downturn are a perfect storm to harm people's mental health and wellbeing."
targetString: BBC yatangaje amagambo ya Rory O'Connor, aho yavuze ko "gushyira abantu mu kato, ubwigunge, ihangayika ry’ubuzima, gutekereza cyane n’ubukene bigira ingaruka zikomeye ku buzima bwo mu mutwe n’imibereho myiza y’abantu."

sourceString: The disease may take a mild course with few or no symptoms, resembling other common upper respiratory diseases such as the common cold.
targetString: Icyorezo gishobora kugaragaza ibimenyetso bike cyangwa ntikigire ibyo kigaragaza, ibi bikaba bisa n’iby’ubundi burwayi bw’indwara zo mu buhumekero cyangwa ibicurane.

sourceString: Mild cases typically recover within two weeks, while those with severe or critical diseases may take three to six weeks to recover.
targetString: Abanntu barwaye byoroheje bashobora gukira mu byumeru bibiri, mu gihe abarembye bishibora kubatwara ibyumweru bitatu kugeza kuri bitandatu.

sourceString: Pregnant women may be at higher risk for severe infection with COVID-19 based on data from other similar viruses, like SARS and MERS, but data for COVID-19 is lacking.In some people, COVID-19 may affect the lungs causing pneumonia.
targetString: Abagore batwite baba bashobora kuzahazwa na COVID-19 nkuko amakuru ashingiye ku zindi virusi abitangaza, urugero nka SARS na MERS, gusa amakuru ajyanye na COVID-19 ku bagore batwite ntaramenyekana. COVID-19 ishobora gutera indwra zo mu buhumekero ku bantu bamwe.

sourceString: In those most severely affected, COVID-19 may rapidly progress to acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) causing respiratory failure, septic shock or multi-organ failure.
targetString: Abantu bamwe bazahazajwe na COVID-19 bashobora kugira ibibazo bikomeye byo mu buhumekero (ARDS) bishobora gutuma babura umwuka, kugira ibibazo by’imyumvire no gucika intege kw’ingingo z’umubiri zitandukanye.

sourceString: Complications associated with COVID-19 include sepsis, abnormal clotting and damage to the heart, kidneys and liver.
targetString: Ibibazo biterwa na COVID-19 birimo kubabara umubiri wose kwirundira hamwe kw’amaraso no kwangirika mu mutima, impyiko n’umwijima.

sourceString: Clotting abnormalities, specifically an increase in prothrombin time, have been described in 6% of those admitted to hospital with COVID-19, while abnormal kidney function is seen in 4% of this group.
targetString: Kuvura kw’amaraso, cyane cyane mu mwijima, byagaragaye ku bantu bangana na 6% by’abarwayi ba COVID-19 bajyanywe mu bitaro, mu gihe ibibazo by’impyiko byagaragaye ku bangana na 4%.

sourceString: Approximately 20-30% of people who present with COVID-19 demonstrate elevated liver enzymes (transaminases).
targetString: Abantu babarirwa hagati ya 20-30% barwaye COVID-19 bagaragaje izamuka ry’uturemangingo mu mwijima (transaminases mu cyongereza).

sourceString: According to the same report, the median time between onset of symptoms and death was ten days, with five being spent hospitalised.
targetString: Iyi raporo igaragaza kandi ko, igihe kiri hagati yo kugaragaza ibimenyetso no gupfa kiri mu minsi icumi, batanu muri bo bakaba bajyanwa mu bitaro.

sourceString: However, patients transferred to an ICU had a median time of seven days between hospitalisation and death.
targetString: Nyamara, abarwayi bajyanywe muri ICU bamaze igihe kingana n’iminsi irindwi mu bitaro mbere yuko bapfa.

sourceString: In a study of early cases, the median time from exhibiting initial symptoms to death was 14 days, with a full range of six to 41 days.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi bwakorewe ku baherutse kwandura, igihe kiri hagati yo kugaragaza ibimenyetso no gupfa kibarirwa mu minsi 14, mu kigererranyo kiri hagati y’iminsi 6 na 41.

sourceString: In a study by the National Health Commission (NHC) of China, men had a death rate of 2.8% while women had a death rate of 1.7%.
targetString: Inyigo yakozwe na Komisiyo y’igihugu y’ubuzima (NHC) yo mu Bushinwa, abagabo bapfa ku kigero cya 2.8%, mu gihe abagore bo bapfa ku kigero cya 1,7%.

sourceString: Histopathological examinations of post-mortem lung samples show diffuse alveolar damage with cellular fibromyxoid exudates in both lungs.
targetString: Ibizamini byakorewe ku bantu bapfuye bazize indwara zo mu bihaha rigaragaza iyangirika ry’udufuka tw’ibihaha rirangwa n’amashyira mu bihahaha.

sourceString: Viral cytopathic changes were observed in the pneumocytes.
targetString: Ibibazo byo mu buhumekero byagaragaje ko Virusi igenda ihinduka.

sourceString: The lung picture resembled acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).
targetString: Ishusho y’ibihaha yasaga n’iyahuye n’ibibazo bikomeye by’ubuhumekero(ARDS).

sourceString: In 11.8% of the deaths reported by the National Health Commission of China, heart damage was noted by elevated levels of troponin or cardiac arrest.
targetString: Muri 11,8% by’abapfuye nkuko byatangajwe na Komisiyo y’igihugu y’ubuzima yo mu Bushinwa, hagaragaye kwifunga kw’imitsi cyangwa guhagarara k’umutima.

sourceString: According to March data from the United States, 89% of those hospitalised had preexisting conditions.Availability of medical resources and the socioeconomics of a region may also affect mortality.
targetString: Amakuru yo muri Werurwe yo muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z’Amerika avuga ko 89% by”abajyanywe mu bitaro bari basanganywe ibindi bibazo. Ibibazo bijyanye n’ubuzima ndetse n’ibishingiye ku mibereho myiza n’ubukungu nabyo bishobora kugira uruhare mu ipfa ry’abantu.

sourceString: Estimates of the mortality from the condition vary because of those regional differences, but also because of methodological difficulties.
targetString: Imibare y’abahitanwa n’icyorezo igenda itandukana bitewe n’akarere, ariko nanone bitewe n’ibibazo bijyanye n’uburyo bukoreshwa.

sourceString: The under-counting of mild cases can cause the mortality rate to be overestimated.
targetString: kutita ku mibare y’abafite ibimenyetso byoroheje bishobora kuzamura imibare y’abahitanwa n’icyorezo.

sourceString: However, the fact that deaths are the result of cases contracted in the past can mean the current mortality rate is underestimated.
targetString: Gusa, kuba abantu benshi bapfa baba basanganywe ibindi bibazo bishobora gutuma ikigero cy’imfu kititabwaho.

sourceString: Smokers were 1.4 times more likely to have severe symptoms of COVID-19 and approximately 2.4 times more likely to require intensive care or die compared to non-smokers.Concerns have been raised about long-term sequelae of the disease.
targetString: Abanywi b’itabi bikubye inshuro 1,4 mu bagaragaje ibimenyetso bikomeye bya COVID-19 naho ababarirwa kuri 2,4 byabo bararemba cyangwa barapfa ugerereanyije n’abatarinywa. Havutse ikibazo ngaruka z’igihe kirekire ziterwa n’icyorezo ku bantu basnganywe inzindi ndwara

sourceString: The Hong Kong Hospital Authority found a drop of 20% to 30% in lung capacity in some people who recovered from the disease, and lung scans suggested organ damage.
targetString: Ubuyobozi bw’ibitaro bya Hong Kong bwasanze amazi yifunze hamwe ku kigero kiri hagati ya 20% na 30% mu bihaha by’abantu bakize icyorezo, kandi amafoto yagaragajwe n’ibyuma byo kwa muganga yagaragaje ibihaha byangiritse.

sourceString: This may also lead to post-intensive care syndrome following recovery.
targetString: Ibi bivuze kandi ko bakwiye gukomeza kwitabwaho nyuma yo gusohoka mu bitaro by’indembe.

sourceString: As of March 2020, it was unknown if past infection provides effective and long-term immunity in people who recover from the disease.
targetString: Kugeza muri Werurwe 2020, ntibyari byakamenyekanye niba ubwandu bwaratumye abantu bakize icyorezo bagira ubudahangarwa bw’umubiri bwisumbuyeho bw’igihe kirekire.

sourceString: Immunity is seen as likely, based on the behaviour of other coronaviruses, but cases in which recovery from COVID-19 have been followed by positive tests for coronavirus at a later date have been reported.
targetString: Bisa nkaho ubwo bwirinzi ariko bumeze, hashingiwe ku miterere y’izindi koronavirusi, gusa ariko hari hari abantu bagarayeho ubwandu bwa COVID-19 na none nyuma yo gutangazwa ko bakize koronavirusi.

sourceString: These cases are believed to be worsening of a lingering infection rather than re-infection.
targetString: Aba bantu bikekwa ko bazahazwa n’uburwyi bwasigaye mu mibiri yabo kurenza ko bakwandura bwa kabiri.

sourceString: The virus is thought to be natural and have an animal origin, through spillover infection.
targetString: Bikekwa ko indwara yaba itarakozwe kandi ikomoka ku nyamaswa, ibinyabuzima bikaba bishobora kuyanduzanya.

sourceString: The actual origin is unknown, but by December 2019 the spread of infection was almost entirely driven by human-to-human transmission.
targetString: Inkomoko yayo nyirizina ntizwi, ariko kkugeza mu Kuboza 2019 indwara yakwirakwiraga umuntu ayanduje undi.

sourceString: A study of the first 41 cases of confirmed COVID-19, published in January 2020 in The Lancet, revealed the earliest date of onset of symptoms as 1 December 2019.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi bwakorewe ku barwayi 41 ba COVID-19, bwatangajwe muri Mutarama 2020 muri Lancet, bwahishuye ibimenyetso yo by’indwara byatangiye kugaragara kuwa 1 Ukuboza 2019.

sourceString: Official publications from the WHO reported the earliest onset of symptoms as 8 December 2019.
targetString: WHO yatangaje ku mugaragaro ko ibimenyetso by’indwara byatangiye kugaragara ku itariki ya 8 Ukuboza 2019.

sourceString: Several measures are commonly used to quantify mortality.
targetString: Hafashwe ingamba nyinshi zo kubarura umubare w’imfu.

sourceString: These numbers vary by region and over time and are influenced by the volume of testing, healthcare system quality, treatment options, time since initial outbreak and population characteristics such as age, sex and overall health.
targetString: Iyi mibare igenda ihinduka bitewe n’akarere, igihe ndetse n’umubare w’ibipimo byafashwe, ubushobozi bw’inzego z’ubuzima, uburyo bukoreshwa mu kuvura, igihe icyorezo cyatangiriye kugaragara n’imiterere y’abaturage irimo imyaka bafite, igitsina ndetse n’ubuzima bwabo muri rusange.

sourceString: In late 2019, WHO assigned the emergency ICD-10 disease codes U07.1 for deaths from lab-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection and U07.2 for deaths from clinically or epidemiologically diagnosed COVID-19 without lab-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection.The death-to-case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases within a given time interval.
targetString: Mu mpera za 2019, WHO yahaye icyorezo cya ICD-10 kode ya U07. 1 ku barwayi byemejwe na laboratwari ko bishwe na SARS-CoV-2 na kode ya U07.2 ku barwayi bagaragayeho COVID-19ariko bitemejwe na laboratwari ko banduye SARS-CoV-2. Ikigero cy’imfu kibarwa bafashe umubare w’abapfuye bakagabanya umubare w’abanduye mu gihe runaka.

sourceString: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global death-to-case ratio is 6.9% (153,822/2,240,191) as of 17 April 2020.
targetString: Hashingiwe ku mibare itangazwa na kaminuza ya Johns Hopkins, ikigero k’imfu ku isi hose ni 6,9% (153,822/2,240,191) kugera kuwa 17 Mata 2020.

sourceString: The number varies by region.Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percent of diagnosed individuals who die from a disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percent of infected individuals (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die from a disease.
targetString: Imibare igenda ihinduka bitewe n’agace. Izindi ngamba zirimo kubara Ikigero k’imfu (CFR), gihwanye n’ijanisha ry’abantu bagaragayeho ubwandu bicwa n’indwara, n’ikigero cy’abishwe n’ubwandu (IFR), gihwanye n’ijanisha ry’abantu bagaragayeho ubwandu (abapimwe n’abatapimwe) bahitanwa n’indwara.

sourceString: These statistics are not time bound and follow a specific population from infection through case resolution.
targetString: Iyi mibare ntishingiye ku gihe kandi ijyana n’abaturage runaka banduye hagendewe ku buryo bitaweho.

sourceString: While not all infected people develop antibodies, the presence of antibodies may provide information about how many people have been infected.
targetString: Mu gihe abantu bose banduye badahita batangira gukora abasirikari b’umubiri, kugaragara kw’abo basirikari bishobora gutanga amakuru ku mubare w’abantu banduye.

sourceString: In the epicentre of the outbreak in Italy, Castiglione d'Adda, a small village of 4600, 80 (1.7%) are already dead.
targetString: Mu izingiro Icyorezo kibasiye kikimara kugera mu Butaliyani, Castiglione d'Adda, agace gato gatuwe n’abaturage 4600, 80 (1.7%) bamaze gupfa.

sourceString: In Gangelt, the disease was spread by Carnival festivals, and spread to younger people, causing a relatively lower mortality, and not all COVID-19 deaths may have been formally classified as such.
targetString: Muri Gangelt, icyorezo cyakwirakwijwe n’iminsi mikuru ya Carnival, cyandurwa n’abantu bakiri bato, bituma imfuzi ziba nke, ariko imfu zose za COVID-19 ntibyatangajwe ko ari uko zimeze.

sourceString: Furthermore, the German health system has not been overwhelmed.
targetString: Uretse n’ibyo, inzego z’ubuzima zo mu Budage ntizacitse intege.

sourceString: In the Netherlands, about 3% may have antibodies, as assessed from blood donors.
targetString: Mu Buholandi, abantu bagera kuri 3% bashobora kugira abasirikari b’ubwirinzi mu mubiri, nkuko byagaragaye mu batanga amaraso.

sourceString: 69 (0.004% of the population) have been confirmed to have died from COVID-19.
targetString: 69 (0.004% by’abaturage) byatangajwe ko bahitanywe na COVID-19.

sourceString: The impact of the pandemic and its mortality rate are different for men and women.
targetString: Ingaruka z’icyorezo n’ikigero k’imfu kiratandukanye ku bagabo n’abagore.

sourceString: Mortality is higher in men in studies conducted in China and Italy.
targetString: Imibare y’abagabo bapfa iri hejuru ; nkuko ubushakashatsi bwakorewe mu Bushinwa no mu Butaliyani ibigaragaza.

sourceString: The highest risk for men is in their 50s, with the gap between men and women closing only at 90.
targetString: Abagabo bar mu kigero k’imyaka 50 baba bafite ibyago byinshi, hakaba hari itandukaniro hagati y’abagabo n’abagore bari bageza imyaka 90 gusa.

sourceString: In China, the death rate was 2.8 percent for men and 1.7 percent for women.
targetString: Mu Bushinwa, abagabo bapfaga ku kigero cya 2,8 ku ijana na 1,7 ku bagore.

sourceString: The exact reasons for this sex-difference is not known, but genetic and behavioural factors could be a reason.
targetString: Ntihazwi impamvu zituma habaho itandukaniro rishingiye ku gitsina, ariko bishobora kuba biterwa n’imiterere y’umubiri n’imyitwarire yabo .

sourceString: Sex-based immunological differences, lesser prevalence of smoking in women and men developing co-morbid conditions such as hypertension at a younger age than women could have contributed to the higher mortality in men.
targetString: Itandukaniro ry’ubwirinzi bw’umubiri riri hagati y’abagabo n’abagore, kuba abagore badakunze kunywa itabi cyane n’uburwayi bukunze kwibasira abagabo burimo ubwo gutera cyane k’umutima bakiri bato ugereranyije n’abagore bishobora kugira uruhare mu izamuka ry’imibare y’abagabo bapfa.

sourceString: In Europe, 57% of the infected individuals were men and 72% of those died with COVID-19 were men.
targetString: Mu Burayi, 57% by’abantu banduye bari abagabo naho 72% by’abahitanywe na COVID -19 nabo bari abagabo.

sourceString: As of April 2020, the US government is not tracking sex-related data of COVID-19 infections.
targetString: Kugera muri Mata 2020Guverinoma ya Leta Zunze Ubumwe z’Amerika ntiyari yagatangiye gukusanya amaku ashingiye ku gitsina ajyanye n’ubwandu bwa COVID-19.

sourceString: Research has shown that viral illnesses like Ebola, HIV, influenza and SARS affect men and women differently.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi ku ndwara ziterwa na virusi nka Ebola, HIV, influenza na SARS zigira ingaruka ku bagabo n’abagore mu buryo butandukanye.

sourceString: A higher percentage of health workers, particularly nurses, are women, and they have a higher chance of being exposed to the virus.
targetString: Umubare munini w’abaganga, by’umwihariko aforomo, ni abagore, kandi bafite ibyago byinshi byo kwandura virusi.

sourceString: The World Health Organization announced on 11 February 2020 that the official name of the disease would be "COVID-19".
targetString: Kuwa 11 Gashyantare 2020 Ishami ry’Umuryango w’Abibumbye Ryita ku Buzima ryatangaje ku mugaragaro ko izina ry icyorezo ari “COVID-19".

sourceString: WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus explained that CO stands for corona, VI for virus, D for disease, and 19 for when the outbreak was first identified: 31 December 2019.
targetString: Umuyobozi wa WHO Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus yasobanuye ko CO ihagariye “corona”, VI virusi, D disease, naho 19 ikagaragaza igihe icyorezo cyagaragaye bwa mbere: 31 Ukuboza 2019.

sourceString: The name had been chosen to avoid references to a specific geographical location (e.g. China), animal species or group of people, in line with international recommendations for naming aimed at preventing stigmatisation.The virus that causes COVID-19 is named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Izina ryatoranyijwe mu rwego rwo kwirinda ko yakwitirirwa akarere runaka (Urugero Ubushinwa), ubwoko bw’inyamaswa cg itsinda ry’abantu, hakurikizwa amabwiriza mpuzamahanga ajyanye no kwita izina agamije kurwanya ipfobya cyangwa iteshagaciro.Virusi itera COVID-19 ni koronavirusi ya 2 itera ibibazo bikomeye mu myanya y’ubuhumekero (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: The WHO additionally uses "the COVID-19 virus" and "the virus responsible for COVID-19" in public communications.
targetString: WHO ikoresha kandi "virusi ya COVID-19 " na "virusi itera COVID-19" mu itumanaho ryo mu rwego rw’ubutegetsi.

sourceString: Both the disease and virus are commonly referred to as "coronavirus".
targetString: Yaba indwara ndetse na virusi byombi byitwa "koronavirusi".

sourceString: During the initial outbreak in Wuhan, China, the virus and disease were commonly referred to as "coronavirus" and "Wuhan coronavirus".
targetString: Ikigera i Wuhan, mu Bushinwa, virusi ndetse n’indwara byombi byitwaga "koronavirusi "na" koronavirusi ya Wuhan ".

sourceString: In January 2020, WHO recommended 2019-nCov and 2019-nCoV acute respiratory disease as interim names for the virus and disease in accordance with 2015 guidance against using locations in disease and virus names.
targetString: Muri Mutarama 2020, WHO yatangaje 2019-nCov na 2019-nCoV nk’amazina y’agateganyo ya virusi n’indwara mu rwego rwo kubahiriza yo muri 2015 arwanya ikoreshwa ry’amazina y’ahantu mu mazina ya virusi n’indwara.

sourceString: The official names COVID-19 and SARS-CoV-2 were issued on 11 February 2020.
targetString: Amazina yemewe ari yo COVID-19 na SARS-CoV-2 yatangajwe kuwa 11 Gashyantare 2020.

sourceString: Due to capacity limitations in the standard supply chains, some digital manufacturers are printing healthcare material such as nasal swabs and ventilator parts.
targetString: Kubera ubushobozi buke bwo guhaza isoko, inganda zimwe z’ikoranabuhanga gusohora ibikoresho by’ubuzima nk’udukoresho bakoresha bafata ibizamini byo mu mazuru, n’ibyuma byongera umwuka.

sourceString: In one example, when an Italian hospital urgently required a ventilator valve, and the supplier was unable to deliver in the timescale required, a local startup reverse-engineered and printed the required 100 valves overnight.
targetString: Urugero rrumwe, igihe ibitaro byo mu Butaliyani byakeneye ku buryo bwihuse utwuma tuyobora umwuka, hanyuma uwatubagezagaho ananirwa kubahiriza igihe, uruganda rwo muri ako gace ruhita rukora utwuma 100 twari dukenewe mu ijoro rimwe .

sourceString: After the initial outbreak of COVID-19, conspiracy theories, misinformation and disinformation emerged regarding the origin, scale, prevention, treatment and other aspects of the disease and rapidly spread online.
targetString: Nyuma yuko umuntu wa mbere agaragayeho COVID-19, ibihuha, amakuru ayobya, amakuru atariyo ajyanye naho yaturutse, byatangiye, uko ikura, kuyirinda, uko wayivura n’ibindi bijyanye n’indwara byatangiye kuvugwa ndetse binakwirakwira byihuse kuri za interineti .

sourceString: Humans appear to be capable of spreading the virus to some other animals.
targetString: Abantu bashobora kwanduza izindi inyamaswa virusi.

sourceString: The study failed to find evidence of viral replication in pigs, ducks, and chickens.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi bwananiwe kugaragaza by’iyororoka rya virusi mu ngurube, ibishuhe ndetse n’inkoko.

sourceString: No medications or vaccine is approved to treat the disease.
targetString: Nta muti cyangwa urukingo biremezwa ko bivura indwara.

sourceString: International research on vaccines and medicines in COVID-19 are underway by government organisations, academic groups and industry researchers.
targetString: Hari ubushakashatsi mpuzamahanga ku nkingo n’imiti bya COVID-19 burimo gukarwa n’ibigo bya leta, amatsinda y’abarimu n’abashakashatsi mu by’inganda.

sourceString: In March, the World Health Organization initiated the "SOLIDARITY Trial" to assess treatment effects of four existing antiviral compounds with the most promise of efficacy.
targetString: Muri Werurwe, Ishami ry’Umuryango w’Abibumbye Ryita ku Buzima ryatangije ikitwa "SOLIDARITY Trial" mu rwego rwo gusuzuma ingaruka z’imiti ine isanzwe ihari bikekwa ko ishobora kuvura iki cyorezo.

sourceString: There is no available vaccine, but various agencies are actively developing vaccine candidates.
targetString: Nta rukingo ruhari, ariko ibigo bitandukanye birimo kugerageza inkingo zitandukanye.

sourceString: Previous work on SARS-CoV is being utilised because SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 both use the ACE2 receptor to enter human cells.
targetString: Harimo gukoreshwa ubushakashatsi bwabanje kuri SARS-CoV SARS-CoV na SARS-CoV-2 kubera ko zombi zikoresha ACE2 receptor mu kwinjira mu turemangingo tw’umubiri w’umuntu.

sourceString: There are three vaccination strategies being investigated.
targetString: Hari uburyo butatu bwo gukingira burimo gukorwaho ubushakashatsi.

sourceString: First, researchers aim to build a whole virus vaccine.
targetString: Ubwa mbere,abashakashatsi barashaka gukora urukingo rwose rwa virusi.

sourceString: The use of such a virus, be it inactive or dead, aims to elicit a prompt immune response of the human body to a new infection with COVID-19.
targetString: Gukoresha iyi virusi, yaba idakora cyangwa yarapfuye,bigamije gukangura ubwirinzi bw’umubiri w’umuntu bukamenya ko hari ubwandu bushya bwa COVID-19.

sourceString: A second strategy, subunit vaccines, aims to create a vaccine that sensitises the immune system to certain subunits of the virus.
targetString: Ingamba ya kabiri ni ugukoresha uduce duto tw’urukingo, ubu buryo bugamije gukora urukingo rutuma ubwirinzi bw’umubiri bumenya ko hari uduce duto twa virusi duhari.

sourceString: In the case of SARS-CoV-2, such research focuses on the S-spike protein that helps the virus intrude the ACE2 enzyme receptor.
targetString: Ku birebana na SARS-CoV-2, ubwo bushakashatsi bwibanda ku kinure kimeze nk’ihembe gifasha virusi kwinjiza ibigize ACE2.

sourceString: A third strategy is that of the nucleic acid vaccines (DNA or RNA vaccines, a novel technique for creating a vaccination).
targetString: Uburyo bwa gatatu ni ubishingiye ku turemangingo (DNA cyangwa RNA, uburyo bushya bwo gukora urukingo).

sourceString: Experimental vaccines from any of these strategies would have to be tested for safety and efficacy.On 16 March 2020, the first clinical trial of a vaccine started with four volunteers in Seattle.
targetString: Inkingo z’ubu bwoko zirimo gukorwaho ubushakashatsi zigomba gupimwa ubuziranenge n’ubushobozi. Ku itariki ya 16 Werurwe 2020, abakorerabushake bane bo muri Seattle batangiye kugerageza urukingo.

sourceString: The vaccine contains a harmless genetic code copied from the virus that causes the disease.Antibody dependent enhancement has been suggested as a potential challenge for vaccine development for SARS-COV-2, but this is controversial.
targetString: Urukingo rufite uturemangingo twakuwe muri virusi ishobora gutera indwara. Hatanzwe igitekerezo cyo kongera abasirikari b’umubiri nk’uburyo bwiza bwo gukora urukingo rwa SARS-COV-2, ariko haracyarimo ikibazo.

sourceString: There are more than 300 active clinical trials underway as of April 2020.
targetString: Kugeza muri Mata 2020 harimo gukorwa ubushakashatsi ku rukingo burenga 300.

sourceString: Seven trials were evaluating already approved treatments for malaria, including four studies on hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine.
targetString: Amageragezwa arindwi yakorewe ku miti isanzwe yemewe mu kuvura Malaria, harimo ine ya “hydroxychloroquine” cyangwa “chloroquine ”.

sourceString: Repurposed antiviral drugs make up most of the Chinese research, with nine phase III trials on remdesivir across several countries due to report by the end of April.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi bwo mu Bushinwa burimo kwibanda cyane ku miti isanzwe ivura indwara ziterwa na virusi, hakorwa igeragezwa mu byiciro III inshuro ikenda ku muti witwa “remdesivir”, mu bihugu byinshi bitandukanye bitewe na raporo igomba gusohoka bitarenze impera za Mata.

sourceString: A dynamic review of clinical development for COVID-19 vaccine and drug candidates was in place, as of April 2020.Several existing antiviral medications are being evaluated for treatment of COVID-19, including remdesivir, chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine, lopinavir/ritonavir and lopinavir/ritonavir combined with interferon beta.
targetString: Kugera muri Mata 2020, hariho igenzura rihoraho ry’igerageza ry’imiti ya COVID-19. Imiti myinshi isanzwe ikoreshwa mu kuvura indwara ziterwa na virusi irimo gusuzumwa ngo harebwe niba ishobora kuvura COVID-19, iyo miti irimo nka remdesivir, chloroquine na hydroxychloroquine, lopinavir/ritonavir na lopinavir/ritonavir ivanze na interferon beta.

sourceString: There is tentative evidence for efficacy by remdesivir, as of March 2020.
targetString: Kugera muri Mata 2020, hari ibimenyetso bigenda bigaragaza ko remdesivir ifite ubushobozi.

sourceString: Clinical improvement was observed in patients treated with compassionate-use remdesivir.
targetString: Abarwayi bavuwe hakoreshejwe remdesivir bagaragaje impimduka.

sourceString: Phase III clinical trials are being conducted in the US, China and Italy.Chloroquine, previously used to treat malaria, was studied in China in February 2020, with preliminary results.
targetString: Muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z’Amerika, Canada no mu Butaliyani harimo gukorwa igerageza ryo ku kiciro cya III. Chloroquine, yakoreshwaga ubundi mu kuvura Malaria, yakozweho inyigo muri Gashyantare 2020, haboneka ibisubizo by’ibanze .

sourceString: However, there are calls for peer review of the research.
targetString: Nyamara, abantu barahamagarrwa gukora ubundi bushakashatsi nkubwo.

sourceString: Korean and Chinese Health Authorities recommend the use of chloroquine.
targetString: Inzego z’ubuzima za Koreya n’Ubushinwa zigira abantu inama yo gukoresha chloroquine.

sourceString: However, the Wuhan Institute of Virology, while recommending a daily dose of one gram, notes that twice that dose is highly dangerous and could be lethal.
targetString: Gusa, Ikigo gishinzwe ibijyanye n’indwara za vurusi cya Wuhan, mu gihe gitanga inama yo gukoresha igarama imwe ku munsi, igaragaza ko iyo iyi ngano yikubye kabiri hashobora kuvuka ibibazo bikomeye birmo n’urupfu.

sourceString: On 28 March 2020, the FDA issued an emergency use authorisation for hydroxychloroquine and chloroquine at the discretion of physicians treating people with COVID-19.The Chinese 7th edition guidelines also include interferon, ribavirin or umifenovir for use against COVID-19.
targetString: Kuwa 28 Werurwe 2020, FDA yemereye by’agateganyo abaganga bavura abarwayi ba COVID-19 gukoresha mu ibanga hydroxychloroquine na chloroquine. Mu mabwiriza y’ikiciro cya 7 arimo ikoreshwa rya interferon, ribavirin cyangwa umifenovir mu guhangana na COVID-19.

sourceString: Preliminary data indicate that high doses of ribavirin are necessary to inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro.
targetString: Amakuru y’ibanze avuga ko hakenewe ingano nini ya ribavirin mu guhangana na SARS-CoV-2 itarinjira mu kinyabuzima.

sourceString: Nitazoxanide has been recommended for further in vivo study after demonstrating low concentration inhibition of SARS-CoV-2.Studies have demonstrated that initial spike protein priming by transmembrane protease serine 2 (TMPRSS2) is essential for entry of SARS-CoV-2 via interaction with the ACE2 receptor.
targetString: Nitazoxanide nayo ishobora gukoreshwa kuri virusi yinjiye mu mubiri nyuma irimo gukorwaho ubushakashatsi nyuma yo gusangamo ingano nke ya SARS-CoV-2. Ubushakashatsi bwagaragaje ko haba hakenewe ikinure cya mbere gikoresha uburyo bwo kwinjiza uturemangingo two mu bwoko bwa 2 (TMPRSS2) kugira ngo SARS-CoV-2 yinjire inyuze muri ACE2 receptor.

sourceString: The studies of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine with or without azithromycin have major limitations that have prevented the medical community from embracing these therapies without further study.Oseltamivir does not inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro and has no known role in COVID-19 treatment.
targetString: Inyigo kuri chloroquine na hydroxychloroquine iri cyangwa itari kumwe na azithromycin yagaragaje ibintu bikomeye bibuza abaganga gukoresha iyi miti hatabanje gukorwa ubundi bushakashatsi. Oseltamivir ntiyirukana SARS-CoV-2 itarinjira mu mubiri nta n’uruhare ruzwi igira mu kuvura COVID-19.

sourceString: Cytokine storm can be a complication in the later stages of severe COVID-19.
targetString: Cytokine ishobora guteza ibibazo mu gihe COVID-19 yyatangiye gukara.

sourceString: There is evidence that hydroxychloroquine may have anti-cytokine storm properties.Tocilizumab has been included in treatment guidelines by China's National Health Commission after a small study was completed.
targetString: Hari ibintu bigaragaza ko hydroxychloroquine ishobora kurwaya cytokine. Komisiyo y’igihugu y’ubuzima yo mu Bushinwa yashyize Tocilizumab mu miti ishobora gukoreshwa nyuma y’inyigo nto yakoze.

sourceString: It is undergoing a phase 2 non randomised test at the national level in Italy after showing positive results in people with severe disease.
targetString: Mu Butaliyani harimo gukorwa isuzuma ryo mu rwego rwa 2 aho harimo gukorwa igerageza ku rwego rw’igihugu nyuma yo kubona ibisubizo byiza ku bantu barembejwe n’uburwayi .

sourceString: Combined with a serum ferritin blood test to identify cytokine storms, it is meant to counter such developments, which are thought to be the cause of death in some affected people.
targetString: Hamwe n’iipimwe ry’amaraso y’ifuku mu kugaragaza sitokini, hagamijwe kureba uko bigenda bikura, hakaba hakekwa ko ari yo mpamvu y’imfu zimwe na zimwe.

sourceString: The interleukin-6 receptor antagonist was approved by the FDA based on retrospective case studies for treatment of steroid refractory cytokine release syndrome induced by a different cause, CAR T cell therapy, in 2017.
targetString: Muri 2017, FDA yemeje ikoreshwa ry’ uturemangingo two mu maraso bita interleukin-6 receptor antagonist tubuza indwara kwinjira hashingiwe ku bushakashatsi bwakozwe ku buvuzi bw’indwara ya steroid yatewe n’indi mpamvu, bise kuvura hakoreshejwe uturemangingo twa CAR T .

sourceString: To date, there is no randomised, controlled evidence that tocilizumab is an efficacious treatment for CRS.
targetString: Kugeza uyu munsi, nta kimenyetso na kimwe kigaragaza ko tocilizumab ifite ubushobozi bwo kuvuraCRS.

sourceString: Transferring purified and concentrated antibodies produced by the immune systems of those who have recovered from COVID-19 to people who need them is being investigated as a non-vaccine method of passive immunisation.
targetString: Harimo gukorwa ubushakashatsi bujyanye no guha abasirikari b’umubiri basukuye kandi besnhi bakozwe n’ubwirinzi bw’umubiri bw’abantu bakize COVID -19 abantu babakeneye nk’uburyo budakoresheje urukingo bw’ abasirkari b’umubiri bakuwe mu wundi muntu.

sourceString: This strategy was tried for SARS with inconclusive results.
targetString: Ubu buryo bwageragerejwe kuri SARS ariko ntibwatanga umusaruro.

sourceString: Viral neutralisation is the anticipated mechanism of action by which passive antibody therapy can mediate defence against SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Uburyo bwo guca intege virusi ni uburyo bwatekerejwe mbere aho abasirkari b’umubiri bakuwe mu wundi muntu bashobora guhuza imbaraga mu guhangana na SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Other mechanisms however, such as antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity and/or phagocytosis, may be possible.
targetString: Hari nyamara ubundi buryo bwakoreshwa, nko kwagura cyangwa se kongera abasirikare b’umubiri.

sourceString: Other forms of passive antibody therapy, for example, using manufactured monoclonal antibodies, are in development.
targetString: Hari ubundi buryo burimo gukorwaho bwo kuvura hakoreshejwe abasirkari b’umubiri bakuwe mu wundi muntu, urugero nko gukoresha abasirikare bakorewe muri laboratwari.

sourceString: Production of convalescent serum, which consists of the liquid portion of the blood from recovered patients and contains antibodies specific to this virus, could be increased for quicker deployment.
targetString: Hakwiye kongerwa uburyo bwo guha abantu amaraso, uburyo bwo gufata amaraso yavuye mu bantu bakize kandi arimo abasirikari bagenewe kurwanya virusi, kugira ngo bagera vuba mu mubiri.

sourceString: Coronavirus diseases, a group of closely related syndromes
targetString: Indwara za koronavirusi, itsinda ry’indwara zifite ibimenyetso byenda gusa.

sourceString: Li Wenliang, a doctor at Central Hospital of Wuhan, who later contracted and died of COVID-19 after raising awareness of the spread of the virus.
targetString: Li Wenliang, umuganga ku bitaro bya Central Hospital of Wuhan, yaje kwandura no guhitanwa na COVID-19 nyuma yo gutangaza ko hadutse indwara ya virusi.
